review_body: We have been there with my wife and it was an amazing experience.Service is top noch, rooms are great. Of course, it comes with a price but in the end, it so great that you forget this detail.Restaurant is fantastic and we highly recommend this place.

I had stayed at the Mandarin a few years back on work. This time we spent four days in adjoining rooms while visiting family, and travelling with family. It was a fabulous experience. The high point was literally the pool which overlooked a lot of the high rises in Manhattan. The stay seemed in another age, although it was only a little over two months back. I was doing laps while there were a couple of more swimmers. That is something unimaginable in the days of the Covid virus lockdown. The bar has great views of Central Park and they go out of the way to help hotel residents find a good table. My son also used the speakesy and was mighty pleased to invite his friends over. The best touch was placing a carefully selected book by your bedside which was yours to keep. Extremely civilised. The concierge team in the hotel also made some really nice suggestions.

Wa hed a very good stay in this hotel. The location is perfect, just in front central park. The breakfast in room was very very good, large choice of everything. The indoor pool is great, 20 meters long, and the gym had everything needed.The room was lovely and very nice view.

We thought we would treat ourselves with a short trip to NYC. After much deliberation we took the plunge and stayed at the MO. And it didn’t disappoint. Location wise it was within walking distance to wherever we are. The rooms were lovely. So nice having a view over NYC whilst having a bath. The swimming pool was a nice distraction from the otherwise cold weather in NYC. As members of MO we were entitled to breakfast in Asiate. The first time it was a bit disappointing due to miscommunication with the waiter but after that we couldn’t have asked for anything more.

I generally like the mandarin chain but the New York property really needs to upgrade the rooms, bathroom and the in room entertainment system. All outdated but the price hasn’t changed. Quite tricky as far as benefits are concerned, we had a $300 credit but they quite conveniently forgot to mention that the main bar will not extend any credit given by the hotel what a sham. We stayed for four nights and thought we were using our credits but at checkout found that only $32 was used from our $300. Shameful form a five star establishment. We were booked to come back again on March 07 but we cancelled. Will avoid this particular property of Mandarin.

Spent our 40th wedding anniversary weekend at the MO. Property and service was nothing sort of spectacular. Wildly exceeded expectations and look forward to our next stay in the City. Makes it almost impossible to consider staying someplace else!

We stayed at the Hotel and it was excellent. We stayed in the "least" expensive room, with views to the river, and even though the hotel offers more "luxurious" rooms and rooms with views to central park, this room was excellent. The views from the 47th floor were amazing.We arranged for the hotel to pick us up at JFK and the process went smoothly.Upon arrival our room was ready (we arrived around 11PM)Room service was perfect every time we used itThe Breakfast is a la carte, no buffet (which for me its a better option)The views from the restaurant and the bar is impressive, with unobstructed views of Central ParkThe service in the hotel is top notch. I agree that the Mandarins in Prague, Paris and Munich are more "luxurious" but this hotel is an excellent choice. The location is perfect and the shopping mall in the first 3 floors provide a lot of options if you don't want to venture off or want an option for lunch that is easy.

This is such a shameful hotel. I stay at Mandarin Brand hotels all over the world and this hotel offered a horrible experience. It has gone down in quality and service. I will not be back. The photos are inaccurate, the pool looks pretty but in reality is disgusting and you can't even enter the room its in for to long as the chlorine smell is overwhelming. The rooms are disgusting and dirty, the furniture in in horrible shape, the food is disgusting and the staff reflect how run-down this hotel is. The beds are old and uncomfortable, the bathroom is outdated small and sad and the tub is a joke, only a child could fit in, which I wouldn't want to anyways because its dirty.

Spent one night at this hotel to celebrate my birthday. Had wonderful service with every employee that we interacted with and enjoyed the view of the Hudson River from our room on the 45th floor. The location is great, right on Columbus Circle directly adjacent to Central Park. There are plenty of bike rental options right outside. The hotel lobby is on the 35th floor of the building complex. It's also connected to the mall for shopping and dining options. There are so many things to explore outside of this building, but it's nice to have something connected in case you can't go outside because of the weather. They have larger rooms for a larger price, but we opted for the smaller size room. For NYC, it was still ample size to move around the bed. The bathroom is large and extends the full length of the room. I've been the MO in SF which I found the room much larger, but this is NYC after all. I have a few tips.... 1) regarding their lounge... make reservations if you think you may want to have a drink or eat there. We got lucky with getting a seat for drinks and dessert, but it appears that it fills up and there isn't a bar that you can just stand around and hang out... you must be seated. 2) Join their free Fan club - it provided us with a few perks like late checkout in the afternoon and a $50 credit towards our food bill.

This is a tuff post to be fair, staff super friendly and remember your name!! Views to die for over the city and Central Park, excellent food and a speak easy bar too which is brilliant..... but the room felt tired whilst being very well appointed. Beds were comfy and the room did have everything you would want, hair dryer, tv in the bathroom, mini bar that was well stocked and again views to die for from the top floor. Shower was excellent and the toilets have heated seats! Great gym and pool too. It is a great hotel that is for sure but it is expensive. I would stay again as the people and food are excellent!

I brought my (89 yo) mum to NYC in a combined business-pleasure trip, and we always stay at MONY except for once in the past. I would say another excellent stay all around. My mum would suggest more lighting in the rooms, which appears too dark in a stay marked by more than half rainy dreary days. It would be good to keep up with the competition by having modern central controls for all lights, curtain, etc as well.

Excellent stay, wonderful staff.Great restaurants, shops, spa, amenities, etc..Frankly, you can spend a wonderful weekend in the hotel and adjacent Columbus Shops and never have to leave the facility!

It’s decent, but not great. Even once you forgive the Mall-like complex of offices and retail that surrounds the hotel (hardly serene), you are left a little cold. They are professional but not warm. Room product, spa and dining all good. Somehow you aren’t inclined to return as it doesn’t have charm or any aspect that is particularly special. Better off at the Peninsula, a far better location and a classier joint in many ways.

Stayed here a few times when business meeting sin NYC ran late. Excellent facility and great accommodations. Great restaurants and drinks as well. While the rooms are costs, you get a LOT for your money including great service. Book early, especially during holidays, because this place fills quickly.

Everything about this hotel was amazing!!! Rooms were spacious, immaculate and you couldn't hear any noise from the neighboring rooms. The staff and facilities are exceeded my expectations! I will plan to return to this hotel again!

Very pricey, doesn’t have a 24 hour gym (or just won’t staff it), rooms boring. There are two Restaurants - one of which I walked out of as there was no service. Given the prices they charge they need to up the game. Unimpressed and hopefully won’t have to return!

I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental while in NY for work and some things were very poor for a hotel of this price range. The customer service from the servers at the breakfast restaurant was very poor and we waited a long time for both service and food despite the restaurant not being full. In addition, the food did not taste good either at breakfast or when room service was delivered.

I checked in for two nights and ended up leaving after one. It is insane that a hotel charges 1000 USD + a night to stay in a run down room. The standard room is 10 years old and looks like a standard room at the Hyatt. Do not waste your money. Stay at another hotel. So dissatisfied.

After doing so much research and comparison on an array of hotels I decided to stay at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC. I must say that I was very disappointed with the hotel. Several things come to my head at this moment. From the lack of information related to the hotel cars available to us, the Quality of the food from room service (wrong items and un-cook food), the view from the room was not as requested, constantly extremely loud noises coming from the cleaning staff room next to my room and last but not least the lack of good service from the restaurant during breakfast (forgotten breakfast, coffee and missing from the server). Being a New York native and have experienced a 5 star service in various hotels in NYC, the Mandarin Oriental was a huge disappointment.

Mandarin always comes through! Very clean rooms, very kind staff. Love the location at Columbus Circle near Central Park. You must have a drink at the hotel bar with the unusual and cool drinks! I will always try to stay here!

This is a great place, very well located and you get what you pay for.. busy? Of course it is.. excellent place for food and amazing cocktails. Excellent place for brunch & dinner.Enjoyable view and friendly service.

This past December I vacationed in NYC for the month. During my time there; I stayed at 3 different hotels. The Mandarin was the worst hotel by far. The star I am giving them is for the pool. The first night I was there I wanted to have a glass of champagne in the lobby before dinner. My guest and I went down to the lobby around 7 pm. It was packed with people and there was not a bar available. Considering that I went over to the front desk and kindly asked if I could grab a lobby seat and have Champagne in the lobby. The front desk woman, Anita, loudly in a high pitched voice “Madame! No! You will have to check in with the hostess and wait to be seated in the restuarant!” First off, Madame? I am not French or in France. Next this is the first time I’ve asked for a glass of Champagne and someone has said “No!” So forcefully only my life. Do you imagine staying at a hotel that charges almost $2k a night and being refused a glass of champagne? Absurd. We go check in at the hostess stand and they say it is a 20 minute wait. My guest and I have no choice but to now go sit in the lobby without a refreshment. However, there are people in the lobby with drinks and some drunk girl spills her drink on the table I’m sitting at. See picture below. When the drink is spilled Anita comes over, because she sees I am infuriated and mortified. She cleans up the drink and I look at Anita and say “this is disgusting” Anita turns to me and in a high pitched tone borderline yelling “she just spilled it MADAME”! At that point Anita should of said nothing and kindly apologized. I asked how they had drinks and we did not. She did not answer the question and walked away. I am blown away at how disgustingly rude she is. We ended up finally getting seated. Had one refreshment then headed to dinner. After dinner I was headed to my room. Anita happened to be in the elevator with me and did not acknowledge my presence. She was being very kind to the gentleman in the elevator.She is the rudest person I have ever met. I vacation often. Never have been treated this poorly. This past week I stayed at the Mandarin Boston. The level of service is impeccable there. Whoever is running that hotel should run a workshop to fix the NYC property. In addition to being denied a glass of champagne I asked for a bathrobe when I was at the pool and it took 45 minutes to find one.

Currently here had to clean the dust off my radio next to nightstand. Wasn't upgraded of course even though I called a day before. Ive stayed at Mandarin Tokyo ,London, Miami this year, this is not great at all. The front desk gave us loads of No nicely I couldn't be upgraded or couldn't get a drink in the lounge. Here sneezing my butt off the dust. I am really disappointed.

Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 3 nights, primarily to attend a concert at Carnegie Hall, which was just a short walk away. It was a very pleasant stay. The arrival experience was the best I think I've ever had at any hotel. A woman warmly greeted me in the crowded lower lobby, asked if I was checking in, then when I said yes, she cleared a path for me through the crowd to the elevator, chatting with me in a friendly and casual manner. Then when I got to the front desk on the 35th floor, I was very impressed by Aneta, who was so warm and professional as she checked me in, smiling and talking with me the whole time. There was a minor mixup with my info on file, but the experience was still superb because of Aneta's personable manner. She's definitely a role model. All the staff I encountered at the hotel were friendly and effective, from the concierges to housekeeping to Asiate restaurant at breakfast. In addition to the Carnegie Hall concert, hotel was a great base for exploring MoMA, Central Park, Neue Galerie, Met museum, Lincoln Center, and attending a Broadway show (took the subway right outside hotel). My Central Park view room was great. Wish the lobby was a little bigger but I could usually find a seat. Checkout experience was very good too. When I asked for a copy of MO Magazine to take with me, the front desk woman made sure that I got it. It was an expensive stay but worth it. This was my third visit in about 5 years. Had good meals at Porter House and Bouchon Bakery in attached Time Warner shopping center.

The Mandarin Oriental, New York is a special place. Located in the heart of Columbus Circle, the property itself is visually stunning. It's conveniently connected to the Time Warner Center shops. The best restaurants and retail are just a few steps away at all times. This was our 5th trip to the property and The service was exceptional once again. Eileen made it another trip to remember for us. They made my wife's birthday very special. An excellent Concierge team too. The only place to stay when in the City. I'm a fan.

Ok so its New York City and hotels are on every corner but I feel the Mandarin Oriental, usually a stand out property, has got lost amongst them all. The service is good, the view is good, but the hotel just feels more basic than other Mandarins. It needs a good overhaul. Mandarin Oriental service in a Shangri-la hotel was my thought.
user_name:
TravellingCorporate
New York City, New York

review_body: The Mandarin Oriental got it all! Location, View, Service, outstanding food, what else??Sitting on the topfloor facing Central Park is pure magic! The food amazing and the total experience a yearly high light ! Just in front of Columbus Circle next to the Lincoln Center with all that Jazz. It can't get any better!

My family and I recently spent three days in NYC during the Christmas holiday and stayed at this hotel. I have stayed at other Mandarin Oriental hotel and this one did not disappoint. From check-in, to the service of the Concierge, to restaurant and hotel staff, to check-out we could not have been happier. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to almost everything. Wile some may say what do you expect for the price, it was worth every penny and was beyond my expectation.

From the door man to the receiver was good. Place is clean, including restroom.... Live band music was great. Food was ok.....We had lots of fun. The view from 36th floor was awesome!!! A must see if you're in the city..

The staff and the service was amazing, extremely pleasant staff and the hotel is just at the perfect location. No city noises easy access in and out with access to shoppes and other restaurants without haven't to leave the building.

Having booked 2 Central Park View Rooms we were thrilled with one ( views straight down central park south) and ok with the other( interrupted park view). Unfortunately it took two days to get the shower in one of our rooms working. The hotel is perfectly situated for central park, shopping (Time Warner centre, madison and 5th ave just moments away) , museums etc, with the advantage of free cars anywhere within 20 blocks. Housekeeping are keen( they bang on your door at 8 am so remember to set your "do not disturb." ) It's beautifully kept: my daughter has OCD and used the hotel as a base throughought our trip whenever she felt overwhelmed/ needed to clean up etc. The highlight for me were the amazing door staff, who took everything and everyone in their stride without batting an eyelid. Well done guys!

Always nice to stop at the Mandarin Oriental NY. I've been to the Spa, had lunch at the lovely restaurant and taken a drink at the bar several times. Excellent service, lovely views and not too busy. It is nice to be able to talk to the person you are with. Looking forward to my next visit already.

I have stayed here twice now. And both times the staff were super Accommodating, rooms were perfectly clean. “I hate finding like random hair and ew” but not this place. The view was literally the best I have ever seen!  Would def recommend to anyone.

My husband and I had such a bad experience we moved hotels. I had booked this hotel based on the brand name (we have loved the quiet oasis, gorgeous rooms, stellar service at many Mandarins) and the reviews here. I used Amex Fine hotels and resorts, thank goodness-they got us our money back and found another hotel within five minutes. I had prepaid and by the time we arrived the room we had booked was $400 less due to a special. We did not receive an upgrade. The room was tiny and grubby. The view was great. The hotel bar lobby was filled with very loud and drunk people, including one woman calling people the B word in high volume. Not what I expect from a Mandarin. I tried to get a different room, but they only one offered was a suite for an additional $600. The manager, Stacy, was not who I would hire for that position. As we left to check into the Four Seasons, where we got a suite for the same price we were paying for this tiny dirty room, one of the MO employees apologized and guessed the name of the manager. Evidently many guests are not very happy with her. There are so many fabulous hotels in NY, skip this one.

The Mandarin Oriental, New York is the finest hotel that my wife and I stay. Our evaluation begins with the staff who make us feel valued and special. The property is magnificent with all amenities. Just the best!

As a frequent guest of the mo I was very disappointed and will definitely never stay there again. The pick up service didn’t work, the personal is not trained well. All in all a terrible experience. No thank you

We stayed two nights before a cruise from Bayonne NJ.We had driven the rental car into NYC on a Friday afternoon and had to drop it off at Alamo in the block immediately behind the hotel. Great help from the door and Bellman on arrival looking after the luggage. Front desk is in the 32nd floor. You have to use a different elevator to get to the upper floors from reception floor. Our room was on the 52nd floor facing south. Great views of southern Manhattan and the Hudson. Room was a reasonable size and clean and the bathroom, with separate shower and bath was very good.All the staff we encountered were very friendly. We had both breakfasts in Asiate which were very good. Great views of part of Central Park from this restaurant but the remainder is slightly obscured by Trump’s hotel!We hadn’t done our homework beforehand and didn’t realise it would an issue to get a yellow cab to the cruise port terminal in Bayonne and into New Jersey. However Patrick on the front door was great and arranged a car for us to the cruise port. We then used the same driver to pick us up at the end of cruise and another of his co workers took us to JFK a few days after the cruise, from another hotel.Great shopping mall beneath the hotel and we ate both evening meals in the Porter House in the mall.All in all, a lovely stay at a superb hotel and one we would stay again on our return to NYC.

Such a lovely stay. From the second we entered the hotel, it was obvious this property is extraordinary. The view alone brought me to tears. The staff pours their hearts into all that they do to ensure the stay is memorable and incredible. I love this hotel!

I am MO fans . This is my worst experience in mandarin oriental . Check in staff wasn’t friendly . Asking question isn’t approachable. Very rude . Assigned a room next to elevator, couldn’t sleep at all night . Order room service saying come at 30 mins but wait for 70 mins . In additional the steak ordered medium but well done . Walk in shower is old and no pressure for hot or cold water . Facilities are out dated . Water drain is slow .$1000 for a night are you kidding me !!!Won’t come back don’t go there .

Love the Mandarin Oriental always smells like a crisp spa and wakes you up any time of the day. The Lobby restaurant is got to be our favorite for food, great views of Manhattan...their nuts, snacks, appertizers and tea is so gooood!!!

The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. We had a view over the Hudson river, so could watch the sunset from our room in the evening. Towels and beds are super quality. Our housemaid Helen was extremely helpful.Breakfast at the Asiante opens at 7am, which seems late for those of us who were from the UK and waking up early because of the time difference! However it's very nice but table service only and quite expensive! But like my husband said...you're paying for the view of sunrise over Central Park and the New York skyline!Everything is walking distance, with lots of restaurants and cafe's nearby. It's a straight walk down to Times Square or Macy's. We also took a taxi to Tao Downtown which is a hip Thai restaurant which was buzzing even on a Thursday night!The staff are all very friendly and courteous at all times. Really nice people.We used room service once but again they were quick and efficient.

I travelled to NYC Oct 25-28, I booked using my Chase Mastercard that included breakfast. The hotel is beautiful, has beautiful views overlooking Central park and NYC skylines. The restaurant Asiante and lounge Aviary over looks Columbus circle (Central Park South). I went the first morning to go to breakfast with my wife at 9 am. I was told the restaurant was fully booked for breakfast and was told I could go down to the shopping area to have breakfast and some of the food court area restaurants.Later on that evening we wanted to have a drink in the lounge (Aviary), we were told there were no tables available and we would have to go online to make a reservation, they could not take them there. The online reservation system had you reserve with a $20 pp deposit.I have never experienced this before, especially after spending $1000+ per night. Why wasn't I advised/ offered reservation at check in? Why aren't hotel guests given priority? I don't get it, the Mandarin is overrated. When i checked out I wasn't asked how my stay was. Really disappointing. If you want to stay and eat in your 300 sq ft room this place is for you.

Staff location service rooms and views are just sublime Great food as well, the hotel is modern compared to most hotels in NY highly recommended for business or family stay.Thank you Grace for everything on site!

The Mandarin Oriental New York is a first class property. Great location, friendly attentive staff, great amenities, excellent food, wine, and drinks, nice comfortable and clean rooms. Sometimes it feels like they know what you need before you ask. What more can one say? Just wish there was a Mandarin Oriental at all of my destinations.
user_name:
F6480GHjamesc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Service was flawless, they aim to please in every way.View of park is obstructed by the trump hotel that sits directly infront.Bed was extremely hard, we were offered a foam mattress topper, not what you expect from a hotel of this price and quality. The blinds were not blockout so room is bright as soon as the sun comes up.

This property is getting a bit tired. The rooms are small, the first two we were shown were smoky/musty and service isn't at the same level as other hotels in its price point. There are far better options in NY.

Always enjoy coming to this place, the service is so good and the room and amenities are great. The location is also top for going for strolls through Central Park or it’s not far to go shopping on 5th avenue. The view from the lobby is also killer. Spa treatments were also good! And the room service as well as the food in the lobby were great. All over 10/10

My spouse and I have stayed here 4-5 times for business and each time we are sad when we leave. The hotel is very conveniently located, right on the Columbus Circle subway station. Being park-adjacent and having access to all of the shops and restaurants (plus Whole Foods) in the building is phenomenal. Food prices are steep but there are plenty of lower cost options nearby and the food at the hotel is really excellent. Rooms are beautiful. Impeccably clean. Giant bathrooms with separate tubs and showers. Beds are insanely comfortable. Views are beautiful no matter which way you're facing. Rooms are very quiet.You cannot go wrong with this hotel.

We went there for my 40th brunch treat. And my oh my for the views. It’s the 35th floor with a full panoramic view of Central Park. This was best treat and a must see place. Felt very intimate as there are few seats plus cause it was Sunday morning it wasn’t crazy busy so we were lucky that way. High prices but very justified not only for the view but for the perfect hosting from start to finish. Professional, friendly and great service.Had an amazing time there and will be sure visiting again next time we are in NYC Thanks guys and keep the great work ❤️

Wonderfully Located hotel on Columbus Circle with great views of Central Park . The quality of the hotel was everything you’d expect from a luxury hotel. My only biggie was the need for residents to have to book a place on the bar .

I am a fan of Mandarin Oriental so l usually stay Mandarin Oriental in Asia Pacific Area.For the first time in New York, i’ve just visited the lobby lounge for resting and enjoying the Central park view .Most everything was perfect. Friendly but elegant, excellent cocktail, stunning view, etc. They kept my shopping bags in a polite very reliable way, I was moved about it .And finally Check my balance, it was a little trouble. They didn’t accept my jcb card Jcb card is the most popular card in Japan.JCB partners with Discover card.I have Never had an experience like this. Because when I stay in Mandarin Oriental, I always use JCB. Next time I visit the lobby lounge, I hope it would never happen again

The first room that we were given resembled a cheap,small room on a cruise ship.Every time that I walked past the bed I cut the side of my leg on a sharp protruding corner.We had to waste the next morning changing rooms.I asked for nightly turn down service.The hotel refused to accommodate the request and it required multiple phone calls every night to obtain turn down service.The woman at the front desk at the spa was very snotty to me and refused to let me see the spa but offered to have someone show my husband around.The concierge was excellent.Room came with a cold box ,not a refrigerator which I had to argue with them that I needed a refrigerator for insulin.Very poor service for a so called luxury hotel.The restaurant does not stick sugar free syrup and it has to be ordered in.The first time that I ordered it I was told that it was sugar free when in fact it was not .

Loved everything about this hotel. Everyone was professional friendly. Any question we had the employees answered right away or made it their main priority to find the answer. Everyone was very welcoming. The location was perfect right next to Central Park. The mall on the first floor was great too! We didn’t use the spa or the pool, but plan to next time we go so I do not have any information on those. The lounge on the 35th floor had an amazing view and it was a nice relaxing spot. The hotel was decorated nicely and very clean. The rooms were spacious and clean. Loved everything and we will be back!

Our son had his wedding at the Mandarin Oriental. As the parents of the Groom, we stayed the night at the hotel. I cannot say enough about how outstanding this hotel is. Every element of the wedding was simply perfect. But let me compliment Nina, the Catering Sales Manager. As a funny story although it caused me a panic, shortly prior to the start of the ceremony, the button came off my tuxedo jacket (thanks made to measure, first time wearing from a nameless store but it begins with N) Anyway, in panic mode, I reach out to Nina. Without batting an eye, she gets on her cell, calls someone, takes my jacket, and in 10 minutes returns with it all taken care of. Clearly not in her job description, but she knows and fully understands the hospitality business. She is absolutely the best. That's not to say all the other people we interacted with were any less. I just don't know their names. Take it as fact as I stay in lots of hotels in a variety of countries, this property is outstanding. Each and every person we interacted with made you feel as though the only person they had to worry about was you. Now this is not an inexpensive place to stay, but if you can handle it, you owe it to yourself to experience it at least once. The location by Central Park South and West is just so beautiful and the views are exquisite if you like a city perspective. And the suites the groom and the bride had resembled an apartment. But even a standard room is spacious, well designed, comfortable and nicely appointed.

The Mandarin Oriental was one of the finest hotels at which my wife and I have ever had the pleasure of staying. The location was great - right across the street from Central Park and the 59th Street subway station. The appearance of the hotel was elegant. Our room, while not very big, was well laid out. The double vanity in the bathroom was especially convenient. The staff throughout the hotel was incredibly pleasant and helpful. For example, our arriving flight was delayed and we hadn't eaten for some time. The receptionist at The Aviary went out of her way to get us into their sister bar, The Office, early so we could get something to eat before our reservation at The Aviary. The staff members in the restaurant, Asiate, were extremely accommodating. We had a spectacular view of Central Park both mornings we went there for breakfast. The fitness center was well-appointed. In general, I had heard great things about this hotel, and I must say, my experience at the hotel actually exceeded my already high expectations.

Beautiful hotel in a wonderful location, the only flaw you need to take an elevator to arrive to the hotel the reception is on the 35 floor (but on the contrary the room for this reason are all with a good view) and the air conditioning is too high inside, my suggestion bring a jumper.

The MO at Central Park is a great place to stay with a super friendly and careful staff. Everyone in the hotel is doing the best to make the stay as perfect as possible. We went to New York for the 30th birthday of my fiancée and In-Room Dining Director Mr. Chazen and Front Office Manager Mr. Sugiura helped me to surprise. Thank you so much!

If you can see, I did an excellent review years ago! And sad to find out that you can not join the lounge anymore! Whet with my husband and my 2 kids, to have breakfast as we did many times before, and it was close to the public with so many restrictions that I was more than confused! So we try it siga in our las day but we went earlier and the same, only option was the restaurant next door on 35 flor witch is not the same and as soon we said we were not staying at the hotel, no table Available for us! Super sad that having such an amazing space with that view any not using it!

As a very frequent monthly traveler to NYC who has stayed at most of the top luxury hotels including Four Seasons, The Plaza, Regis, One Central Park(great green hotel), Lotte Palace Towers, Dominick(best views and food in SOHO) I had the best experience ever. The lunch and room service was exceptional with lots of options for vegetarians. I left my valuables in the room safe by mistake and checked out. I realized this hours later and when I called and spoke to the concierge/security they advised me they had my items and they would FedEX them to me the next day. The staff is so honest and helpful I will forever be grateful. My new favorite spot in the city and fantastic views of central park.

The MO New York is an absolutely amazing hotel!! The location was very convenient. The doormen downstairs were all very welcoming and actually the entire staff was incredibly friendly and helpful! Ethel, Erdal and Ken were so great from the reception side and every detail was paid attention to. Housekeeping was fabulous with all the personal touches and extreme cleanliness, the room was also quite spacious. I highly recommended a visit to the Aviary, it was really fun and the drinks and food were amazinggggt! Thank you to Chef, Rachelle, Jules, Nathaniel and Miranda, our experience there really stood out and we were blown away by the hospitality and warm welcome. I highly recommend a visit if you want true luxury and a nice vibe!

My most recent stay in New York was at the Peninsula and I didn’t return as the hotel felt tired...we came to the MO and sadly the very same can be said for here too. The room was large and very clean, but furniture was worn and old, and facilities like the elevators, communal corridors etc all felt old and in need of updating. The gym was ok, as was the pool, but not particularly 5 star. The bar has fabulous views of Central Park but that too felt...tired! Service at the hotel was super and staff are lovely, but if I walked in off the street I would never have said it belonged to this chain. Come on guys, you’ve got the staff, you’ve got the location - bring the hotel up to standard!!

Don’t miss the amazing experience in this excellent hotel.Exceptional location, friendly staff, tasty food at the breakfast restaurant.Everything is around you, CVS, Walgreen and the mall is located down the hotel.The whole food market is in the basement floor and central park is across the street.This will be my choice in future trips to New York.Thank you everyone in this awesome place.
user_name:
naeemaalmheiria
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Excellent on so many counts - service, room quality, views, food, spa. I definitely would like to go back. The only drawback is that the entire hotel is on very high floors - which some people may not like. There are porters on the ground floor to help you but in any case you need to use two lifts to get to your room. They welcome you with amazing green tea - be sure to order it. If you’d like a classic New York breakfast with spectacular views - this is the place. Very elegant. Highly recommended.

Located right on Columbus Circle with Central Park a few meters away. Well appointed hotel with excellent staff. Has a proper pool. Great views of city and park. Comfortable room, well appointed. Lower level shops very convenient.

The best hotel I stayed at up to now. The view is spectacular. The only thing that I did not like is the mustard stain on the couch. I thinks they couldn’t remove it in time. I stayed in the penthouse with big living room and view of the Central Park. The bedroom is clean and comfortable.

What should I say - the location and view is just stunning. I got a nice room with a perfect view on the park (except for a part that is blocked by another hotel in front). Unfortunately, all the very high (guess 30 floors) are residential and not rented to guests). I was a quite disappointed to hear that I cannot get an complimentary upgrade from the highest room category to a suite because of an internal policy. Paid upgrade would have doubled the price and given almost no discount on list price.Rooms and all public spaces seem quite aged and need to be renovated within next years to keep up. In Aviary, all tables have deep scratches, and the room decor is quite worn. Also, you had to switch off lights individually and there is no electric curtains or so. Bathroom doesn't have rain shower. Stuff I'd expect nowadays from top notch hotels.If the service wouldn't have been this great, fast and welcoming, I would have rated this only with 3. Service was really exceptionally great.

Everything is perfect. Super-friendly staff. Perfect rooms. GREAT shower. Lounge with incredible views overlooking Columbus Circle and Central Park. Wonderful food. Pretty penny, so be prepared for that! Always a joy.

I stayed at the MONY partly because of its good reputation but mainly because I was in town for three different events and I could easily travel to all of them by subway from the hotel and avoid traffic. The location is, obviously, super convenient to many attractions and areas of NYC. My room was surprisingly not-small and it was well appointed, good-looking and comfortable with a beautiful view. The bathroom layout and shower were great. The two room service meals I ordered were excellent. The service was almost perfect. There is coffee available in the morning either by the front desk on the 35th floor or the restaurant will give you a to-go cup. I also like that housekeeping puts ice in your ice bucket every day so when you get back to the room at the end of the day, it's there waiting for you. The only service failure was when I called to housekeeping to ask for a small scissors, and the scissors were never sent. The gym is adequate but too small; the hotel should re-locate the front desk and expand the gym in that area. In all, I was very pleased with my stay and will be back.
user_name:
EyesGlazed
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Everything about this hotel works, service is second to none, rooms and quality of furnishings are exactly on par for ultimate luxury. Nothing is too much trouble and make sure you spend some time in the bar with the outstanding views!Only spent two nights here but will use this hotel again as it’s location is perfect for a typical tourist visit. They do have a car service, you just need to ask.

My fiancé and I came to the Mandarin Oriental while we were eloping. We had a terrible experience at the hotel that we previously booked so had to check out. I called the Mandarin and their amazing staff got us a fabulous room. They welcomed us with champagne and strawberries, they helped us with every need and they made us feel so special on our special day.

We had a short break in New York for dinners and a show. The Mandarin occupies a superb location on Columbus Circle and has that rarity a proper pool as well as a spa and a good fitness center. Service is always impeccable and we will return

The rooms were amazing -- amenities, views, decor, location. The public spaces were terrific -- the Aviary, the Office, the spa, the lobby. But the best part about this hotel is the staff: everyone we came in contact with -- from the doormen, the bellmen, the front desk, the hosts at the Aviary and the Office, housekeeping -- were the utmost professionals but still friendly and approachable. We were there for less than a week, but it seemed like a sad farewell leaving friends by the time we checked out. Can't recommend this place enough!

I might be wrong, but it is very hard to beat the public spaces and staff at this hotel in NYC. Excellent and expensive. From our initial greeting to the email from the general manager as a follow up of our visit, every encounter with the staff here was five star and caring. And the lobby, lounge and restaurant have the greatest views(35th floor overlooking Central Park) in a luxury environment anywhere in Manhattan. Our room was superior but not drop dead. Next time, we will ask for a corners Hudson River view. Can’t wait.

Substandard to be avoided MandarinContext: I am a MO Fan, have lived in a MO for more than and stayed under my name or my significant other in many properties. This tells you that the MO is actually on my good side. My significant other pushed her favored hotel, I lived in NY for some time but stayed only in pre-booked hotels ever since. I wanted to check out the MO so I pushed for it.Our agent booked a room that would get us the MO upgrade to a 950$ room. The upgrade happened. Findings:See attached pictures. I am still totally baffled by the poorly maintained room that was run down, tapestry rolling off, smears and dust everywhere. The room was gloomy and dreary even with all lights on and the sun out in full. Reality is a mile off the photoshopped web version. That's not unusual, yet I can say that visual gap at the MO in HK is nothing like what I experienced in NY. The same goes for the furniture and bathroom hardware/shower that is made to look high end, yet it's more common to flimsy budget department stores than what one would be used to from high priced premium brand hotels.Worst of all:I practically had to live in an elevator shaft due to the constant elevator noise that could be day and night, and EXTREEMLY annoying. 950$ for a room that has an elevator running through it day and night?! My wife had a friend join her, she experienced the same noise in a different room, and my wife was equally annoyed my the rolling elevator sound. So I am not a hypochondriac making a fuss. The MO NY did not drop on our list of NY hotels. It's now #1 on the list of to be avoided by all means hotels in NY; within the category of 5 star premium brand hotels. Rooms of the quality we experienced go for around 350$ if you do your homework, which I obviously did not do. I hope this feedback leads to a few empty rooms per year and helps others from overpaying for a hotel that's not worth it. I am writing this while residing in the MO HK as we speak. That's a real MO!

We chose this hotel because it was recommended by various websites as having a great view. I made our reservation over the phone a long time before our trip, asking for a room as high up as possible and near the southern corner of the building. I confirmed this request by email a week later, confirmed it about a month before the trip, then called two days before our arrival to specify our request again. Each time we were told: "We can't hold a specific room for you, but it shouldn't be a problem." When we finally got there, we were given a choice between a room more or less facing south but TEN FLOORS below the top, or a room 4 floors below the top, but facing north. I don't see why the hotel can't honour a simple request for someone who is staying 5 nights in one of the highest categories of rooms.Once we had checked in and deposited our luggage in the room which did indeed have a nice view (though not the one we were expecting), we went back into the lobby and asked to enter the bar just to take a look for a few seconds. We were told that this WAS NOT POSSIBLE! At the restaurant, the hostess allowed us to take 2 steps in, but then ushered us out! We were told that this is hotel policy, but what did they think we were going to do? Stand on top of the other guests? To be treated as a potential troublemaker when you are just asking for a discreet visit is rather insulting.On the positive side, when we did enter the restaurant the next morning for breakfast, the staff was very nice, and Brian at the front desk was very helpful.

Wonderful Hotel. Wonderful Staff. Wonderful Asiate Restaurant! Good Wine Menue. Great view to the Central Park.Its a great pleasure to stay in this Hotel. The Staff is very friendly!we will come back!

Amazing stay, throughly recommend staying if you are visiting New York. Views , quality and service hard to beat! We stayed for a week in one of the amazing suites. Breakfast at the Asiate a must and a great way to start the day. Columbus circle also a perfect place to spend time in between exploring the city. Enjoy!

I loved the stay, although the room was very tiny the staff was very friendly and the concierge was very knowledgeable. Also the ladies that clean the rooms were so sweet, kind and organized. My favorite thing is the breakfast— the food is wonderful, everything is good and its open until late in the morning (important for jetlagged people). But I was absolutely impressed by the crab cake egg Benedict.
user_name:
mimzm2014
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Absolutely disappointed with our stay in the hotel. From the check in and then another incident happened next night. The stuff just say standard "we appologise" which is absolutely not helpful when your impression and night is ruined despite you wanted to get best impressions and emotions that is why we have been choosing the hotel carefully. Would never recommend it to anyone . No simple understanding of service at all. We came to enjoy New York and eventually I personally spent half of the day looking for the new hotel, how to get there , how to take out luggage there and waste the less of out short time in NY.

We had been planning a spring break trip for a little while and settled on NYC. We split our trip into 3 nights near Central Park and 3 nights near the World Trade Center. During our Central Park stay, we chose the Mandarin Oriental New York because of the great reviews, views and pool. Yes - it has an indoor pool!! It is one of very select few hotels in the city that does. And the location can not be beat. Walking distance to Central Park, it is also attached to the Shops at Columbus Circle / Time Warner Center including a Whole Foods. Super convenient!Service from check in to check out and everything in between has been flawless. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the doormen where they collected our luggage and directed us to the 35th floor for check-in. At check-in, we were given an upgrade to a Premier Central Park view room on the 45th floor by friendly front desk staff because we booked through a travel agent that had access to MO’s “Fan Club” rates. She explained all the perks of the rate at the MO like upgrade at check-in, complimentary breakfast for 2 people, and $100 food or spa credit. There is a separate elevator bank that take you to the rooms near the spa. After 7 pm, you have to use your key card. All the rooms at the MO are the same size but with slightly different layouts (except the suites - but they don’t generally comp upgrade to suites, so you gotta shell out money for those). Anyway, since we were there for our kiddo’s birthday week, they gave us a rollaway bed at no extra charge. There were a couple books in the room for the kids that we were able to bring home too. The king bed room was the perfect size to add a rollaway and we still had space to stretch out a tiny bit. The room is big for NYC standards and had a separate bathtub and shower. Online said they had some bathtub toys for kids, but when we called they didn’t have any - just bath safety items (whale themed nonslip mat, knee pad for the parents, spigot cover, drain cover, and thermometer) which was nice too and appreciated. We hardly heard any hallway or outside noise during our stay.We chose to eat at in-room dining for our breakfast and one of the dinners. The food is always excellent, but they sometimes forgot to bring certain items though they were quick to send them up when we called back. As for coffee - no, there are no coffee makers in the room. You can either buy coffee through room service OR if you call guest services, they will bring you an old school coffee maker and coffee grinds (the maker and coffee arrive separate) so you can make your own coffee. These are not pods, so you kind of had to experiment a little with water and amount of grinds. For us, 2 bottles of drinking water and the entire bowl of coffee brewed the perfect cup of Joe.Another perk of the hotel is its complimentary house car available to all guests on a first come first served basis within about a 10 block radius. We had the same driver when we went to Times Square for the M&M store and then again a different day to Nobu Fifty Seven. It was such a great service to have a friendly and professional driver available for these trips. He was awesome! Nice small talk conversation and even gave us some helpful tips for our visit. There are also water bottles and wet wipes in the car. Don’t forget to tip - these guys deserve it! Really refreshing, especially after experiencing some not so friendly or professional uber drivers. FYI - the MO car service doesn’t pick back up though, only drop-off service.And last but not least, the pool and fitness center on the 36th floor. It is open to all guests. It’s not huge, but quite adequate. Attendants check you in on your first visit and then remember you the rest of your stay. There is a fruit tray right outside the pool and an infused water dispenser in the fitness center. The pool is a long narrow lap pool that starts at 3.5’ and ends at 4’. The attendants are also lifeguards so they watch you while you swim or play. They even had a couple kick boards, pool noodles, and toddler life vest you can borrow during your swim. They also check to see if you need any water bottles when you leave. We were super impressed with the amenities and the staff.Overall, we could not have asked for a better introduction to NYC. The Mandarin Oriental New York was the perfect 5-star hotel for our stay. We are now continuing our stay near the World Trade Center and wish we were back at the MO. The staff, service and amenities just cannot be beat! Thank you for a great stay!

This place is spectacular. Great location, wonderful amenities, spectacular views and the service was PERFECT: gracious, warm, friendly, accommodating and very very genuine. The pool and gym are great, a run, bike ride or walk in Central Park. Worth every penny of the stay! Make sure to have a drink at the Aviary and breakfast at Asiate... both very special and unlike anything in Manhattan.
user_name:
Nors_in_NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: It was a great pleasure to stay at the Mandarin Oriental, New York City. The view from our room ( Hudson River ) was amazing, the room service was so good, the room beautiful. Great service as well. Had a really nice time at this hotel.

Mandarin- simply the best of the bestGreat staff, rooms, great attitude and great attention to detailDetail included- bookmarks for books, cleaning cloths for glasses, complimentary coffee and soft drinks upon arrivalBreakfast -is in beautiful restaurant with great views and crazy beautiful wine collection

This was my second stay at this property within a few months. It's one of the best in NYC. My thoughts are best broken down into the following bullet points:35th FLOOR/RECEPTION:- Lobby, reception and bar are top-tier. - Francesca (sp?) at the front desk is the best employee at the hotel. Outgoing, warm and enthusiastic she is one of the top reasons for returning.- The hotel bar (Aviary) is frustrating as it is a bit of a tourist attraction in and of itself. While it's annoying you can't just saunter up to a table, I've had no issues requesting one an hour or two in advance from the concierge. - The drinks at the aforementioned Aviary are amazing. Really creative and fun. The price point is expensive to the extreme, especially for the food. They are charging, on average, $20-$30 for a few bites. For 5 of us, each having two drinks and a couple bites, it wound up being $600. I almost fell over.ROOM:- When compared to other hotels of this price point, the rooms feel a bit dated: No designated USB ports, lots of light switches as opposed to an integrated system, etc. - The bed and linens were a tier or two below what you'd expect. It was hard and springy. Linens rough and unpleasant. Oddly, I was able to move from a "Hudson River view" to a "Central Park View" and the linens in the new room seemed quite a bit softer than the previous ones. It was odd. You'd think they'd be consistent throughout. This newer view also made the room seem quite a bit larger thanks to a revised layout that widened the room while placing the bathroom nearer the corridor. - Bathrooms are spacious and nice. You'd think the tubs would be a little larger but they are manageable. ETC:- The laundry is the most expensive I've encountered. Overnight service for a couple shirts and socks came to $200. No idea if it was a billing error or not, but it was insanely expensive for some basic cleaning sans a suit or tux.

A beautiful hotel with exceptional views, lovely rooms and truly first rate service apart from the check in clerk who was stressed by phone calls and failed to alert us to the benefits from the Fan loyalty membership I had arranged. Spa is exceptional too. Highly recommended.

In a city where hotel service can be hit or miss, particularly at the high end, the MO stands out for truly exceptional service. The staff are gracious, competent, and unfailingly helpful. More than that though, they truly care about the quality of the guest experience. My experience was, if they can do something to make your stay better, they will.The location is fantastic, with Central Park across the street, a private entrance to Time Warner Center, and subway station 100 yards away. Upper West Side and the restaurants of Hells Kitchen are a very easy walk away.Rooms are on the smaller side for a premium hotel, and the Hudson River view rooms are a bit exposed to the hallway for my taste. If this bothers you, book a Park view instead. Bed was extremely comfortable, and linen and towels are absolutely top quality.Special thanks to Alex and Yolaris at the front desk, and Christopher at in room dining, all of whom helped make my stay especially pleasant.I will look forward to returning.

The Mandarin Oriental will definitely spoil you with service and amenities, especially if you sign up to be fans of M.O. A true gem in the city centrally located to the sights of New York City. The hotel rooms are clean and well serviced. Any issues are quickly addressed and the customer is well cared for. You will feel special when you stay at the Mandarin Oriental.

Overall, I do not think you can beat the location of this hotel. Check in was wonderful, the lobby is quite impressive. Room gets high marks, although it doesn't WOW like some other newer 5 star properties. NYC rooms are on the smaller size and this was larger than the traditional. Huge television and décor you would expect from MO. The bed was not a comfy as I expected for a hotel of this caliber. Views were stunning and housekeeping did a nice job. Had issue with room service, and the follow up was not great. Spa is by far the best in NYC and one of the best in the world. See separate review of the spa as it is my favorite place on earth. I liked the old lobby lounge better than the new "aviary" but you still cannot find a better view from a bar. It was a very good stay.

I was blown away by the sheer comfort and royal treatment at this hotel. This wasn't the hotel we were meant to stayed at but the one we did booked was a total disaster so we had to move hotel very quickly. We stayed at the MO for two weeks and that was money well spent. The sheer luxury was unbelievable, room was beautifully decorated, spacious and overlooking the central park. The bathroom and shower was heavenly. The bed linen , towels and robes was soft against your skin. The staff very polite and very attentive and the service was excellent. We were on the 40th floor which was very quite and peaceful. This hotel is at an excellent location which is very central to everything and everywhere you so desire to travel to. The restaurant is awesome and does have an arrays of food which was lovely and serve to a high standard. We are already planning our next trip to Manhattan this summer and will be staying at this hotel once again. On our way back to London we felt like the Royal Family after having such a royal treatment. Excellent service and money well spent for staying two weeks at MO.

MO is in a class by itself. It is a well managed hotel, very polite staff and lovely spacious rooms and common spaces. Excellent location opposite Central Park, walking distance to the theatre district, Lincoln Center, great shopping within the the multilevel Time Warner building. The westside neighborhood offers very good shopping (chains and boutiques) and local restaurants. The view from the room, restaurant and lounge overlook Central Park, the city skyline from Central Park South to 5th Avenue on the east side.Upon arriving in the ground floor lobby our suitcases were whisked away and we were directed to take an elevator to the 35th floor where we were warmly greeted by reception. After registration we were escorted to our room on the 42nd floor. All along the front desk person talked about the hotel and how the access cards work. Once in the room it was fairly straightforward how things worked and soon thereafter our luggage arrived as did complimentary hot tea.When booking our reservation we were given a choice of rooms facing Central Park or the Hudson River. As all of the rooms are on high floors they are relatively quiet from any street noise, however, we did on occasion hear a screaming kid running up the hallway which is surprising as one doesn’t hear any noise from the rooms next door. Beside being a spacious room with king bed, there was a long, comfortable chaise lounge by the floor to ceiling windows overlooking the park. The bed was extremely comfortable (not too firm and not too soft) and the edges of the mattress were reinforced to prevent sagging from sitting on the edge of the mattress and rolling over (if sleeping on one’s side). The bed linens and pillow fill were very nice as were the towels. The room has an accurate thermostat and we were able to set the temperature to our liking. There is complimentary water and turn down services. My only suggestions would be to add a night light and exhaust fan in the bathroom.The decor is contemporary with tasteful, oriental accents, indoor plants and orchids, and nothing is over the top. The curated colours, textures and design are elegant, calming and rich.The restaurant has an excellent array of food offerings and service is of a high standard. We did experience some families with screaming and crying children that were indifferent to others in the lovely restaurant. It’s accepted that young, affluent families stay in nice hotels, however, MO might want to consider a policy for under the age of 12 children where families can dine separately from couples and power meeting breakfasts. It’s a very mellow restaurant and the lack of mindfulness doesn’t project the MO allure.There is no traditional lobby. Instead MO offers a scenic lounge on the 35th floor adjacent to the restaurant and reception area which is the perfect place for cocktails and small snacks. Reservations for drinks during cocktail hour are recommended especially if you’d like to sit near the window seats. The afternoon we arrived, we observed a few very loud children standing on the leather sofas in the lounge. Perhaps MO should consider a safe, designated playroom where children can express themselves without projecting themselves on other guests. It was a lovely 3 day weekend and by far the nicest hotel we’ve stayed in NY. As we visit NY quite frequently, we hope to make MO our new go to hotel as it had everything we could hope for and more.

I am a fan of this hotel collection but never seem to stay with them enough. This hotel in New York is top notch and rivals the best in the city. Location and views from the common areas, restaurants and conference rooms is quite spectacular. The condition of the room was outstanding. While not particularly large (nothing is in Manhattan), the art, linens and other amenities were top notch. Service as you might guess was also excellent. Impressed and will be back.

Every time I stay at the Mandarin Oriental, I am treated like royalty coming home. I am spoiled by the royal treatment, and really don't want to stay at any other hotels. I can't wait to return. The hotel is beautiful, comfortable and the staff is fantastic.

A super experience again at a Mandarin Property...From the moment we got out of the cab from the airport to the minute we got in the cab, back to the airport every single interaction with anyone on the Mandarin staff crushed it! Crushed it!!!!!I’d recommend getting reservations for the restaurants and bars because it does getcrowded.I’m not going to say anything about the SpeakEasy either (oops....) but if you like perfectly made Perfect Manhattans just ask Diane to make you one, or two or three!Seriously not one bad thing to say and that’s a rarity in hotels of any level. Well done and thanks for a great Anniversary/Birthday trip. I’m sad we had to leave....

Unfortunately I have not stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in New York but have been to their bar a couple of times.Like to go here to get a drink and enjoy the nice view of (part of) Central Park.Having stayed at Mandarin Oriental in Singapore (which was amazing) I am sure a stay here would be fantastic.

Spent the weekend at the hotel and it certainly did not disappoint!! The staff could not have been more accommodating. If you are going to NYC for the weekend this should be your must hotel to stay. You will not be disappointed.

Luxurious hotel well run and sweet. The rooms are smallish, though pretty big by NYC standards. I stayed in a junior suite (which is not a suite, just a bigger room) which was lovely, but then also stayed in the Hudson Suite, which is a magnificent, huge, two room masterpiece with views everywhere. It's on the West side by Columbus Circle, great location to get to everything in midtown and easy to the subway if you're going far downtown. The room service isn't Michelin star but it's good, and the espressos are great. The views top notch, and the overall fell of the rooms super cozy in the best way. It's pricey - not for the faint of heart, but if you can afford it...sigh. I do love this hotel.
user_name:
BusinessandKids
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed at this hotel when in NYC for the opera at the Met. Staff took care of our every need and made us feel special and welcomed. Especially impressive was the free shuttle to Port Authority when we were tight on time to catch our bus home. The Aviary bar is a must with creative drinks and a great view of Central Park.

I’ve booked a premier room with the park view for this trip. The check-in was a little difficult this time- we couldn’t check in at 3pm since the previous guests smoked at the two rooms they showed us and we didn’t want to have a room with strong smell. When we got back to the hotel at 6pm (when the room was supposed to be ready) and the room still wasn’t ready they offered a discount on one of their suites for the incovenience caused and because we were loyal guests. In the end we checked in a corner suite with the park view. Our suite was spacious and beautiful. They remodeled the rooms about 1.5year ago and the style and the color palette is a bit different than before- not too oriental. We enjoyed the stay and the service was great too.

When a hotel charges you beyond 500usd per night for a room and tries to charge you an extra 18usd to lend you a iPhone charger for the night I think we can say they ignore what the word service means. Never go there!

As always, the Front Office staff especially Manager Kent was very courteous and welcoming. They did an excellent job in checking us in and helping us settle down in our suite. The Bell man was quick to help us with our luggages and delivered them to our room promptly. This hotel is full of wonderful surprises in terms of suites. Each time we visited, we found a suite that we loved. No matter what kind of suite we stayed in, they were all very spacious and they ALL have spectacular views even though they were very different in size and decorations . And very importantly, they are ALL on HIGH floors, guaranteeing you a good night 's sleep :) The air condition was quiet. The water flow of shower was great. The Suite was kept very clean and very well organized. We loved MO's welcoming amenities. We loved their Suites. They are great for a small family as well as for a big family :)The food and the service at Asiate (the restaurant inside the Hotel) were excellent. I had the Long Island Duck - the best non-roasted duck ever. According to my family members, the Lamb Loin and the Wagyu Beef were incredibly delicious too. What is more, the Staff at Mandarin Oriental NYC were wonderful people. They were incredibly kind and they welcomed you as if you were their families or relatives.Our stay at Mandarin Oriental has been a wonderful and incomparable experience. Thank you.We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and families. And we will definitely return (hopefully soon) .

This is the second time I have stayed un the Mandarin Oriental NY, and the second time was exacly because of the first. This hotel was a discovery I made just by accident. Some years ago I was in NY, and I was walking on sixth street when I saw a man dressing like a doorman of a hotel, but the building did not seem like a normal hotel. Inquired, the doorman told that it indeed was a hotel, with a litle difference: it started on the 35th floor! Then I decided to see by myself. What a wonderful lounge,with an incredible view, and when I saw the restaurant I was flabbergasted. As to the rooms and all the other amenities I only have to applaud

I had been wanting to stay at this hotel for a long time because of the views and location (I stay in New York often), however, I always wound up staying elsewhere. That said, the views and location did wind up being amazing, though there was not much else that was outstanding about the hotel. The main restaurant, Asiate, does have a beautiful view and a chef’s tasting menu that was good. The bar next to the restaurant definitely has an incredible view too. FYI check in is on the 35th floor. The location is ideal for seeing a show in Times Square, shopping or just going for a walk around Central Park. The rooms are average size, and the Hudson River view room has a good sized bathroom with a separate soaking tub overlooking the city. The bathroom does offer nice little extra amenities such Az bath salts, a shaving kit and a dental kit in case you forgot something.The rooms do not offer complimentary coffee or water, which I find surprising for a hotel that costs over 1k per night.Overall it was a lovely hotel, but for 1k+ a night there are other hotels in the city that I would return to before returning to this one.

I visited this hotel several times in the past and I considered one of the best hotels in town. Unfortunately not anymore!Of course is expensive but that is not the problemService is correct but not outstanding. Facilities are not up to date.Not even a coffeemaker in the room. You can order a coffee for a mere 12$ and some waiting time...Breakfast is disappointed too. Average food with little variety. Of course good views if you are near the windows.In summary, this is perhaps the worst mandarín oriental I stayed. But is New York.

The Mandarin Oriental, New York City is not only a spectacular property, but it is has the best service in town! Everyone greets you with a smile and makes your stay feel very special. The property is visually stunnnig and located adjacted to Columbus Circle/Time Warner Cente Central Park. Whether for business or pleasure, The only place I will ever stay in NYC.

We book a suite for a special occasion and travelled to NY. Don't take me wrong, suite was wonderful and totally worth the price.there was a little bit of lack of atmosphere in the overall building, nut sure if it was due to the very young ( and very fashionable) staff or because of the product or lighting in the building.we had a couple of drinks in the evening and the view was defenetely an highlight of our stay. Next time we may look probably at something slightly more traditional in terms of hotel style but it is a wonderful address anyway !

My wife and I stayed here for a week. It exceeded our (high) expectations. Excellent in so many ways. The staff at the front desk enhanced our visit to New York. One little problem - a mistaken wake up call at 4am. More care needed! But overall a memorable stay.

Great location right next to Central Park and Columbus circus. Rooms have a great view as well and the service is outstanding. NY has many great hotels but this definitely stands out. Highly recommend this place and will be back.

Great food and service.Cons Spa policy cancelation (min 24h) so same day cancelation would be charged.Concierge services average didn't really impressed me compared to other 5 stars I've been in the past

I recently visited the Mandarin Spa, the service is incredible, all the staff treat you like a king, I couldn't recommend this more highly. The pool is amazing, all the facilities are top notch. I will be back soon!
user_name:
Marcus S
New York City, New York

review_body: There's a great deal to be said about a well-run hotel, esp. in the luxury category. When you add to this the fact that the hotel is new and extremely well maintained, the rooms are large (for NYC) and the position is great, it's really an unbeatable combination. We recently spent 3 days here, celebrating our anniversary. Even though we're locals, we wanted to treat ourselves and chose the hotel b/c it has a wonderful spa and a long pool. To our surprise (it's not advertised) it also has a sauna. Although the hotel was full, we were mostly alone in the pool, and the spa was not overly crowded. The rooms with Central Park views were sold out when we booked, but this extremely helpful guy at the front desk found one for us (a room that is normally part of a suite, but was not being used as such). So call them if your room of choice is sold out, they might find a solution. The view towards Central Park is amazing!A special kudos to house-keeping. I'm not sure we've ever seen bathrooms that shiny or carpets that clean. Also, unlike every other hotel we've stayed in, they organized our toiletries in helpful ways (I'm constantly annoyed when someone un-does my arrangements, but these people made them better). We got exactly what we were hoping from our stay here: a few relaxed days with long swimming and gym sessions, a few luxurious hours in the spa, great views, and just steps from two of our favorite bakeries (Bouchon and Kayser). Having stayed in a fair number of expensive but not well run hotels, we fully appreciate the difference great management makes. We'll definitely trust this chain in the future.

Every time I go to New York I choose this hotel as it’s very convenient location the bars are the best in town the staff always offered the best service ever and even the hotel is top luxury the miracle is whatever u wear the staff would be always very human and always have a close attitude to the client for them to feel at Home

Came out for one night for out anniversary . one of the best hotel experiences. room was very clean. great layout .The views were amazing. i definitely will be coming back in the near future. staff was very pleasent . over all great experience.

I paid 1400$ for 1 night . They don't even giving you a complimentary coffee machine in the room!!!!!! You only pay for the location. So do yourself a favor and save the money. There's a bunch of nice hotels in that area for half the price.

Mandarin NY is a great place to stay during a business or leisure trip. In the perfect location too. A bonus is the swimming pool at the hotel. The staff is almost on step a head of your needs and sensible for what is important for you as a guest.
user_name:
Renato D
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Mandarin oriental gives you an excellent and professional service, from the moment you check in to check out. Great view over Central Park and Columbus circle. The connoisseur service arranged ticket to the metropolitan as well as helped plan our dinner reservation. Pay a visit to The hotel bar, it is excellent and so is the office.It was also extra special to meet a Swedish staff, who made our stay even more enjoyable.I highly recommend this elegant five star hotel.

I cannot say enough positive things about this property and its amenities! Location is great, restaurant is excellent, and staff and helpful and knowledgeable about the city. You don't have to wait for anything from check in to check out your wish is their command. If you are looking for 5 star luxury in Manhattan, this is the place to go!
user_name:
Charlotte B
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff made it clear my party was not welcome because of someone’s heritage. Buying a substantial number of nights at Mandarin Oriental I was surprised. I myself think well of the brand and think the employees were having an off night as offensive as it was. However, the spite was palpable. Noted!

We stayed here for 9 nights and it was amazing. Particularly the service.The location is excellent right next to Central Park. Restaurant and in room dining also is great.One of the best hotels we’ve stayed at.

Great location on South Park west with nice view around. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable, and quite insulated from the surrounding noise. Facilities are in excellent condition but style seems to get oldish. Excellent service and friendly staff. Breakfast was Ok but not great, a bit slow and not offering a wide choice as customary in this hotel category. Gym facilities were well maintained but not overly spacious.

At $1500/night for an MO flagged hotel in NYC, the management’s lack of response to our difficulties was surprising if not downright awful.We spent one full week in room 5126 Saturday to Saturday last week in the hotel. The room was noisy all the time because of its proximity to the room service and housekeeping elevator and storage rooms.We specifically requested a room away from the elevators and housekeeping when we arrived.We slept very little due to that noise and despite requesting another room or a discount on the terrible room we received, our requests were ignored.I booked this hotel through AMEX Travel and will not likely repeat the stay even though I make many trips to NYC for work.I will be advising AMEX of these issues as well.Suggest others take heed and look for alternatives if the hotel will not provide you a room away from housekeeping, room service and elevators or credit your per night stay due to the inconvenience. Not 5 star.....in my experience...Sorry MO.

We stayed here for a couple of nights in February. The location was very convenient for the subway and a shopping center on your doorstep if that’s what you enjoy doing. The hotel overlooks Central Park and some rooms are overlooking the Hudson River with a good views of the city. The rooms are beautifully decorated and immaculate. I would highly recommend enjoying a cocktail or two at The Lobby Lounge. Very tasty! We also enjoyed a run through Central Park which was a good way to see all the sights without taking up too much of your day. Definitely worth a visit! High end luxury!

The hotel is very centrally located on Columbus Circle right next to the Columbus Mall and across the road from central park. Superb Location. Excellent facility and the staff is very courteous and helpful. The conceirge are one of the best, very helpful and knowledgeable i have seen in the business. The one bedroom suites are superb and beautifully designed with a huge lounge and seating area and spacious nicely designed bedrooms. The bathrooms are very spacious with rain shower cabinets, bathtub and automatic WC. The room service quality of food is also very good and the housekeeping service is outstanding. Overall a superb experience.

One of the best views in NYC...Food is first rate....expensive....It is a Peaceful room....quiet...great place to have a conversation..A romantic dinner....a business meeting Great service....Excellent fish...Wonderful dessert

I had the good fortune to be given a stay at the Mandarin Oriental has a birthday gift. It was my second time staying at the New York property. It was better than my last visit, if that is possible. The staff, the decor and the beautiful view from my room of Central Park were fantastic.Very highly recommended!!

Loved this hotel. Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip and it exceeded all expectations. It had a very unique first impression as hotel check-in was located on the 35th floor.For NYC, the room was very spacious and the unique layout made the bathroom feel really large. Room had skyline/river/sunset views.Service was flawless throughout the stay. Liked the unique Asian flare throughout the hotel. Lots of black and gold with dim lighting. Building attached to time warner center and mall do you don’t even have to go outside. About 1 block away from Central Park.Would recommend to anyone.

My boyfriend and I visited the bar for a drink. As a young couple we found the service was impeccable from start to finish as we were served by George who made our experience even better and went over and above

From the moment I had arrived at the hotel staff had greeted me warmly. Manager on duty showed me to my room and explain all the facilities. I found the bed most comfortable with beautiful linen. I highly recommend staying at Mandarin Oriental NYC.

Spent three days two nights in New York and the reason why this short trip were so enjoyable for my family and myself, I would said 90% is beacuse we selected one of the best hotel in the city. The room is located at 53th floor and the view is amazing. The Aviary is top notch and it's not just a drink in a high end place , its indeed a experience. The staff are friendly and ready to assist. The location is wonderful and convenient. Time square, central park, museums all were few blocks away. We walked to the Majestic theater for the opera in Broadway and walked to Penn station for Amtrak back to Boston. The hop on hop off bus station also 5mins away from the hotel. For people who like me 1st time here, I would said it's really helpful and make your travel much easier than take the taxi or subway. Overall, I wasn't a Fan of NYC as it's quite dirty and jam everywhere but now beacuse of MONYC,I have changed my mind, i will be back...
