Visited here today window view of central park next to trump hotel at columbus monument.this place is frequented by sharon stone,morgan freeman etc.even a back exit into shopping mall need to experience this place great staff

This is undoubtedly the best hotel in New York considering its location, unparallel views of the Central Park from the top, proximity to fine dining and shopping. The staff is one of the friendliest I have encountered and made me feel at home on the other side of the earth from home! And like all Mandarin Oriental, the rooms are superbly and luxuriously comfortable

Wonderful stay at Mandarin Oriental NYC. Can´t be much better than this. The staff is the best i´ve ever met. Location, view from the room, service was absolutely outstanding. Will be back in the future, for sure

Stayed for the Thanksgiving week and had a great time with my family. We did not know that we needed to book for breakfast this week and that was annoying. Perfect location and very good service. Will be back

They are truly the standard for incredible service. They try to bend over backwards- room service food/coffee, turn-down service, beautiful quiet and luxurious rooms. Couldn't have been happier.Also upon check-in they really try to offer you what you're looking for- they don't say "sorry", or "I'm sorry I have nothing to offer", nothing like that. They truly strive for happy guests.

Fantastic service from beginning to end , the best way to experience NYC. Incredible views!! I hope to have the opportunity to experience this ultimate luxury experience!!!!Location is exceptional, walking distance to most destinations in the city fantastic restaurants bars and shopping..

Great looking hotel and service has been good. The concierge had been amazingly helpful with securing dinner reservations and lunch suggestions. However, the front desk could make some improvements. I had notified the hotel weeks in advance that I was coming with my family for our babymoon. However, on arrival the gentleman that was checking me in was disinterested and made no acknowledgement that I was here for a special occasion. Furthermore, the couple next to me was being upgraded and given multiple room choices for their room upgrade. On the other hand,there was no mention of an upgrade for my stay despite my stay being booked with FHR program. Very limited on-site dining options and the only restaurant available for lunch has strict cut off times. We had checked into the hotel at 1:30 pm and went directly to the restaurant at 2:05 pm and was told they were no longer seating for lunch after 2:00 pm. We also had our young son with us and there was no special welcome gesture that we have come to expect from other brands like the Four seasons or The Ritz. The hotel does have a unique place to grab a cocktails at the Aviary bar. Very creative cocktails with great views! Overall, I would likely check out one of the other central Park hotels next time I come to NYC. I still enjoy the Mandarin Oriental brand but this hotel has been my least favorite one.

We had an amazing baby moon!! The entire staff was very friendly! We had a great time with my husband and my dog!!Breakfast and dinner at the hotel was incredible !!, Great location!!! and the view was fantastic!!

MO NY is beautifully appointed with superb views over Central Park and within easy walking distance of key attractions. The bar vista on floor 35 is a must for an early evening drink and the long pool a real bonus. Over our 3 night stay the staff were invariably courteous, professional and responsive which makes a great difference on vacation, even stretching to looking after our bikes whilst we lunched. The rooms are elegant and the beds luxuriously comfortable. Why the fallen star? Although our agent booked over 4 months in advance requesting rooms on the same floor for our daughter, we arrived tired after a 14 hour journey to be informed at 4pm, our room would not be ready until well after 5pm (check-in is allegedly 3pm). We were eventually offered a room 4 floors away from our daughter. The shower was defective in this room. (An engineer eventually came to fix it). We found the next day, the bath taps simply didn’t work. (An engineer came to fix this).The final day the fuse in the bathroom blew when using the hairdryer. We have stayed at MO many times in other cities - NYC not quite up there.

Someone that we had met in DC had suggested going here for a drink on the bar because the view was really good. They were right about the view it really is a good one from the 35th floor. The service however was really rather poor. The colleague who greeted us and showed us to a great seat was lovely and friendly. After at least five minutes another colleague came with some drinks menus and eventually some water. He didn’t seem to reappear and after about ten minutes we got someone else’s attention to order a couple of beers. These even then took quite a while to be served and when the colleague went to pour one of them he did a terrible job, creating a lot of froth and not much beer in the glass! I would have expected any server to be able to pour a beer without too much trouble! So it’s definitely worth a trip up to the bar for the view but don’t expect great service. It’s a shame as it has loads of potential and you’d expect better for the very expensive prices.

We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at this hotel. The entire staff was extremely friendly, responsive and accommodating. If any issue came up (we had a small one with room service) it was addressed and corrected even more than was necessary - they went above and beyond to take care of things for us!

Stayed here on a business trip for one night. The room smelled like BO. I got in late and wanted to order room service. No room service menu in the room. I called down. Absolute chaos. They said they would send someone up with a menu. Never came. A colleague was staying on another floor and I borrowed his menu. The towels were very disappointing for a Mandarin. Not plush resort towels as you would expect. It was a less than ideal stay.

Was initially in a Central Park view room that was small and sadly mostly view of Trump Hotel. Paid upgrade to move to Premiere Central Park Suite, a room that normally goes for 2600 (?!!). The front desk was awesome in arranging my move. Truly great service! However the room itself, you hear a fair amount of noise from above. I’ve never had that in a hotel before. Just shoes on the floor above, endlessly. The much bigger issue is the blackout drapes don’t really black out. I called for someone to help at about 6am when it was already fairly bright, and maintenance agreed it seemed weird for such an expensive suite to have curtains that don’t overlap. He tried (as I did) to push them together but didn’t work. They also left gap at the wall. He offered to come back later with tape to try and tape them to the wall and together. That just seems a little low rent for Mandarin— for something a thousand dollars more than Park Hyatt’s much nicer city view suite (where I didn’t need tape!Service at Hyatt not nearly as good but sleep wins!) So in summation: staff is super nice— manager heard about curtains and at check out apologized saying he wish he knew it was issue at check in (not sure how I’d know before dawn) but small rooms and the suite (at least #4500) can’t sleep much past dawn. Wouldn’t stay here again. Really really REALLY wanted to like it. This pic is as dark as i could get in the room once sun comes up.

We had two suits reserved and they both were ready before check in time. First suite the sofa had bunch of stains on it, and the second suite, the sheet on the bed was dirty. I contacted the front desk manager, very responsive and caring, he personally made sure that the issues were taken care of. I wasn’t impressed with the hotel restaurant for dinner at all, very short menu and very small portions, but was very good for breakfast.Overall I had a very good stay at this hotel and would recommend it.

My family has had a wonderful experience staying at Mandarin Oriental, New York. The front desk services were excellent. The Front Office Manager Kent was extremely courteous, professional, and accommodating. Kent and his team provided our family with lots of help and hospitality during our 3-day stay. We dined a few times at the Hotel's restaurant Asiate. We loved the dinner Tasting Menu and the Sunday Brunch. And we loved the VIEW at the window seats :) Asiate's services were excellent. The Hotel is at a great location. The panoramic view in the high floor Suite are spectacular. We love everything about Mandarin Oriental NYC. We would definitely recommend it to our friends.

With its prime location overlooking Central Park and in the center of all activities in Manhattan, the Mandarin Oriental hotel is a great place to stay at while visiting NYC! You can easily walk to different sites (for us, this included Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Broadway, MoMA, American Museum of Natural History, among many others! -> see my other reviews for comments on these). Breakfast was delicious; we went down to the Asiate every morning and ordered various items on the menu - all of which we loved. We also had room service one evening, and it was excellent and comparable to other meals in the city - just that you get to eat in the comfort of your room! Not to mention that the room was laid out well and the view was incredible! My only complaint was that in our particular room (not sure if it’s also the case with other rooms), the shower’s controls - hot and cold - are switched, and we didn’t realize this until later in our stay. This is so minor though, and it didn’t dim our stay at all! I will recommend this hotel to my friends should they also come to New York. Don’t even think about it - just book!

After a bike ride around Central Park we wanted a drink that could take in the views of it all. So after asking in trump tower they sent us here. Wow what a hotel !!! The place is truly stunning. Drinks were great with some truffle popcorn!!!! Amazing views of Central Park which is the cherry on top . £1350 a night to stay there is out of my range but if you got it .......

The Mandarin Oriental at Columbus Circle in NYC is an outstanding hotel. The front desk, bell, housekeeping and wait staff go above & beyond to ensure a perfect stay. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with great views on any floor. The hotel is centrally located with valet parking. A beautiful lobby level lounge and tucked away speakeasy features creative and delicious food & drink. I would stay at the Mandarin again on my next overnight in NYC.

This was our second visit to MO New York and although nothing has changed, the good news is that nothing has changed. The hotel is beautiful and well kept, staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and you can’t beat the location. It’s a great place to walk around, Central Park is directly across the street and numerous other sites within a short distance. I’d highly recommend the MO if you’re in NYC

We travelled to NY in early morning and front office was really friendly to offer early check in for us. Really appreciate for this great favor!! Also, we had drinks at the speakeasy bar for girls talk. Unforgettable trip with friends and warm sweet home at NY.

I loved this hotel, having stayed at many hotels in NYC over the years, I'd definitely return to this one. The location is fabulous, I could have sat and watched the view from my room for hours, over the Hudson River. The rooms are on the small side but perfectly adequate, the bathrooms are lovely. The spa is very nice and I enjoyed the pool although there could be a few more chairs around the side. The view from the bar is fab.

I stayed here for 3 nights for business reasons, and overall it was a great stay!The amenities and the service was excellent! My room was spacious and offered lots of closet and storage space. The bathroom was equally spacious with room to comfortably get ready. The location is pretty great - Accessible from both the mall and from street level. It's super convenient to have Whole Foods and Bouchon Bakery within minutes. It is also above the subway so it was easy to zip to Soho and Downtown. My fav part was the gym. It is spacious, clean, and has the latest and greatest equipment. It is comparable to the gym at the St Regis and the Peninsula. The one inconvenience was that one has to change elevators to get to their rooms..but overall a great stay!

We like big suites and travel a lot. Mandarin was recommended to us cause of the view. We got a Central Park View Suite. Very nice view. The suite is kind of small for NYC Top Suites and the bathroom really to small. So we have seen better suites. But location is top and if you don’t like the Penthouse next door at Trump Hotel it’s worth a try. We wouldn’t go for it again...
user_name:
Michael S
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Having once lived in Manhattan, I can say that the location of the Mandarin Oriental is perfect for just about anything you wish to do in the City. The view over Central Park from our room was amazing.From check-in to check out, the Hotel staff were courteous, welcoming, and offered suggestions/tips without even being asked! The dining/bar options are fantastic; as is the availability of a fitness center, pool, and spa. The room was impeccable and offered everything to make our stay comfortable. There are no coffeemakers in the rooms, but Room Service quickly spoiled us with prompt delivery of coffee scheduled the previous night. Sometimes even luxury hotels encounter inefficiencies, quality issues etc., but I can honestly say that everything was absolutely perfect at the Mandarin Oriental. The visit was

We stayed three nights in July and absolutely loved everything about the hotel. From the start driving up to the hotel was easy. Valets took the bags up and car to the garage, no stress. We go up to the 35th floor for check-in and it was very smooth. Everyone was super friendly. Our room was on the 51st floor over looking Central Park and the view was drop dead amazing. Room was really big and very clean. Bathroom was posh and large. Room service was fast and delicious. We had kids at ages 5 and 1, they were very welcoming in the hotel AND the indoor pool. Lots of kids there during our stay. The gym was a bit small but Equinox is downstairs. Will definitely go back.
user_name:
Bj1005th
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I am a long time Ritz Carlton Central Park customer but found the rooms ridiculously overpriced for this stay and stayed at the Mandarin Oriental. The service from arrival to departure was outstanding, our room had a 51st floor view of Central Park was breathtaking, the food and drinks delectable. Housekeeping staff took the time to do little things like wrap our phone power cords with velcro ties, leave a plastic bag to put my toothbrush when I left, etc. I have been a hard core Ritz Carlton customer; it looks like I am making a change!

I am surprised that at this kind of room rate, the wifi which is a very basic utility for travelers is at such poor low speed. If you want a higher speed, you have to pay extra! I found it offensive! Penny wise pound foolish for such a high end hotel!

We had incredible drinks at the beautiful bar that opened to the corner of Central Park. Have never experienced such tastes. Recommend the tequila that is served in a see through type flask. The bourbon served in a closed plastic bag that wafted everything bagel smells was a crowd pleasure.

Spacious rooms with an incredible view of central park. The service was excellent and the rooms were very clean. The gym and the pool are immense. I loved the infused water offered at the gym especially after working out, it was very refreshing! I enjoyed breakfast at Asiate, particularly the delicious homemade granola while contemplating the impressive view of the heart of New York! Very well located in Manhattan, I highly recommend it.

The Mandarin Oriental, New York City, is both stunning and elegant. Located adjacent to the Time Warner Center, it's extremely convenient and well kept. The staff is professional and goes out of their way. This was my third trip and I intend on returning many more times.

"MICKEY MOUSE looks like he's conducting the lights!" I tell you, the tiny school-girl swinging her arms about at the next table & showing me Mickey in the "The Sorcerer's Apprentice" was absolutely right. Since our Mandarin Oriental hotel visit here in New York City, we now stop by whenever we're in the area & have been waiting to try out THE AVIARY, the new lobby bar & small-plate café designed by Chicago cocktail Svengali, Grant Achatz. The Aviary is quite pleasurable & I for one had already been a loyal fan of this grande space for several years. Now, gazing up at the sweeping new overhead light installation, it did indeed appear that Mickey Mouse was magically conducting the swirling back & forth-shaped illumination dancing across the ceiling. The Aviary is located in the Mandarin Oriental Hotel lobby which features panoramic views 35 floors over Central Park that regularly melt the heart of even the most seasoned traveler. Swirling lines of the ceiling lights are picked up again by sweeping lamp-stands curving up & over massive sectional couches & dropping down-light over the central seating areas. They add dynamic whimsy to an already magnificent space.Known from the start for its promise of "atomic" cocktails theatrically steaming with dry-ice explosions of brandy & bourbon & tequila, I confessed today that I had never actually seen one of these concoctions being served & only knew them from photos, since I usually come to the hotel at lunch-time. To my delighted surprise, the Bar Manager, Berit Soli-Holt, graciously indulged me with an amazing personal demonstration, up in the bar's staging area. The Aviary cocktails are crafted by "liquid chefs" at an expansive bar space displayed behind floor-to-ceiling glass which stretches the length of The Aviary above & behind us, while we guests gaze out at Central Park. As Berit told me the story of The Aviary, she produced wonderful rum-spiced steam rushing over the counter from a slim-necked chemist beaker at the bar. All of this inspired me to try out her suggestion of a "Boom," as she called it, with my salad. This is the special cocktail known as "Boom Goes the Dynamite," in which she stirred up a combination of rums, vanilla, violet — with just a gourmet touch of ver-jus and "rooibos," which is some sort of South African herb. After a few minutes of fragrant rum explosion at my table, a straw was playfully served — although I preferred a glass, which was delivered frozen, to best set off the flavors of the drink.Both times I've enjoyed the chicken sandwich, it has been delivered by the chef himself & combined a spicy fried chicken cutlet dressed with creamy sauce & lightly pickled cucumber slices ever-so-carefully fanned out on a sesame bun. Most dishes — such as my Orchard Salad today — are garnished with colorful flourishes of edible blossoms, often pansies, fresh plucked from the stem. The little movie-savvy princess & her mother were gone by the time I finished a cappuccino, but I will always remember her imaginatively "conducting" the ceiling lights like Mickey Mouse for me.
user_name:
VKMc
New York City, New York

review_body: It's exactly what you would expect it to be. Accommodations are top notch. Service is on point. The view from bar is ridiculous. Yes it's expensive but worth every penny. Enjoy! Oh and don't be cheap know what you are getting into - live a little.

Lovely hotel, enjoyed our stay in a large room for NY with good views over Central Park. With the hotel being so high you do not get any street noise. The breakfast was included and excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Love the view, the service, the food, the cocktails and the giant “chicharrón” (pork). Perfect to go with friends at the End of the day. It is in floor 35 looking central park. Ask for a table near the window.

My wife and I visited new york and stayed in the madarin oriental for a friends wedding. I wanted to make it a special trip and the mandarin oriental did not disappoint! I can honestly say this is one of the finest hotels i have stayed in anywhere in the world. The level of service was superb and the staff were friendly and attentive. We had a meal in the hotels restaurant and had the tasting menu. It was the best meal we ate in new york, bearing in mind we ate at Daniels (michellin starred restaurant). On top of the stunning tasting menu we had a gorgeous view of central park. I couldn't recommend either the hotel or the restaurant more highly, truly a 5 star experience, expensive but well worth the money.

The service, amenities and rooms exceeded my expectations. The rooms, in particular, were large and well-appointed, especially considering that most NYC hotels are quite small. The service was great, and concierge was so helpful. My husband was having an allergic reaction, and a runner was promptly sent out to get him Benadryl. Thank you for a great stay!

Air quality is now awful. Air vents are coated in grime and nastiness. Last visit made me ill. Used to be a time-tested favorite--great views, great location, great service. Ruined by terrible indoor air. Had to leave early.
user_name:
livefortravel878
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have wanted the oppurtunity to try the Mandarin Oriental for a while. When I finally had the oppurtunity it lived up to expectations.Service, room and location were incredible, as was the view of Central Park from our room. We had breakfast in the room three mornings in a row and it was great. All of the staff were very helpful and thoroughly professional, but I want to point out that the doormen were especially helpful in giving us directions and a few recommendations.We look forward to going back.

I work a lot in NYC and fortunately I am able to stay at MO NYC on most of my trips there. This is an amazing hotel and the service is excellent, from the moment that I arrive and the door men greet me, to the front desk staff that always remember who I am, to the housekeeping that adds special touches like flowers and candy in the room. The lobby bar is also great and has an amazing view of Central Park.

The entrance may be ground level but the lobby starts on 35th and meeting rooms on the 36th. The rooms are big, especially the bathrooms with a long, double sink elegant bathroom. The views from my room - 3824- overlooked a rooftop so not so good, but other directions have awesome views over central park. The lobby is small, but nice The bar is amazing with cool views and amazing drink concoctions - some $50 bucks and to be shared.

We stayed at the M.O for 3 nights. Overall the stay was comfortable. Rooms were nice (albeit bit tired) and bathroom was spacious. The room was not as nice as the picture on the MO website for our category but comfortable. One should not expect the service levels of MO in Asia or any nice chain in Asia. Second, at this price point, I think there are several hotels in NY that are much nicer (such as the Park Hyatt, The Peninsula and St Regis). We have also stayed at several mid-tier hotels (mostly W’s) and have found the rooms and service to be at least as nice for less than half the price. The night we checked in, we were disappointed to see that the bathroom had not been properly cleaned and there were several strands of hair in the shower. Also, when they did the turn-down service, they did not leave chocolate mint by the hotel – they were happy to bring it if you called and were actually surprised that it wasn’t already there – on all 3 nights.Breakfast at Asiate was nice. The Aviary is the best part of the hotel – it is in the hotel but managed by the Alinea group of Chicago. If you are staying at the hotel, you don’t need to book on Aviary website, which requires a non-refundable deposit. We ordered BF in room one morning and it the room service would not answer the phone despite long tries. Eventually, the operator was able to connect – again not what you would expect in a 4-star, let alone the fact that this is a 5-star.Overall, I would not stay here again given the awesome choices in this awesome city.

The location perfect close to all the best restaurant The service was so professional and so nice The spa is unbelievable the best The room is clean stylish and so beautiful view The best breakfast and best bar The manager reception Kent is so nice and give the best service For sure I gonna come back

I booked the hotel 3 nights through AMEX FHR, the hotel knows to give excellent service, the reception manager took care of me personally and took care of me in a really good way, the view from the room is worth the money and it is an experience of the city to see the city backed up. I recommend only a view suite to the park. The hotel food is really tasty and the breakfast is excellent. The hotel does everything you will be pleased with! The hotel has replaced us with an apartment for a larger one, but the classic nightmare with a view of the park is what I recommend.

We are great fans of NYC and visit regularly. This was our first stay at the Mandarin Oriental and I think it is fair to say we will struggle to stay anywhere else now. Our room was a good size for a New York hotel and had amazing views of Columbus Circle and Central Park. It only lacked a coffee maker other than that everything we needed was there. Housekeeping was incredible, they tidied and refreshed with attention to detail such as replacing a small tube of toothpaste when they spotted we had run out and making the bed and changing the towels even though we were a late check out. The best we have ever experienced anywhere in the world. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning, it is a table service breakfast so no opportunity to help yourself at the buffet, this makes service a little slow and we had quite a wait one morning although we were given coffee in the lobby as we waited. Orders arrived wrong and we had to send the toast back to ask for it be actually toasted! So maybe a little fine tuning required on the breakfast front. Other than that guests can dine in the hotel or take a quick spin in the elevator down to floor three where there is a plethora of dining opportunities within Columbus Circle. The concierge was very helpful and knew the magic words to get tables at restaurants that were packed. Thanks Concierge team! The Aviary bar in the hotel is great fun with a madcap scientist approach to drinks so we had a slingshot that had to be cracked to reveal the drink, a steaming glass flask that contained a the drink and a ship in a bottle to name but three! Not cheap but a great bit of theatre, and the drinks a good too. There is also The Office which is like a speakeasy hidden behind a door. There is a well equipped gym, a lap pool and a spa that is right there on floor 35 where you check in rather than hidden in the subterranean depths of the hotel as they very often are.From Columbus Circle all of New York is at your feet with subway stations nearby and Central Park across the street the location couldn't be better. We had a great stay and will be back.

With it's incomparable location and service, Mandarin Oriental is definitely one of the highlight during my journey in NYC. Mahmut was fantastic for my checked in, Fitness and Spa were always excellent as it always be, Wendy helped a lot in my turn-down as she cared about me and offered humidifier proactively when I told her NYC humidity is low compared with my city and I am feeling dry. Check out was proceed professional. Concierge was helpful as well whenever I approached them for some inquiries and needs. I will absolutely come back again.

I wanted to write this review because I had stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, New York one time previously and did not have a great experience. I decided to try it again, and this time my expectations were exceeded. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean, and offered wonderful views over Central Park. I was snowed in during a blizzard and the Mandarin was the perfect place to be with all the restaurants and the Time Warner Center below to keep me occupied. The hotel is also steps away from Central Park. Perhaps management has changed since my first stay, but I am so glad I decided to try it again and will definitely be staying here again on my future visits to New York.

We signed up to be "Friends of the Mandarin" and immediately got an upgraded room with a view of Central Park (which is marred, as is so much of modern life, by Trump whose hotel blocks the view of the park). The room was spacious, the bathroom even more spacious for a NYC hotel. Bathrobes, slippers, and endless attention by the staff made this a memorable and comfortable stay. The breakfasts were wonderfully prepared. The new lobby bar turned out to have the same view as our room, so there was no point to stopping there. It was also pleasant, given the bad weather, to have ready access to the Time-Warner mall where we wandered for an hour or two.

Like most of the other Mandarin Oriental Hotels the one in New York is superb. Perfect Location, very nice ambiance, very professional staff. Only the carpets in my room could be renewed and a Nespresso machine would be fine and can be expected in a Hotel at this class and Price.

I've had the distinct pleasure of staying at the Mandarin Oriental New York for the past fifteen years. As soon as I exit my car, I'm swept away into a world of unrivaled beauty and luxury. I've traveled the world and the staff here is by far the best I've ever encountered. The amazing Doormen, Concierge Desk, Housekeeping, Room Service, Front Desk Personnel, Security and Management always make me feel incredibly special and welcome. My needs and wants are taken care of quickly with a smile. Service on every level is impeccable. They make me feel like a valued part of their family and it doesn't get any better than that! The rooms are spotless and beautifully appointed. The beds are dreamy, views outstanding, shower is amazing, soaking tub is an oasis after a long day of tripping around the City. I LOVE this hotel!!Thank you Manny, Pablo, Felix, Ken, Eileen and so many others for your friendship and outstanding service through the years! I can't wait to return!

Everything about this hotel is done right. The staff, the quick housekeeping and room serivice, the spacious bathrooms and floor to ceiling views-hard to find in NYC.The lobby bar has a spectacular view of the Park and skyline. We had a little glitch and the staff was AMAZING in making things right. If you want quiet elegance, this is your hotel. the doorman were spotty in friendliness and resonsiveness , but not a deal breaker. they could be more welcoming since you don't enter into the hotel lobby itself-compared to some other hotels where you really get a great welcome from the doormen-this could be an area of improvement. But don't let that stop you from staying here-it was FANTASTIC!! My new favorite location is Columbus Circle.there is a ton of connstruction going on near Times Square (yuk) and around Madison-so this is a great area, and walking distance to Hell's Kitchen for foodiesThank you for the great Stay!!

This was our first time at the Mandarin, and I must say it was excellent on all counts. It's located by Columbus Circle across the street from Central Park. Food is a little pricey, but the quality is there. The room itself was very nice. Spacious bathroom, comfortable bed. Immaculate. Customer Service was spot on to. Room Service was delivered within 25 minutes. I would definitely book here again.

Before travelling to New York, I emailed MO to book in a breakfast in their restaurant, I informed them it was for a special birthday and would like a table by the window. Had a lovely email back from them confirming they had availability. Arrived that morning, no reservation could be found and a very uninterested lady on reception who had no interest in why we were there. Despite trying to tell her we would like a window seat, she showed us to a table furthest away from any windows, facing a bar!! The service was awful and we felt really let down by the hotel, it cost us $100USD for the breakfast and it was mediocre at best, could've spent $20 in Starbucks and at least had a conversation with the barista! We stayed at MO in Kuala Lumpur and this was miles away from this hotel, they need to take some tips from KL on how to treat others. This hotel should be ashamed of themselves, $100 is a lot of money to save up to spend on a special breakfast which was completely ruined. Will never step foot in this hotel again and will not be recommending it to anyone else.

I attended a black tie gala at the Mandarin recently and found the service to be more than lacking. First, during the reception, there were tables filled with empty glasses that were never cleared. Second, we go in to the ballroom for dinner and during the first course, we were not served bread. There was a plate of butter and other tables had bread, yet when we asked the server, she told us it was not being served. When the first course was finished, they half cleared the tables. As the main course was served, one of my friends was on her way back from the ladies room and she was refused service. She waited nearly 20 mins for her dinner. As wine was served during this course, the used my shoulder to balance the bottle. Finally, during the dessert service, the plates were thrown onto the table rather than placed. This meant that the rather delicate mousse was splattered all over my arm. The servers did not apologize nor bring fresh plates. We had to consistently flag down the servers for wine and when I requested tea, instead of coffee, the server rolled her eyes and said she’s be back. By the time she finally arrived with my tea, everything was being cleared. The event space was beautiful, it overlooks the park and Columbus Circle, but for the kind of money that was paid to host the event, I am appalled by the quality of service.

This is a very luxurious hotel in a great location on the edge of Central Park and sitting above a shopping centre at Columbus Circle. The rooms are much larger than you would usually find in Manhattan and although our room was a bit dated it was extremely comfortable with great views over the Hudson River and Central Park. The service was as you would expect from a five star hotel, polite and friendly and quietly understated. We were there for a birthday celebration and the hotel even provided a birthday cake. Not cheap but worth every penny!

Great location, nice pool for doing laps and good gym. The rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable but the clincher was the service.. dare I say it - almost Asian standards of meticulousness, both at front desk and housekeeping. Very very pleasant stay

This is a fantastic located hotel close to all amenities and attractions! As like all oriental hotels the standard and quality of rooms and food offered is excellent!The wine selection and cocktails are a must for anyone travelling to NY! Great atmosphere and throughly enjoyed my stay here. Many thanks will come again

Love the location, love the rooms, love the views. The rooms are small but well-furnished and bathrooms are top-notch. The location is very convenient since you are inside Columbus Circle so there are a variety of restaurant and shopping options without ever having to step outside (if there is inclement weather). Service is fine. There have been a couple snafus with reservations but never anything major. Biggest con is room service menu seems to have exaggerated prices along with their in-hotel restaurant. However, they do have a lovely speakeasy-style bar that serves amazing cocktails and an amazing shareable icecream sundae. The cocktails and dessert are worth the splurge.

We had a lovely stay at this hotel. We were allocated in a Suite facing the Central Park. It was an amazing accommodation, well cleanded daily and had everything you can think of. Upon arrival in the afternoon about 3.30pm the Suite was not ready yet due to any circumstances with another guest. We were tired from the long journey and a bit disappointed since we wished to refresh ourselves and to relax a bit. Nevertheless, the staff took good care of us and we found an agreement with which we could cope. We could move into our Suite then about 1,5h later. Congrats to the Lady on duty which handled the circumstances very well. The location of the hotel is just fantastic and we would recommend it any time.

This is my fourth stay at the M.O. in NY. It is one of the nicest properties, especially in that area (Hell's Kitchen/ West side). The style of the rooms is a bit dated but still very clean and well put together. The standard rooms are small with a disproportionate bathroom (the bathroom is about two third size of the rest of the room).This time I stayed with a city view (vs park) which is fine, however my room (4226) was right in front of the service door and the service personnel kept on banging against my room door.The quality of the amenities is what you would expect at that price point, perfect.

The Mandarin Oriental, New York has exceeded our expectation again! Great job!!!Just stayed at this property for 4 nights and we had a splendid time. We were upgraded to a Premier View room, overlooking Central Park on the 46th. Floor. The view was breathtaking and I cannot emphasized how much we enjoyed the service and personal attention that the staff at Mandarin Oriental, New York have provided us. I do not write reviews much unless it is well deserved. Having stayed at some of the finest hotels around the vicinity, Mandarin Oriental scored, based on our experience. The room was clean and the amenities were of superior quality. I would like to take this opportunity to express our sincere gratitude to Ms. Yarisol Martinez, the front desk supervisor for her assistance during our entire stay. Having said that, we feel that the service provided by the entire staff at Mandarin Oriental has exceeded our expectation. We would like to stay at The Mandarin Oriental again,the next time we visit New York. We highly recommend

One of the best hotels in New York. Very private, excellent service, and the concierge work magic. The rooms are small, but very comfortable and luxurious. The location is wonderful, with two 3 Michelin star restaurants downstairs. The only complaint this time around is that the bars seem to always be full. If you are a guest, they make room for you, but its a process and you have to agree to let go of your table by a certain time.

My friend & I had the Merc' collect us from JFK, not a hotel car but arranged by the hotel and all went smoothly, whisked into Manhattan and to the MO doors. We pretty much dealt with our own cases and made our way in, we were directed to the lift by somebody inside the ground floor entrance and up we went to the 35 floor. Usually in hotels of this magnitude your bags are whisked and you are ushered to reception by a member of the front door team, this was noticeable but wasn't any major concern. Check-in lady was excellent & efficient and took us up to our Hudson-Twin. I was travelling with my friend and we were in NY for the Opera. Twin rooms are invariably the lower category rooms in deluxe hotels from my experience, this twin was lovely and comfortable, although due for its twenty year refurb now as the decor is looking tired and dated. No fruit in the room but I guess this is because of our lower category room. No heated towel-rail in bathroom or heated floor, which is pretty standard these days in top hotels, but the general layout of the bathroom was good with great shower and bath with a view. The room was very comfortable with quality furnishings and fixtures, albeit nearly twenty years old. The room had a nice walk-in closet with space for our things. Beds/linen top quality, super-comfortable, the glassware, crockery etc was quality, tea/coffee-making facilities in-room were very good, fresh-ground coffee and percolator provided to make lovely fresh coffee instead of those awful 'pod' machine things that many hotels are using these days. Fresh milk provided in silver jug which kept it cool. These were good finer details. There was no magnifying mirror fixture in the bathroom but we phoned down for one and an excellent illuminated portable one was delivered within ten minutes. Excellent body products in the bathroom, re-stocked generously. Housekeeping and turn-down was good, but only received bedtime pillow chocolate on the first of our four nights. Complimentary bottled water generously provided in room. Room service was prompt and the fresh milkshake brought up to my room late at night was delicious. The restaurant was beautiful, it's had a fairly recent make-over and the views of Central Park and Midtown are awesome. Breakfast was delicious, delicious freshly-squeezed Grapefruit juice, delicious Canadian proper bacon, all five star, and the management team and servers are extremely pleasant and professional. We didn't manage to get a window seat on our visits to the restaurant but this was no big deal. We got great views and photo moments from the Ballroom upstairs, it was not in use during our stay and on a couple of mornings after my swim I sneaked in to sit in the window to admire the views! The hotel reception area is beautiful, although it too is due for a modernisation I am led to believe. Concierge guy, William if I remember, was excellent and very knowledgeable about his great City. The Pool was great, big enough for a good workout, the Pool room was a bit on the cold side, not sure if this was because I went down early morning, but with small kids this area would be too cold, air-con blowing cold during winter in a big pool area made for a very cold space. Pool attendants were polite and professional. My morning sauna was not the best, it just got colder and colder and after 30 mins in there I realised it was not working correctly. I went to the guy at the Pool desk and he came and fiddled with it and said it had shut itself down, he said it would be lovely and hot the following morning but it wasn't ever really up to usual Sauna temperatures. Also, the Sauna floor under the boards looked like it hadn't been scrubbed in quite a long time. For a hotel of this rating this basic hygiene slacking was disappointing. Pool changing area and gym were of a good standard with nice ice-cold citrus water machine and fruit basket laid on. There was a slight issue with our usage of the Spa facilities, we'd gone down to use the facilities and was told by a Spa member of staff that the vitality pool and steam room were not working, but then when we got back to our room and rang down and complained to the duty-manager that we hadn't checked into supposedly the best hotel in NY to then learn that the vitality pool & steam room wasn't working, she got straight on the case and we were invited straight back down to use the facilities. It was obvious to me that the Spa member of staff was attempting to reserve the Spa for people coming for treatments and for members maybe, thus attempting to usher hotel guests back to their rooms with lame stories about facilities not working. This is a very poor philosophy as the simple fact is, without paying hotel guests there would be no Spa. I realise that they are offering a deluxe service for Spa treatment customers, but this must not be to the detriment of the hotel guests who rightfully wish to come and have a steam and wallow in the vitality pool. This issue was dealt with promptly by management and my friend and I were welcomed to use the Spa facilities for the duration of our four night stay, and the standard usage charges were wavered for all of our Spa visits, which made amends and reconfirmed my trust in the MO brand. It has to be said that the Spa is now in need of modernisation, the relaxation room/beds are very comfortable and the Spa changing rooms well fitted, but the vitality pool space does now need refurbishment, floor tiles etc need replacing around the vitality pool and in the showers. The steam room is dated although it is a quality steam room, and as usual for MO hotels, the vitality pool is great, hot and powerful, although it did stop a few times and the man had to come and jiggle buttons to get it going again. For all of the little niggles, I still loved my time at the MONY, once the bedrooms, main reception, Spa thermal area etc are modernised, there is no reason why the MO cannot claim to be the best hotel in New York and certainly back up there with Four Seasons, Peninsular and Park Hyatt. I would certainly consider choosing the MO on my next visit to New York... Mark Drinkwater.

Just a great place...sort of hidden away. Restaurant has to die for views of Central Park and New York City. Rooms are lovely and you get that Mandarin Oriental treatment by the staff. And if you are going to a Jazz at Lincoln Center performance, just a few steps away in the Time Warner Building.

Being among the top luxury brands guarantees attentive perfection in details, but the location on the southwest corner of Central Park in addition to Lincoln Center's proximity summarizes for the perfect choice on base for catching up on performances, fashion week events or simply indulging in the amenities! Stayed Summer 2014(-can only appoint as of April 2017 onwards for the review)

This was my first time staying here and I was impressed from the moment I walked in the door. The service was excellent from start to finish. The rooms are quiet and very comfortable. I enjoyed the room service, breakfast and drinks at the lounge, with amazing view of central park. Great experience and looking forward to coming back.

We stayed in a suite overlooking the Hudson River. The views were amazing and the suite was so comfortable and luxurious. It had one and a half bathrooms which is so unusual in NYC. We received everything we asked for, from a refrigerator to a nesesspro coffee maker. The rain shower was hot and plentiful, with all beautiful bath amenities. A fruit platter and chocolate cake were thoughtfully presented for my husbands birthday.

We were thrilled to get brilliant tickets for Springsteen on Broadway and spent 5 nights at this wonderful hotel within walking distance of theatreland.We could not fault it in any way. Our well appointed upgraded room overlooking Central Park was everything we could have wished for. The hotel facilities were first class and the friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff were excellent with a special mention for the brilliant concierge Bryam who recommended and got excellent seats for two great Broadway shows and the door staff who pulled out all the stops to get us through the blizzards to see BruceWe would not stay anywhere else in New York

We stayed for 3 nights over a weekend. The room was tired and the furniture scuffed. On the first night we could not use the bar, because we had not booked a table. We tried to book a table at the bar on the second night, but were told that they only had availability at 5:45 and 10:45pm. This meant that we were paying premium prices for facilities that predominantly non-guests were using. It would have been nice to have been told when we booked the hotel that we also needed to book a table at the bar. When we finally managed to get to the bar, we were under a strict time limit, so not very relaxing. Next time we will stay somewhere else and just book a table at the bar...

Stylish. Friendly. Well orchestrated. Tremendous views. And wonderful food. Great for locals with guests or those of us fortunate to be in on business. Strongly recommend for a nice and long leisurely dining experience.

We checked into the Mandarin Oriental before 1PM Sunday 25 February for our long-awaited girlfriend getaway. Our room wasn’t ready, so we decided to have a quick bite at The Aviary NYC before our matinee -- other luxury hotels welcome guests with a bit of bubbly, unfortunately, not Mandarin Oriental. When we got back to MO after dinner, we were given our keys. Our room was on the 48th floor and we had high expectations, until we walked in and found two twin beds! Seriously? Both Hilton and Marriott can accommodate with two queens, or doubles at the very least. We were appalled that a luxury property, with 4-figure nightly rates, provides twin beds to adult guests. The chocolate treat delivered to celebrate the birthday was too little, too late. Upon waking, we found our view blocked by the mirrored side of the building next door. The live orchid in the bathroom was a nice touch; however, one of the lights over the sink was dark and remained so through the duration of our stay. Furthermore, the furniture was oddly placed: while there was a floor lamp in the corner of the room, there was no chair. There was a tiny chaise at the end of one of the twins, but no chaise at the end of the other. Since we saw no complementary coffee in the lobby, we decided to have breakfast at Asiate. While the food was good, no cold croissant is worth $30 – not even in NYC. Shame on MO! Luckily, The Spa at Mandarin Oriental did not disappoint and we enjoyed a number of awesome services. We had wanted to schedule mani/pedis, but were informed that those services were no longer being offered. That being said, mani/pedi services remain listed in the hardcopy spa brochure in the notebook on the desk. How hard is it to tape over the listing? The next morning we called to see if complementary coffee was offered (of course this 5-star room has no Keurig) and found out that the coffee set-up in the lobby is dismantled at 7AM, but is available ‘upon request’ at the restaurant. One would think with the mission statement: “to delight our guests each and every day” that someone might have brought some up to our room. We thought we we could provide some feedback at checkout, but we were never asked about our stay. The Front Desk could learn some valuable lessons from hotel chains that charge half their rate. MO NYC was opened in 2003, and it appears that they are way past due for some refresher training about the meaning of providing the very best in luxury hospitality.

This is an incredible hotel that values service and creates a memorable experience for guests. Everything about the visit went smoothly -- reception was great, housekeeping was great, concierge was great, restaurant was great. The service always exceeded expectations -- and I literally mean exceeded. The location couldn't be better sitting right next to Central Park and Midtown. This will be the only place I stay in NYC in the future.

We traveled to NYC for my husbands birthday and decided on the Mandarin Oriental. Our room was beautiful and overlooked Central Park. The concierge got us all the hard to get reservations we requested. They sent a lovely bottle to the room for my husbands birthday. The room was well maintained and looked exactly like the photos. Good towels and sheets. Make sure you check out the Aviary bar and The Office. Can’t say enough wonderful things about our stay. A special thanks to Joel and the concierge team for getting our reservations and broadway tickets.

As soon as I arrived to the hotel I realised they where displaying fake pictures in their web page. The view to the central park, for which I had to pay extra, was extremely ruined by the Trump International black building right in front of the window. This wasnt shown online. When I complained about it, I was told that many guests comolained about the same thing all the time but there was nothing they could do. I felt scammed. #fakeadvertisingThe room service always took like 2 hours to come so I decided to start ordering food from restaurants arround the hotel. The food frome these arrived to the hotel door in much less time than the room service.However, the hotel made sure that wasnt the case. They took 30 minutes or more to deliver it from the door to my room, every single time. It is obvious they were doing this to make me stop ordering food outside and continue ordering it to room service.The gym is extremely small and lacks some essential machines. The indoor pool was very cold; taking into account that the weather was very cold, it should have been warm.The people who cleaned the rooms were exceedingly invasive, every time I went into my room someone was inside. If I had the "do not disturb" light on (this wouldnt allow them to ring the bell of my room), THEY WOULD KNOCK MY DOOR. Dont you understand the meaning of privacy? The decoration of the hotel was horrible, distinctly old, who ever chose it has exceptionally awful taste. And last but not least, the elevator system was really slow. It took for me at least 25 minutes to get to the ground floor and I had to take two elevators.

...location just near everything, views of the central part and city, staff super friendly and not snobby, shopping everywhere, directly in Columbus Circle or 5th avenue or...in the building itself...and the building itself, just beautiful. What else do you need for your birthday?

There is something about a hotel that starts on the 35th floor. The views are epic. The hotel was full this time so we had a Hudson river view on the 47th floor AMAZING.My wife loved the bathroom which may be the largest in NYC. It was almost like having his and hers bathroom. Tub up against the view on one side and separate shower on the other side of the bathroom. There were about 5 feet between the sinks of the double vanity and dual pocket doors behind each side of the bed. "The Aviary" a sister of the Chicago location by Grant Achatz serves up kicked up bites and cocktails with the craziest spin. You could also order a Cabernet and look over Central Park from the 35th floor. Behind the Aviary is a door which leads to a speakeasy "the Office" that serves up craft cocktails made from old and rare bottles. They have a private entrance to the " the shops at Columbus Circle" oh by the way Per Se is also in the same building. No time the check out the restaurant but next time for sure. We will be back!Of course its NY so you have to get out there. Park across the street and the closest hotel to the Lincoln Center for performing arts. Cabs, cars, uber all at the ready..Last but not least great people looking after you while your taking in that intoxicating view..

We have stayed at the Mandarin at Columbus Circle 6 or 7 times and it gets better each time. First of all, the greeting from the staff at the curb with very welcoming and efficient. I thought it was going to be a hassle to have the lobby of the hotel on the 35th floor but it was not an issue at all. A quick elevator ride takes you directly to the 35th floor and opens to a beautiful space with a spectacular view! The rooms we have stayed in are modern and spacious. If you can afford it, get a park view - well worth it! You cannot beat the location - Columbus Circle. Central Park is across the street and we walked for a couple of miles there each morning. The hotel has direct access from the third floor to great shopping mall that has upscale shops and restaurants and even a Whole Foods in the basement. The location is also great for getting a cab 24/7, although we walked to most theaters and restaurants. And I saved the best for last - the spa is SPECTACULAR! We have facials and massages every time we stay there and their staff is outstanding. The Mandarin in NYC defines LUXURY! We love it and so will you!

This hotel is not only beautiful, but the service and the amenities are outstanding. In my room were two suggested novels to not only read, but take home as well. The new bar lounge offers super creative drinks and wonderful atmosphere to enjoy them in. The hotel is also directly connected to the indoor mall, which offers great shopping and five star dining, i.e; Bouchon and Per Se etc. Nice feature, sepecially when weather is inclement. You can't go wrong by staying at the Mandarin!!

I had a lovely stay at the Mandarin Oriental, NYC while in the city for a memorial. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is amazing.I stayed in a King Central Park View room that was perfect (except that I had to look at the Trump Hotel which blocks some of the view). Housekeeping was terrific and very accommodating, as was in-room dining.I’ll be back!

Very disappointed! We wanted to give another chance to MO NY on the day before NYE with family. Our room wasn't ready until 5p. I had to ask 4 times when it would be and wanted to speak with a manager, no manager spoke with us. We waited in the lobby. At a hotel at this caliber, you would expect to be invited a sitting area or outlet and offer drinks as we had 2 8 and 9 year olds. We had to be an important family appointment at 4:30p and we were already late as we traveled from 3 hours to the City. Finally after communicating 4 times they checked us into an upgraded room but it was too late and still no manager had apologized or just speak at least someone say hi to my kids (if kids are happy, parents are happy) more over in the room, wall paper was coming out by the closet and in living room area. Through the hotel smiles and eye contact have been missing. No-one addressed us with our last name, nothing special was made to make up to being totally late to our year ly organized family affair, whether or not were satisfied in room, kids were happy or not. Doormen doesn't even smile and open the door for guests, bellmen brought our luggage late and he was friendly. My kids told me after this experience that we should have gone to our choice of hotel around the world: Four Seasons. This trip made this for sure not to change the hotel choice.

Stayed two nights at the hotel, as part of a celebration of my wife's Birthday. went to a matinee on Broadway, onwe dinner with adult family at the Asiatic restaurant and another at Daniels for just the two of us. We took a room with a view of the Hudson River, the room was excellent, and large bathroom. The service is as good as it gets need something and it is there. Location at Columbus Circle was just what we needed. It is expensive, but you only go around once is this world so sometimes it is great to indulge yourself.

Mandarin Oriental is a "known" entity, which provides top quality accommodations. The NYC Hotel is located in a fantastic location, adjacent to the Time Warner Building with access to great dining and to Central Park.

Had an awesome meal in the hotel to start - then went up to the ballroom for New Years' Eve Party (2 from South Africa and 2 from London). What an awesome experience - at 69 years old I can say hand on heart was the best New Year Party hubby and I have been to. With all the entertainment, the band, the accessories and the fireworks (and of course the fantastic staff and the wonderful and welcoming people of USA - it was a night to remember....

First class, no doubt about it. Nicely located at Columbus Circle near our target, the Lincoln Center. “Paid” with airplane miles, otherwise out of my league price-wise. Room was impeccable but I was surprised there was no coffee maker or hot water appliance. Based on prior reviews, I asked about the price of WiFi, and the desk person comped it (gave it to us free) immediately and without discussion. View is fabulous, as noted. Unasked, they gave us the Central Park view, which surprised but pleased me. We liked the connection to the mall, especially since it was super cold outside. Perhaps feeling the need for a plebeian experience after the breathtaking cost of the hotel, we had breakfast at the Whole Foods in the basement of the mall - served the need perfectly. Pool was out of order during our stay due to frozen pipes. We were disappointed with that, but these things happen. Steam room and hot tub were both comfortably warm at around 100 degrees F, but another degree or two warmer would have been better. Turning on the TV set as part of the evening turn-down service is a bad idea. I would have much preferred to walk quietly into their lovely room rather than have to fumble around to find the TV remote and turn the stupid thing off.

Loved the view from the higher floor, but what I loved the most about the hotel was the girl who worked at the front, her name is Stacie Mei, very accommodating. She right away made us feel very welcomed. She was very professional, very patient and very sweet. We have been to lots of 5 star hotels, she definitely stood out going above and beyond taking care of our family and my daughter.

This Mandarin Oriental is in a great location with a great view over Central Park, and the room and service is generally great. However the toilet was insufficiently cleaned and filth clearly visible on the toilet. Asked the front desk to remedy the afternoon of my check in. They offered to change the room but I declined since I was already unpacked and asked that someone properly clean the toilet. They comped me a breakfast which I appreciated. Came back later that night about 6 hours later and it was still not addressed. The next day I spoke to a manager that the toilet was still filthy and it was taken care of that evening. This was my first time staying at the Mandarin Oriental and honestly I am not impressed with the two tries it took to take care of this issue. Staff was otherwise great but compared to other 5 star hotels I have stayed at, I just can't feel good about my stay here and am hesitant to give my business to this hotel again.

We have a good New Year vacation in New York. The hotel is next to shopping center very convenient in cold weather. The Central Park is next door and our view from hotel is spectacular.From this hotel we can walk to Broadway, Time Square easily.The service is good. Our suite is nice. With AE blacd card program we have free breakfast and incidental.It is a great vacation and great start for 2018

Stayed during the aftermath of the snowbomb for the weekend and was treated in royal fashion. The dining, views, relaxation and evening cocktails were a blessed refrain for the igloo outdoors. The MA was ideal for slipping out for dinner or braving the sub zero weather, central to everything. Easy asscess to Time Warner Center was fun to get some shopping in without the brutal cold of 5th ave.

We live in New Jersey and checked into the Mandarin Oriental for a 3 day pre-Christmas getaway in New York City and to take in Alvin Ailey at the City Center.Valet and front desk service is tops. Everyone was very attentive. Valet greeted us with a smile--we chose to take a limo to NYC from NJ since parking was $ 70.00 a night. After a warm greeting --valet escorted us up to the Lobby. Staff at the front desk was very friendly and gave us another warm welcome and wonderful room. all staff were very accommodating throughout our stay. We have a Maltese dog and there is a $ 250.00 pet fee, $ 150.00 per stay and $ 100.00 refundable cleaning fee.The hotel is within walking distance of the performing arts at City Center and Lincoln Center . The hotel and City was beautifully decorated for the Holidays. We also very much enjoyed the mall-shops at Columbus Circle which we could enter from inside the Hotel. There is a Whole Foods Restaurant and we enjoyed purchasing snacks, fresh juices, and eating from their buffet.Our room was on the 53rd floor--a Hudson River view room. The room was well designed with spectacular views of the City and New York Skyline. Good views of the Hudson--partially obstructed by other buildings.It came with a $ 75.00 per day meal or Spa allowance.WiFi was included.The bathroom was wonderful! Large with double sinks, a deep tub with views overlooking the City and Hudson River, and a TV, and a large and separate shower. The King size bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed the magnificent views and sunsets from the room and the bed.Cleaning could have been better--the room was not automatically vacuumed daily. We had to request it along with a change of linens daily. Housekeeping aims to please and we found Housekeeping will honor requests about cleaning the room, extra pillows, towels, and toiletries, etc. Room service was excellent--a broader menu would enhance it. We did not eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel. Elected to try nearby restaurants and really enjoyed Jean Jorges at nearby Trump Tower.Had a terrific and relaxing massage at the Spa. Services will be customized for you. Well decorated but does not offer all of the amenities one would expect including individual Jacuzzi tubs, multi-stream showers. Nice steam room and sauna with cold water shower.Fabulous pool on a high floor with great city views. Great fitness room and facilities also with spectacular views of NYC.. Free fitness classes offered.Overall, we highly recommend this hotel and would return. Excellent location. A doctor is on hand and the friendly and caring staff truly tries to accommodate your requests.Very much worth the splurge.

MO NYC has a comparable standard like the other MOs. Not as good as the one in Bangkok, but equivalent to the hotels in Boston or Miami.There is one point, which did make us very angry. We have been irritated all days, therefore we have decided to give only 1 star.After beeing back in the hotel, we are used to have an afternoon tea, or a coffee or even a beer. And I am used to have sometime a dinner in my hotel.In 5 days, only on 1 day we could get a table for a drink in the lounge - all tables blocked with tourists and people out of the region. We had to go in the cold to find a restsurant or a bar.And: We had 2 performances in the near MET-Opera - but had to go to other restaurants for dinner. In the hotel - restaurant, no table has been free. According to the reservation desk New Yorker peoble and tourists like the lounge and the restaurant very much. The management is proud, that the lounge and the restaurant are new hotspots in NYC. Wonderfull for New Yorker and for tourists. But what about hotel guests. Not Important enough ?

Surprise anniversary getaway for my wife and me, location and service were FANTASTIC. Room amenities and upkeep need some review, but overall we were very happy. The Mandarin will definitely be on our list for our next stay in NY...

A wonderful NYC experience!! From start to finish, this was a white glove experience and we are excited to come back and visit this amazing hotel once again. The staff, managers, and all around environmental were very impressive.
user_name:
Daniellinyc
New York City, New York

review_body: Beautiful Hotel with some surprising dints.Welcome to 2018, where even every Starbucks offers etc. offer complementary Wi-Fi. I travel the world and I can tell you that it is unheard of to charge for WiFi! And we are not talking about some budget priced hotel, we are taking about an establishment were you can exceed 100$ p/pax for breakfast. This is just unacceptable!The next unpleasant surprise fur me was in the spa. Having walked trough a snow storm in NYC all day, my wife and I were looking forward to a relaxing Jacuzzi session together in the hotels highly acclaimed spa. Unfortunately the facility practices gender separation. Although Having no understanding for this kind of medieval rule, we nevertheless decided to at least have a short 15 min stay to warm up and satisfy our curiosity. Imagine my shock when after five minutes in the water, two completely nude guys showed up walked around and finally entered the Jacuzzi ! I left that place on the spot and will never be back !

We stayed at Mandarin Oriental for our mini 3-day family vacation. This is a very beautiful hotel. The room and the views were fabulous. This hotel's service is incomparable. The staff was very courteous, warm and welcoming. They were very efficient in taking care of customers' needs. The food and service at the restaurant Asiate were wonderful too. We loved the Tasting Menu (dinner) very much. During our stay at Mandarin Oriental, everything exceeded our expectations. We loved every minute of it. We are definitely coming back to this hotel for our future family vacation.

Quick and easy check-in and wow what a location. Views from the dining room are simply breathtaking and the whole hotel has an air of understated sophistication. Escape the crowds of Times Square and enjoy the shopping and restaurant facilities just downstairs in the Time Warner Centre. TOP TIP: Whole Foods in the basement of the TW Centre is awesome - puts UK supermarkets to shame. Happy days.

Stayed for 3 nights around Christmas to NYE. Sizable and comfortable room. Decent view of the park albeit partially blocked by the Trump hotel. Not a huge fan of the decor (nice but feels a bit dated - I’m a much bigger fan of the Four Seasons downtown and the Park Hyatt on the 57th). The service is decent, but didn’t really wow me. Four Seasons will still continue to be my go-to chain.

In summary the property is ageing and it is badly kept. The tub valve was broken and one of the door knobs was broken and actually hazardous (see the pics).You need to pay for wifi...Breakfast service was slow. I had to ask 3 times for someone to come and take the order. I was with my 4 year old who was promised a colouring book which never came... The dinning room view is beautiful.Indoor swimming pool water was cold at 27 degrees celsius and the pool room was also cold which makes for an unpleasant experience overall.At check out they didnt even ask if everything was ok with the stay, they just want your money and you to move on..Overall service is very sloppy and unatentious. Not worth staying here.

Just spent one night at MO NY for a mini staycation. Wife and I do that 4-5 times a year since our little one showed up. Nothing like a 24h break in a hotel with a pool and spa -assuming the facilities are really nice.Sadly, our high expectations were not fully met at the Mandarin. Surprising since I am usually a fan of Asian five star chains or hotels, and stayed at many Mandarin which always gave me full satisfaction.Arrival:Lobby elegantly decorated but setup in such a way that you feel like you just stepped into Grand Central Station at rush hour. Very busy every time we went through it (granted it was during the xmas-New year period so one can expect lots of tourists.) But the issue is the long line of people waiting to have access to the tea salon or adjacent lobby bar. And if you feel that because you’re a guest paying close to $1,000 a night you will have some kind of priority when you decide to spend an hour there and soak up the beautiful views over Central Park and Columbus Circle, well think again.The front desk agent checking you in will waste no time telling you that the hotel has outsourced the management of those two spaces to some obscure Chicago-based company and that should you want to get in, you will have to book a reservation via the concierge. Am I still talking about the only places for drinks in the lobby area? Yes I am.Room:We booked a standard room via Amex Plat and we didn’t have an upgrade. Again, no big deal since busy season and we were not really expecting one. After seeing the first room (4818), we asked for another, that would have less of a weird layout. That room was actually accessible, which explains the unusual layout. We were moved to 5332, which while much smaller, was a bit more Mandarin style. Great views from the high floor.Small-ish bathroom, with only one vanity. And I just don’t get this. 5 Stars hôtel in a very modern building and they couldn’t design the room with a double vanity bathroom? Strange. Not a deal breaker but strange. Room was elegant in the Mandarin-asian zen traditional style. But I couldn’t put my finger on what made the overall experience disappointing. I just kept having the feeling that the room/furniture/hallway/wall paint etc...were tired.The property is definitely ripe for a renovation when you consider other similarly priced properties such as the Baccarat, the Peninsula, Four Seasons Downtown and many more.In-room Dining:Ordered dinner before our show at the Dizzy’s jazz club in the same building. One of the dishes, a market salad, had a very fishy taste that both wife and I had a strong reaction about. We didn’t touch it past one bite. Looked at the menu to make sure and no, no fish ingredients listed. Called to indicate the issue. Got some very polite apologies but the dish was not removed from the bill by the time we checked out. I didn’t say anything because its not very elegant but still...Spa:Over Asia and other countries, the spa at Mandarin properties have very high reputations so our expectations were high. My massage with Nicolette was excellent but the overall experience was a bit of a letdown. Firstly, the entrance is on the 35th floor, right next to Grand Central mentioned earlier and we debated before heading down whether we should don our plushed bathrobes or get dressed. We opted for jeans. Who walks in Grand Central in a robe? Once in the spa, everyone is very polite and kind. But there again, not sure why, the setup didn’t scream exclusive and elegant spa. Was it the floor to ceiling windows that made the atmosphere cold? The lighting? Anyway, we didn’t feel like we were in a 5 Stars spa in the middle of one of the most expensive cities in the world. Again, this is my subjective opinion.Pool:It’s located one flight above the spa and there is conveniently an elevator to bring you there from the spa, without having to go trough Grand Central. But then again, you’re in for a scary experience. This elevator is brutal. You know the kind that you don’t know when it leaves and you’re already there? Well, that’s not one of those. It’s more like a version of riding an elevator in SF in the middle of the BIg One. Everything shakes when you depart and when you arrive, and the trip takes an hour. The pool is a nice size (for NY standards)and the water had a good temperature. What was bizarre is that even though we came from the spa elevator, we were asked to sign in. Why I wonder? All guests from the spa have access to the pool so I missed the point. It just didn’t feel like you were in a Mandarin... Also, there were 3 persons at the desk who were busy tasting chocolates (from Maison du Chocolat, my favorite so I can’t blame them) but once we got to the pool which was empty, we noticed dirty towels on every single bed. None of the desk persons followed us in the pool area and there was only one clean towel on the shelf so I had to go back in and ask for one. Got one, and then we proceded to remove the used towels from a bed so we could put our belongings. Again, not the top notch service I came to expect from properties like the Mandarin.Fitness:Located next to the pool area. I decided to check it out after the pool but since I had left my sneakers at the spa reception, i was in for another dreaded elevator ride to get them and use it again to go back. Fitness equipment is excellent, new, and in great working condition. Odd thing was I couldn’t find any towels. No shelves. I saw the basket where you can dispose of the used towel but I’m still perplexed about the missing towels. Was the shelf right there, staring at me and I missed it? Who knows. The point is, towels ina fitness room should be the first thing that your hand encounters.... you should not go on an expedition trying to find one...Conclusion:Business in NY is tough. Competition is strong and one has to keep up with standards being raised every day. I get it. And that’s why my review here is a bit severe. I tried many competing properties and the way I see it, in the current state this hotel is in, there are no reasons why we should plan another staycation at the Mandarin. Just too many missed opportunities to leave a lasting impression on guests who are familiar with the brand.
user_name:
jeffNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: 7 nights in a Hudson river double on the 47th floor, so spectacular views and as comfortable as you would expect for such an establishment. Fruit bowl much appreciated, as was the daily NYTimes. Kettle/tea-making provided on request. The bathroom was particularly good, very spacious with a large shower and lovely bath. Decor is of course bland, and the carpet was particularly brown and depressing, but these things are to be expected in international hotels. Some of the public areas are quite dark too and I found it very irritating that there was not a guest bar. Luckily Gabriels (just across the road) is a an excellent bar/restaurant highly recommended. I actually chose this hotel for its lap pool, which did not disappoint. Had several terrific swim sessions, mostly with the pool to myself. It is a lovely space to be in, excellent water quality and not too hot. Designed for swimmers. Unusual for a hotel pool. Changing rooms very well appointed, excellent sauna and friendly staff.

We have really enjoyed our long weekend in NYC. The Mandarin is located with amazing views over Central Park if your budget can stretch to one of these rooms. It’s a great way to wake up with the sun rise over the city. The hotel staff are so focused on customer care, you really feel you are their number one priority without the “smarm”Concierge team are knowledgeable about everything you would ever want to know. Rooms are not the biggest but it’s New York but the views and floor to ceiling windows give you a real sense of space. Our youngest son’s cuddly toy was scooped up with the bedding and three days later after a fully focused search in the hotel and the laundry that The Mandarin use it arrived back safe and well. We thought that it was gone forever as did our son, who was over the moon when he heard the news that it had been found. Not sure that determination to help exists in other hotels. He even got a Mandarin Panda to keep him company whilst they tracked down the missing toy. The cocktails are a bit over the top but fun and great theatre at the same time, the food that goes with them is delicious. Well worth a taste but I am sure a normal gin and tonic tastes as good!Great location. Great staff. Great views. Great holiday.

We had am amazing stay in October. From early luggage drop off to check out service and hotel were amazing. The bar is very special and Andrew Mandel made out 10 year anniversary trip by organising just what we needed. Staff make you feel special and that nothing is too much trouble. Many thanks

Average kind of 5 star hotel. Standard rooms are very very modest. Suites are better and have better facilities, but have no work desks..But I guess, as all other hotels in NY - too old, too dark with odd entries.Fantastic concierge team. Chris Taru , Sanam - highly recommended.In general very good personnel, reception, bellboys. Great location. Forgot to mention : amazing breakfast restourant! “Asia” something.

This was my first time staying at the NYC MO and no regrets. The Hudson view room though not large compared to other MO properties was well appointed and spacious by NYC standards. Location was superb, just opposite central park and part of the time warner centre which offers excellent shopping and a supermarket in case you need anything. I highly recommend a visit to Asiate to try their prix fixe menu and to book early to get a seat by the window (I'd originally wanted to visit per se but couldn't secure a seat.
