Nevertheless, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal at Asiate which was tasty and reasonably priced for the quality). Hope to have a chance to return soon!

I've stayed at this hotel in the past and- other than the value- it has been a good experience each time. However, I was in town for just one night to attend a special event at Per Se, and the experience was not as up to par.The room was clean and neat, and the view was spectacular. However we were woken up at 5:30 AM with a wake up call. This would have been fine, if we actually PLACED a wake up call request, which we had not. We were planning on sleeping in that morning but it was not meant to be. I almost slept through it but they kept calling over and over again!!!Possibly an honest mistake (albeit a rookie one), but the thing that bothered me about it was the reaction by the staff member when I checked out. She said "sorry," but that was it. And then as she finished checking me out, she laughed and said "next time, we won't wake you up at 5:00 AM!"TBH, I might have given this hotel 5 stars, but the attitude and discourteous nature of the woman whom I checked out with, just ruined it. The single most important thing a hotel can do is provide a good night's rest. When you can't do that and it's your own fault, you don't have to reduce the charge for the room, but at the very least don't LAUGH about it to the guests!!!!..."next time, we won't wake you up at 5:00 AM!"Do you honestly think there will be a "next time"??!!

I love Mandarin Oriental! But I do not love MO NYC as they do not care about me!After 16 hours flight from Hong Kong to New York, I reached the hotel at 11:45 am and they could not release my suite before 3 pm! Instead they advised me to go the restaurant next to reception to have a noisy brunch for a couple of hours! Not the best advise for someone tired who was just expecting to reach his room to have a good rest! Finally at 3:10 pm waiting in the lobby, I went back to the reception as I was clearly ignored by the staff!The room was nice! But the service was minimum... no welcome card, no fruit basket, no coffee machine, no kettle! The last day a party happened around and I could hear the noisy music from the room next to mine! Well! Not that I would expect for a luxury hotel! Change the manager! Back to the basics!

Had the opportunity to stay this week at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC at Time Warner Center. Amazing. Check in lobby on 35th floor. We had a gorgeous dinner in the restaurant in a private room with jaw-dropping views. Our dinner was exquisite and service was top-notch. Rooms are gorgeous and well-appointed. I had a lovely view of the Hudson River. Very comfortable and spacious. Breakfast was also delicious and the view!! As for all Mandarin Oriental properties, the staff is warm and inviting, and your every wish is granted. Fabulous.

A truly five-star hotel and service I don’t usually write reviews on hotels but in this occasion I had to make an exception.The management team staff service and the food was absolutely sublime.what more can you expect.Definitely one to stay if you’re in New York

High end hotel, you can feel the 1000$ has to be spent for a night. pool views are one of the best you can get in the city.staff are nice and consideratea bit pricey though, should have been 200$ less

Across the road from Central Park and rooms were spacious by New York standards.Disappointed that no tea/coffee-making facilities in room. For the price I would have expected an espresso machine at least. I was provided with a kettle, but battled to get them to remember to bring milk. Lovely ground coffee brought, but no way to make it, i.e. no cafetière Great view from cocktail bar, but food menu ("nibbles" / light snacks) over designed & messed with to make unrecognisable - doesn't work.Lovely staff, especially receptionWe chose this hotel to stay in a high-rise, but will not go again.

Great prime location over view Central Park. The room is comfortable and excellent. Services and staffs are impeccable!! Nice spa and sport facilities. We enjoy our 3 nights stay. Friendly and attentive staff.
user_name:
scottfleischer8
New York City, New York

review_body: Starting with the positive features: the location is great, view over the Central Park is spectacular, the entire staff is very attentive and helpful. The restaurant kept booking for us a very nice table by the window for additional 30 min, though the place was busy and the tables were in high demand. Really appreciate. However, I certainly can’t pass without noticing certainly uncomfortable issues: The place is popular; restaurant and bar are busy serving the external guests. So, it was the first place in the world where I couldn’t have a lobby bar drink at 9 pm. “Fully booked, sir! Really sorry...”. When I came down at 11 pm, the bar had shut down already. So, too busy, too crowded, and the hotel guests can feel there at the party, but not at home.The premier Central Park view room is not spacious enough and comfortable for two; compared to the same class hotels you get less vacant space and no convenient working zone. And the room doesn’t look really fresh, as well.Really, next time l’d prefer trying another place.

I stay here for business twice a year for 3-4 days at a clip. Rooms and Staff great ! The change of the Bar area was a big mistake as it is pretentious and not very good. The quality of Brands where at all time low level and trying to create a boutique flavor that slowed service and quality
user_name:
Aaron K
los angeles, United States

review_body: The Mandarin and Park Hyatt are my favorite NYC hotels. The location of the Mandarin is the best, while the rooms at the Park Hyatt are a little nicer.The spa and staff are amazing here. And the rooms facing the park have very nice views.I couldn't find a place to review the Aviary - the lobby restaurant bar. The Aviary has to be the worst value worst bar/restaurant I have ever been to globally. I can't tell you how bad it is. Mandarin Management: Please fire these guys and go back to the old lobby lounge menu or bring in new people. You have a fantastic hotel, beyond taking Instagram photos what value does Aviary add. Avoid Aviary and eat at the hotel's Asiate restaurant or in room dining or any of the good places in the building at Time Warner Center or across the street.

Up to the par, 5 stars International Mandarin Oriental hotel chain!! I stayed there for 3 nights and quite impressed. Good bar, spa, nice prime location, next to Central Park, great services. Highly recommended...

This hotel is among the most expensive in NYC but it is far from the international Mandarin Oriental standard you would expect. Rooms are ok but nothing extraordinary. More like a top of the range Intercon than a Mandarin. Most annoying is the restaurant/lounge/bar facilities of the hotel. One restaurant, one small bar and a lounge area that are "full" the whole time with empty seats marked "reserved". They are playing the stupid game of showing these facilities as being in demand, but for a hotel guest with limited choice for a quick snack or drink you have to suffer this nonsense. Ridiculous, they are clearly targeting the local NYC market at the expense of hotel guests for their public spaces. Also having to take two elevators to get to your room from the lobby is an added annoyance. Staff are helpful and polite but that is the only positive. A very far cry from the Original Oriental and Mandarin.

The Mandarin Oriental Hotel, is a place of LEGEND!!!!! Upon entering the sumptuous lobby, you are immediately transported to hospitality of a by- gone era, except it is current!! The rooms, bar, restaurant, service, also, exquisite and refined! Have a Lycee Martini, and, let the luxury envelope you!
user_name:
eventsbythirteen
New York City, New York

review_body: Just stayed 4 nights at the Mandarin and enjoyed our suite overlooking Central Park/59th St. Coming in was a little difficult as all the taxi in front of the hotel make it hard to get noticed by valet and reception / concierge area was confusing at first but after that all went smoothly and I found the staff very helpful during out stay. Would recommend this hotel.

I had not stayed at the Mandarin before but for hotels around Central Park (including the Plaza and Ritz Carlton), this is definitely one to consider. I not sure all rooms booked would get the view we did but we were “way up there” with an amazing view of Central Park.The room and bathroom were okay if not somewhat small. Comfortable and well-appointed but the styling cues were lost on me. Taking elevators to the lobby and then to the room wasn’t as inconvenient as I though it might be as very little time was spent waiting for them.The food in the hotel’s restaurants was good but like the hotel, expensive. However, there is a world of restaurants at your feet and right outside your door. Having the Park essentially across the street was nice.The staff was perfect. Efficient, friendly, and helpful. Upon returning to NYC, this hotel has definitely made our list and if you don’t mind splurging, you’ll enjoy it too.

The start of our check in process was not very pleasant. I booked a Central Park View room and was given a city view room. I called and the reception said I was given a corner Central Park room, which is a bigger room. The room (4032, I believe) had mainly city view and only a strip of Central Park view. I was quite disappointed since it looked nothing like the pictures shown on the MO website. I was later changed to 4610, which is a real Central Park view as seen in the pictures. But I find it very odd they would place me in a corner room in the first place. Besides that, everything in the hotel was awesome. Very comfy bed and nice bathroom facilities.

Our Hudson River View Suite offered and unbelievable view of the River and the western third of Manhattan. The room is beautifully appointed.The hotel offers easy access to shopping at the Time Warner Center. to Time Square, and to Central Park.The concierge was helpful in arranging a limo to the airport.The only disappointment was the "Library Bar" behind the front desk that was expensive and nothing special.

The hotel is really nice obviously. I loved the pool area and the rooms. We had a view over Central Park. One of the best views of NYC I've seen.I usually don't stay in this kind of hotels but I had a good offer that time. I enjoyed every aspect of it.Does it deserve the price tag? My opinion is no. You can get something almost similar cheaper. But if you can afford it, go for it!

I have wanted to stay at a Mandarin Oriental for many years and finally we came to NY for the first time and stayed here. Initial impressions were very good, we had a lovely high room overlooking the river (high up is good if you want to escape the noise and obviously have a great view), the room was clean and had all the facilities and was a good size, although it was a little tired and needed a bit of updating. Bed was very comfortable. Staff were very attentive. The restaurant Asiate was great for breakfast, lots of choice and good service. (but please don't refill my teacup, I am British and I like to pour it myself. I had to guard the teapot!) The reception and concierge were incredibly helpful, as were the doormen. There were a couple of niggles. One afternoon we wanted to sit and have a drink in the Aviary but we weren't allowed to sit by the window as those seats were reserved for 'larger' parties. However the place was empty, but they 'helpfully' said they wouldn't seat anyone by the window directly in front of our allotted table so as not to spoil our view. So why could we not sit by the window then? It remained free for the entirety of our refreshment. My husband and I felt it was a silly rule when the bar was very quiet. We went to the spa where we both had a fantastic massage. The only thing that let the side down a little was the pool reception staff were a little unprofessional, they were swearing and mucking about which didn't necessarily bother me, but it might have bothered some guests. We went to Asiate one evening and had their tasting menu with the wine. The food was good, but it wasn't as good as I was expecting for the price. I wouldn't recommend the tasting menu and would choose differently if I went again. I didn't feel we had value for money with the wine either. It all felt a bit rushed. However they were accommodating with a menu change for my husband. It just lacked a bit of 'occasion'. Having read this back, it sounds a bit harsh, generally speaking we had a great time, just a couple of things that let the side down but certainly didn't alter the fact that we had an incredible time. I would certainly recommend the hotel, but with hindsight I would probably eat out and I would be more insistent about sitting where I wanted in a quiet bar. We had a fantastic experience and New York is a fascinating city.

Mandarin Oriental New York remains a five-star property and has recently refreshed its dining offerings. This property is an excellent choice for business or leisure travelers looking to star in the heart of New York City.The rooms are generous (by NYC standards) and well appointed. The bed was quite comfortable with well-pressed linens. There was also a nice seating area with a view of central park. The bathrooms are also spacious. The room feels like a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the city below.Room service was prompt and of high quality. Breakfast at Asiate was also great - the wait staff was prompt and attentive (without being overbearing.)The bell staff was courteous and helpful. The same was true for the front desk staff. The Mandarin is a top spot for NYC and worth the price.

Literally the high life as the mandarin in the top floors of a gorgeous building overlooking central park , the Hudson and nyc. One of the world's finest hotel chains, every detail is attended to. I highly recommend the suites, and you will feel like a king whenever you come back to your room.

Best service we have ever received in a NYC hotel. Upgraded to a beautiful corner suite as our room was not ready upon our early arrival! Even though hotel full because of United Nations week, service was exceptional...friendly and fast.

This hotel is ideally situated in the corner of Central Park, 10 min walking from times square. Idéal to visit the visit.The staff is really nice, the room is beautiful with the amazing view.I would like to thankfull the housemaid Wendy who was wonderful with us Hi le she was doing the room for the night. She was the most welcoming person ever. We did laugh and exchange a lot with her. She has been really nice and careful to my friend who hurts her legs by walking too much.She was the highlight of the stay in New York.Thank you so much

My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental New York in which it was pretty much the center of all attractions. The hotel was first class so save your money when traveling to New York so that you can have a great time throughout the visit.

This is a lovely hotel in a great location-right across from central park and attached to the Time Warner/Columbus Circle Building. Very easy to walk to Times Square. Service was excellent. Views are scenic and room was a good size.

This is not my first rodeo at a "5-Star" hotel. The details of a 5-Star hotel are what should make it stand out, and when those details are missed, it's a problem. Spending $1,000 a night, it's expected those details are not missed.Check-in was great. Nothing missed, room ready early, and my wife's feather allergy was accounted for when we got to the room.Our room was a standard room, overlooking the River. It was as expected, not too small, but everything is in the room was in tip top shape. Great TV, comfortable bed, large bathroom with 2 sinks, overall, the room was great.Housekeeping did a great job each day, beds made as expected, towels replaced daily, nothing out of place.Nightly turn down was not consistent. The first night, there was water left on each bed table, the rest of the stay this did not happen. The first night, chocolate was left on the pillows, the rest of the night, this did not happen. It almost seemed that the weekend staff was going through the motions, and didn't follow those steps.The bar area was under construction and could not be used. This is really disappointing, and there was no mention of this, except during check-in. Renovations occur, but have some sort of accommodation for your guests.Here is where it falls from a 5 to 4-Star hotel. The doormen. They are really not helpful. At least 4 times, no one was there to open the door. They were standing inside by the Bell Desk. I understand that there are other guests, but the first impression when coming to the hotel is the most important, and most memorable. There should always be a doorman. I know when I go to the Mandarin in Miami, I have never opened a door into the hotel and I am always greeted by someone. This did not happen here.I get that my complaint is a first world problem, but that is a mark that distinguishes the top hotels in the world. The MO-NYC needs the details reviewed.

From arrival to departure and everything that goes in the middle, a truly exceptional hotel, that even if for your drinks, lunch or supper....you must visit if in Manhattan.There is really nothing I can do or say to fault this place...it is truly exceptional

The Mandarin Oriental is a nice hotel. Make sure you get a view of the park though, if your budget doesn't run to the extra cost, think about staying elsewhere and save your money. The entrance to the hotel is basically via the loading dock. Arrival isn't a very 5 star experience. Once you work out which elevator to use to get to the reception, things start to become a bit more opulent.Breakfast while good, is extortionately expensive. And room service can take a while, so business at Starbucks across the street is booming! The pool is lovely, clean and empty of other guests for the most part. The beds are comfy, and bathroom facilities are nice.There was no lounge while I was there, no where to crash after a hard days shopping for afternoon Tea or coffee, before venturing back out into the city for the evenings entertainment. Instead you were expected to sit in the seating in the very cramped, impersonal reception. Not conducive to relaxation. The billing regime is slightly odd to. I ended up with three quite large charges on my credit card, two of which eventually vanished. Considering the reputation this hotel chain has, I have to say, overall I was disappointed. And will probably not be returning to a MO property anytime soon. P.s Charging for wi-fi when your are already taking a thousand bucks a night for the room is verging on rude!

I wish I could give The Mandarin Oriental New York a ten star rating as five stars just isn't enough. From the moment you arrive, you are treated like the most important guest at the hotel. The service is First Class in every way....the Bellmen, Concierge, Front Desk Staff, Housekeeping, In-Room Dining and Management are all first rate! The views are exquisite, the beds and bedding are luxurious, the shower and soaking tubs are amazing. The attention to detail by the friendly, attentive staff is beyond reproach. They truly make my visits spectacular....so much so I hate leaving!Thank you Susanne, Eileen, Felix, Pablo, Gabriel and so many others for your great service and friendship over the years.I can't wait to return!

Let me start by saying this is the nicest hotel in Manhattan and I have stayed at quite a few. Apart from an excellent restaurant spa and rooms with spectacular views of Central Park, it is well located for museums, park walks, broadway, shopping etc.However as a businessman that prides my company's value on the people that work there extending and advertising my brand this hotel wins the award. From the driver Achmed, to front desk and Brian, the concierge, the spa masseuse, specifically to Andrew the Director of the hotel restaurant Asiate. This posh young man and his staff were working so hard to ensure our stay with business guests from Italy we were hosting was perfect, I am tempted to hire them away from this hotel! Dear management at Mandarin Oriental head office,, don't lose these assets, this is what makes 5 stars, not just fancy digs. I will be staying here again, telling all my business associates about this hotel and that is not my norm, nor writing a referral review.If you want to have 5 star service while in Manhattan, the staff at this hotel sets it apart.

Recently arranged an elaborate marriage proposal at the hotel, Kent, Front Office Manager, Ahmaed, Asst Front office Manager and Carlos, Concierge couldn't have been more professional, kind and courteous. Our Central Park suite was stunning and staff is attentive beyond comparison. I am a native New Yorker, born and bred Upper Eastside ... hands-down this is best hotel in NYC!!

I've always wanted to stay at this hotel. We got a decent rate, though still expensive at $750 a night, but splurged while my husband was working in New York. Front desk was lovely and got us into their new speakeasy for a drink and snacks upon arrival. But unknown to us the bar area was being renovated. Room was decent, but a bit dated with paint peeling in places. Concierge was hit or miss. Sometimes they were totally on, but when we needed help on 4th of July, took them 4 hours to get us to their entertainment guru for help finding a fun place to dance and be adults without kids for the night, and by then we had taken care of ourselves and found a cheesy place to have fun. My spa service was lovely, but I have to say the spa was not as great as I thought it would be. Front desk didn't seem thrilled to have us there. I would save my money for shopping next time and stay somewhere else.

We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for six nights in the Hudson River view room and it was truly perfect. From the views to the spacious and well appointed room we could not have been happier. The hotel amenities covered everything and even though they have some renovations happening at the minute it really didn't have any impact on our stay. The people who work at the hotel are gorgeous, they cannot do enough for you and make you feel very much at home. Chandra our housekeeper was so lovely and very happy to provide tips on local activities and share her local knowledge and Joel at the concierge performed miracles to organise reservations at some of New Yorks best and Michelin ranked restaurants. The location was ideal for us because even though we do like shopping, we also enjoy going for walks and running so being on Central parks doorstep made our trip very memorable. Thank you so much we had the best trip we could have ever have wished for and the hotel manager who we bumped into without realising he was the manager was very keen to seek our feedback about our trip and stay before he mentioned he was the manager - which is a real sign of his commitment to making sure the hotel is delivering the service and experience his guests desire. We will be back ;)

Great hotel with poor breakfast. Had breakfast at the hotel twice out of 7 nights and got better quality food at the Dinner next door ! the food is just not good enough to justify the cost and time.............. .

This was our first stay at the Mandarin NYC, and we were impressed. The service, courteousness, and helpfulness of the staff was incomparable. The facilities were impeccably maintained, the location in Columbus Circle unbeatable, and we had a fabulous time thanks to the great staff at MO NYC, we will definitely be back!

My family, myself, husband, two daughters, 20 and 18, and son 16 arrived in NewYork from Uk and booked in to our hotel ( not the Mandarin) and were so disappointed. It was awful. After ringing the Mandarin Oriental around the corner, we checked out of the first hotel and were greeted by the most wonderful staff at the Mandarin who knew our predicament and made sure we were settled into this lovely hotel with two rooms with fantastic views across the Hudson River. It was so comfortable. Beds were amazing, bathroom, shower etc first class. Luxury. My only gripe was there was no tea/ coffee facilities in the room and you had to book/ make a reservation to use the bar in the reception area. However after a bit of persuasion, the staff let us go in for an hour for cocktails ( which were gorgeous!) We had a great stay in New York made even better by staying at the Mandarin Oriental. First class hotel.
user_name:
Teddyedward123
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: This is my second stay at this property, and both have been wonderful. The hotel is in a great location for both the theater, and upper-West-side attractions. Rooms are elegant and comfortable. I especially enjoyed having a drink at their new "Office" bar. Service is refined and perfect.The only issue....there is construction going on outside the hotel which really detracted from the experience - and I suspect that is the reason I received such a good rate.

This is a fabulous hotel in a great location at Central Park and Columbus Circle. Awesome service from the front desk to the concierge (especially Sanam she was very helpful !) I would have given the Mandarin an excellent rating but I was a bit disappointed that the lobby bar was closed for renovation and I was not informed that was the situation until I had checked in .... granted they offered alternative arrangements (not sure what it would have been) but we had already unpacked and settled in.... You also have direct access to the Time Warner Center for shopping and dining... there is also an awesome Whole Foods in the basement.

The Mandarin Oriental NYC is right by the Columbus Circle, very convenient and very good. We have stayed in rooms facing either the Hudson River or the Central Park. The view could greatly improved, if the Trump Hotel is shifted about fifty blocks to the left. The hardware of the hotel combines elements of the MO in Las Vegas such as the open lobby, it also has the grand view like the MO in Tokyo and also the massive size of the DC property. Service is where it slides quite a bit in comparison. First visit, the receptionist barely made eye contact. The spa is also a real let down, I have had better massage at the local YMCA for fraction of the price. The spa receptionist was outright rude, and therapist was in a rush and had the touch of a limp fish. The views of the central park from the restaurant is breathtaking, but when the regular F&B manager is not on duty, the food and service can be all over the place. Empty coffee pot left unattended, welcome smoothie not served and seating out of order. One morning, the steak and eggs rubbery and the Japanese breakfast inedible on second try. Most embarrassing was my hosting of a Sunday brunch; we were fortunate enough to be seated in the side room. However service was neglected, drinks barely refilled and food mediocre at best. Upon giving feedback to the substitute manager, we were told "they were busy." I still like the MO, it has lovely room and a very generous bathroom. The duty managers go above and beyond and readily rectifies short comings. I just wish the MO service philosophy trickles down stream. Otherwise, having a cup of coffee, reading the New York Times and just looking at the gorgeous views of the Central Park, makes this place worthwhile staying.

There lobby area / bar is currently undergoing renovation. And concurrently, the hotel JV'd with a third party to launch a new trendy bar called The Office (which btw is awesome) next to the reception desk. What it means for regular guests who want to hang out and have a simple coffee/ drink upon arrival, or to meet someone, is that there's no where really to do that now - and that for me is a good issue. Besides this (renovations should be done by Sept I'm told), it remains one of my clear favourites in NYC and would have a five star rating otherwise.

We had the opportunity to stay 5 nights at this property - a first time with this hotel chain. It was a New York trip that was a combination of business and pleasure. We only used the room and did not use the pool, spa or restaurant so cannot make an informed comment about those amenities but they looked fabulous.The location is wonderful and the Mandarin is a well-run, high-end facility. We were on the 40th floor in a standard king room with an excellent view. Everything was luxurious with a tremendous bathroom. Since I was there for a conference, we did not pay rack rates but received what I have to call a bargain rate compared to what I would have paid for a personal visit. If you have the desire for a first-class stay in Manhattan, the Mandarin is highly recommended.

If your like me I spend hours comparing and contrasting hotels not knowing which is the best in a place I am unfamiliar. I took a chance on this hotel as we knew we wanted to be close to Central Park to run. The service is top notch. We were greeted by a fantastic valet gentleman, bell man remembered our names even after dinner, front desk gentleman actually walked us up to our room since we were having a conversation about a new restaurant in town.. A little special story, we asked the concierge for change and when he went over to the front desk ladies he shook every one of their hands to say hello it was really classy. ( 7/15 evening) He was working with another concierge Chris who was AWESOME and helped us a ton with restaurants and ideas. These guys really seem to truly want to help you have a great experience. Thanks guys!The room we had was on the 49th floor great view of the Hudson and city. The hotel is a GREAT location. We ran Central Park in the morning and walked 1 mile for a play in the afternoon. It is so nice to say here and have some quiet after the craziness of Time square. Rooms have great amenities, toothpaste, shaving cream extra touches which are just nice and not often included anymore. The rooms have an asian flare and are very comfortable. I would agree with one of the other reviewers that this is a 5 star hotel with a 6 star experience. Don't overthink it, just book if this hotel if your looking for a higher end experience. Thanks to all the staff for a great stay!

NYC'S MANDARIN ORIENTAL is buzzing with excitement as Chicago cuisine visionary, GRANT ACHATZ, launches his exclusive new GASTRO BAR, "THE OFFICE: NYC."On a recent summer theater stay at the Mandarin Oriental, what a delightful surprise to find this exclusive speak-easy open for business & ready to take very good care of us at cocktail time. We had just delighted in NYC's own "Manhattan-henge" sending startling sunset straight thru the crosstown streets & came home to the hotel to find this new treat. Located on our 35th-floor hotel lobby with other Mandarin Oriental courtesy services, including its fragrant spa & the Asiate Restaurant (which still serves my favorite NYC corporate breakfast with eagle-soaring views), this jewel of a cocktail haven is accessed, with the help of the concierge & a reservation, through a velvet-draped hidden passageway. "THE OFFICE: NYC" is all about service. Our hosts, Sebastian & Anthony, tucked us into a comfortable dining nook with rich leather seating & dark wood to enjoy discovering this new bar with the feel of a private speak-easy. Brass antiques abound, with little secrets appurtenances, like a dancing monkey sculpture & a non-functioning antique radio which swivels open to reveal brandy & crystal highballs ready to pour out the fun. Even though a special "THE OFFICE: NYC -- EXTINCT SPIRITS & ANTIQUITIES" menu was served, with liquor arranged by historical decade, the approach with our cocktail order was an emphasis on personal interplay with our bartender. Nicholas, quite the drinks-master, scoped out my abiding preference for wine, even over his inventive cocktail suggestions & he graciously provided me with a Château Pressac Saint-Émilion Grand Cru Classé 2007 which was not even on the menu for my drinking pleasure before the Lincoln Center Festival ballet started, performed right there in the hotel building at the Rose Theater. What a prince of a wine this was to taste. First of all, classy fruit presented itself in the nose with the rest of its heady almost-caramel fragrance. And then, on the tongue, a well-rounded smooth​, actually​ rather extravagant​ Bordeaux. Although the non-stem wine-glasses are not to my liking, I admit they are​ ​of late​ stylishly cutting-edge.Lovely ​signature ​etched plates ​& stem-ware are also served with the small plate menu specialties. We enjoyed the Salmon Rillettes dressed with créme fraîche aux fine herbs​ & yellow caviar & buttered buckwheat toast. This was a familiar dish from my grandma's ​table ​& it was even served potted in a ​comfy-looking covered glass dish, with the freshest​-ever​ herbs on top ​& even a few brilliant red flower petals.To finish with something sweet​ before putting on lipstick for the theater, we had blueberry cobbler with creamy sorbet & drooled with honey that tasted like lavender. Next time,​ we want to try​ the​ Prime Rib-eye Tartare, because Nicholas was bragging on the beef ​---​& for me, the special Iberian Ham dish​. The Mandarin Oriental does continue to impress.
user_name:
VKMc
New York City, New York

review_body: The Manadarin NYC is an incredible hotel. Great location, and probably the best hotel staff I've ever encountered. Large rooms with great views, especially the park-view rooms. The swimming pool on 16 is a neat treat, although it'd be great if they had a hot tub too. Breakfast at Asiate was delicious, even if the staff there seems to move at their own leisurely pace. Overall, just a wonderful experience that I can't recommend highly enough.

I stayed in mandarin oriental wz family for 3days, it's fabulous! The location is good, and the view face to Central Park which is amazing. It's very convenience cuz the hotel connect with Columbus mall, all you want to buy just go downstairs. I love mandarin hotels so much. I am a fan.

I stayed here for my birthday and it was one of the nicest hotels I have have stayed at. Cant say anything negative. Room beautiful, View wonderful, Restaurant amazing . Just a wonderful experience for my birthday.

This is as expected a beautiful hotel in an awesome location right on the corner of the park. We were in town for a wedding (also held at the hotel in the ballrooms) and had a great weekend at MO. Room was nice, though a bit underwhelming when compared with other Mandarin rooms I have stayed in. The service and food in the restaurant was good, but again nothing too special. We were most impressed with the food, service, arrangements, and everything surrounding the wedding. Truly the most beautiful night I have ever been a part of. The Mandarin team was unbelievable throughout and we really enjoyed it.

We like to stay at MO during our holidays - great hotel, great service across the cities we have visited.This summer we decided to vacation on the east coast and NY is the first leg of the trip - we decided to spend about a week at MO. This is a good hotel and service levels are good compared to a number of other NY hotels. But it pales when compared with MO's elsewhere.Simple stuff like timely housekeeping is absent. Amenities are not replenished...room service is fine but not too much choice (and there have been no attempts to create food outside regular menu - read my review of the Prague MO which was a class apart). It's just not MO experience.As I said earlier...it's a good place if you are comparing with a normal NY hotel. But if you are expecting a typical MO, this is probably not it.

I have stayed at other Mandarin hotels, Hong Kong, London, Vegas but this was the first time staying in New York.It was wonderful, I stayed in a Hudson view room located on the 51st floor and it was just lovely, from housekeeping daily to turndown nightly was just great.My only regret was that I didn't spend long in the hotel due to commitments elsewhere so didn't get to dine or drink or even sample the spa but will return in October to spend more leisure time for me.I must give a very special mention to Billy the concierge who had a shared love of the theatre and our joint love of the show "The Great Comet"....he was more than helpful and please do pass on my thanks to him.I was shown around other rooms and suites for different views for my next visit by one of the reception staff but sadly have forgotten her name.All in all the Mandarin continues with its first class service, from the door staff who remembered me by name each time I came in or went out to everyone else....just perfect.Thank you.Annee

What's not to Love?!? - From Check-in, Mandarin Oriental has this fixed to ensure you don't waste any time... escort to your room; if need be. Go around the hotel and it feels like you've been there for days when you just really arrived moments ago. Love the Bathroom space and the view is incredible!
user_name:
FirenzeNJ
New York City, New York

review_body: i love the location of mandarin oriental, sitting right between midtown and uptown. You can walk a bit up to lincoln center for more laidback and residential ambience; and you can also easily get to midtown by walk or take a subway downtown. the service was great, i stayed for 9 days and have not encountered any situation where i was unsatisfied. i am particularly impressed with concierge. it's a service so often overlooked nowadays and mandarin oriental reminded me there are things beyond what yelp and opentable can do. the concierge staffs had great knowledge of the city, from warning me which subway lines go on construction during weekends to getting me into top restaurants in the city. Bill at concierge is the best concierge ever, he is always one step ahead of our needs. i don't think i can say that about any other hotel service i have experienced in the past few years. my only complain is the minibar which uses an automated fridge that reminds me of business hotels in japan in the 90s.... the fridge is packed with drinks and left no space for me to use, and once removed from the slot the drinks will be charged to your bill automatically. i don't understand why a five star hotel in new york city would install that. overall, i think this hotel was worth every penny.

We booked one night at the Mandarin Oriental in New York just to have the ultimate New York experience. Wow! We were given a room with a view of the Hudson River on the 51st Floor - it was dizzying and exhilarating and something we will NEVER forget. The Mandarin Oriental is a culture all its own. We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas and decided to pursue this one even if it was for just one night. So worth it. The MO is known for its impeccable service. Everything - every moment - from the moment a guest walks in and gets to the lobby on the 35th floor - to checking in - to going into your room - is special. The room is absolutely gorgeous and the view - through a floor to ceiling window - was breathtaking. My teen son and I went for a swim in the indoor pool and had a chance to glimpse the spa. Next time !!!!!! Later in the evening we had drinks in the lobby lounge with relatives - everybody LOVED it - there is an eager crowd of people who frequent this place as the atmosphere is so festive and elegant. There is no doubt in my mind that I have become a Mandarin Oriental devotee. They've got me hooked.

I have been staying at Mandarin Oriental numerous times over at least a decade and I have always likes the place. Last night was very special however. This time my family and I are in New York and not even staying in a hotel. My daughter was scheduled to leave in the morning for Boston to attend a summer program for high school kids in Harvard. As sometimes happens when you deal with kids and paperwork, only literally last minute we did figure out she needed a hard copy print out of some form right there and then. And then was well past 1 in the middle of the night. Happily for us, we were next door to MO. Despite the late hour, the gracious reception team offered their help, allowed my nervous teenager to log into their system and got the desired document neatly printed out. Thank you Mandarin Oriental and special thanks to Anita. You guys are the best.

Not a detail is overlooked at this hotel. It's location is ideal, the rooms are very spacious and quiet and all the hotel staff were extremely kind and caring. The chicken curry I ordered from room service was delicious. I didn't have a chance to use the spa, but it looked lovely!

I've always wanted to experience a night of luxury and romance in my hometown. On a whim, I decided to book a weekend and enjoy the Mandarin Oriental and the spa facilities. This was one of the most extraordinary and memorable experiences I've had in a long time, and it was a pleasure to have it in my own backyard.The rooms are luxurious, the views of Central Park and the surrounding skyline is impeccable. The service was simply the best. Whether you're staying for a few days or you just want a weekend away, the views alone are so worth the reservation.
user_name:
OnlySane
New York City, New York

review_body: A very nice five star hotel located by the park. The hotel has great views of the park and the Hudson River. Shopping is located on the first few floors which makes for fun during your down time. hope you agree

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in late April. Close to the Metropolitan Opera, Central Park, subway and Broadway. Easy walk through the Park to Guggenheim, Frick, and walkable to MoMA. Staff are very courteous. Bill at Concierge was quite knowledgeable. Breakfast was a bit mediocre but the view makes up for it. When we return to NYC, we'll stay here again.

I am a New Yorker as I lived in the Big Apple for more than a decade. When I return to the city, I usually stay in SoHo at The Crosby, but since I was helping my daughter relocate to the Upper West Side, I needed to stay close and chose the Mandarin Oriental. There was a special promotion with the third night free and I grabbed it. I was there for 7 nights and basically paid for 5 nights. Such a deal! I was also upgraded to a Park view because I booked through American Express (something that I rarely experience with this benefit). The staff was always accommodating and willing to go the extra mile with a smile. The room was nicely appointed, large and very comfortable. However, housekeeping was not always consistent, especially at turndown. Aside from that small misstep, I could not have been happier or felt more at home away from home. I will be returning again soon!

My daughters and I had high tea at the Mandarin Oriental yesterday. We were on a girls trip and it was also my daughter's birthday. We had a reservation and were seated close to but not at the window. Our waiter noticed our disappointment and as soon as a a window table was available they moved us which was very thoughtful as we hadn't asked to be moved. The whole experience was lovely and relaxing. The service was amazing. Our scones, sandwiches and sweets were delicious, not to mention the cream and homemade jam. They presented my daughter with 3 chocolate covered strawberries with a lit candle for a bday treat. We couldn't finish all of the sweets but took them to enjoy later. I would highly recommend and plan on returning next visit to NYC. Thanks for such a pleasurable dining experience!!

I stayed here for two nights while attending a conference. The hotel is superb - service, rooms, restaurants, location, etc. Rooms are very comfortable and very quiet (unusual for NYC). My only recommendation would be to not charge for the Internet. Considering rooms are $1250+/night, it doesn't seem appropriate to charge an additional 1% ($10/night) for Internet. I would recommend and stay here again.

It was my 60th birthday and I just finished riding my motorcycle to Maine, via Key West and Canada. I normally stay at the Peninsula, but this time I decided to change it up. During the reservation I was told the suite I booked had a "full Hudson River and Statute of Liberty View.." Not even close! At best, we saw small glimpses of the river and the Statute of Liberty was nowhere to be found. The onsite restaurant is basically a Dennys, at which I never eat, but we elected to try their breakfast. I am certainly not a penny pincher, but for $110 (pancakes, eggs, coffee and on orange juice), I thought it may be delicious. Again, not even close! I stayed in suite 4530 at $1995 per night and found it to be dark, damp and musty. The employees are nice and professional, except for the doorman, that guy is useless. The only other good thing I can articulate is the limo service arranged thru the hotel is the best I have experienced. Lastly, the lobby is on the 35th floor and depending on which elevator you use, one must switch elevators at least twice to gain room access. I feel I wasted almost $7000 for three days at this subpar property.

I have been coming to the Mandarin Oriental, for years. I have never had anything but the very best of food and service. It is beautiful. I love the atmosphere, the view from the 35th floor, overlooking Central Park and Columbus Circle is stunning. The Mandarin is very gracious and welcoming whether you are coming to stay for weeks or just pop in to see the view. A delightful New York experience.

We stayed here almost a week in March, 2016 and the views are spectacular. We had a view of Central Park, and it was gorgeous even that time of year.Make sure you eat at Asiate, and get a table next to the window at dusk where you can see Colomubus Circle light up.Great location, of course, and the rooms are fabulous.I found the hotel staff to be friendly, and especially accomodating, as we were celebrating a 16th birthday girl. She was so happy!

I love this hotel! Staff very friendly, Spa was very good with 5 star service and room was beautiful and clean! I didn't eat at the restaurant but front desk give me advice where to get the best food. They help to provide complimentary transport to hospital for my father treatment. My first time at this hotel, but no my last! See you soon!

Have stayed at almost all the Central park hotels and I loved the views ( much higher than most) and clear unsurpassed views of Central park. Walk straight out the door across the street into the park. Hotel is on higher floors so the check in is very calm and smooth - foyer restaurant is a buzz with large full wall windows. Had business and dined in the Restaurant against the windows and soaked up New York sky line with really attentive waiting staff. Unobtrusive but focused on what was happening on the table with drinks, food plates etc. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous - pillows - feather duvette - amenitites were well selected and fresh. Breakfast after a long walk in central park had some unique different choices which was refreshing - try the Japanese breakfast box - light delicious and fresh. Seating is different level so you all get to capture the views. If you are looking for under stated luxury - quiet elegance and the true brand of Mandarin Oriental in an iconic location with absolutely high stunning views from many windows then you should stay here. Spring is the best time as its warmer - the park is in full bloom and love the energy of all the dogs walking. Joined a fun run on the Saturday which gave you a sense of community right off. Concierge at street level are fantastic and well trained and knowledgeable in getting you in the right direction for a Pharmacy or any item you may require. Made you feel at home when they welcome you back each time - sometimes by name !

I have always heard people gush about the mandarin oriental and was curious to see why. My wife and I, came to NY for a family event and figured it would be a good opportunity to see what this hotel is all about.First things first, 1400 dollars a night for a room, I was expecting the accommodations to be in the same category as the St. Regis. We were escorted to our room, only to realize how cramped and small it was. The view was not particularly great, as we were blocked by tons of buildings and faced the beautifully green looking Hudson River. I thought maybe the bathroom is what people love about this place. I was wrong. While the bathroom is big and luxurious, it is an odd layout with a cheap looking bathtub and toilet. It was very narrow and the doors would not close. The bed was average and had very tough pillows.When I woke up in the morning, I needed a coffee and figured the room service would be just fine. My coffee was watery and tasted like it sat on the fire since 6am. The only great thing was the late check out for 3pm, as this is very uncommon in NYC hotels.I am generally not someone who complains however, for this price I was expecting a little more. If you are contemplating spending this type of money, there are far better options.

The rooms are well equipped but quite small. The maid service was terrible (had to call for evening turndowns and daily room makeup). Food in the restaurant was good, but the service was indifferent and inattentive. Way overpriced for what you get. Will not return.

Caveat: I did not pay for this hotel room - it was given as perk for hosting a corporate event in the hotel. The Suite was amazing. Beautiful living room/dining room combination with its own bathroom, and the bedroom was large with a nice armchair and footstool to enjoy the city views. It overlooks Central Park and from this Suite, you can also see the River to the West. The shades are electric so you can make it very dark or leave them open and enjoy the day and evening city views. We were lucky to have a full moon that night so we watched it rise over the city.Breakfast in the room was prompt and the coffee was delicious.

At Luxury Trips by Bea, we try to visit some of the most luxurious hotels in the world and this is without a doubt a must stay at hotel for those who want a little luxury and tranquility in a busy city. Asiate is a great restaurant while staying here.The rooms are spacious, Luxury Trips by Bea stayed here over Christmas and New Year and surprisingly, we were upgraded to a stunning park view (picture attached).The staff are helpful and multilingual along with super knowledgable. 100% recommend staying here.

We had great service, good food & drinks! Our room wss perfect with a fine view of Central Park & the front desk, concierge, & housekeeping people were so friendly and accomadating! It doesn't get any better than that!

We just returned home from a quick 3 night stay at the MONY. The hotel is beautiful indeed, however, the real deep attraction is the delivery by every staff member of an extraordinary level of understanding of our needs and requests. Every request was managed both competently and graciously. The facility is lovely and all food and beverage matches expectations. Although the hotel has been on scene for more than a decade they continue to set the standard for a true five star hotel in New York.

Fantastic hotel, gorgeous rooms, award winning views, amazing views and locationI really highly recommended this hotel The hotel start from the 35 floor until 68 They have good SPA and amazing restaurants you most book in advance

My company treated me to a few nights at the Mandarin and it was the most beautiful hotel I have ever visited. My suite had the most incredible views of the city and the room had every amenity possible! The facilities at the spa and gym were amazing and super clean and the actual location of the hotel to great restaurants and the subway could not have been better.
user_name:
jenl182
New York City, New York

review_body: Having an out of town guest who had never been to NYC, they wanted a room with a Central Park view. There were many hotels in the area and this one was far from inexpensive.Ultimately the room that was supposed to provide an amazing Central Park view, was very good for that, not excellent. However, the city view more than made up for that.That aside, the room was beautiful and the staff incredibly accommodating on any request (wifi help, ice, and they even provided champagne glasses for our own). For those on a budget, it will be worth the 1 night if you want to be lost in luxury.

The staff, room and overall experience was 5 star and first class. I surprised my wife with a night at the Mandarin and it was pure luxury. We enjoyed a very large room with lovely views and the bathroom was surprisingly large side with a comfortable tub. Some might find it a bit pricey but it is in line with the luxury hotels we frequent around the world. We really enjoyed our visit!

Service, room, meeting rooms, food.... all incredible. Special requests were honored in a flash. Service is definitely the high point here - this hotel knows how to make sure each guest feels taken care of. If you can afford the price tag, it is worth it for stunning views of central park.

The room was amazing as was everything else coming with the hotel. The service was outstanding. The only downside to this hotel was it was quite far from Times Square and some major areas. However, it was worth the semi-long Uber rides to get places! I really enjoyed my stay!

Ate breakfast at 'The Lobby Lounge' at MO - New York. Amazing view and a nice breakfast overall but rather pricey(but hey, the view is pretty worth it!). The staff was OK. The interior was modern and fresh. MO is definitely worth a visit but maybe just for a coffee break next time!

Had a sit down with a friend at the lobby bar. Atmosphere is really nice, love the view and not being repeatedly annoyed or interrupted by servers. I love the Xavier French rosé and tuna tartare, very delicious. Would visit again.

The view is beautiful but it is very expensive. The gourmet entrees were delicious, but be prepared for small portions. The pre fixe was $95 for one 3 course meal. The restaurant was full yet it wasn't very loud. The staff was very attentive.

I stayed for a couple of days in a park view suite. Somehow they managed to get two corners in the suite--one in the living room and one in the bedroom, each with floor to ceiling glass...I really am just writing to say thank you to the staff who made such a big effort for my stay---and really appear to make every guest feel that they care about your stay. Thank You. The only thing they could do is add a few more electrical sockets. and maybe save a little less water in the shower.

Recently had cocktails at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC. The view of Columbus Circle and the skyline from the 35th floor is great. Excellent Service. Pricey cocktails, but no different than any other fancy hotel. Go for a special treat, special occasion, or just a peaceful view in the sky, with drink in hand. Grab a bite to eat. Enjoy Afternoon Tea, which I have done a while back. All service done with just that extra special touch.

What else can you expect but the best from the Mandarin here in NYC. The room was perfect. The bathroom was on the large side with a huge soaking tub with all the fixings.. Views that can't be matched, room, lobby and restaurants. The service was top notch...

Fantastic service from the first moment! The location is great with many sights within walking distance. The bar and restaurant is also really good and offer great views over the park. This is probably one of the best hotels in NYC!I stayed in a room overlooking Central Park and it was worth the additional charge (compared to a room facing Hudson).

Excellent hotel with efficient service and excellent staff. Rooms are slightly small, but well planned. Concierge was extremely helpful. Welcoming and all staff were extremely helpful and professional

This is home away from home in Manhattan . The view over Central Park are breathtaking, no matter what the season. We spend New York fashion week here, and the staff are like our own family. The spa makes a perfect city getaway and the bedrooms are spacious and elegant.

I had one night in the luxurious hotel.Actually I've been to stay this chain hotel at Tokyo,Paris,Hong Kong and Taipei Mandarin Oriental hotels.The view in New York is excellent.You could see the grand Central Park.Nice.

I have just returned home from an amazing 10 night stay at the Mandarin Oriental, New York. Everything from check in to check out was seemless. The staff are excellent - each and every member of staff we encountered was friendly, knowledgable and happy to help. We stayed in a Hudson View room on the 53rd floor and the views were fabulous. The room was very spacious even by NYC standards as was the amazing bathroom complete with bath, large shower and TV. The level of in room house keeping is very high. I don't know how they manage it but the rooms are cleaned and made up immaculately and yet you never see housekeeping or housekeeping trolleys. I amazed how they do it. The turn down service provided nightly is also excellent as each night you are provided with a letter offering details of the weather forecast for the next day and possible activities for you to consider as well as a quote, or pearl of wisdom about sleep. It's a very nice touch.We used in room dining a couple of times (breakfast and dinner) and the attention to detail is brilliant. They bring a table complete with linens and flowers and set the table as if you were dining in the restaurant. The food was excellent. The only thing that I felt was trying to be too clever and ultimately not working as well as it could was how they operate mini bar services. The mini bar and in room snacks are motion sensitive. Once you pick up and item from its spot you have 30 seconds to put it down or you are charged for it. We had seen this in the in room information which detailed this therefore did not pick anything up however at some point possibly during housekeeping items had been somehow dislodged and these items were now appearing on our bill. This issue was addressed and was a non issue however it seem like a cumbersome feature that is not fool proof.In terms of location I loved this hotel. It is facing Central Park and more or less above the 59th Street Subway so is excellently appointed with all areas of NYC easily accessible from this location. I will definitely be back to this hotel and have plans to try Mandarin Oriental properties in other locations when I travel.

This is one of the best hotels I've stayed. What I love most where the amazing views over Central Park. I also loved the location, is very convenient if you want to go to a concert or ballet at Lincoln Center. I enjoyed to have Central Park just downstairs.

Met our son &family in NYC; had 3 bedrooms, plus a living room, for the 6 of us.Stay was excellent. Andrew Archibald (front desk) did a great job with complicated room rearrangement; was always available &courteous.Maid service was great, morning &night, esp. Chandra. Concierge did a great job; booked a restaurant (for 2 adults) at the last moment. Took care of a lost pair of eyeglasses, 'phoned to make sure it got back to us.Great restaurants. Liked the Japanese breakfast.Room service service was very good; food not as good as restaurants.Fini (facial at SPA) is excellent; my wife recommends highly.Bell desk was very good, Also doormen (taxi w/2 toddlers &stroller can be an issue).Hotel car to/from airports is very good; not free.Between the Mandarins in Paris, Munich, and NYC, this is the best.

In total a super nice hotel ... as expected since the hotel is among the top-10 most expensive hotels in NYC. Here is my notes regarding the hotel. INTERNET PAYMENT!!To pay to use the internet in a five star hotel in 2017 is simply NOT ok. Why dont you also charge for hot water? On a positive note, the WI-FI coverage is super, even in the spa. MINIBAR WITH SENSORSThe minibar has automatic sensors that make you pay if you remove items for more than 30 sek. Totally a thing most three-star hotels wouldnt install. PAPER Newspaper delivered to the door every morning is super nice. ICEAutomatically refill of icecubes in the room every day is a nice feature. ELEVATOR SECURITYI noticed that the elevator wants a doorkey in order to stop at your exact floor. It is NOT enough that one person in the elevator has a key. A nice security-feature!NOT DIRECT VIEWWe paid extra for Central Park View. We got the view but please note that the Trump building stands between you and the park (see picture) This is conviently NOT shown in the hotel-pictures.

I spent 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental NY in Feb 2017. I had a room with views on central park from a 39th floor, OUTSTANDING. The breakfast was excellent and the staff very friendly. The location is great as there are many metro lines just by the hotel entrance and it is also perfect if you are keen for a morning run in Central Park.(thing to do)

Beautiful and accommodating hotel. Highly recommend staying here. Great fitness center and large indoor pool. Love the lounge at teatime and Asian breakfasts. Great views since the hotel starts on the 35th floor.

The room is well amenitied and the bed very comfortable. There are functional blackout drapes and nice linen plus toiletries. Of the 2 room types we liked the Park view because we could make it totally dark. The Hudson view has a larger bathroom. Both have stall showers plus tubs.We found it convenient to have a shopping mall in the building when the weather was bad. There are also 4 restaurants in the mall so you have plenty to choose from. Across the street in the Trump International there is a 3 star Michelin restaurant. Lincoln Center is 3 blocks south and Carnegie Hall 5 blocks northeast. There was a taxi stand on Columbus Circle at the mall entrance so it was easy to get a cab. There is also a subway down stairs plus Central Park across the street.

I am never one to take photos of my food when it arrives, but this was so impressive I couldn't resist. Presentation was just as amazing as the taste and to top it all off, you have panoramic views of Central Park. 5* service with a very reasonably priced lunch menu. Will definitely return!

Party of 4. Great venue with excellent views. Very good service. Food was elaborated but expensive and I didn't get to appreciate the whole of it. Soups were just ok and gnocchi didn't impress me much.

My husband and I spent the night at the Mandarin Oriental in New York last week and the Mandren is now our favorite hotel. We have had the opportunity to travel the world and we have tried several different hotels in New York City. By far the Mandarin has the most luxurious rooms with the best views of Central Park and the city skyline. We booked through AMEX FHR and were treated very well! The staff was great and the spa was the best I've ever been to in all my travels and the restaurant Asiate was just delicious and had the most amazing views. We are extremely happy with our choice in NYC and we will definitely be back. We absolutely loved our stay.

Breathtaking views, exceptional service, a great location, bottomless brunch is an absolute must. A real treat an whilst it's pricey, I felt it reflected value! A piece of heaven, would return at the drop box f a hat!

Went to the Oriental on recommendation from friends it was lovely; excellent service and a lovely view of a Columbus Circle. Just after dusk, so could only see lights.......not really Central Park. Two Drinks and nibbles cost us $120 -and we were only there for about 45 minutes due to needing to leave for Madison square Gardens. Expensive for Aussies but one of those New York experiences.

My Sister and I had afternoon tea here to celebrate her birthday. The view over Central Park was fantastic. The food was delicious and plentiful, especially the ginger scones. I could not fault the service. Would thoroughly recommend.

We recently stayed at the Mandarin for my niece's birthday. What a treat! From the outstanding service at check-in, the amazing suite overlooking central park AND the Hudson River, the incredible room service and of course, THE SPA!!!! Great location, attached to the Time Warner Center in Columbus Circle (shopping, dining, etc.). In the words of Ferris Bueller, "If you have the means, I highly recommend it!"

My wife and I recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC as part of our "mini-moon" after our wedding.Everything about this hotel is spectacular. Checking in was quick and friendly, and the gentleman at the front desk personally brought us to our room. The room overlooked Central Park and Columbus Circle...and since we were on the 53rd floor, we had an amazing view of the city. The decor was elegant, but comfortable and "home-like," with a very comfortable bed and a large flat-screen TV. The bathroom had a shower (with "normal" and "rainfall" showerheads) and a large tub. There was plenty of closet and drawer space (far more than we needed).The lounge off to the side of the lobby has wonderful views of the city, as well as delicious food, great drinks, and friendly and attentive staff. If you get a couch next to the windows you won't want to leave.We ate breakfast in the restaurant (also on that main lobby floor) and the food was absolutely fantastic. And, of course, the view can't be beat.We spent one morning at the spa...and we could have easily spent the whole day. The staff was friendly, the massages were rejuvenating, the facilities are amazing, and we even saw a celebrity! (Smiles were exchanged, but we were respectful of their privacy.)In terms of location...it's tough to beat the Mandarin: it's right on Columbus Circle, across the street from Central Park, within easy walking distance of Broadway shows (we walked to see a show one night), and if the weather is bad you can spend a few hours walking and shopping in the mall on the first couple of floors of the building. (There are also some fantastic restaurants there.)Every staff member we encountered - from the gentlemen at the front entrance, to the staff in the lounge and restaurant, to the cleaning staff - was exceedingly polite, very friendly and always helpful.I've stayed in a lot of nice hotels in NYC, around the country, and around the world, and this was easily one of the best places I've ever stayed. In fact, we are hoping to make this an annual "anniversary" trip.Let's be honest: Is the Mandarin Oriental expensive? Absolutely.Is it worth that expense? Without a doubt.It is - as my review title states - spectacular in every way.

Modern hotel with great service, very nice rooms and beautiful view. Stayed in the hotel a few time and prefer it over other New York hotels. Got an upgrade to a room facing the park. I noticed an improvement in the reception service. It was always good but it got even better.At times (Christmas, for example) prices can get quite steep.

The Mandarin Oriental Hotel in New York is an exceptional hotel and always feels like home. For the past 13 years it has always exceeded our expectation. The staff are very experienced and the service is impeccable

Extremely well managed hotel, excellent level of performance in all services, a 75 foot pool in 36th floor ! Interesting presentation of menus like the lounge bar new "east box menu". The Sat & Sun brunch at their Asiate restaurant is a bargain. Enough variety even for our 7 night stay.

While i typically do not use luxury hotels for business, this was the site for a conference. The quality of service and facilities is what you should be able to expect from a luxury hotel. Great food, including room service; great staff; great coffee; great water pressure; everything clean and up to date.

My husband and I decided to splurge and stay at the Mandarin Oriental for two nights to celebrate a special anniversary. Our trip was nothing short of spectacular. The Mandarin was a perfect choice for romance and respite. Here's why:--the service is really wonderful. Every person we encountered was kind, friendly, and helpful. --when the hotel learned of our anniversary, they sent up champagne, sweets, and a congratulatory note. --our room was beautiful, the bed was heavenly, the bathroom luxurious, and the Central Park views were spectacular. --the location of the hotel cannot be beat. It's a quick walk or train ride to pretty much anywhere. And Central Park is right there! I also think it's advantageous to have the Time Warner shops sharing the building with the hotel as well. We enjoyed some light shopping and picked up treats from Bouchon Bakery. --we took advantage of the pool and gym. The pool is really beautiful! It was also empty when we used it so we had it all to ourselves. --breakfast at Asiate each morning was a true treat. My husband and I are usually too busy for our own good. It was such a pleasure to start each morning by slowing down and savoring a delicious breakfast in such a peaceful and lovely setting. Service was, of course, perfect.Although we only stayed for a couple nights, the Mandarin managed to feel like home for us. We hope to return next year too! Thank you for such a memorable stay.

I have only positive things to say about my recent stay at the Mandarin. I traveled on 2/9/17, the day that a winter storm covered the northeast. The concierge staff monitored my flight status and made sure that a driver was there to greet me at LGA when my flight finally landed. Bill Hawkins was on duty when I arrived. He and the rest of the concierge staff left a delicious bottle of Pinot Noir in my room - it was a wonderful way to start my stay in my beautiful room (room #4210), overlooking Central Park. Room service staff, restaurant staff, front desk staff, cleaning staff - all excellent. My bed was quite comfortable and my room was clean. The location is great, close to everything. I walked to Exhale Spa and took a great Core Fusion Barre class on Saturday. I highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Allison D
Sullivan's Island, South Carolina

review_body: Really enjoyed the hotel while attending the Westminster dog show this week. Location is great. Service was exceptional. Love the bookmark left on my bedside table for the novel I was reading. Food was great, housekeeping was top notch.

Highly recommend the afternoon tea here, the views over Central Park are second to none. Food was lovely and the staff were great. A lovely treat. We did not stay in the hotel, we went especially for afternoon tea, definitely recommend.

Really a top notch hotel, beautiful views of central park, room could not be any more spotless and well appointed. Phenomenal restaurant and cocktail lounge. Everything is so elegant & romantic. Great location in Columbus Circle, service is truly great. The cost is somewhat breathtaking, but this is as good at it gets.

went to a charity event in the ball room on the 36 floor of hotel - the views were breath taking - the smorg served were excellent - a very enjoyable evening at a fantastic hotel settings on the 36 floor overlooking East side and Park
user_name:
badbaruch57
New York City, New York

review_body: from the minute you pull up to the time you check out....service was first rate...must commend the bell captain for use of hotel car to run an errand rather than a taxi. Front desk very pleasant and helpful.Service at the lounge was very efficient.

We stayed in a king room with a Hudson River view , room was well appointed and the maid service was efficient . Service at this hotel was exceptional ,staff were pleasant and concierge went above and beyond to accommodate all of our requests . Will stay here again

Such an brilliant hotel with an excellent location in the heart of the city. We stayed for 5 nights and the only downside during our stay was that we could not stay for longer. Thank you Mandarin for making our stay in NYC so comfortable.

We have visited MO NYC many times(30 plus times ) since the Columbus Circle Warner / Time centre opened . A most convenient location to get key locations in the city . Tons of restaurants ( PER SE to MASA) close by .The check in area on 30 plus floors , process is seamless , doorman smart and helpful ( don't confuse with the residence door on left ) The room / suite spacious and well appointed , modern and functional . Cleaning staff efficient and polite . Exercise room is good not great , the Pool is best in NYC , 25 meter wide ,and spectacular view. Share with residences . SPA is superb , always has room for guest for massage. . We stayed there for thanksgiving a few times , they have a big party for kids the ballroom, where you watched the parade from high Both lounge and their restaurent have friendly staff and a menu for all ages. Both offer spectacular views . Room service may be a weakness , not on time . One time ,a nail in the salad ,the chef and food manager came up to apologize . We asked for extra rice , a extra scoop charge was 10 dollars ! We were shocked ! The room service was better for the first 5/8 years , then spiral down a bit . I compared room services to two near by hotel we also visited Trump / Pennisula both better . We have family with grand kids and we used in room dining a lot For that reason , we are shy going back to the hotel. MO In Hong Kong we visited frequently with our grand kids ,never a problem . If I come just with my wife and plan to dine out , I do not mind MO at all, still an excellent hotel in every many ways

What else can you expect but the best from the Mandarin here in NYC. The room although on the small side was perfect. The bathroom was on the large side with a huge soaking tub with all the fixings...Tv..Salt..tray for reading everything. Views that can't be matched from the soaking tub, room, lobby and restaurants. The service was top notch and genuine. The facilities were well maintained and fresh. Everything about the hotel is perfect to make you feel relaxed and stress free in NYC of all places.
user_name:
mblit
New York City, New York

review_body: I was disappointed in our recent birthday night at the Mandarin Oriental. My husband and I are frequent travelers, especially in New York City. We have stayed, for example, at The Eventi, The Bryant Park Hotel, and Nomad. The Mandarin Oriental was a splurge. What I found you get for the money is great views and a larger room. My criticisms are: at 12 noon we requested we get into the room early and it was not ready until almost 2 pm, they charge you for the internet (Yes!!! They say it won't be on the room charge but it was - though they took it off when we made a fuss.), Requested foam pillows when reservation was made, front desk confirmed the foam pillow request, there were goose down pillows on the bed, (housekeeping did come and change them), the fitness center is not open 24 hours (closes at 9 pm I believe), a small but telling thing - the magnifying mirror in the bathroom is on the counter and not at eye level like at most modern hotels.

We travelled to NYC and stayed in the mandarin in January 2017. We were adult family members sharing a room. Check in was flawless and we were shown to our river view room on the 56 floor. The views were amazing but the room was incredibly small for three adults. That being said, as soon as we informed reception of this we were given a much larger room with amazing views of Central Park. I think they had assumed it was two adults and a child when we booked. The second room was on the 45th floor and was perfect. The views from the lounge/bar are truly magnifying burg during the day and at night. We had drinks in the bar on several occasions during our hour night stay and the service was impeccable. The hostess always managed to get us a table at the windows when she got to know we were residents. We also ate here at lunchtime on a few occasions and had afternoon tea on the day of departure. The food was consistently good. Hotel is very central, rooms are quiet and the street outside is quite calm compared to a lot of other hotels adjacent to the park. Will definitely be returning the next time in in NYC.

Can't believe what I paid and what I got. Hotel is very rundown. Feels old and poorly maintained. Very noisy rooms; you could hear all the doors banging from adjacent rooms due to a weirdly strong wind current generated in the hallways. The rooms were super cold (heater wasn't much help) it felt like the cold wind was making its way inside the room also generating more noise. The towels felt like bad quality ones. Also they were very stingy when asking for additional towels. Super small rooms considering the price. Specially the bad room was minuscule. The only plus could be it's "location" and the view from the lobby bar (which by the way was outrageously expensive with bad service). It's a disappointment being a fan of the brand and having stayed in many of their properties.

We stayed here for only one night to celebrate my fiance birthday. Apartment had a great view to the central park.Front desk, concierge and cleaning ladies were great and execute amazing service.The only negative point was during the dinner as menu price and billed price were different, and waiter service wasn't good at all. But view at the restaurant was great, for wasn't good either.I would certainly come back, but for sure wouldn't come back to the restaurant.
user_name:
felipepR7794VE
New York City, New York

review_body: I have tried quite a few Hotels in NYC... the 4 Seasons, The Crosby Street, The Soho Grand, the Andaz...I was eager to try the Mandarin! After all, it is supposed to be one of the Best in Town... well.. I was disappointed.Everything about it was so-so to my taste. The food was ok not great. The room was ok, not great. The service was ok, not great. I mean everyone would do his job... but...it doesn't have this extra feeling where you feel you are treated in a special way. The feel the makes you believe that you are the only client that matters in this Hotel. I felt that at the 4 Seasons. No special complaints about the place. I just felt that I was in a "Westin"... nothing special...

From the minute I entered the hotel to the minute I left the hotel , I felt very special.Fabulous service , great and friendly staff willing to go that extra mile .On arrival my room was not ready and I was shown into the restaurant for a free drink and snack .The Mandarin is in a superb location with a great bar and restaurant with exceptional views.My room had an amazing view .

I am in NYC frequently to visit family and have never stayed at this hotel. I usually stay in lower Manhattan or boutique hotels in Brooklyn. I just love this hotel. Every person I encountered was professional, polite, and went out of their way to exceed my needs. So rare today. My room was comfortable, quiet, and relaxing. I enjoyed an after dinner drink in the lobby lounge and tea on the afternoon of my departure -- just pinch me. Both were so enjoyable. I am already looking forward to my next visit.

The hotel is perfectly located right on Columbus Circle. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed. The staff was courteous and accommodating. This was by no means a budget stay, it was expensive, but we got what we paid for. We had a two bedroom suite, connected to a one bedroom. My only complaint would be that the TV reception was poor.

Mandarin Oriental New York was a great experience. The rooms were the perfect size. The service both in the room as well as the front desk and concierge was impeccable. Very courteous and helpful. The health club facility was a little lacking. But overall very highly recommended.
