Having never previously stayed in a Madarin Oriental we had great expectations. Our stay was above and beyond our expectations. Wow, this place is seriously impressive.The staff are the best I've ever encountered, they certainly made our stay complete.

Fiftieth birthday treat for my husband, myself and our teenage son.Fabulous location, great views. But disappointed with the rooms. We booked two rooms, both were very small. I had planned to do a special champagne breakfast, in the room for my husband on his actual birthday but it was just to small, and the rooms were over £2000 a night! I phoned the hotel prior to our stay and asked for a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to be placed in our room, on arrival, as a special treat and surprise for my husbands fiftieth birthday. It hadn't been done and when I asked them to do it, It was put in our teenage sons room and not our room. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean, with nice bathrooms but for me just to small. Tea and coffee facilities might be nice as well. We will not be staying here again, as the room size is a big thing for me especially for five nights. It is a shame as we love the Mandarin in London.

Loved this property, great rooms, friendly staff, great bar, really excellent location. It simply couldn't get any better and that is why it's the Mandarin, you only get the best. Really loved the concierge, super friendly. Superior views of Central Park, really amazing to stay there. A special treat and experience. If you have time definitely do the spa, wow!
user_name:
Samantha J
New York City, New York

review_body: This is the first hotel we've stayed in in a long time that was so attentive and personable. There were so many little things that made a difference between this hotel and those we've stayed in over the past few years. For instance, when our room was cleaned, they folded all of our items that were left out, arranged our shoes and other items, and threw away our trash that was left on the tables. It sounds so small, but even when we've stayed at the JW Marriott, they don't do that. Furthermore, they left bottled water every night at turndown (complimentary), left two complimentary hardback novels to read and take with us, and refreshed our bathroom towels and amenities every day. As dumb as it sounds, one of my biggest pet peeves is having low water pressure or a bad shower head in the shower. This is the first hotel in as long as I can remember that had a great shower head and water pressure! In addition, the room temperature was great, and we were able to make it as cold or as warm as we liked. Finally, the location of this hotel was perfect for us. We did not want to stay in Times Square, as we preferred to stay a little further away from the crowds and noise. The Mandarin is right across the street from Central Park, it is attached to a fabulous mall, and is in walking distance to a ton of different sites and activities. The subway is right at the hotel, and cabs are easily attainable. One final perk is the car service the hotel offers. Although it's not always available, there were two times when we were going somewhere close, and the doorman offered us the complimentary hotel car rather than calling up a cab for us. Just one of the many wonderful services and attention to detail the hotel offers. I highly recommend the Mandarin!

Great location for a property on the edge of central park and convenient for the theatre district .Has a boutique feel and quite small but has a personal feel . Staff are well trained and provide attentive service . Dining is quite limited with one main restaurant and the lounge bar and room service offer the same menu which is pretty limited but well prepared and tasty .

Great staff and superior service compared to equivalent 5 star hotels in the city. Breakfast and brunch on weekends are mandatory with breathtaking views of the Central Park. The gym and spa are good but not as impressive as the Shangai's and Tokyo's branches. It's a Mandarin hotel for sure.

It was something to be expected from such a brand. Everything was perfect...the services and rooms. I stayed with a big group as we were in NY for an official visit and the staff and management were able to attend to us without any fuss. The security was rather tight as the King of Jordan and his Queen were also staying there but I am not complaining. Would love to stay here again but for a vacation.

The people make the stay pleasant and the service is great. The room we ended up in for eight nights was not great at all. It was poorly laid out and the bathroom was cramped. At a high end price for accommodation, this is not worth it.

I recently stayed at this hotel to celebrate an anniversary with my wife, I couldn't have been more disappointed, even if the stay was free. This hotel honestly couldn't PAY me to stay there again.I expected a 5 star hotel, what my wife and I got was an outdated, overrated unpleasant atmosphere. The front desk girl was nice enough, but not impressive, and the engineering team was an absolute joke. Our toilet was clogged and the heat in our room didn't work, it blew out cold air. I called the operator and they were supposed to send someone up. I had to call 3 times before someone came to our room. They showed up over an hour later, and the man was extremely rude to my wife and I. He unclogged the toilet, using a disgusting plunger and then used the towels in the room to clean up his mess. When I asked him if that was normal, he wouldn't answer me. He was extremely unpleasant, treating me and my wife like we were a nuisance to him. He then told us he needed help with the ac problem, he called another engineer to the room and that engineer wreaked of cigarette smoke. It was absolutely disgusting, my wife and i had to leave the room because we couldn't take it anymore. When we returned, it still smelled of him. I didn't bother calling the front desk because I didn't want anymore terrible service. We just opened the window. I don't remember what the name of the second engineer was, but the first ones name was Billy, or that's what I think the other engineer called him. because of this, this hotel has lost this customer, never again will I stay here.

Oh! Gorgeous! Delightful! Wonderful! The lobby is in the 35th floor, so your first impression is looking out at the most amazing view, Ther is nothing you could ever ask for that you couldn't get here. Great job. Great property.

The hotel hasn't been renovated in a while and some of the staff are a bit rude if you aren't a 70 year old in a full suit. The experience was fine but not what you'd expect for almost $1000 per night even for New York. Go to the Lotte Palace Towers or Park Hyatt instead.
user_name:
Trevor Carl N
Los Angeles, California

review_body: We decided to come for our 17th Anniversary. From the exit of our cab to our door this hotel strives to empress! We are staying for two nights but we are planning our return already! Gabriel & Diandra amazing!
Great job folks!Keep up the good work.You guys are on que and I wouldn't change anything at all,,, from the front door greeting with the bellman to the departure!!!Sincerely,Richard A Magliocca , Sr.

Took our group of 6 for dinner and drinks after treatments upstairs at the spa. They make any drink you can imagine and service is fantastic. The bar food was great and the ambiance is fun and very cosmopolitan. We loved the roasted edamame and the sliders and fries. The tuna tartare is to die for! I didn't love the chicken lollipops- too fatty in a very thick deep fried covering like a General Tso's texture. For the 6 of us the bill came to $900 for two rounds of food and 3 of drinks. I'd go back.

Quite simply this hotel is superb mazingly and staff couldn't be more friendly. The only gripe we had was not being notified that the pool was being renovated, so it was not possible to use. Other than that, fab!

If there Money is not an issue in your trip highly recommend to stay in the Mandarin Oriental hotel.Normally Mandarin Oriental hotel is located in best position both for business and shopping.Staff are professionally trained and welling to serve with extra mile.Providing good business centre, gym and Spa facilities.Restaurants also above normal standard.
user_name:
JamesBeh
New York City, New York

review_body: My friends, group of 6, stayed in a suite for the weekend and we had the best service ever. Every staff member (room service, front desk and servers at the lounge) treated everyone with the most attentive and caring service. The view in the lounge and suite were superb. If you are looking for a girls weekend to get pampered in NYC, look no further and stay at the Mandarin!

The highlight of our recent stay at The Mandarin Oriental New York was the service. From the moment we stepped out of the car to our room, we were greeted and treated with a lot of caring and attention. The ambiance was warm and soothing both the lobby and the room. Great restaurants and enjoyed our meals very much. If you want to indulge and have a romantic getaway, I recommend The Mandarin Oriental New York.

The hotel is beautiful and staff is very helpful. We thought the room was a bit small for the price as other hotels in the area had larger rooms but were more reasonable. Bed was comfortable and turn down service was nice.

I was there for half a day to speak at a conference and also had lunch in the Asian restaurant.The conference room and reception venue was nice. The UN annual meetings were on so all NYC hotels were busy. One could see many international official delegates on nearby tables enjoying both the view and the nice food.I was not very well but the food was so good it energised me and got me to perk up and deliver a good conference speech.AR.

Booked a one night stay for business for Saturday November 20. booked my reservation online through the mandarin website. booked a Hudson view room. drove from Baltimore. valet is very efficient although a bit expensive ($84 for one night) . excellent check in as they have the ability to have more than 1-2 front desk help if the line is long. very comfortable room. it is not a big room but everything very smartly organized. even room for a nice sofa by the window, beautiful TV and easy to operate . my one complaint is the pressure sensitive mini bar. I placed a soft drink in the mini fridge to stay cold. I inadvertently moved some other mini bottles and was charged accordingly (however as always the mandarin staff are first class an customer focused- I explained the situation and was offered a full refund no questions asked) turn down service efficient and un-obtrusiveordered room service for dinner and breakfast. both fantastic. bed is very comfortable. you close the curtains and the design is so nicely done that the room is pitch dark and this leads to a very comfortable sleep. I ordered breakfast for 715 am and they arrived 7;12 am. that is the Mandarin Oriental in one experience. check out as usual very efficient and friendly- they knew that I had asked for my car- will stay here again for sure

We had an outstanding stay at the Mandarin Oriental in New York. The staff is so nice and happy. We had a room on the 54th floor, very comfortable with a unique view on Central Park. I won't forget the sunrising behnd the skyline.

Evening event rooms were beautiful- food was good service was ok- they were rushed and bumped into people sitting down a lot as served- view was beautiful and we enjoyed the evening very much! We would have loved to stay but rooms were too expensive

This hotel is has a beautiful lobby that provides a stunning view of New York City. It is only second to the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo. The service is professional with knowledgeable people working at the concierge who are more than eager to help and regularly offer suitable recommendations. We were heading towards the Mandarin hotel is Boston upon checking out and they were helpful enough take it upon themselves to inform the Boston branch of our specific requirements for our stay. The service of the hotel is perhaps the best service I have come across from all the hotels I have stayed at. I will certainly be staying there again on my next visit!

The Mandarin Oriental continues to be one of my favorite hotels in New York. As I am a bird watcher, I feel so blessed to be in my perch up on the 35th floor of the Time Warner building. The restaurant, bar, and spa are amazing places as well and the service is impeccable. Did I mention Edyta and Fini in the spa or Ken and Joel at the concierge desk or the view of Central Park in all the seasons?????Seriously I know this is a big ticket here but you do get what you pay for! My only criticism is that some times the bar is rented out for special events! Not fair if you are only here for one night!!
user_name:
DianeP212
San Miguel de Allende, Mexico

review_body: Stayed at the Mandarin in New York for 3 nights on business. Room has a bath tub overlooking central park. Not quite as nice a view like the old Mandarin in San Fran (now has a different owner) but spectacular nevertheless. It sits on top of a shopping center with upscale retails. Convenient to walk to everything. Expensive but worth it. Restaurant has a nice view as well.

I travel a lot for business - approximately 120 days per year. I am fortunate to stay in some really terrific hotels. I chose the Mandarin because it has a 20 (or 25) yard pool. Seriously, that is how much I love my swimming. Pros:- it really is an exquisite property, modern, high ceilings and excellent staff- the rooms are quite nice with great linens- it has a great pool and gym- the restaurant is very accommodating to "high maintenance" guests - I heard the most ridiculous order being placed over lunch and the server didn't bat an eye; and no it wasn't meCons- pool doesn't open until 6:00 am which is a problem when you have an early morning meeting- the location is a bit suboptimal if you want to be in thick of things - on Columbus Circle provides great proximity to Central Park but is not convenient for shopping near Rockefeller Centre

Checked in at the Mandarin Oriental NYC where we stayed 2 nights for the Thanksgiving Party where you can watch the Macy”s Parade from a good vantage point. The hotel is located on top of Time Warner on Columbus Circle, overlooking Central Park and close to restaurants, shopping and walking distance to the theatres. There are lots of shops at Time Warner with hotel access on the 35th floor.Our room is beautiful, spacious with the Hudson River view. It has nice comfortable bed and was given the choice of pillow firmness which was a plus. The bathroom is spacious and luxurious with double sinks, has separate tub and showers and water closet, the floors has radiant heat. It has all the toiletries you will need.Staff are friendly, knowledgeable and courteous. Housekeeping did a good job on making up our room. They made sure we have all we needed.The Hotel has a bar on 35th floor where you can have a nice drink, appetizer and enjoy the beautiful view.Pricey but worth it.

We live in New York City and my wife and I treated ourselves to 2 nights at the Mandarin Oriental. This was our anniversary gift to ourselves. It is a 5 star hotel and I would give it 6 if I could. Knowing that we were there for our anniversary and booked through the American Express Fine Hotels Program, we were upgraded to a suite. The room, on the 48th floor, was perfect. The first day there we had breakfast in the restaurant. I was very surprised when the waitress called me by my name. That has never happened in any hotel I have ever been to. When the woman who made up our room saw us in the hall, she also greeted us by using my name. And the same thing happened when we had lunch in the lobby cafe. Most impressive!In the afternoon, we both had massages in the Spa. What a treat! A hot whirlpool, a steam room, and a fantastic massage. They also have a relaxation lounge that overlooks the city.The service, the attention to every detail was just perfect.Now, I hate to degenerate into potty talk but I have to. I can only speak for the room I had but I will assume that the other rooms have the same toilet. It is a Japanese toilet. When I walked into the small toilet room inside the very large bathroom, the toilet seat cover rose on its own. When I sat down, the toilet seat was nice and warm. There is a box on the wall that explains how to operate the toilet. It can shoot water up while you are sitting to clean what ever needs cleaning. Now, to be honest, I didn't try that feature. I like technology but this is something I want to do myself. However, if you go to the Mandarin Oriental and do use the full capabilities of the toilet, I'd really like to read about your experience if you review on Trip Advisor.I think the present we gave each other was the best anniversary we've ever had.We saved up for this present because it was very expensive. But we have already decided that we are going back next year and possibly adding an extra day.

Resting adjacent to Columbus Circle, this hotel is a must go to any business, leisure, traveler to the New York City area. I was recently here for a wedding I was attending and it was breathtaking. I was lucky enough to see the bridal suite, a regular suite on the 42nd floor, as well as numerous of their regular rooms. The accommodations are top notch, the views of Central Park New Jersey the Hudson river all the way up to the George Washington Bridge are breathtaking. The wedding itself at the Mandarin ballroom was one of the best I've ever attended. The catering staff as well as the Mandarin staff handled everything with the upmost professionalism. They are more than accommodating but remember this is New York City and you are going to pay a price for that. I highly recommend this for any high and traveler, from anywhere all over the world. You will not be disappointed.

This hotel was superb! We had a wonderful room, very luxurious, with gorgeous views of Central Park.This hotel is geared toward the business traveler and spa goers. I did not have the opportunity to try the spa, but I hear it is to die for.The hotel is in the highest floors of the building, so the views were beautiful. Slightly obstructed by the obnoxious Trump hotel.The hotel is very expensive, but it is top shelf. The service is excellent... the front desk had my name memorized after checking me in... that surprised me when they remembered my name the following day.The hotel is right at Columbus circle and a short walk to Central Park and about 15 minutes to the theatres.

Upon arrival were upgraded to a suite. They wished my husband a happy birthday without me even mentioning it was his birthday. Gorgeous room with top end amenities (love the Fresh products). Fantastic views. Staff is fabulous. Great location. We ended up going to the spa at Equinox instead of the hotel which was great for massages.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
LizG311
New York, New York, United States

review_body: The entire staff of the Mandarin could NOT have done more for us the week of our daughter's wedding. From accommodating my request for rooms on the same floor, the helpful concierge staff recommending brunch location for Sunday am and arranging transportation throughout our stay, bellmen delivering boxes of photos via cab, helpful front desk staff as guests arrived, bellmen delivering flowers to the brunch venue on Sunday, storing said flowers and cake, lovely staff in the Asiate at breakfast....I could go on and on. All this and a convenient location....
user_name:
ctcyclist
New York City, New York

review_body: This Hotel was a great disappointment. It is very expensive. The suites, at 2200+ a night, are just not worth it. The staff are not overly friendly, particularly at breakfast, I was woken up early two mornings running by housekeeping noise outside my room at 7am, the corridors are dark and worn, the furniture in the room is old, stained and not very comfortable and I won't be staying here again.And one more thing...the glass in the windows is pretty thin and the noise from sirens is very loud and they go all night long!!

Good location, great view, decent size room if that counts for 5 star or luxury in New York City! Not quite to the taste level of some other Mandarin oriental I have stayed in the past! Will charge you 5 dollars for five minutes of wifi, could find better ways to charge you for more!!!!

A perfect hotel, we did not even want to leave our room. I was so peaceful . The location could be be better easy access to everything we love in NY. The views were amazing and everyone at the hotel was helpful and made us feel special.

Great place, more than anything the location was Perfect!! It's The Mandarine Hotel, but for the price It was better than what we expected!! Clean, confortable, overall was perfect!! For these who want the Best for the money

I also stay at the Mandarin when in NEw York I find that the views are formidable.Unfortunately I have noticed a slight change, the rooms could do witha bit of renovation and it would be nice for recurring guests as myself to receive a more personalised touch with fruit in the room for example.

I decided to try the St. Regis based on a recommendation, but after a disappointing stay there, I checked out early and moved to the Mandarin. Talk about a different world. Everything about the experience was terrific. The views, needless to say, are incredible, but it's really the warmth and friendliness of the staff combined with their amazing attention to detail that sets the hotel apart. It's not an artificial warmth, either. Everyone seems genuinely friendly, eager to help, and extremely knowledgeable. The hotel is very expensive but it justifies the price. You'd be very hard-pressed to find anything better, not just in New York, but in the US. One of the very best hotels in the country.

It's starts with outstanding service and just gets better. We came for the view and got so much more! Great sliders with fries and enjoyed a wonderful bottle of wine! You must do this however a little expensive.

We moved here from the Carlyle hotel and well what a difference! World class hotel - spacious rooms for NYC, superb park view, the best manicure I've ever had at the spa and very central especially if it's your first time to NYC.My husband tends to gravitate towards this hotel as he usually stays at the manadarin in Hong Kong and you always know that you will get the best.Even the room service and tidy up is above and beyond. The concierge is extremely helpful and the breakfast is excellent and the view of Central Park is so beautiful in fall. It's a great hotel to take advantage of the Park, midtown, upper east and west side are able to be walked too and you can get to soho and downtown via subway fairly quickly. The biggest advantage is that it os nice and high and much quieter in terms of traffic and sirens which are always blaring through NYC.Highly recommended!

I was recommended this hotel by a friend who's dad runs a mandarin in Asia having stayed with the group before in Tokyo I knew what to expect sheer excellence from a driver waiting for us at the airport to even getting us a certain type of juice we wanted in our room also the location of the hotel is 1st class we paid a little more for a park view which we loved at night as we where knackerd from all the site seeing and shopping might I add the reception recommended 4 restaraunts and bars for us too go to and each where outstanding also having asked the hotel too sort our day trips which included the Empire State Building and a helicopter trip which is a must if you have the time there was no hassle just sheer effiency.

The view of snowy Central Park and service in the hotel were incredible. Asiate is a must to go and to their lobby bar for breakfast.Their blueberry pancakes are heaven!!!! Everyone is extremely polite, patient and they will truly work with you to accommodate your needs. One of a very few nyc hotels that have absolutely everything you need in a very short walk distance, and on top of that unbeatable view of NYC finest Central Park.

We had a nice afternoon tea, the ginger scones were special but the price was eye-watering (just shy of 200 dollars for afternoon tea, two glasses of their cheapest champagne and a standard tip). We hoped to get a seat near the window but were out of luck and they mixed up our reservation date. The clientele seemed dominated by stern business types which dampened the mood. Service can be improved - the waiter pointed out we were missing our favourite of the listed sandwiches, went to check with chef and never mentioned it again. We were also going to get another drink but after dropping off the menu he never came back. They also said they'd try to move us to a window seat but when the chance arose they just led another couple over. Still, it was good food, great views (if you are near them) and delicate bites, I just think the context of the slight stuffiness/final price puts things into perspective

Superb hotel location on Central park, sophisticated staff.Outstanding bedroom views with floor to ceiling windows. Greatgym, Ydillique restaurant setting with panoramic view,Chocolate cake is a must.

Stayed here for a week in a Hudson View room. The view is spectacular. Had adjoining rooms with my teenagers, worked very well, as there was a second door that could be closed, creating your own apartment. They look after you exceedingly well here. Lobby view of the park is worth seeing as is the view from the restaurant. Pool is worth using, and has an amazing view too.I would stay here again.If you can afford this hotel, you will not regret staying here.

I actually cannot think of anything negative about this hotel! Everything from the customer service to the restaurant to the rooms and view are on another level to any other hotel in New York! The rooms are very big for NY standards and the view on Central Park in the restaurant is amazing.

A fantastic experience. We had the city skyline view room, but it also gave us a nice view of Central Park. Perfect location close to metro lines and with walking distance to some of New Yorks greatest sights.

The Mandarin in NYC is definitely one of the best places you can stay in NYC. If you have the freedom of budget for a luxury hotel I would recommend this one for its keen location in Columbus Circle, which is within walking distance to several shops and restaurants and Central Park! But I also love the lobby bar restaurant because of the stunning views. Attending a business event in one of their meeting suites and the food and service was outstanding.

Mandarin Oriental was, by far, the best hotel I've stayed in. It truly was an experience. Everyone in the hotel made it a point to say hello, ask if I needed anything, etc. The fitness center was fantastic. The room was a showstopper . . . The bathroom was so spa-like. I was more comfortable than I knew I could be in a hotel. I'd love to stay again for any occasion.

When I was looking for a hotel to stay in New York, I was a bit worried because I've never been to New York before and wanted to stay in a place that I can feel comfortable with an amazing view. I chose Mandarin Oriental and I have one word for this hotel.....fabulous! Great hotel with excellent service. I was glad to choose this hotel and I'm coming back! The view was amazing from the room and the room itself was perfect. Loved it!

We stayed at this magnificent hotel. The views were fantastic, the staff was amazing . My brother got married and they had the reception there as well. They went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. The only thing I would recommend is that the wi/fi should absolutely be included in the cost of a room that is many, many hundreds of dollars a night....

I was upgraded to a Suite with a small additional charge and had excellent stay in New York. Unfortunately swimming pool was closed, and Spa and Fitness center limited. Staff are extremely helpful and warm.

Great location at Columbus Circle with gorgeous views all around, however, hotel is a bit tired and in need of a refurb... Lots of wear and tear on furniture in room and for some reason this hotel just doesn't have the special MO buzz to it... Perhaps my standards are too high by comparing this hotel to the awesome MOHK... In room amenities certainly not on the same level and hotel facilities also lack. Tried to visit the bar twice, closed on both occasions for private functions...Will want to visit again, however, for $750-$1k a night, I may look to some other options such as the St. Regis.

Pricey, glamorous hotel with amazing views of New York City. But that and the Central Park location felt like the main reason for the place's extraordinarily high price. I was also there for work--so it's probably the kind of place you'd only go to if your company paid for it. Compared to other places I've stayed in New York it's not that much better.

The worst five star hotel I've ever stayed in! You can't find a piece of furniture in this hotel that is not scuffed from years of wear and tear. Any other self respecting hotel would have refurbished years ago. The room (as with all the hotel) is out dated, faded and tired. We just attempted to visit the bar only to be told it's closed! The pool and fitness room are also closed for refurbishment. We were not advised of this at the time of booking. Do not be fooled by on line images as the hotel looks nothing like them. I just don't know how it has maintained its five star status. I was looking forward to a great week in New York but this hotel has ruined it.

This time around the Mandarin oriental hosted our annual board meeting, and the preparations, venue and service was impeccable. But I wouldn't ever have expected anything less from this hotel. They always deliver....

To stay at the Mandarin Oriental is a luxury - locationwise, servicewise, accomodationwise and pricewise. If you care to stay in a walking distance to the MET and to all the very central amenities you are certainly at the right place. If you care for a spacious room, as nice city-view and a friendly, helpful staff, you are at the right place, too. If you care for an open window instead of aircon, a relaxed breakfast with good espresso and an uncomplicated access to your room you better choose somewhere else.

Having stayed here several times over the years, I can recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the finest experience in the hospitality industry! Friendly, professional staff, some of the best views in NYC from both rooms, restaurant and lounge. 5 Star in all aspects and very serene for NYC.

I stayed in this hotel in summer 2015 with my family for two weeks, it's one of the best hotel I ever stayed in including Paris GeorgeV and L.A. Four seasons. The service was brilliant, the staff were superb and helpful. Sure we'll come back.

We have booked 3 nights from 18 until 21 August in the premier central park view suite, which is really beautiful but at the same time very expensive. First of all I have to share that the hotel is perfect located, the suite were excellent. BUT, the hotel forgot to mention in advance that the swimming pool is closed and the SPA only partly works due to renovation works until October. It should be visible and they should have warn us in advance. And u pay the same price! However the hotel offered us "SPA" possibility in a regular, huge fitness club next to the building but I am sure u don't want to relax there and it is located in lower level, very full and looks bad... We asked in advance, that the suite should be located possibly high level! We got a room on level 38 which is the first or second level with rooms in the hotel which it goes up to 54th level, so not the best view at all and it looks over to a huge terrace of the hotel which is below the room, from the side of the room u cannot see the Hudson river neither. So the hotel stuff just ignored our request which by that price is not acceptable. We asked to change, the staff was very helpful and the promised us a new room in 30 minutes. It took 2 hours!!!!!!! After arriving from Europe, tired and I underline that we have asked for that in advance, I have to tell not the best service at all. The front desk manager invited us meanwhile for a drink in the lobby, which amount has been charged to the room... Not very attentive. Then we got finally the room on the 47th level which had a really amazing view and the room was beautiful. We have asked for late check out until 2pm, the hotel was not able to provide this, however we waited 2 hours for the room...So the hotel is very nice but the service could be much better, even if we stayed at the first time in the hotel which is noted in their computer.

I spend half of my life travelling and I expected the same quality of hospitality that I always get in Asia with Mandarin Oriental. I made a big mistake : I was in NYC and not in Singapore or somewhere else in Asia. The rooms are great, the view is great but the service is poor, and not personalised at all. I am sure I was unlucky - the checking staff did manage to block all my credit cards that I use all the time from Australia to China... even in the USA and Canada. Not a great way to start your holidays with your family.... and it is fair to say the staff could not care less.there was nothing personal throughout our stay. It was all about money...I would strongly recommend Mandarin Oriental in Asia.... but if you decide to go to NYC you need to reset your expectations and avoid any non US credit cards.

The Mandarin Oriental has it all : great location, great views and superb food. Our two adjacent bedrooms were spacious and impeccably maintained. The view is nothing short of amazing. Our rooms were cleaned twice a day and everybody was very polite, especially the housekeeper.However, the check-in was a nightmare because we had European cards with pins and apparently their software wasn't updated (that's what we were told). The guy tried several times, and as a result our cards ended up being blocked. Lovely. Things got sorted eventually but I was made to feel that it was our problem (it wasn't !), and the bank called as they thought our cards had been compromised. Needless to say, the hotel couldn't care less.We had a good stay, but there was no tea or coffee facilities and I must admit that I would have liked a coffee when waking up (at 4 or 5 am, because of the jet lag). The in-room dining was good but a bit too long to arrive (45/50 mins).The hotel gave us a late check-out, which was nice as we could stay in one of the rooms for a couple of hours. They called us when our car to the airport had arrived (in advance, which was fine because we were ready) and we all (I was travelling with husband & children) went to the ground floor (the lobby is on the 35th floor and our bedrooms on the 54th). I don't know what happened then, because the staff spent at least 15 mins looking for our car. It was a complete mess, I think that the team downstairs changed shift, and the new guy didn't have a clue, he first told us that the car hadn't arrived, then that it was the wrong time, made us say our name at least 10 times and ran like a headless chicken to the 5 cars waiting for clients without being able to find ours.Eventually he found the right car (right in front of the entrance) and apologised profusely. I found the whole episode surreal.In short, I enjoyed my stay but didn't feel like a valued customer -more like a walking purse, actually.

Amazing hotel with beautiful views. Attended a wedding here last night and it was breathtaking. The prices to stay at the facility are very inflated. The food and the service is wonderful. A must if you want to splerge.

The lobby is on the 35th floor, has amazing views and the rooms are all on floors higher than that! Drinks, food and service, in all manner is exquisite and of the highest caliber. The beds and couches are amazingly comfortable and there should be no problem falling asleep. Expensive, but worth every penny. It is an amazing experience in itself!
user_name:
TravelersKnow
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for our wedding anniversary. The views were incredible, the staff was amazing and the hotel was gorgeous! We enjoyed the spa so much. It was the best massages we ever had. The room was beautiful and so clean!
user_name:
Alex1014Sara1010
New York City, New York

review_body: The Mandarin Oriental NYC is both visually stunning and luxurious. Its located in Columbus Circle, in the Upper West Side of Manhattan, and is surrounded by high end retailers and fine dining. The staff is professional and helpful. They ensure that all of your needs are met. This property is well managed and maintained. They made a stressful arrival (our flight landed at 1:00 am) into a seamless and enjoyable experience. Eileen went out of her and took great care of us; And Eugene (the night manager) personally escorted us to the lobby for personalized check-in. We appreciate it all and will only stay at MO NYC going forward! Thank you MO NYC - we are fans for life.

Room was beautiful, with excellent view of the Hudson river. Shower and tub were roomy and relaxing, housekeeping was excellent. Workout room was well-equipped and attendant was helpful. Convenient shopping on the lower levels, convenient location across from Central Park.

First time at the Mandarin in New York, and it is the best hotel I've visited in New York so far. They have everything wired perfectly--staff, location, rooms, dining, concierge, and bars. I plan to stay at the Mandarin on my visit for sure.

i've been to the mandarin hotel many times ,it is consistantly perfect. from the food to the entertainment, to the service,this hotel is a gem,in the heart of n y c .located on 60th street and columbus circle the views from any window are breath taking.

I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights for the conference, and even though it was a work trip, the stay was a truly relaxing experience. The views are amazing, and you can work or sit in a bathtub with a beautiful view of Manhattan. The rooms are very clean, the staff is courteous. There are fitness center and the pool amenities in the hotel, both have excellent views on the outside. The water is the pool does not have chlorine. Highly recommended!

1st impression, as I arrived fro the airport wasn't stellar. Once I got to the 35th floor and checked in, the service improved. Room was as expected for a 5 star. I will say the hotel did have plenty of outlets for charging of electronics. TV was also a good size. The hotel restaurant, Asiate, was great. Next visit will have to try the Spa.

As a family of five we stayed one week at the Mandarin Oriental New York during our spring vacation. The hotel is perfectly located at Columbus Circle near Central Park, Park Lane and Broad Way with 5th Avenue in walking distance. It is located on the upper floors (36th+) of the Timer Warner Buildings with great views, especially of the Central Park from the top-end bar area on the reception level. The Mandarin staff is authentically friendly, very attentive and helpful. The rooms are decently furnished and decorated with the highest sleeping comfort I have experienced in a hotel. The food either at the bar, for break first or at the restaurant is far-above average. Try the Wonton Soup and the lemonade at the bar! The hotel is a perfect starting point for exploring New York by walking. Just around the corner the Broadway starts, the shows and theaters are in walking distance to the hotel. Walking along Park Lane passing by the other top-end New York hotels (though none of them surpasses the quality and standards of the Mandarin) you will reach 5th Avenue after a few minutes. Left-hand side, you pass by the Central Park and can jump on a Riksha to explore New York's green lung. I have stayed at other Mandarin hotels before in Washington D.C., London, Munich, Singapore etc. and it is the right place to be. The staff makes you feel at home, every service is of the highest possible quality. The concierges are the best travel consulting firms you can experience. So whenever going to New York, there is definitely no better place to stay and to enjoy a perfect hotel service. It is one of the best managed places I have ever experienced!

We got a great deal on Hotels.com, far lower than the posted room rates. We weren't treated any differently, though I think we had to pay for wifi while others may get it free. But we had a great time!The hotel is located in the CNN/Time Warner building, at the center of the action between Central Park and the Theatre District! Perfect for walks through the park, walking to museums, walking to a show! We walked a lot, but were easily able to make it back to home base for a change of clothes or a quick rest!I'm not usually a fancy-pants luxury hotel person, but I might start to be one!The view was amazing, the room was amazing. Only complaints - bathroom lacked a privacy fan, bathroom sliding doors were a bit hard to close.

Enjoyed a five night stay recently in a Skyline View King Room at this high end Columbus Circle property. Room quality was up to the usual high MO standards – comfortable bed, tasteful decorations, great bathroom and views. Service was attentive and prompt from the curb to the room, and from staff throughout the hotel. I especially appreciated the diligence of the concierge staff at securing reservations at several high demand Manhattan restaurants; their advice was spot on, and they succeeded in getting us exactly the times we wanted. Location was extremely convenient – adjacent to shopping in Time Warner Center, and a quick walk to Central Park, midtown shopping, and Broadway shows. Will definitely consider for future NY visits.

Amazing view and settingGreat to start going around the cityLoved morning jogging in Central ParkService is to the perfection, such a nice welcome everywhere Concierge absolutely fantastic for restaurants, advices, tickets , you name it !

I have stayed at Mansarin Iriental in Ny twice, both times to treat myself. It is expensive but WOW! The room, the view, the bed, the robe, the bedfing, and the service The pool is awesome and with Whole Foods at the bittom level...,i was in heaven. The lobby, bar area, appetuzers, and the fiod was great. I was treated to a pot of jasmin green tea in my room when i checked in. Security is great and lication is perfect: upper west side close to Central park and shopping and restaurants. The spa is anazing. The only turn off was being charged $25 for wifi. I mean really ? Couldn't you have included it in the $1500 a night room? However i called and they took it off my bill. I mean Really? C''min. Would i stay there again? If i have the moneyYES

It was a hot and humid New York afternoon at 91F, we went up to the The Lobby Lounge on the 35th floor for an afternoon tea. Our table was at a corner with an awesome view of the south end of the Central Park. We witnessed the change of Manhattan skyline when temperature dropped from 91 to 85F and the storm rolled in. The panoramic view of both sunny and rainy day in the heart of Manhattan was breathtaking!Selection of sandwiches and desserts were great, homemade jam and warm scones hit just the right spot. It's a worthwhile experience for just US$48 per person for an afternoon tea but do remember to make reservation before you go.

Went with my girl friends to celebrate my birthday.Pros - amazing view of colombus circle-the scones melt in your mouth and the cream is light as air- most of the non-chocolate pastries were divine-the sandwiches were goodCons - the service was super slow. I don't know if it was because they were busy but no explanation was offered-the tea (I had the rose of new york, which is supposed to be their signature) was what I would call middlingI've had tea in a few different cities, and though this experience was not the best by far I had great company and the scones were amazing. Choose here if you want a great view and don't mind paying for a good but not excellent tea service.

The hotel is outstanding, from the front desk to the what I believe to be the best concierge in the city. The hotel made our stay that much more enjoyable and memorable. I would highly recommend the hotel.

fantastic hotel in the upper floors of this new Columbus circle tower with staggering views of Central Park . Excellent restaurant, large bedrooms and a very beautiful spa. Ideal for doing business uptown, less so for Wall Street.

Wonderful service went above and beyond. Loved the room and all of the special and subtle design features. Highly recommend for comfort in Manhattan at a great location. When we arrived the staff was so warm and helpful -- from the bellman who greater us and checked our luggage to his staff who offered us water to the kind woman at check-in who made sure our bags were in our room waiting for us when our room was ready.We were in Manhattan for a day with friends -- my only regret was that we couldn't extend our stay to take advantage of the spa and other amenities the hotel offers.Read some negative reviews and really did not see any room for improvement.We had a corner room with views in many directions on the 48th floor -- just stunning.

Great Hotel, great location!We had a very pleasant stay here. Hotel is next to central park and columbus cirlce for shopping. Room service staff were lovely and restaurant staff we fabulous. Rooms were very modern &, very clean.Gym had very modern equipment and was very clean.A great place to stay.

Amazing and helpful staff and perfect location. It has the best breakfast menu in New York city, and I have stayed in most of the 5 star and Mandarin is the best. However their gym is quite small, maybe because there is an Equinox next to it.

The Mandarin Hotel is in a wonderful location right by Central Park. The check in was easy and the guy who checked us in, Andrew, was excellent and made sure we had two great connecting rooms on the 53rd floor which gave us magnificent views. Unfortunately I have to give this hotel a three instead of a five because because the beds are rock hard and the enormous pillows are even harder. The air conditioning is extremely noisy and we could hear every movement in the room next door ours.

This was my first time at the Mandarin Oriental. I loved it. The hotel is right off of Columbus Circle at the SW corner of Central Park. I chose the Central Park View room -- and the view did not disappoint. The room was bright, clean, quiet and contemporary with an Asian decor in keeping with the rest of the hotel.The staff were polite, attentive and accommodating. I requested a room on the top floor, which they kindly arranged on my second and subsequent nights there. Frankly, having now seen the views from the 50th and 54th floors, there is not much of a difference. So don't obsess about it like I did. Even the view of the Park from their restaurant on the 35th floor looks amazing. A couple of things to be aware of:1) WiFi isn't free, or at least it wasn't when I was there. Granted, it wasn't expensive ($5/day?), but I felt like maybe it should've been free given the price of the room.2) Valet service was $85/day. If you're staying there several days, it's something perhaps to keep in mind. It definitely adds up.That said, I felt like I got good value for my money. It's a hotel that deserves its 5 star rating. Though I want to sample a few more hotels in NYC, I will likely come back to the Mandarin Oriental.

Commanding a prime view of Central Park-this hotel lacked something special that I have found in other Mandarin properties.Not sure it is because you have to go to the 35th floor to find reception-but for me lacked charm.The room was large by city standards but signs of ware both in the bedrooms gym and pool signal a re fresh is required.Didn t eat in the hotel so can not comment.Hotel taxi service crazy expensive...I should have known their is more affordable opitions.

The room was small but good. Very high and the staff a bit unpersonal, no attention to the guests. The swimming pool a bit old. But in general a good and chique hotel in the heart of NYC. I personally cancelled my stay in the mid of the week and went to another hotel because i found that my room was too high (53th floor).

I had a brief stay at Mandarin Oriental for a business meeting. I am not necessarily their target audience (more of a fan of upper/midscale than top luxury hotels) - but honestly, I am not sure what all of the fuss is about. Yes, the hotel lobby was beautiful and the breakfast was amazing (great view of Central Park to go with my $60 eggs) - but the room itself was just OK. It was small (yes, we're in NY) and very well appointed - but nothing that really wowed me. Bed was OK - but I've slept on better beds at Westin & Hyatt. Bathroom was excellent with a large soaking tub. This is a beautiful hotel with excellent service - but I did not walk away thinking "I can't wait to stay at a Mandarin Oriental hotel again."

Not sure I would pay to stay here on my own dime, but I sure do enjoy staying here for business. Large room, great service, amazing views, beautiful bathrooms. Perfect location for access to Central Park, broadway theaters, Lincoln Center etc.

I had the luxury of staying at this hotel last week. Right from the service as you arrive you are treated like gold. The check in on the 35th floor has a great view of the city & central park. The rooms were beautifully designed and very elegant. Service at the drop of a pin. Dinner at Asiate restaurant was to die for. I had the Wagyu beef which was so tender it was effortless to cut through it and the dessert which is all made in house was like a piece of heaven. The location is right by central park which is right where you want to be!

I only satyed one night as I was travelling for business but really enjoyed the suite I stayed in and the location. I had a great view and the space level of the suite was superior. Only ate breakfast but really enjoyed the quality.

I've been staying at this hotel for years but it's not always my first choice unless I have business on the west side. The minute I stepped into the hotel things were just terrific. There was not a bump the entire stay and that is pretty hard to do unless you have great staff. Great rooms, food, and service. What more could you ask for!
user_name:
James C
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: The location of the Madarin is FANTASTIC. You basically fall out of bed into Central Park. Walking with your morning coffee in the Park is just perfect. As a general point of reference, we are closer to 60 than 50. We walked everywhere. To the Theater District, Rock Center, etc. The only time we jumped in a cab was to dinner. Our room was very comfortable, not incredibly spacious, but immaculate (always) and well appointed. I wished I could have take the mattress home. The only observation that I would make is that service in the casual lobby bar needs a bit of attention (maybe more than a bit). And as an FYI, if you have some extra time - go see "The Incident Of The Curious Dog in the Nighttime". It is exceptional.

We stayed at MO NEW York and it was a truly great experience. The hotel offers great views over Manhattan, staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and best of all, the concierge could get us a table at a Eleven Madison Park, where it's usually very hard to get a table with short notice.On checkout day, i forgot something in my bedside drawer, the hotel got in touch with me and send it free of charge to europe.

Not recommend to stay in NYC location. It's loud, not so clean, facilities are not so new. Almost all the controls in the room are manual and service level is not even close to other luxury hotels. They had an old fan outside of the room which made tons of noises. They were not able to exchange the room the same night. I could not sleep because of the noise of the fan and the hotel. The turn down service put all the extra pillows and covers on the floor when the closet has a space to put away everything nicely. The room was not so clean either. When asked to hail a cab, they told me to walk over to the next street and get it myself when I had a big luggage with me. All of these are not acceptable considering the price and the level of expectations I got from other locations.

I have stayed in many 5 star hotels in NYC over the years and thought I'd try the Mandarin OrientalThe location can't be beatThe views are beautifulHowever there are a few disappointments which will cause me not to visit this hotel again.I was disappointed in my room. Luxury prices for non luxury accommodations. Ny room was small with no extra table for a room service breakfastAnd it looked like an office with black furniture. Fine for a businessman (which I think this hotel caters to) but not for those who are looking for a luxury hotel on an escape to the city.No reception from anyone on arrival by taxi. There were what looked like bellmen but they were busy talking so I found my way to the elevator after realizing the reception was up on another floor, carting my small bag myself. There was a private party in the bar area which is open to the reception so the noise was deafening and I was told we couldn't use that area until the party was over at 8. This tells me the hotel doesn't cater to its guests first, but rather is concentrating on renting itself out to make more money (as if they don't get enough from its guests at such steep prices)Room service took much longer than it should have. I had to actually call them to find out where it was after 49 minutes and I had only ordered a large bottle of water because they only provided the room with one small bottle. The soaps and lotions in the bathroom are tiny, bring your own and I didn't find the towels luxurious at all. They were rough and thin.I was not impressed and feel the prices are WAY out of line for what you get at this hotel. 3/4 star quality for 5 star cost.

Had a suite on the 52nd. floor and had spectacular views of most of the city. the suite was beautiful and our overall experience was wonderful. We usually stay at the Peninsula or the Ritz Carlton, but we would come back to the Mandarin.

Wonderful hotel, wonderful employees, wonderful dinner at asia restaurant (thanks to the chef of the 2 stars restaurant of the hong kong mandarin oriental), 3 years in a row at mandarin oriental, june 2017 could be our 4th stay!

Absolutely outstanding service and world class hotel. Check in is efficient and you feel welcome right away. Staff will do everything to make you feel at home. The views from our room was spectacular and you don't hear your neighbors!

On arrival, the Dir of Guest Relations recognized me immediately. Guest room was clean and bright. Breakfast in Asiate was flawless albeit expensive. Room Service was particularly good at dinner. Door staff very efficient and pleasant

A great hotel in an incredible location! Everything you need is in the building from stores to bars and resteraunts. Even have a whole foods store under the mall. And it's located on the corner of Central Park and walking distance to Times Square and Broadway. Excellent service!

This hotel is beautiful, luxurious and so close to Manhattan's best areas. My room had gorgeous views of Central Park. The room was bigger than most Manhattan apartments! The turn down service was lovely and the toiletries high quality.

Arrived here 13th May for three nights.After staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas this was such a disappointment.The check in desk is located right next to the bar and the acoustics were appauling, such noise it was a struggle to hear and be heard.Room 4828 was acceptable but expensive for what we paid and no free Wi-Fi.This hotel is not a good example of Mandarin Oriental and was not service with a smile.

The Mandarin Oriental in New York City was an amazing hotel. The staff was incredibly helpful from even before the visit in getting dinner reservations and theater tickets. The facilities at the hotel were unparalleled. The location was perfect for both business and leisure trips.

We had a disappointing stay at the Mandarin. As a New Yorker, I typically know better than to complain about room size, but at $1000 per night, I would expect more space than this room of just adequate size to fit the bed, with not even enough space for a small table to dine at if one were to order room service. The room was tastefully decorated and the bathroom did feel spacious and well-appointed with fixtures and amenities. The bed sagged a bit in the middle and there was a lot of motion transfer when one person got up, which didn't make for a great night's sleep. There was no coffee maker or way to heat up water for tea which was also an unwelcome surprise.There was turndown service, but whomever did it left an empty bottle and dirty glasses.We were celebrating an anniversary and although the occasion was acknowledged verbally at check-in, we were surprised that there was no token fruit or wine or any acknowledgment of the occasion in the room. As my husband commented, even the hotel hallways had bowls of fruit, and even the very casual place downtown that we went for dinner brought us glasses of champagne! The spa locker room was small, with one hair dryer that multiple women were waiting to use. (though I will say the massage was excellent.) The air of stinginess continued when we arrived back at the hotel from our evening out and there was a bottle of water on one nightstand but not the other. Really? For $1000 we can't each have our own individual bottle of water? These are certainly not the most egregious things to complain about overall, but the main message is that it was not a top notch experience and did not feel like it was worth the high price tag.

The Mandarin Oriental was the perfect luxury hotel to have the most amazing views of Central Park from the rooms! The location is ideal to hop on to the subway, enter Central Park, get to Times Square, hop on City Bikes, etc! The location is perfect! Everything about this hotel is amazing - customer service, quality and beauty of rooms and hotel, staff, etc. If you go to New York, Mandarin Oriental is the perfect place to stay!

This is a good hotel, the service is good but slightly slow, the management is good but not perfect and the Hotel is what you would expect from a luxury chain of hotels.The thing that really lets itself down is the inventiveness of the extra costs.I had a spa massage that cost me nearly $400 and a tea and biscuits in my room was $60. I do expect to pay high prices and really do not penny pinch but I will avoid this chain of hotels in the future.
user_name:
Gerald D
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I have already been to at least 10 hotels in the city and I can confirm this is the best option in town. Great location near the Lincoln Center. Easy subway access. Shops at Columbus Circle is an option for food, which includes Whole Foods.

The Mandarin always treats you like you're someone special and does a wonderful job making everything seem easy. They accommodated my every need and concierge even came to my room to help me zipMy business Dress and cut off loose threads. Above and beyond.

It's been my second trip to this place with in a span of 365 days.Explains why I like it. It's right in the middle of NY, City. You decide if you want to go straight/ Left/ Right and you still in the heart of the city.Great rooms overlooking the Central Park. Though you have the other Favourite hotel of mine, Trump Towers , blocking a bit of the view.But I love the Mandarin. More so , I love the views

Spent a couple of hours with friends on the 35th floor bar with the most fabulous view of NY. We ordered a chopped salad, a tuna appetizer, spiced edamame and the lamb chop appetizer. All were excellent and price worthy. Drinks were fine, Scotch, iced tea and pellugrino.

We had four good nights in this elegant hotel, and paid high Manhattan rates for the privilege. Service was always attentive, from the bellman to bar and restaurant wait staff, housekeeepers and doormen. The room, a standard $700 a night king, was cozy for the money. The bathroom was well laid out, with adequate counter space. Food and drinks were fine in the restaurants, again at premium but normal prices for the area. Fortunately the hotel is on the upper floors of an office tower, with indoor connecting corridors to a shopping mall on the lowest floors, where other restaurants are also easy to reach without going outside (this was a very cold January weekend). The hotel was convenient to Lincoln Center, which was the original reason for choosing it. Overall, we liked the quiet and refined atmosphere, with checkin, lobby, bar and restaurants off the street and 30-plus floors up. But we have grown accustomed to more space in the room for high rates; the service and atmosphere appear to be what drives rates in this neighborhood (CPW and CPS) c

we had a great stay at the mandarin oriental in new york! the rooms were equipet like you are used to mandarin oriental hotels worldwide, just outstanding! amazing views over the central park and the city from the rooms, bar and restaurant. superb location, close to everything. we definitely comme back!

Previously, we had stayed at the Mandarin Oriental hotel in Las Vegas. Again, we were pleased with our selection. Rooms are not large, as is typical for NYC. The bed was comfortable and towels and linens are excellent. We were upgraded to the top floor with a view of Central Park. The hotel is conveniently located on Columbus Circle. The staff and concierges are extremely helpful. They make every effort to ensure your comfort and convenience during your stay. The doorman will summon taxis to the front of the hotel. Also, there are always taxis waiting around the corner on Columbus Circle.We always had breakfast at the hotel in the Asiate restaurant. We ate our dinners at several of the many restaurants in the area. The hotel is on the upper floors of the Time-Warner building; the lowest four floors and sublevel are a shopping mall. Many of the shops and restaurants are higher end. My wife must use a walker; the staff was very accommodating in assisting with her needs.

Have been staying at The Peninsula the past 6 years... finally decided to stay at MO after never being completely satisfied at Peninsula. MO service and rooms were great. Will stay here from now on. Location in Columbus Circle, few minutes walk to the shops.

Still one of the nicer hotels in NYC, though I’ve seen it gradually decline over the last few years, as it appears to be catering much more to business meetings and groups lately, and it’s the individual guests who tend to suffer for that (less attention, slower service, more crowded common areas, etc.). Because of that, I don’t think the high prices are justified (base rooms can be around $1,000, base suites can average $2,500). For those prices, you would expect top notch service, and you just don’t see that any more at MONY, not consistently anyway. The Park Hyatt, which is newer, has better service, more updated rooms (high tech), and is less crowded – though you don’t get the views, but the prices are better and it’s a little closer to 5th Ave. The MONY updated some suites recently, mainly by putting in larger circular couches, which look very nice, but are less practical. Used to be very nice, top notch service, exclusive feel to it the first few years after it opened, but it’s lost some of that cachet. Still nice, just overpriced for what you get – but seems their target market now is the business traveler or those not concerned about getting top service and environment in exchange for top dollar.
user_name:
George J
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Mandarin Oriental has the best protocol for hotels. The way service is given and how people treat you is great. The best beds, room service is great, outstanding view, and comfort every where. I am always very happy to stay here.

I booked an overnight at the Mandarin Oriental for my husband's birthday. We arrived Saturday around 1:00 p.m., expecting to drop our bags and head out. Instead, we were given a wonderful room, overlooking the Hudson River and the Cruise Ship Terminal. The rooms are spacious, with high ceilings and luxurious furnishings. The bed is beautiful with magnificent linens. Breakfast (included in our package) was delicious. The gym is very nice with new equipment and very helpful staff. Everything about The Mandarin is best of kind. For a special, spare-no-expense celebration, this is the place you want to be.

I am quite a traveller and this hotel still surprised me in the concistancy of its service. The only issue is to get a reservation! Always full and no wonder. They keep good track of your visits and regular clients are protected. Do not miss to visit Asiate with incredible views and wonderful cooking. The spa also is a MUST. Bravo Team Mandarin

Amazing facilities and service. In the heart of Manhattan with great restaurants in the building or in the surrounding area, the theater district nearby and Central park on your doorstep. The staff is top notch meeting or exceeding any and all expectations.

Nothing beats the lobby lounge experience, the rooms are uniformly excellent and the location is great for both business and pleasure (on Central Park at Columbus Circle, subway right outside, theaters, museums, midtown, shopping, etc all within easy walking distance).
user_name:
christopher k
New York City, New York

review_body: We decided to try the Mandarin after we read some great reviews. We booked a Hudson River king room at a cost of $895.00. The room was well appointed and clean, it had a well stocked mini bar at a fee, large barroom and great bath products. The hotel is very nice and has several top end restaurants inside the building which is great for bad weather. Very nice place but we do not think it warranted $895.00 a night

Great hotel. The service and products they offer to the guests are just amazing. Great location - obviously located on the columbus circle / looking over central park. what not to like? I was actually coming down with some kind of flu when I was staying there so I asked if they could bring extra fridge to store my medication as well as a humidifier, they brought it to me straight away. When you are staying at a high-rise hotel, I absolutely hate slow lifts where I have to wait for 10 mins to go downstairs or vice versa. This is not the case in this hotel. The lift literally arrives within a min! Amazing room service. The food here in this hotel is just delicious so no need to go anywhere if you are feeling lazy in New York City. Room size is more than enough. Compare to some of the New York hotels, its actually massive!

This review does not need to be long. Our experience was perfect. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They took very good care of us. The hotel is beautiful and comfortable. The location is ridiculously convenient. Wonderful restaurants and shopping an elevator ride away from your room. World class spa. Obviously it is expensive for a hotel in the US. But for a hotel in Manhattan, walking distance from a long list of wonderful things? With this luxury? It is worth every penny. Highly recommended.

In simple terms the service is excellent, the operations are seamless and all the individuals are complete professionals. Whatever your needs the staff has the ability to deliver them in a timely manner. Lobby views are dramatic over Central Park and if one is awake the sunrise is even better.

Spent a few nights here as our usual choices such as Four Seasons were full owing to ongoing building work. It was disappointing on arrival at 5.15pm to be told the room was not ready. They did offer an immediate alternative, but as I had asked for a high floor and away from the elevator, the substitute was a low floor (albeit only by this hotel's standards) and right next to the elevator. We took it as we had been travelling for 12 hours. The hotel is fine, and bathrooms with a window are a real plus. Excellent housekeeping, but the lift lobbies and entrance are rather gloomy and too dark for daytime. Personally I find Columbus Circle too far west for my liking, but that's an entirely personal view. It does mean you tend to walk more often in Central Park, which is a bonus.

My wife and I spent a few nights on a 51st floor room facing out onto Central Park. Everything about the hotel is top class - the rooms, the lobby, the views, the staff - and, not surprisingly, the price of this hotel matches its quality. This is easily the nicest hotel I've stayed at in NYC. However. given its extremely high price, I was little put off in a few areas: paid Wifi, small set of towels in the bathroom, and disengaged staff on the entrance. If you want an one of a kind, extraordinary experience in the heart of NYC, I strongly recommend the Mandarin Oriental. If you are looking to balance your experience with your budget, you might want to look elsewhere.

Not the best mandarin oriental hotel. Service was very rude and the room wasn't as clean as you would expect for the money you pay per room. Location is the best walking distance to Broadway and Central Park.

You will need to book and have a head for heights.This Michelin Starred restaurant does not disappoint- whether you opt for the Prix Fixe, A la Carte or tasting menu you will savour superb food, imaginative presentation and taste bud tingling/salivating flavours. Friends said the steak tartare was the best ever tasted and they too are not strangers to restaurants of this ilk. Michel Roux being a personal friend. The Actic Char was magnificent too. The wine list as you would expect is extensive yet caters well for every budget unless that is you buy Liebfraumilch.Non residents are welcomed and the service friendly, informative and attentive albeit not in an intrusive way. Those wine drinkers out there will be pleased to know the glasses are kept topped up without the need to ask - often a frustration even in the best restaurants.So go on spoil yourself and that special someone, you must deserve it!

This was our second stay at the Mandarin Oriental at Columbus Circle. The location is excellent, close to all the beauty and buzz the Big Apple has to offer. Rooms have a gorgeous interior, stunning views of either Central Park or the Hudson River, and all the amenities you could ever need to make a place your "home away from home." The fun thing about the Mandarin Oriental New York is that it's attached to Time Warner Center, meaning you are just an elevator ride away from great shopping at all times. The staff at the hotel are kind, helpful and eager to meet your every need. Food options at the hotel restaurant are delightful, and the hotel bar is always worth a visit to catch up with dear friends or make new connections. On this occasion, we stayed over the Christmas period, which is an especially magical time to be there, with all the gorgeous decorations and special events at the hotel and surrounds. Regardless of when you choose to stay, the Mandarin Oriental New York will make for a memorable stay. It will always be one of our favorite hotels, worldwide.

Very nice place to finish the day in the big apple !Good food, very expensive... and a lovely view to the central park !Relaxing atmosphere and good music in an extraordinary location !Do not miss the experience !

Perfect services Great View Easy check-in Normal lightening in roomOld toilet services Long reach to room by setup two elavatorsGreat access to shopping mall and main street Good minibar Expensive to stay

A modern luxury hotel that makes you sleep very comfortable at night. Even during winter, I can still swim in their indoor heated pool, which is great. The pool is also equipped with a facility for people with disability. Very well thought and two thumbs up. Small attention to details like a basket of complimentary bananas and bottled water on the way out is a nice service. Little details like this is what earns a 5 star hotel an excellent service. The only unfortunate experience I had was, I left a suitcase full of interpreting equipment with the reception to be sent via FedEx. All forms are taken care of. But we had a glitch about this equipment, the vendor ended up not receiving it on time. The equipment suitcase is somewhat jumbled in the storing room, which was very unfortunate.

Incredible location and great views near Columbus Circle and Central Park. The rooms are new and tastefully decorated. The staff was very friendly and discrete. Great spa and fitness room. The bar/lounge has incredible views of Midtown Manhattan and Central Park. Highly recommended!

The staff is great and friendly. The housekeeping people are especially great. The standard rooms feel comfy and are a good size and the bathrooms are huge! Loved the large rain shower head and the water pressure is really good for a hotel and for being so high up. We had a few out to the Hudson, most people would probably prefer the view of the Park, but we liked looking across to the other buildings and watching the sunset behind the river. The beds are really comfy and the mattress can get pretty hot. The pillows aren't the comfiest though. It would be great to have a bit of minibar space to store your own food and drinks, rather than just all drinks you can pay for and a coffee plunger in the room would also be appreciated. All and all a great stay though.

I think this hotel is better for business travel than leisure based on my own experience. I had a great massage at the spa, but found it strange that most guests were talking inside the spa area. The gym is really nice (as expected) but I found it strange that guests were talking loudly on their phones while others were getting a workout at a luxury hotel. The location is good if you want to be centrally located in NYC or close to Central Park. I love Mandarin Oriental properties, but I don't think I would stay at this property again when there are so many other great choices in NYC.

Asiate serves an all time favorite hotel breakfast. The rooms are quiet and the staff friendly but not overly intrusive. I never have trouble getting a treadmill in the fitness room. Hard to beat the location. My current favorite New York hotel.

This place is an absolute gem. I cannot say enough about the location, the views, and the staff. I was here for my sisters wedding (we had it on the property) on May 2nd, 2015 and it was just stunning.
user_name:
ArielleC
New York City, New York

review_body: Well, this should have been great but it sooo wasn't.On arrival, the bed had long black hairs under the covers which presumably came from the maids, on moving rooms, the surfaces in the bathroom and on the bedside uunits were dirty. They hadn't been cleaned and still had ring marks from the previous guests.The decor of the rooms was beige and tired. I have been to the Mandarin in Vegas which is fabulous but this wasn't anything like that.This is a very expensive hotel but it really isn't worth it.The one good plus point was the eggs benedict in the restaurant was the best ever but it they took sooooo long to prepare. So long that I was on the verge off walking out. So, the hotel can't get its act together to make breakfast on time or clean a room properly, so, I'm sorry but I'd recommend you go somewhere else.

The staff at any Mandarin Oriental hotel is always superb and this location was no exception.Get a drink at the bar/lounge while taking in the view of midtown Manhattan/Central Park.Drinks can get pricey, but this is a luxury hotel so that should be expected.
user_name:
T767TUrobertb
New York City, New York

review_body: If the hotel was not a little tired in places, it would receive 5/5. The most impressive factor is the level of customer service encountered every step of the way. The staff is the credit to the hotel, not the physical environment, which needs improving in places. Overall, a very good experience, very close to excellent.

I had the pleasure to visit the hotel as part of the #aligamwedding reception on Nov 2015. We spend a lot of time in the hotel bc we had a lot of pictures to be taken on the rooftop and everyone from the staff was great. By the time the reception started, everything was presented in a way that you felt like royalty. For the cocktail hour they had so many different yummy appetizers that you were almost full before going to the main event (for us it was ok...because my family are all foodies and we were hungry :).When we got to the main room, the decor and the space for the wedding was amazing, the chef menu was great and everything was delicious. The only thing that I didn't like it was that the tables were set with too many glassware. It look like a mess. I had to ask the waiter to clear a couple of the wine/water glasses in order to see the table more clearly.The bride and groom stay at the hotel with my family and the rooms were very elegant.I may have to say that this hotel is so great and beautiful. From the location, service, the views to the city...just amazing. I hope I get the opportunity to visit again soon.

I stayed here in mid 2014 for 3 nights in the premier Central Park view room. In my view, this hotel is the most luxurious in NYC. It's in a great location - I could walk to Times Square, opposite to Central Park and about a 20 minute walk to Madison and fifth avenue. My room was what I expected from MO - beautiful decor, clean and perfect views of Central Park. The bathroom was not large but it was still a fairly decent size. I've noticed a reviews have said that they have stayed at more luxurious hotels in NYC - I am curious to know what these - I personally have not come across a more luxurious hotel in the city.In terms of service at the hotel - the doormen, porters, concierge, housekeeping and room service staff provided exceptional service. Front desk/check in staff were not bad or unfriendly by any means but I have had more pleasant/friendlier check in service at other 5 star hotels. My biggest suggestion for improvement is for some of the wait staff at the hotel's lobby lounge. Some of the staff at the lobby lounge were great. However, on at least three occasions during my stay I had to wait a long time for my order to be taken at the lobby lounge - there were instances where staff were standing near the counter but for some reason did not come and take my order - that was quite disappointing and I actually had to call a waiter over for my order to be taken after I waited for so long - not the service you expect from a 5 star hotel.Overall I had a great experience at the hotel and thought it was a beautiful venue.

Stayed here recently for 2 nights - business. Room was decent size by NYC standards. A bit of a problem with the way the room was laid out in that the bed was positioned a little awkwardly. Service was excellent, but my requirements were pretty basic. My biggest complaint with these 4* hotels is that you have to pay for wifi. I have said this many times, but I will repeat: Why can I get free wifi at a fast food joint. Obviously if you can afford to pay $600 or more a night you can afford whatever for the wifi, but I don't like being nickel and dimed.
