Keep your morning newspaper, give me free wifi.I got an email from them shortly after my trip asking for a review. The questions kept repeating "is this the best hotel/experience/etc. in NYC?". I had to disappoint them in saying no it is not the best hotel or experience in NYC, but it was very nice.

This is by far the best spa in all of New York and rivals many worldwide. I always relax in a way that I do not at other spas. Have never had even a mediocre massage here. They have all been outstanding and 50 min is never enough. Always always always book an 80 minute.

I did not stay at this hotel as a guest but had a pleasure of attending an event there on the top floor. My review is of the food and it was average. For a luxury hotel of this magnitude I was truly expecting outstanding dinner but did not receive it..

Location is my favorite, the room view to central park not to be underestimated, service is impeccable, spa and pool divine, dinner and drinks area at the bar with fantastic views. Its a very pleasant atmosphere for business and pleasure.
user_name:
Nomadicaustrian
New York City, New York

review_body: Terrible bell hop service. Took 3 phone calls to front desk and 90 minutes to get our bags delivered to our room. First we were told they were on their way, then we we're told they were delivered. Then we were told the elevator was broken! Breakfast buffet in the lobby is slim pickings. Stale bagels with no jelly or marmalade. Cheap boxed cereals, no Greek yoghurt. No meats or cheeses. Breakfast cost $100 for 2 people! Another customer was likewise complaining about the quality.

We have stayed at different Mandarin Oriental hotels over the world and especially after the amazing experience in Barcelona, we decided to stay at the Mandarin Oriental New York. We had reservations at the Baccarat hotel, however this was after the big snow storm and wanted to have Central Park views.We booked through Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts, which usually provides for room upgrades, early check in/check out and other amenities if available.The staff at check in was wonderful. They didn't have any upgrades available and our room was not available when we checked in around 10:30 am, we had booked a Premier Central Park view room. We were offered another room with less direct views, but we preferred to wait for our room. When we checked in they told us our room was in process of getting ready, so we decided to wait at the Lobby lounge and have some tea. We waited there as we thought it would not take more than 30 minutes, but we kept checking every 30-45 minutes and the room still was not ready. We had a show at 2 pm, so we decided to leave at 1:45 pm without changing or being able to go to the room as it was no ready yet. We didn't have a problem if our room was not ready as regular check in is at 3 pm, but when we are told that our room is getting ready, we don't expect over 3 hour wait as we could have gone somewhere else.We went to see the show and came back around 5:30 pm and then we checked in the room. The views are great of Central Park. The room is small and the bathroom seems a little bit outdated for a Mandarin Oriental, but overall was a nice room.When we came back from dinner at o Ya, we had champagne and a birthday cake in the room, which was a nice touch.The lap pool has great views of Hudson River and it has a great size for a lap pool, the water temperature was freezing cold though. We had breakfast at the Asiate restaurant, the views and the food were amazing.Overall the hotel is great, small rooms and maybe not as attentive as other Mandarin Oriental properties, however we did enjoy our stay.

We stayed here for week over Christmas but I've been a bit tardy with getting a review posted. In short we had a fantastic time. The location is simply epic and even if you need to go further afield you're on top of a major subway stop so it's super easy. By being on top of the Columbus Circle shopping centre too you're close to some great shops and all to a Whole Foods which is really handy if you're feeling like some basic, healthy food - in fact we ate here a couple of nights!The staff were 100% friendly and attentive for our entire stay. Even when I was wide awake at 5am on our first morning and in the pool the minute it opened (6am IIRC) I was greeted politely and professionally. Room service staff, house keeping, concierge and anybody else we encountered were all so friendly.Our room was incredible with great views toward the Hudson. The bed was firm but comfortable (how I'd choose it anyway) and the bathroom very spacious and perfectly equipped. The only one thing we wished there was (and maybe this is a British thing) is the facility to make hot drinks in your room - but it certainly wasn't the end of the world as if you go down to Asiate and ask there you can get a takeaway hot drink for which the hotel makes no charge.And now for my only negative point - the reception area lounge. Unfortunately you never feel like you can just walk in here as a hotel guest, sit down and read a book, or look out the window, or just relax - there always seems to be slight pressure to eat/drink something. This is a shame because it's the only lounge in the hotel so there's nowhere else to go. What also sours the experience is that a coffee is $8 and a Coke is $9 which, quite frankly, is just taking the p***! I know it's the Mandarin. I know it's an expensive hotel and I know this is what happens - but it just feels like I'm having my pants pulled down!This aside it's an incredible hotel and we'd certainly return. We truly felt valued and when you're staying at a hotel at this price point that's important.

Located in the Time Warner building, this is actually more inconvenient then convenient, as you have to travel to the 35th hotel just to get to the lobby -- which is nice, if a bit glitzy. The service was very good, but no better than one would expect of a hotel at this echelon. My room, on the other hand, was smaller than those of other comparable NYC hotels at which I've stayed. The bathroom was a good size, but was literally a third the size of the room. It didn't help that my room was located in a spot where I could hear what sounded like the elevator. Worse, although on the 52nd floor, the soundproofing wasn't so good, as I could hear a lot more street noise than from the 4th floor of a competitor property that shall go unnamed. It did have an xcellent lap pool. Maybe the last high end hotel to charge for WiFi. There are better choices in this price range.

I stayed in a very expensive suite for what was supposed to be a special treat for my wife, daughter, and mother. Unfortunately, the stay was a big letdown. The property itself is lovely (nice rooms, nice views, etc). But, I found the service to be quite lacking (far less than what I have experienced at 150 dollar a night Marriotts). What the staff seems to be best at is apologizing. And while I would constantly hear "I am sorry", I never had the feeling that anyone really meant it (I have a strong hunch that "I am sorry" is just MO NYC's way of telling unhappy guests to stop complaining). What particularly bothers me is when hotel managers respond to a complaint by handing out a business card and saying "call me next time you stay here." Nothing about such an offer feels genuine to me (and it certainly does nothing to fix the current stay). Nonetheless, this tactic seems to be a favorite among managers at MO NYC and I now have several manager business cards as souvenirs of this unfortunate experience. And, despite the many offers I received to make future stays better, no one seemed to be able to do anything to help me on this one. The over 2000 dollar a night suite I booked had a broken television (it was eventually fixed but it took too long and the repair person had to be in and out of our room during our dinner). Our 200 dollar room service meal took over an hour to be delivered (despite a promise it would be up "right away") and my hamburger was burnt. I found the lobby and elevators to be noisy and crowded (not at all exclusive feeling). And, a very loud alarm was ringing in the wee hours of the morning right outside my room. The alarm kept me wide awake until 4AM (and the night staff could not figure out how to turn it off--- but they sure knew how to apologize). Lots of other things bothered me, but most of all I just found the staff to be rude (yet in a very passive aggressive sort of way). In addition, many of them seemed to be very inexperienced and/or bumbling. I have a feeling this hotel has outlived its glory and is now riding on its name and location. For the money, I believe one can do much better in NYC. I won't be returning. Nonetheless, I have a hunch a manager will be responding to this review saying how sorry he/she is and offering to have me contact him/her on my next visit. To that manger, I say no thanks. Apologies (and future offers) not accepted.

I was in NYC on the recent sub-zero-degree weekend and was looking for some indoor activities. A friend suggested finding a restaurant with a view instead of doing an outdoor observation deck and we ended up at the Mandarin's bar/restaurant having high tea. It was $50 per person, which I think is a typical price for tea even though I know that's ridiculous. The view was fabulous and we were able to relax there for several hours. Worth it.

This hotel is my favourite in midtown - the only downside is it is never cheap!The hotel is modern oriental luxury. The rooms feel new and tastefully decorated. I had a fantastic view over Central Park!I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough!

Outdated, and bad service, high demand hotel. It used to be my favorite hotel in NYC, NOT ANYMORE.I recommend plenty of other options available for lesser price, Location is outstanding, one of my favorites, such a shame the started believing the were the best....

Truly the best 5 star hotel in NY compared to others (The Plaza, St Regis & Peninsula). Rooms are luxuriously outfitted, maintained extremely well and impeccably clean. Does not have an "old and tired" feel compared to many other 5 star hotels in NY. Concierge staff - Carlos, Joel, Kenny & Daniel really go above and beyond to be of assistance with your needs as well as all the other staff in the hotel from the valet, bell boys and the reception staff. Location is also fantastic! This is our third long stay and we will continue to select Mandarin Oriental whenever we come to NY!

For the price you pay, you would expect luxurious service and accommodations. This is not the case at all. The staff is standoffish and acts as if they are doing you a favor by working there. The rooms are very uncomfortable -- the beds are rock hard and the windows are thin, allowing much noise even on the highest floors. They usually book 2-3 events at the hotel per night, and this takes the priority. Events are exclusively what this hotel should be used for. There are many better options in NYC.
user_name:
P8582EMjasons
New York City, New York

review_body: I had the opportunity to stay at the Mandarin Oriental for a team building event that my company was holding. I was in charge of handling all of the logistics and the Mandarin Oriental could not have made my job any easier. Their hospitality was amazing. The were able to give us a great room block rate and we were all treated like VIP guests. Those at the front desk were friendly and got us checked in quickly and efficiently. The sleeping rooms are beautiful again with great views. The turn down service is also a very special treat.Our meeting room space for our actual team building was great with large windows over looking the city. The food for the two day meetings was also really good.I could not have asked for more.

Great location, great service, fantasic rooms. In town for a wedding. Problems at hotel 1. M.O. made room for us and made us feel welcome. Made sure room was ready to go. Facilities are tremendous. I recommend enthusiastically for leisure travel.

Cannot be beaten on anything. The staff were fantastic right from the beginning.Food and beverages were the best quality both at breakfast and dinner.Regardless of you breakfast choices they were sure to fill you up well past lunch time!Superb quality and great views from the entire hotel.

5 star hotel with great Central Park views and a nice midtown location. Excellent service and facilities. Amazing staff that responds to your every request. The park view rooms and suites are very nice. Suites have Toto Neorest toilets that are incredible. You will want one in your home. I highly recommend this hotel if you want a midtown location on Central Park.

We stayed here for one night. The Mandarin chain of hotels makes its name on effortless service, which was on display during our stay. Attention to detail was very much in effect (my wife even noticed that the fingernails of our front desk hosts were all very well manicured). The furnishings in the room are starting to show some serious age with chips and bumps, which is not unexpected at this point. However, the room is still elegant in an understated style and because the layouts are designed well, the wear has not affected the overall effect.We had afternoon tea at the lobby lounge which was excellent, and the room service Japanese breakfast was surprisingly good, approaching in quality to what we've had before in Tokyo.The only downside was that our shower handle broke off while trying to maneuver it back into place after a shower. Although this wasn't a practical issue due to the presence of a rainshower, the staff were unable to replace it on a Sunday but quickly offered to cover one of the charges on our bill due to the inconvenience.We have been a fan of the Mandarin hotel chain for a while, primarily for their excellent service, and this stay didn't disappoint. That said, this is one of the most expensive hotels in New York and quality hotels can be found for much less, but one generally does not stay at this hotel for the value.

We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for a romantic weekend, and it exceeded all expectations. This was a treat for us, we rarely ever stay in a place that's this fancy, but I felt pretty A-list while I was here. The service was warm, helpful, and accommodating, and the hotel itself was spectacular. Our park view room had amazing views from the 43rd floor and was very spacious. The ceilings were high, everything was very clean, and there were lots of amenities, like bath salts and a welcome tea service. I had mentioned the special occasion in my reservation note and shortly after we arrived the hotel brought us a complimentary bottle of champagne to celebrate, with some chocolate covered strawberries. We took advantage of the hotel lounge, which could have had better service and drinks, but was still a fun experience thanks to the views and the great waitstaff. I used the gym this morning and it was pretty much deserted, but still very clean, with great views of the city and lots of modern, high-end equipment. We didn't take advantage of the spa while we were here, but it's one of my wife's favorite splurges in the city so highly recommended. All in all a tremendously positive experience - we can't wait to stay again!
user_name:
Ben K
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is beyond stunning. From the doorman to the concierge desk every employee you run across is nothing but pleasant. I always love the chosen decor; MO's have a simple beauty about them that sucks you into the tiny details.Our room was a premiere central park view and per my request they gave me the best view possible for my first ever trip to NYC. And the bathroom! The soak tub with bath crystals was my new best friend after being on our feet walking all day! So relaxing and a great way to end the day. The makeup mirror and the TV were thoughtful extras that were well appreciated. When we arrived they had a lovely bottle of Pinot Noir waiting as well as a beautiful tray of macaroons, sweets, and a chocolate Statue of Liberty and NY skyline. SO CUTE! My husband and I have tattoos and dress more "urban" so sometimes we are judged by our appearance. This did not interfere with the fact that every employee was extremely helpful, kind, and knowledgeable to us. The only downfall, unfortunately, is that our appearance seemed to throw off some of the other guests visiting (to the point they would not ride the elevator with us!). However, we tried to let our manners speak for themselves; Can't win them all! Big thanks to your staff yet again. They gave us an amazing experience! Danielle (Daniella?) at the check-in desk was welcoming, pleasant and accommodating beyond measure! Can't wait to see what the other MO's have to offer :)

We just returned from a four night stay over February break. My husband, 16 year old daughter and I went to celebrate her birthday. I picked the hotel for the location; we had plans to go to the ballet (Lincoln Center), Le Bernadin, a taping of The Chew and two Broadway shows. We also planned on touring the American Museum of Natural History and the 9/11 Museum. Everything except the 9/11 Museum was within a mile. Check in was very smooth, our bags were brought up immediately by a very personable bellhop. We had a lovely breakfast daily in the hotel restaurant and enjoyed lunch on our arrival day in the lobby restaurant. The hotel sent up a dessert for our daughter to commemorate the occasion. All great things. But . . . for about $1000 a night (we enjoyed a stay two nights, get the third night free special), I wanted to FEEL more and I can't say that I did. My family is partial to the Four Seasons, service and decor. Maybe it was the Asian decor that we didn't connect with. In some ways, it was just as boring as what we often say about Ritz Carlton decor - you could be in any place and a Ritz is a Ritz and in the same way, a Mandarin just be a Mandarin. The Four Seasons tends to make us feel like we are wherever we are, immersing us in the local experience. So would I stay here again - maybe. The location cannot be beat. But next time we visit NYC, I may venture to the east side of the park and stay at the Four Seasons or even head downtown and try the Langham. I just feel like I shouldn't feel like I do for all the money that was spent.

Stayed here for three nights with a group of 12. Rooms not huge but you don't expect that in New York. Decor a good mix of Asian fused with Art Deco with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the park. Only thing lacking in the room was a kettle or coffee machine but when I asked I was promptly given one. Otherwise everything perfect. The staff were extremely helpful, particularly Cathy on reception and the concierge who sorted out our problem of lost theatre tickets. The reception is on the 35th floor with stunning views of the park. The seated bar there can be busy with non hotel visitors but they do tend to keep seats for hotel guests.Good shopping mall downstairs with a Whole Foods etc. Highly recommended.

We stayed here for 6 nights in premier central park view room for our paper wedding.Everything is simply awesome! I have to admit that the room size is not really that big , no heated floor , no washlet, and no iPod interactive system in room and bathroom (only bluetooth player). But nothing is more than perfect to sit by the window with the iconic, luxury central park view. You can feel the vitality of NY and imagine all the NY fantasy in your dream.And don't worry , it's easy to ignore the trump hotel!Besides, the staff are the stars !They are exceptionally lovely and nothing is too much trouble. They really do make you feel very special. The location itself is so perfect. Many hot spots are within walking distance and you also can get anywhere in NY from the columbus circle subway station. Don't forget the whole foods market at the basement of the building which stay open late.Anyway, thanks to everyone and everything to make my anniversary so special and memorable . I know its not cheap. But it's manhattan. Do pamper yourself at this city oasis. You won't be disappointed! Definitely return!!

My darling and I had a lovely hour or so overlooking Columbus Circle. We had delicious, well-concocted cocktails, Korean seafood pancakes while snuggling on a couch. The atmosphere and service was exemplary. I recommend and would return!

My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 4 nights this week to enjoy the city a little. Around halfway through the trip, my nose began running uncontrollably and I thought I was getting sick. It was misery. When we were checking out, my wife noticed someone with dogs heading into the elevator and asked if dogs were frequently at the hotel. "Oh yes, we're very pet friendly" was the response. Ulp! No warning of that was made at any time when we booked or checked in. I left the hotel, changed my shirt and the symptoms promptly disappeared. I don't mind if a hotel wants to be pet friendly, but they should put a big notice on the booking page so that allergic people are warned.

We checked in for our second Christmas time stay at the Mandarin and this time we got a west facing room with a spectacular view of the Hudson River. The bathroom was as usual huge with two entrance doors. We both loved the rain shower head in the shower and the tub had a view out the window towards the Hudson. The front desk was its usual helpful self on check in and check out. We had to avail ourselves of the wonderful restaurant in the hotel when the restaurant we had a reservation at emailed us telling of kitchen problems. The Oriental's Asiate restaurant accommodated us on Christmas eve and we enjoyed a wonderful meal both in term of food quality but also in the quality of the service. As usual the Mandarin's location puts you in close proximity to Central Park and the Christmas stalls. Also the many Upper West Side restaurants are and enjoyable walk up Broadway. The Museum of Natural History is a short subway ride north and for those intrepid hikers the MET is a nice but extended walk through Central Park.
user_name:
edward w
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Flawless. Spent 3 nights at hotel. Attentive, professional and helpful staff across the board. Great Spa, nice business center. Concierge attentive and kind. I have only good things to say about this hotel and highly recommend it!

An excellent location, fabulous staff and the best of luxury. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave the staff makes you feel welcome and royal. A great hotel. Valentine's Day weekend was busy, of course and the hotel was full. Still it never felt crowded and no one ever seemed harried. We booked too late to make a reservation in the dining room, given the special occasion, but had wonderful room service which was far more intimate. The spa is fantastic and is one of my wife's favorite. A must if you are a guest or just traveling to NYC. The room is very luxurious and the amenities are fabulous. We had a view of Central Park and as the weekend was one of the coldest in history, enjoyed watching the park from the comfort of our warm room.We highly recommend the Mandarin Oriental and look forward to a return.

This is probably my tenth stay at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC and I have never been disappointed. From the check in to check out with room service and housekeeping in between the service has always been quick, helpful, and courteous. The quality of the rooms have always been first rate and the meeting areas, lounge, and dining areas are top notch. The bonus of being right on the park and part of a shopping complex that includes dozens of shops, restaurants, and even a Whole Foods is unbeatable.

I stayed at the Mandarin for 2 nights in early February 2016. Quite easily one of the best Hotels I have stayed at . Looked after very well from the moment i checked in . I was given a great room overlooking the Park . Asiate is great for breakfast with views over Central Park, a perfect start to the day. The service is slick , genuienly friendly and no request is too big !! A big thank you to Julien Gardin at Mandarin NYC for making my stay exceptional...

The Mandarin Oriental was hands down one of the nicest hotels in the in the area. Service was impeccable and staff was genuinely friendly and unobtrusive. The room was very roomy and tastefully decorated. Colors were very soothing. The room over looked the Hudson River and took advantage of the sunset. In the wintertime Central Park looks dreary as the trees are bare so the river view is better. The shower was refreshing and the tub over look the cityscape. Turn down service was terrific. They made sure that they provided the service even when the guests went out later in the evening. They made sure everything was refreshed and straightened up and provide water and chocolate by the bedside and the slippers were placed by the foot of the bed. They provide novels for bedtime reading and really high quality spa robes in the room. Highly recommend this hotel.

The stay starts before you arrive! Every request we had was accommodated. Our room was ready early so they allowed for an early check in. The front desk staff couldn't have been more welcoming. The lobby is amazing with a perfect view of central park during the day and night. I attached some day pictures of our arrival into the room. The bathroom had a separate soaking tub, separate shower and my favorite separate toilet. Beautifully appointed marble throughout and a TV next to the sink. The bed was ultra comfortable with great linens and an oversized flat panel HDTV. The pool was the perfect temperature and the spa was second to none, pricey, but second to none!Only complaint is that are stay was so short!
user_name:
mblit
New York City, New York

review_body: I was so happy that we have changed hotel to MO NY for last night of my gateway weekend. This hotel is right by Central Park and connected to the Jazz at Lincoln center. It was super cold on the day of check in, and the doorman Gabriel was welcoming us with a very warm smile right when we got off the taxi. Once checked in the staff showed us to the room, the bellman sent our bags up within few mins and took the time to recommended things to do around the area. The view of the room that I stated in was facing the Hudson River which was perfect to watch the sunset. Everyone in the hotel were so nice and helpful. The concierge gave us some great tips on how to get good seats and good price for the Broadway show...If I go back to NYC next time, I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

We stayed at the MO for three nights this past weekend, early February 2016. All in all I would rate the hotel highly, we had a lovely room with views of Central Park from the 49th floor. The room was not huge but with the picture windows spanning the entire length and height of the wall overlooking the park made the size of the room less important. The bathroom was a decent size with very nice products, and a separate toilet cubicle which is always a nice feature. As we stayed through Centurion FHR program we had breakfast included which was fabulous by the time we figured out our perfect order of the healthy breakfast to share along with one shared order of Salmon Eggs Benedict which were perfectly cooked. The only two issues I had were one with the restaurant- we ate at Asiate on our second nights there and had the tasting menu which was delicious. However the wait staff were determined with each course to clear my dining companions three plates while I was still eating. On two occasions I was still chewing when they removed my plate as I was the slowest in our party of four. This is very basic fine dining etiquette to my mind.... to not clear any plates from a table until all members of the party have finished the course. Similarly at breakfast, if I am not in a diner, don't pour more coffee into my cup until I have finished the cup I am drinking. Apart from that the food was delicious and the service competent and friendly. The second issue was the lack of turn down service which was not provided on our last night after asking the housekeeper to return once we had gone out. She never did.To be fair, on check out the reception person called the manager who had expressed his interest in addressing the turndown issue when we checked out. He was very charming and appeared interested in addressing both of our issues.How does the MO compare with the Plaza, the Pierre, Four Seasons, The London where we have stayed in the past two years, all on short weekend trips to NYC? Very well and we hope to have a repeat stay in the not too distant future. Only real complaint is that when I tried to buy some of the amazing hand cream they had in the lobby bathrooms, the spa and gift shop were all out of stock. They should keep more in stock so that we could take a little bit of the MO home with us!!

I try to go to an Afternoon Tea in any city I go to and the Mandarin Oriental takes the cake. It was my mother's birthday and they organised for a beautiful window overlooking central parl. The service was great, food was delicious and it's something we will all remember for a very long time. If you're a fan of Afternoon Tea, or even if you're not - put the Mandarin Oriental on your list.

One of our goto hotels when we stop over in Manhattan. The lobby on the 35th floor has a great view overlooking Central Park and Columbus circle. Most rooms have a really nice view of the city from high above. The pool and fitness are a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle outside. On our last visit there was a stale smell in the room as well as the smell of smoke.

Mandarin Oriental is just wonderful. We were here in January during the great blizzard Jonas! All of the staff are just amazing, The rooms are cozy with great views, very clean and the bathrooms are a nice size, . Great connection to the shopping center and restaurants. We ate at the Asiate one of the nights and we were very pleased. Restaurant staff and manager were sooo great! Spa treatments were also very good. Thank you for a great stay.

Superb location, great staff, outstanding restaurant and the best concierge team in NYC. We were smitten by this property which is leagues above some of the other Mandarin properties we have stayed and for us, one if the best hotels in NYC.

It's been two years since I've stayed at The Mandarin, but this January it was like returning to a group of friends. The Mandarin isn't about flashy rooms...crazy fun furniture...or a fun club scene. It's simply a great place to get a great night of sleep.The consistency comes from the staff. No matter what you need...they'll take care of it. And quickly.Plus you can't beat the location. There are lots of luxury properties in NYC. In our case, we've settled on The Mandarin as our base there. When the price is right...that's where you'll find us.

The Mandarin Oriental New York is gorgeous and enjoys a wonderful and highly trained staff. The rooms are a bit on the small side but they do enjoy very generous bathrooms, superbly equipped. The lobby lounge on the 35th floor is a terrific gathering spot to enjoy cocktails and light fare overlooking Central Park and the Hudson River.

Our four night stay at the Mandarin turned into a six night stay thanks to winter storm Jonas and the nearly 27 inches of snow he delivered. THANK YOU, Jonas. I cannot imagine a place I'd rather be "stuck" than the Mandarin Oriental. The beautiful facilities, great food and incredible staff kept us in a state of peaceful bliss. No doubt about it, our stay was perfect.

I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for exceptional service. The rooms were clean and the service was wonderful. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel for those of you who want to be treated very well.

You can't fault the staff and service at the Mandarin, the hotel is just SO out of date in compairison to the many other great 5 star hotels in NYC. From the Soho House to the Baccarat, there are many other hotels that offer luxury in far more detail than the Mandarin. It felt to me like the Mandarin is trading off of it's view's, when you're spending over a $1000 per night, you expect more. I felt trapped in the 90's!

My wife was celebrating a significant birthday. We stayed for a couple of nights. The standard of service we received was excellent from start to finish. We arrived quite early but Brian on reception quickly found us a great room overlooking the Hudson and could not have been more attentive. Later in the day complimentary champagne and strawberries dipped in chocolate arrived in our room. Throughout our stay every member of staff was unfailingly helpful. Breakfast in the Asiate restaurant was really good and we had a wonderful view over Central Park. We will definitely return.

We celebrated my husband's birthday last weekend. The staff were all very helpful in arranging the cocktail hour by the large picture window in the lounge for 8, followed by dinner in the restaurant's private dining room (suggested by the manager). Both worked out perfectly. I had spent the day at L'Ecole Valrhona in a baking class, and our waiter was kind enough to take what I had made and plate it up beautifully for our guests. My only complaint was he heaviness of the bathroom doors in our room. They are very tall heavy pocket doors and we had a hard time opening them.

Lunch at the Lobby Lounge at the Mandarin Oriental is unique with a spectacular view of the city skyline. The food doesn't taste as good as it looks. :(The presentation is good, the service is good, but the food is just okay.

Stayed here for NYE and loved every minute of it. This hotel certainly surpassed my expectations. Great location and high up so you get fabulous views no matter where you are. Rooms were smaller than i expected but nevertheless gorgeous. The bathroom and vanity area is stunning. Staff were great and extremely pleasant and helpful. Will certainly be back.

I could go on and on about this hotel, but I'll just say if you're not interested in seeing the rest of NY, then book your stay here because you won't want to leave your room. I came for a company event, but left early to enjoy my accommodations.

Stayed here this past Friday with my wife and it was pretty spectacular. We had the premiere Central Park suite and the views were stunning as you would expect. We were told that these rooms were recently renovated and it showed. Loved the hardwood floors instead of carpeting which is the usual, seemed to be cleaner as a result. Great furniture, tv's (even one in the bathroom mirror), and just the overall feel of the suite, very New York. Didn't use any of the offered amenities so I can't speak to those but the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Hopefully my wife and I can make it back in the near future, preferably during the fall when the Central Park view must be amazing.

Pretty amazing place to stay for our first visit to NYC. Saw a few famous people and stayed in a beautiful room. The location is right by Central Park and just off Broadway, we were able to walk or ride the subway to every place we wanted to see. I don't know how you old find a nicer place or a more perfect location.

Everything about Mandarin Oriental went perfectly.The door men were courteous and attentive. Cathy the young lady who brought us to our room was focused on our needs and questions. She was also the one who checked us in at the front desk. It is help like that that makes the stay turn out so well. The bellman also was helpful. The view out of the windows was fantastic!I would recommend staying in The Mandarin Oriental without hesitation.

Truly a five star experience. The hotel staff are the upmost friendliest people, plus the rooms are incredibly spacious and clean (especially the bathroom!) with a wonderful view of Central Park (make sure you ask for the room facing it).The food is exquisite, particularly their restaurant on the 35th floor called "Asíate". You really do get what you pay for!
user_name:
Coco P
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband surprised me with a one-night stay at the Mandarin Oriental over the Christmas Holidays so that we could see a Broadway play (we were easily able to walk back to hotel after the play because of the mild weather). We had a standard room but it was on the top floor facing the Hudson River. The view was breathtaking both from the actual room and also from the bathroom (one could lounge in the big tub with the City of New York twinkling underneath!). The room was small but well-appointed and comfortable. The service was impeccable and I would definitely stay here again despite the nightly room rate being on the exorbitant side. I think it is well worth the cost given the experience, even if it's just for one night!

Six of us thought we'd treat ourselves to afternoon tea, but it was a massive disappointment. They didn't appear to have enough staff working or keep track of the tables. Our table wasn't ready so we were asked to wait ten minutes, and after fifteen we went back to the manager to ask if we could sit down and they had forgotten to come and get us. They had only put out five seats and suggested two of us squished into one, but we asked for another seat... We ordered champagne and tea and although the the tea came immediately the food was another 45 minutes - and we had to ask them where it was! The tea was cold/finished by then. The servers couldn't fit everything onto the table and there was lots of crashing around and putting things on the window ledge. I also asked for more milk and it never came, which is a small thing but important when drinking tea! Our overall impression was that this was a tourist trap-type activity without the excellent service and class the Mandarin is known for. Don't go!

It's hard to add something meaningful to the other reviews; the views are what sets this hotel apart even from most other five star hotels in NY. It's already 12 years old but feels still very modern. The staff is nice, the food at Asiate offers good Asian fusion cuisine. Personally I would pick a different place for a fanfic weekend but highly recommend it for business trips.

I had the pleasure of visiting the Mandarin Oriental a few days after New Years (infamously hotels' slow period) and I am happy to report the hotel was at the top of their game. For years, my husband and I, who live in the West Village, have stayed at a hotel in the city for a night to celebrate his birthday.The hotel itself is obviously beautiful. The bar located in the lobby has one the most breathtaking and unique views in the city, but as impressive as the property is, the service is equally amazing. From the moment I gave the doorman our keys to valet our car (a very unique service for an NYC hotel) I felt pampered and looked after. Every staff member I encountered was cheerful and genuinely helpful. (Example: We called for the car at the end of our stay. After hanging up, a gentleman called us back and apologized that he hadn't asked if we needed help with our bags.) The service was pampering without being obtrusive.The suite we stayed in was amazing. Located on a corner of the 42nd floor, we had unbelievable views of the park and the river. The electronic shades kept the light and noise of city out, till we were ready to face our day in the morning. The decor was gorgeous with perfectly placed furniture and televisions to make relaxation and comfort seamless. The bathroom was my favorite room and probably the best one I've ever been in. The full service toilet that heats, cleans and dries was out of this world, as was the amazing rain shower head and tub that overlooks the city.Another huge highlight at the Mandarin Oriental was the room service. I'm always surprised how mediocre the room service can be at many luxury hotels. Well not here. The food was brought quickly, presented beautifully and most important was over the top delicious. We had severally Asian selections for dinner (including the tuna tartare-- which was one the most inventive and tasty interpretations of the dish I've ever experienced) and everything was on point. The meal was expensive--as all room service in NYC hotels is-- but the meal was one of the best I've had in months and definitely on par with the top rated restaurants in the city. Breakfast was equally impressive and delicious.I'd definitely recommend this hotel for a Staycation (for my fellow NYers) as well as for visitors to the city. Is it pricey? Absolutely. Even for New York. But, you won't be disappointed in this indulgence.

I think y'all are amazing wonderful people and my helper was very gorgeous young man this is such an amazing place I live it so much but the chicken was cold and so was the rest of my meal buuuut they did give me $600 to spend on Souvenirs and I love the manager he is pretty so yeah swag money yolo❤️❤️

Traveling from London we thought it would be nice to enjoy afternoon tea in nyc. Whilst the view was good (we asked to me moved to a table that had good views over the park and upper east side) the afternoon tea was very disappointing and no way 5*. Two mini sconces- four tiny savouries and some mini patisseries accompanied by one pot of tea that was not replenished. In England afternoon tea comes with a selection of savouries and they are replenished at your request. Your tea is poured for you and frequently replenished.I think the Mandarin Oriental could learn a lot about afternoon tea from some of London's best hotels including The Berkeley, The Savoy and The Connaught. We didn't get a chance to express our thoughts as no one asked us if the afternoon tea was satisfactory. Very overpriced and poor value for money- which was a shame as it as part of our daughter's Christmas present.

Booked here and at Asiate for our wedding evening, Travelled from UK to be married in New York. Stayed at a traditional New York hotel the first two nights....wished we had stayed there!! Appears to be a business hotel. Awful stains on the chaise-lounge in our bedroom.Did not want to make a fuss on our wedding night. Great views from our room and fab bathroom but not made to feel spaecial on our special night.Extremely disappointing Mandarin.

Over-priced and disappointing!!Stayed here as a treat on our wedding night. Room was great with fabulous views but chais-lounge had the most awful stains on it!Dined at Asiate. Again, over-priced and disappointing. Had a window seat but we booked early in November (confusion when we arrived). Disliked foie-gras on the menu and real fur advertised in hotel foyer....but our persoanl views.Would not stay here again. Preferred our 3 star New York hotel! Worrying as staying at Mandarin Oriental, Singapore in Jan.

Top notch hotel all the way. Friendly staff, exceptional service, tremendous attention to detail and convenient location make this hotel one of my favorites in the city. This is a great place to stay with kids too as the rooms are large and extremely comfortable while still being very elegant. Make sure you ask for a room facing Central Park! The view is breathtaking.

Having been THere several times, I can with all honesty say that it is the best hotel in New York city, great service amazing views and excellent location if you like you stay from crowded more tourists spots

I was in New York for vacation and I would say, my holiday was satisfied. The service top notch. The location is perfect to go anywhere in new york, walking distance. We checked in on deluxe room, and we both loving the room. So spacious, bed so comfy and after such a long flight, this is the kinda bed you looking for. Thanks, we both were happy.

My wife and I were extremely impressed with the service and overall appearance of this hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. We were always greeted with a smile. The room is larger than most Nyc hotels, especially with such a good location. It looked clean and we'll kept. It is in the Time Warner complex so it's close to shops, restaurants and a subway station.

We stayed in two premier central park view rooms for 5 nights 9/10-9/16 with a toddlerBooking was made through American Express- with guaranteed upgrade and other perks. Upon checking in the lady informed us: they don't have connecting rooms as we requested. Also there will be no upgrade since we already booked the highest room category they offer. When I asked them to move us to the connecting rooms tomorrow once they become available she promised to do so. Needless to say I never heard from her again.The premier central park view we paid 1400 a night for ( per room!) was a view of the Trump Tower. No kidding. You can only see edges of the park. The following day my toddler's favorite toy disapeared from the room. We got it back two days later after multiple phone calls- the toy looked very weird as if it was washed ten times. For some people it's not a big deal but for a 2 y o kid it is a very big deal. She cried for hours.The room service was OK but you expect more for that money- very often they forgot to bring an item or two. Once I found a hair in my omlet. They replaced it after my request and I had to wait 30 min. They still charged for that messed up meal. (!) No chocolate, no coplimentary fruits as they do it in Peninsula or four seasons. The hotel does not provide with 5-star services. It's extremely overpriced for what you get. I could not schedule a spa appointment due to they were completely booked for several days ahead. No one knew our names or greeted us upon seeing. It's not what you expect from a luxury hotel. My husband and I have been regular visitors of Mandarin Las Vegas and I can't even compare these two hotels. In Vegas management personally greets us upon arrival every time, they know our names, our toddler's name, even our nanny's name! When my mother in law passed away, mandarin Las Vegas overheard us talking and sent us flowers the same day. This is the way you do business and keep clients on coming back. We go there 5-6 times a year. We will never stay at any other hotel while in Vegas because we are completely satisfied and happy with services provided every time we stay there. On contrary, management of Mandarin New York don't care of its's clients satisfaction and here is why: When I posted my review back in September, someone from the management team responded asking me to contact them for "the opportunity to discuss your comments further so we can examine the issues you experienced. We hope that you will reach out to us directly at monyc-executiveoffice@mohg.com"I did contact them on November 13th and NOONE EVER FOLLOWED UP. So I am assuming it was done only for one reason: so the potential clients / readers would think the issues were resolved or at least I got a formal apology. Well: I did not. And I don't really need it any more. I just want to write that review so those who consider that hotel know what to expect. No hard feeling. :-) Since I couldn't edit my old review I simply re wrote and posted a new one.

Ok - we are middle class. I had to have a very challenging medical procedure at Mt. Sinai and wasn't aware how terribly awful I would feel when it was over. We are from upstate and I am in NYC all the time so I know that at 3:30pm - unless you take the subway - you are not going anywhere. Better half insisted on can ride. Got to Columbus Circle and I just said "I'm getting out." So - up to the beautiful view off of the restaurant from Mandarin. Now - we stayed at a Mandarin in Las Vegas when we got a real deal and it was lovely. There was no question I could not make it back upstate this evening in NYC and better half decided to book - easiest to book right where we were - BUT - definitely not worth the price. Go to a Courtyard or A Hampton Inn or a Red Roof or the Fitz (which I truly love). The Mandarin in NYC is next to the view blocking Trump - and that should be your first hint. Sorry I was in such bad shape that evening. Better half was vulnerable and so was I.

The Mandarin Oriental has risen to the top of my list for NYC hotels. The service is impeccable. The restaurant/lounge areas offer striking panoramic views of the city. The Spa is world class. The rooms are elegant and well appointed. The bathroom was stocked with Fresh bath products and I also have to mention that the bathroom also came equipped with a Toto toilet with all the features. I don't need to go into too much detail, but if you know about them, this one was awesome! This was a suite and I don't know if the standard rooms are equally equipped, but it's worth asking. The hotel location at the Time Warner Center is convenient to walking to Lincoln Center, Broadway theaters or strolling through the park. It's also at the Columbus Circle subway stop, so transportation is really easy to pretty much anywhere you want to go. If you want to splurge on a weekend in NYC, especially if you have Broadway on your agenda, the Mandarin Oriental is an ideal choice.

The location is superb! With direct access to Time Warner Center, Jazz at Lincoln Center, Central Park, excellent shopping and restaurants you find yourself torn...stay in the PERFECT hotel or easily explore the best of NYC. Top to bottom the hotel is wonderful. We have stayed here many times before and that decision will certainly continue!

The view is impeccable, as is the service. The ambiance is incredible too. Get ready to have your socks knocked off from the second you walk through the front door. You'll forget where you are. The cafe on the top floor is pricy and not well-suited for children, but a GREAT place to grab a night cap or a morning Americano.

We have spent many nights an MO Hotels in several cities and have certain expectations. These expectations were not met. We stayed here 5 nights. At check-in, I was handed a key and told to find the room myself. Normally, someone takes me to the room. There is no Club Room at the New York hotel (a place for tea and snacks for those of us staying in the more expensive rooms). You are supposed to call room service and wait......and wait.......and wait......There is no coffee maker in the room. This is really a problem for me, as I'm always jet lagged and need coffee immediately upon waking. The first morning, I tried to order coffee, and two of us showered, dressed, and still no coffee.......It was faster to go across the street to Starbucks. I requested a coffee maker and was presented - two days later - with a 12 cup conference room sized item. It took up most of the room on the dainty desk. No cream provided. Finally - and this is a big peeve - the internet cost 15 dollars/day on top of the $1185 per night I was already paying. Trust me, Mandarin managers, just round it up to 1200 and don't irritate me!!!

We celebrated my husband's birthday. A quiet and relaxing celebration... Thank you for the bottle of champagne and the birthday cake! Thank you too for the stuffed toy and book for my baby! Indoor pool was very relaxing. Loved that Central Park is a few steps away! Service is top notch!

Service, Views, and Perks were fantastic such as the allowance and town car drop off as well as concierge was able to book any and all things we needed. The spa and room service also great. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to enjoy the big city feel while staying in New York City. It Also right next to 3 subways lines and central park so easy to get around

If money is not an object, you love being pampered and want a room that offers a sweeping view, this is your place. There is a lot of attention to detail to the room, amenities, the showers, you-name-it. We received great in-room service. However, if you don't place a high value on sweeping views, doting service and a name, I'd book elsewhere for a fraction of the cost. The Central Park view facing the Upper Westside on 45th floor seemed pointless. Was just a sliver with a Trump highrise in the way. There is more than 1 type of room with "Central Park views" so double check. Likely to do again but would be more discerning with the room selection.

Hotel was amazing, we had a wonderful view of Central Park. We only had Breakfast one morning, but the food was excellent. The attention to detail in the rooms was wonderful (Tea served when we arrived, Newspapers in the morning, small sofa near the window overlooking the park. Would have been nice to include WiFi in the cost of the room, don't understand why Hotels charge for this. A minor problem with the in-room mini-bar, just opening the door caused some charges to occur (automatic process) -- The front desk quickly removed the charges in error.

The rooms are gorgeous. Views are great. But the staff are a bit disorganized. Our room was not available when promised. And then showed to a room that reeked of smoke. And then another room that reeked less of smoke. Finally after complaining I was upgraded to a suite. Room service also quite slow and fond of over promising and under delivering. Next time I'll just book a suite at the trump Central Park hotel for the same cost as a room at the Mandarin and hopefully skip the drama.

Everything about the Mandarin Oriental, New York is incredible, from the location of the building to the decor, friendly knowledgeable staff, an amazing restaurant and the BEST spa I've ever been to.Sadly, I was suffering from jet lag when I ate in the restaurant so I don't remember exactly what I ate but I do recall that everything was delicious.The Japanese breakfast was a revelation and by the end of my week stay I was hooked.The rooms are clean, beautiful and elegant with incredible bathrooms. I watched the sun rise over New York one morning and the view was spectacular.I had the best massage I've ever been given in the sumptuous spa, it was so good that I said I would be tempted to fly to New York once a month just to be massaged in the Mandarin Oriental.Shame Concorde isn't flying anymore or I probably would!The best hotel in NYC.

Worth going here for the views across Central Park alone. Simply stunning, especially at nighttime.Visited as part of an organised dinner, so only ate hare and didn't stay at the hotel.Food and service were excellent for a large function.

Absolutely no doubt you get what you pay for. The hotel is gorgeous and a serene oasis. Location and views of central park from the park view rooms, lounge, and restaurant are absolutely stunning. Service is impeccable. If you do not stay here at least treat yourself to a drink in the lounge or a meal in the restaurant any time of day.

My wife ran the TCS NYC Marathon this year and we booked a 5 night stay at the Mandarin Oriental as part of a runners package. It was our first time visiting New York City and we will definitely be back. The hotel far exceeded our expectations with the friendliest staff members we have ever experienced. Our hotel room was incredible with some of the most amazing views of the city. Just a stones throw away from Central Park and perfectly located for quick access to most of the major sights, we highly recommend visiting this hotel. Can't wait to go back :)

As usual The famous mo hospitality and superb roomsOn Columbus circle ...right next to all meetings in New York and Central Park Stunning views of Hudson River from the rooms Stunning views of Manhattan skyline and Central Park from the restaurant and loungeGreat lively bar with efficient serviceGood room serviceThe rooms and bathroom and linen etc are of course top quality Must stay

This is hands down the best hotel in the city. The service is perfect. However not for the faint of pocket. We had a great stay. Ran in the park steps of the entrance. Dinner in the Time Warner building so didn't go out in the rain. Breakfast with a great park view. Romantic and fun,

We recently had a stay-vacation here at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in NYC. Its location at Columbus circle is most convenient, the spa and the fitness center with its three lap pool was great. View of Central Park and NYC from the hotels restaurant spectacular. The Mandarin is truly a 5 star hotel which will not disappoint.

With its fortuitous location and half its hotel rooms sporting spectacular views spanning the panorama of Central Park from at least 35 stories up, as well as soaking tubs and good desks—the MANDARIN ORIENTAL HOTEL remains one of my special New York City pleasure resources. Occasional breakfasts resting there after difficult business meetings restore me like nothing else in Manhattan. Even entering the spacious lobby with its towering flamingo "ice" sculpture lowers my blood pressure. (See photo) While the Asiate Restaurant (See photo) is advertised as a soignée adventure in Asian fusion cuisine, I enjoy it for early business breakfasts, instead. In fact, I’ve never even seen the restaurant illuminated at night. Asiate offers the best fresh-squeezed ruby grapefruit juice, the best pressed coffee, the best fresh mixed berries, and the best selection of pastries in town—all enjoyed while scanning the Upper West Side beauty of Manhattan from soaring eagle height. (See photo)On the weekends, the prie-fixe brunch begins with an amuse bouche of yoghurt smoothie offered to you in a sherry glass. Breakfast is also served--and other goodies--out on the plush couches of the Lobby Lounge. (See Photo) This impressive social space features a continuation of the floor-to-ceiling windows from the restaurant, with chaises pulled into conversation circles for four, and my favorite cozy tête-à-têtes seating, so you are perpendicularly aligned for intimate chat.Yesterday, when I came to the Mandarin Oriental for a birthday party, right across the way from us were several Asian guests, resplendent in sheer cocktail dresses, enjoying High Tea in beautiful individual teapots, with the hotel’s three-tiered tower-platters of sandwiches and pastries. After our own festivities, we walked out past a veiled Arabic honeymoon party.Because our gathering was later in the day than I usually come, I was able to visit the Lobby Mobar (See photo), which by then was open. It is designed in dark wood tones with a bold square-shaped bar thrust into the room space and dynamically aligned at odds with the line of the windows. Mobar also features sherbet-colored specialty cocktails, celebrity caviar & Champagne, and several deliciously intimate small tables for two along the outside walls and up a step, so each couple is tucked into a world of their own.
user_name:
VKMc
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Mandarin for five nights when we were in New York to run the marathon and we were so pleased with everything. The service was amazing. When we arrived everyone in the staff knew that we were going to run the marathon and had prepared a special marathon breakfast deal (since the breakfast restaurant would not be opened early enough on the race day) and a small marathon runner gift bag with things to help you recover after the race, like a special SPA offer and different creams, oils and plasters etc.We stayed in a Central Park View Room at the top floor, which had stunning views over Central Park and all the way east of New York. The room was spacious, with a really nice sofa bed by the window, which we used a lot to enjoy the views while sipping on a glass of wine. The bathroom had a bath tub and a separate rain shower, which was so appreciated to get really soaked in hot water after completing the marathon run.The hotel also has a nice gym and a pool on the 36th floor, with spectacular views. We were pleasantly surprised to discover that the pool was not just a normal recreation pool but a full size lap pool. We started every morning doing laps in the pool as the sun rose between the sky scrapers. Magical! The hotel has a really good bar and a fantastic restaurant – Asiate – on 35th floor with (almost needless to say, but yes) stunning views over Central Park. We didn’t visit Asiate this time, but have been there several times before and it is one of the best restaurants in New York.Naturally the hotel is quite expensive with that level of luxury and location, but we really felt that we got good value for money and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for something extra for their New York trip (or planning to run the marathon next year - the location so close to the finish line and the attentive service before and after the race is absolutely worth every dime).

Extremely disappointed by how cold and rude the staff were at the Mandarin. Most of the hotel was under construction, severely limiting our access to most of the hotel, including the restaurant. The best features of this hotel are panoramic bar and the proximity to so many awesome attractions, shopping and Central Park. For the price, the rooms were extremely small and the beds were uncomfortable. You could compare them rooms at a Hilton Garden Inn. We even upgraded to make sure we had a perfect few of the snow covered Park, and still were displeased. Do not stay here unless you have specific reasons such as location or obligation.

For our tenth visit to the Big Apple, my husband and I divided our stay in NYC between the Mandarin Oriental and the Nomad Hotel, both on Conde Nast's Gold List. What sets the Mandarin Oriental apart from all other hotels in NYC is their SPA. Because the spa is located on the 35th and 36th floor, the spa offers beautiful views of Central Park. The treatment was exceptional as was the relaxation room and the rest of the facilities. This is MUST for those staying at the Mandarin Oriental.Our Central Park View Room was spacious, beautifully appointed, and needless to say, the view of Central Park was stunning (although the Trump Tower does obstruct the view slightly). The bathroom was also quite spacious and even equipped with a small flat screen TV. We loved the rain shower with consistent hot water, a necessity after a cold day of walking! Because we booked with our Amex Platinum Card, wi-fi was free.What sets the Mandarin Oriental apart for other NYC hotels is not only their stunning Central Park views or their five star spa, but also their five star service. We flew in early at 8 am and we were extremely pleased that our room was ready. Reception was warm and pleasant as was all the hotel employees we encountered. All this came with a hefty price tag though of 1000+ dollars, but hey you get what you pay for.  Way to go Mandarin Oriental, you've made FANS out of us!!

Perfect location, beautiful room with a great view, topnotch service - what more can you ask for? The bed was extremely comfortable as well - I had two blissful night of sleep at the Mandarin. I happened to be staying at the hotel on my birthday and they delivered an amenity. It's the little things like this that make a difference. Also good shops at the Time Warner Center which is easily accessible without walking outside AND basically right on Central Park.

I thing the Mandarin Oriental is a very elegant hotel. Expensive. Good food. Good Restaurant and excellent view if you are lucky to have a room with a view. I love the central park view from my room. If you can pay it,, it is worthy it

Second time we visit NY and had breakfast here. Amazing place and view. Also great service. 5 stars for Julianne the floor manager for find us the perfect table and enjoy his conversation!!. Definitely every time I go to NY this place is a MUST!!!!

My fiance and I celebrated our proposal at the Mandarin and they were very accommodating. The professionalism and friendliness of the staff is world class. The rooms are unique and beautiful. We also used the spa services and would recommend them to anyone.

We stayed at the Mandarin the day of and night of our son's wedding. It was such a relaxing retreat in the midst of all the stress, parties and preparation. everything about the mandarin is exquisite and calming. I would live to go back and enjoy the amenities as we had no time with our other events.

And I'm completely spoiled. This hotel has set the bar for service and location in New York city. People will complain left and right on the cost to stay here. It's worth every cent.I messed up the reservations for a massage and they fixed everything and provided free spa gifts for my troubles (and I was the one who caused the troubles in the first place!). I didn't make a big deal about it and just made another reservation but they bend over backwards to make sure everything was perfect. And that was just the spa!The front desk and room service were all very professional and polite. My favorite part about this hotel is its location. Shopping and food without ever needing to leave the building.The Whole Foods on the bottom level is insanely crowded but things move along efficiently.Being right next to Central Park is an amazing bonus too. The bathroom was probably my favorite part of the room. I made sure to spend a part of each day in that bath tub, using their bath products and enjoying the beautiful views. There's a TV right by the tub too! And the water pressure is incredible. The tub fills very very quickly. Certainly spoiled me and made me want to replace my tub back home.All in all a wonderful and lovely experience that makes you forget about everything else in the world, even if it's for one weekend. Will stay here again for sure.

Cocktail in their rooftop bar very nice. Room very well fitted up but smaller than we expected for the very high price. However we did have a great view over the river. Location was super for an evening of theatre, easy walk in great weather. Would recommend for a splurge!

After a 3 week tour of the US, we wanted a treat at the end having stayed at some pretty basic motels and even one night in the car with the the children! We had booked two Park View rooms for us and the kids for 2 nights but stayed 4 as it was just so so nice, made one feel great and worth every penny!

Met lady in Central Park who suggested we go for Cocktails and view in HotelWas dressed in scruffs. Treated lovely by hostessWaiters lovely friendly and informative . The Wasabi nuts to die for.Go for experience Have the Grey Goose Vodka Martini Wonderful

This is our third time staying at the Mandarin Oriental, NY. The previous two times were in suites, one the presidential. This time around, we were staying for just one night and went with a standard room. What really hit me was the small size of the viewless room, and the fact that we paid less at a nearby five star hotel two weeks earlier for a 2 room suite triple in size. While the hotel is lovely, it's hard to justify the inflated prices, even by New York standards. I would also mention that the room could have been cleaned better (film and streaks on mirrors, lint on carpet). The staff also did not offer a complimentary room upgrade through AmEx as part of their Fine Hotels and Resorts program. Room service for breakfast was very good. I would recommend looking into other 5 star accommodations in the area to get more for your money.

Very nice. Would stay again. I had a great room, good service, good food at all the restaurants and bars, and a great location. Connected to a shopping mall that had many great restaurants. A+ place, will stay again.

Elegant, classy and sophisticated. Nothing else needed to add but I am obliged to add more words to satisfy the minimum word count that trip advisor requires . If you enjoy old world service and attention then this is your type of hotel. The location is wonderful for Central Park and general walking around mid town Manhattan. Wonderful park view from our room. The fitness centre is modest in size but well equipped and a pool 36 floors up is a rare treat.

First we booked regular room and than we got swit at the 51 st floor! It was amazing apartment with dining room and bedroom, with 2 bathrooms... We had a view from both rooms on different sides( Central Park and the city). Breakfast was amazing, I recommend healthy one... Service was perfect and definitely one of the best hotels I've ever been .... Location was perfect , Central Park is on 3 minutes walk from the hotel... Times Square on 5 minutes,5 th avenue also.... So , go there and you won't regret!!!!

My husband was told by a NYC Rickshaw driver while on business that the Mandarin was by far the nicest hotel to stay. He was spot on! Several months later American Express sent me a post featuring the hotel. We go to New York every July and stay at the Fairmont Plaza.i can honestly say our stay at The Mandarin was the loveliest time in New York ever. The suite was a corner unit and the views of Central Park West breathtaking , we could also see down to the Fairmont- our former experience. When we arrived the front desk staff were professional, charming and expeditious. The amenities were abundant. From the heated bidet/ toilet- I know it may make you giggle but it was something really special! The details and the design of our suite were glorious . They provided yoga mats a generous touch that I really appreciated and I was provided water and a fresh towel upon return from my morning runs. Breakfast was a study in presentation and flavor- perfection. They are very friendly with a touch restraint. Something to appreciate with the barrage of cell phones, social media and the Internet. We look so forward to spending time with Mandarin Oriental this July 2016!!!

Absolutely amazing. My wedding couldn't have been anymore beautiful. James Munz and his catering team are top notch. He truly made our wedding perfect. Such a beautiful venue, amazing food and truly impressive service. Our bridal suite was above and beyond and all our guests rooms were just beautiful. The spa is incredible as well. Would recommend ten times over. Loved it!! 5 stars and beyond. We cannot wait to go back for our anniversary.

This place is terrific. The front desk staff was excellent, and gave me a nice room upgrade even in the midst of UN General Assembly craziness. The location is terrific, and you can hit the Time Warner Center restaurants and Dizzy's without leaving the building. The only negative is the fact that the rooms are pretty high up- I think they start on floor 35. So if that will bother you, you should look elsewhere.

One of the best brunch in New York city and magic view on Central Park. If you want to have a great brunch on an abordable price ($60), go there: the view id breathtaking and the service is perfect. The brunch is unique and not traditional. This is very cool way to start a Sunday in New York!

Staff is truly professional and remembers you every time you walk by.The swimming pool is incredible for central NY and offers amazing views. What's a bit surprising and disappointing was: no free wifi in the rooms, and no coffee makers neither.

This neighborhood is expensive, but it is fantastic - next to the park, shopping, fabulous restaurants, subway, museums, and close to the theaters. The hotel starts on the 32nd floor and goes up (no idea what is above or below), and if you end up on the west side of the hotel, the views are lovely. You can even see the Hudson. There is a restaurant and lounge on the same floor with registration, and it has a sweet vibe. Everything is really pricey, but you're in Columbus Circle. In New York City. In the Mandarin Oriental. The rooms themselves are lovely and spacious (for NYC) and have a large bath. Beware of the automated system in the fridge and snack bar... we accidentally tripped some auto-charges by putting a piece of fruit and some water in the fridge. It was easy to correct at checkout however.

Your staying at a famous hotel and will see celebrities. It's first class and expect to spend $ if your at this hotel. It's in a great location, in the middle of it all! Everyone in the hotel is nice and go out of there way to give you the best 1st class service. You get what you pay for and you will be impressed. Best business center I have ever been in as well! Very good people in business center and hotel. I will be back. Thank you

Having previously stayed at Mandarin Oriental hotels in San Francisco, Miami, and Las Vegas, we had great expectations for this hotel. However, they were not all met. The rooms were not as nice; and although the staff members were efficient, they were not as friendly as we had experienced at other Mandarin Oriental properties. This is a good hotel, it just lacks some of the elements that keep it from being great.

The rooms were fantastic, clean and the view was out of world , room service , housekeeping "hats off". Near to all amenities....central park, Times square & fantastic shopping amenities , the mall on 3rd floor with wholefoods and surrounded by street foods of central park....very safe surroundings

Initially, I was not very impressed with the appearance of the hotel, however, once I entered the room, I was immediately impressed. It was very beautiful and clean. I was completely impressed with the service specifically from Bill in concierge. He went above and beyond to track down a piece of luggage that was lost by the airline. The hotel is very conveniently located to several subway stations and within a walk from Times Square

Now I know why the stars stay there! We saw Morgan Freeman, Queen Latifa, Conan O'Brian....Centrally located and close to everything, wonderfully appointed rooms and courteous staff. We were there for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. If I could make one comment , why skimp on the toilet paper?

Whats not to love...the location, the room size and bathroom, style and decor all add up to a wonderful stay. From the moment you enter the hotel, you feel relaxed and attended to. Dont forget the gym, spa and pool! The lobby bar area is a wonderful location to relax and unwind with the view of Central Park, a perfect location before dinner.

We were very excited to visit New York for our 25th anniversary. We went big and booked at the Mandarin. It was very pricy but we figured it would be worth it. Much to our disappointment the hotel has a smallish reception area with a nice view on the 35th floor with some lounge chairs and that is about it. No grandness at all. Then when we got to our room the room was tiny and very modestly appointed. No heated floors in the bathroom or anything special. Pretty much should have paid $350 a night for a place like this. What we paid was just robbery. To finish off the experience wifi was extra. So we paid over $1,000 per night for a poorly appointed room and they wanted an additional charge for wifi. What a joke. This was absolutely petty on their part and just left me with a bad taste. You are better off getting a room at the Plaza or the Waldorf or any other hotel for less money and more grandness.

This is our third Mandarin Oriental Hotel, & our least favorite. We agree the location is great, the food and beverages were very good, and service was friendly & efficient. In the midst of this busy area, the Hotel is quiet & relaxing. The park view rooms have floor to ceiling windows that are partially obstructed by a Trump Tower between the Hotel & the park. In the lower floors you can't see Columbus Circle due to a roof line. Views from upper floors, at a higher price, clear that roofline exposing the Circle. For the money, the rooms are too small, especially the one sink bathroom. The bed, while comfortable, is outdated by the luxury beds normally available in five star accommodations. However, the positives for many could out weigh the negatives, just choose your accommodation carefully according to your desires

My wife and I just completed a three-night stay at MO NYC and loved it. The location is perfect for shopping, sight-seeing, etc... Our room was also very nice with an outstanding view of Central Park. Bed and bedding were fantastic. Room service food was good but not great. We definitely plan to return and encourage looking for a luxury hotel to strongly considering MO.

Had a great stay at the Mandarin. The hotel has excellent views over Central Park. The service is the best anywhere in the city. The rooms are beautiful, although the bathroom is rather small. The hotel isn't exactly new but it is maintained well. The location in Colombus Circle is excellent! It is walking distance to Central Park, Fifth Avenue, underground station, etc. It is connected to a mall and some of the finest restaurants in the country, Masa, Per Se, Jean Georges, etc.Breakfast was rather expensive and the food, average at best but the view more than made up for it.What makes this hotel truly stands out is the service. I once called the concierge regarding some training classes in nearby gyms. A few hours later, to my surprise, I received an envelope with complimentary passes. The staff in general goes out of their way to make feel guests welcome from check in to concierge, from housekeeping to check out.

This is a great hotel in which to have a reception. The view of central park from is phenomenal! It is the perfect location to host an event in during the spring or summer months when Central Park's trees are in full bloom. Great hotel with great service!The food service is delicious!

The Mandarin New York is one of the finest hotels anywhere. Great location, across from Central Park, great nearby restaurants, shops, easy access to cabs & subway, impecable rooms. If you can afford it, you'd have a hard time finding a finer hotel.

Mandarin Oriental is perfectly situated in the exciting Lincoln Center neighborhood, surrounded by good restaurants and lots of things to do.Beautiful hotel with great service. Very nice gym, and with a pool, which is unusual for New York. Staff couldn't have been more accomodating.

Upon arrival we were greeted with chocolate covered strawberries and a gorgeous view of Central Park, what's not to love? The room was spacious and well laid out. Very comfortable. It was comfortable to arrive and hang out in the room after a busy day in the city walking and sight-seeing. The hotel is very quiet, relaxed and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again. You get what you pay for in the city.

The Mandarin is as near perfection as you can get in NYC. The windows are locked down but if you ask Security will come up and open them for you. They charge for Internet which is just odd--they do not ordinarily charge small amounts for 'additional' services...The staff can basically get for you anything---NY has everything, and the people who work here take their work seriously--they want to be the best, and they succeed...small issue is that their room service menu could have a wider range--though they will find anything for you--the sheets are great. The pillows are great--the towels are great, the water pressure is great, the AC is great...the bedside tables have electric sockets within easy reach--even in the smallest rooms --about 400 sf the a divan fits nicely by the window--the hotel has one of the best views of the city...i have never been in a room with a park view---anyway--have fun.

Our room was lovely, super comfy bed. Fabulous bathroom, nicest I've ever seen in an hotel. Bar on 35 th floor very nice...I left a scarf there and they left a note under our door saying they found it. Much appreciated! This am we took a swim in their pool on the 36 th floor. Great, pool all to ourselves. Room service breakfast excellent. Best coffee ever. All in all a delight. Expensive but worth it!
