Great position and some good views. Nice bar and restaurant but everything felt just that little bit too expensive. For instance a green juice at breakfast was US$15 as was a coffee in your room. Some parts of the hotel feel a little dated.Air Con in room was super noisy.

Travelled as a couple on a business trip but mixed with pleasure. We spent a few days in the meatpacking district then came to spend our last 4 nights in luxury.It is amazing! The staff as superb and their service is second to none, the hotel is stunning. The views are amazing! I cant say enough about how great it is. We had an amazing view from our room, we were about 4 floors from the top, it was a crazy view looking down, so high! And we overlooked Central Park and Columbus circle. We also ate at the restaurant twice which cost us a bit but was worth it! Lastly, we met Ken Jeong (Mr Chow from the Hangover film) in one of the lifts so it must be good if he's staying there too! :)Stayed August 2013

I have stayed in other NYC hotels that are good, therefore I had really high expectations before we arrived at the Mandarin Oriental at Columbus Circle. The location is very good, with one of the best views of Central park possibly. But we where a bit unlucky with our room. We had two Hudson River view rooms, interconnected, and I could see that they needed to be refurbished. The swimming pool is really not anything to promote. It should have been closed down years ago. I tried it once, but it wasn't looking as a pool in a luxury hotel, so I just left it.The fitness center was OK, but not as good as it should have been. The breakfast was very good.The bar was looking a bit odd, to be a part of Mandarin Oriental. The staff was friendly, but not a nice place to have the drink before our dinner.The restaurant was closed due to refurbishment. I have heard so much nice about it from friends being there, so that was a bit sad.The concierge mixed up with the booking of the transportation to the airport, so we barely made it. But this might be just a mistake.As I started, we had really big expectations before we arrived, and we felt it wasn't quite there. My major point is that the two rooms needed very much an upgrade to be called Luxury.

What better way to view NYC than visiting the Mandarin by night? Great service, great drinks, and even a better view. Watched the city life by night with my date and enjoyed great company. Worth every penny for the ambiance and wonderful customer service.

I had an amazing stay at the Mandarin Oriental in summer. My partner and 1 stayed for 4 nights in the Hudson rive view suite which was spectacular. We left for a couple of days and returned for another 4 nights expecting again to stay in the Hudson river view suite, instead we got a free upgrade to a Central park view suite on the top floor which was an amazing touch to our holiday. The enormous windows make looking out onto the city perfect. Room service food quality was excellent. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning, it was so good that we did not consider going elsewhere. The service at breakfast was a bit lacking (especially seeing as it is a 5 star hotel) and there were several occasions where orders were forgotten or took half an hour just to arrive to the table. To their credit the hotel did notice and sent up complimentary chocolates and made every effort to ensure things went right for the remainder of our trip.The hotel is within easy walking distance of central park, 5th avenue and broadway. I would definitely come back here and recommend to others!

This is a beautiful hotel with many amenities. The staff was great! Very courteous and attentive. My two night stay was covered by a vendor, couldn't do it on my budget. Great location next to the park
user_name:
Nancy L
South Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: An excellent hotel to stay at in New York. The location is convenient with the Columbus circle shopping mall underneath, as well as the amazing park views from the rooms. The decor inside the hotel is sleek and the rooms are in good condition. The food in the Restaurants are very good and the view of the park is breathtaking while dining!

A "modern and exciting" Asian-inspired hotel in the Time Warner Center has "exquisite city views." Furnished with 1940s-inspired lacquer desks, Asian-style credenzas, paintings of New York City bridges, and watercolors by Asian artists, rooms are "well-appointed and spacious" and have floor-to-ceiling windows. The spa, which has an amethyst-crystal steam room,

We stayed at Mandarin Oriental in New York from 4th August 2015 till 9th August 2015, we have had amazing experience, we asked to locate us on the highest floor possible and they did this for us we stayed on 54th floor big thank you for making this visit so special, it was our after engagement treat just before our big day, big thank you to all Mandarin Oriental staff especially thank you Tom from concierge for all hard work and a lot of research we were unable to say thank you in person for recommending is the "the press lounge" it was amazing we both were amazing by the views and big big thank you to Director of food and beverage Lion.

I felt very comfortable as much so as I was at home! The staff were extremely professional! I never ever wanted to leave and I was born and have lived my entire life in New Yirk City! My stay was amazing!

Fantastic hotel with beautiful rooms, would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a luxury experience in NYC. Location is great (right beside central park) and only a 15 minute walk to times square. Beautiful views from the restaurant too.
user_name:
Alex_NZD
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: Wonderful, impressive hotel, Outstanding, friendly and efficient staff. Well appointed with a mix of contemporary and classical far eastern elegance.. Central location (on one of Central Park's corners) with excellent amenities and facilities. Wish I could be a more frequent guest (and if money was no object I would be!).

Awesome room with an amazing view of park and upper east side. Rooms are very comforatable and my room had the best waterfall shower I have ever had, very hot and amazing presure. The hotel staff is very friendly form in room dining to front desk. I loved my stay there, could not have asked for anything more. Also the spa is awesome and facilities are sweet. Sweet kitchen, grat tasting food everwhere in the hotel. This is a grat hotel and measures up very well on my value meter.

We had a wonderful stay at the mandarin hotel, the location is perfect for exploring Manhattan and central park. All staff is really helpful and caring. Our 2 year old daughter felt at home. The congierge had also great restaurant recommendations.

My sister had her reception here and I had the pleasure of staying for two nights. Our room had a gorgeous view overlooking Columbus Circle and Central Park. The location is perfect and close to the subway. The hotel is one of the few that truly offer 5-Star service. The lobby has a floor to ceiling windows and views of the park. We had tea there in the morning as well as cocktails in the evening. The staff goes above and beyond and they made our stay so memorable. I wish I could afford to stay here more often!

Stayed with family - had to take 2 rooms. Was on 54th (top) floor - good view of Central Park (apart from view of trump building in the way !). Pool Ok but on 36th as opposed to rooftop pools on some other hotels. Pool just for paddling in as only 4ft deep. Decent location for central park and Broadway.

Great location, great view, great service! One of the best hotels in Manhattan! Rooms are incredibly light, spacious and beautifully furnished. Beds are very comfortable and great shower with super fluffy towels...you've got to love that! The restaurant and the spa are a definite must!
user_name:
MichelePalma76
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a nice time here and everything was great - however, I still just have a hard time paying about $800 a night for a room that is the size of the maid's quarters in my flat where I live now. Otherwise, all was exceptional, just bring your wallet stacked heavy - still was a bit taken back that with that cost they still charge you for wi-fi.

I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental the location is excellent CP is next door there are excellent restaurants close by there is the connected Time Warner center with shops restaurants and Whole Foods Market,easy subway ride on the 1Train to Broadway what makes this hotel special are the people that take care of you excellent customer service ,for example the host at the restaurant recognized me on the second visit remembered my name a personal touch

Great location, view from the Central Park and facilities. Service was also very gentle. Very convenient location righ next to columbus circle mall, where there's a subway Station. Walking distance from the lincoln center as well.

We just had another stay at the Mandarin (unfortunately too short) and were once again impressed by the service received there. We have stayed with the Mandarin many times over the years since they first opened and have been consistently pleased with our experience. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. A visit to the Lobby Lounge for a "Mandarin Sunset" really sets the right tone. Over looking Columbus Circle in a relaxing atmosphere. Perfect. The staff is professional yet friendly and warm from the Valet to Check-in to the Lounge. It is the service we have grown accustomed to and are never disappointed. We will be back, again and again!

Although the Mandarin is not the closest luxury hotel for my needs, I keep returning. The staff is friendly but not overbearing. The rooms are quiet, spacious, well lit and comfortable. Subway stations are nearby. And the food is terrific. I have a gluten allergy, which Asiate and room service accommodate better than any NYC hotel in which I've stayed. I am always able to get a treadmill in the well appointed but modest fitness center. Keep up the good work.

The Mandarin Oriental NYC has some very nice features: a beautiful swimming pool overlooking the city; rooms also with great views; a very comfortable bed; large bathrooms; friendly staff. It is expensive, though, and you will have to pay for the delicious breakfast. It is a nice option for a romantic stay to watch a ballet at the Lincoln Center.

We spent 3 nights in this beautiful hotel with our 3 children and had the most amazing time. The location, rooms, views but, most importantly, the staff, were outstanding. I could not fault anything about this hotel. This for us was a 'once in a lifetime' trip and one we will NEVER forget. Thank you Mandarin Oriental, NY.

I brought my 15 year old daughter here for a very special afternoon tea experience during our recent stay in New York. What an experience for both of us to sit on the 35th floor overlooking Central Park in mid Spring! The staff could not have been more helpful - from the excellent manager (a lovely lady!) on duty (who had taken our booking) to the wait staff, it was a 7 star experience for us and worth every penny. My only regret was that in all our excitement we forgot to take a photo! We were kindly moved to a window seat after 1 hour when one became free so were able to savour the magnificent views. When I return to NYC in the not too distant future I will return here again, thank you Mandarin Oriental.

Stayed here for a birthday and it was fantastic. The rooms were incredibly spacious and the room service was divine. Beautiful location and extremely nice service from all staff members. Will definitely stay again and recommend to anyone in the area.

Facilities and service are excellent, with a few minor misses . Rooms are in good shape and nicely decorated (however a little bit on the glitzy side). Service twice daily is good and timely. Pretty much spotless with a few things missed. Room service meals were good, but not spectacular. Breakfast in Asiate was spectacular - both the food and the ambiance. My only nit is that they should offer some Asian choices. One of the things I enjoy about the Mandarins around the world is their dim sum at breakfast. This was not offered at the Mandarin New York.The real differentiator of the hotel is the views of Central Park, city scape and Hudson River. However, the park views are obstructed by the Trump International Hotel which is unfortunate. Still the view is spectacular. Overall this is a very good hotel, especially if you're looking for a high rise with views in Midtown/Uptown. It's missing the character you can find in smaller, premium boutique hotels below 23rd street, like the Mercer or Crosby Street.
user_name:
Peter V
New York City, New York

review_body: Our stay at the Mandarin was delightful. The property is magnificent, the staff superb and the rooms lavish. It is always our first choice in New York. From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed we were treated graciously and attentively. The entire staff focused on ensuring that our stay was perfect.

This is really the most delightful and enjoyable hotel in NYCPerfect service, attention and facilitieshard to get better than the Mandarin Oriental The best part is the staff are simple the very best!

I have stayed at many 5 star hotels over the years. The Mandarin is the only hotel I see a true 6 star experience. the intuition that staff has to your your every need before you voice it is amazing!!

This hotel is just amazing! I accompanied my husband on his business trip and felt like royalty! The staff and the service is incredible! The views from the lobby area and the rooms is spectacular! The location of the Hotel is key since its in Colombus Circle, right in front of Central Park and minutes away from Time Square. The room was very clean when we arrived and everyday they would have 2 services. When you leave in morning they clean the room, make the bed...the usual. And at night they would prepare your room to go to bed, remove pillows from bed and put them aside, leave a cute little note on the bed, wishing you a good night...etc. we would definitely go back!

Attended an alumni reception in this hotel. The room overlooked Central Park and Columbus Circle. The view is spectacular. Not only do you have a wonderful view if Central Park but the view of the skyline is amazing. The food and service was very exemplary.

The best spa I've ever been to. The experience was so peaceful. The treatments were soothing to the body and mind. The restaurants were great. The location is Columbus Circle and you truly can't be in a better location. The hotel had their private car take is downtown to eat at the Old Homestead. It was a Bently, I felt like a queen for the dat

An excellent property to stay. Well located clean comfortable with a super staff. The view from breakfast is unsurpassed‼️ I always feel like I'm home at the Mandarin Oriental. I have stayed at Hundreds of luxuryproperties worldwideand the Mandarin Oriental is always at the top.

The hotel is in the center of Columbus circle with 3 floors of high end retail mall below. The bar sitting on the 35 th floor has beautiful views. Service was very good although some of the staff were a little snooty. Business center was well staffed and very helpful. But again for $800+ a night I expected something grander. And beware of the prices in the minibar!!!! Very very expensive wines.
user_location: Briarcliff Manor, New York, United States
user_name:
naj6363
Briarcliff Manor, New York, United States

review_body: Had a fantastic 6-nights stay in the Mandarin Oriental, New York - without a doubt one of the best hotels in the city offering amazing service, our stay was made much more memorable thanks to Gabriel at the Front Desk who was very professional yet so personable, what an asset to this hotel!

Excellent hotel, perfect location and the staff go out of their way for you! They made sure the tooth fairy visited my son! The Hudson suites are beautiful, spacious and have the best view. This is how New York is done!

Dear Mandarin Oriental Hotel,As I sit in my fabulous suite on the 54th floor watching New York City wake up, I am reminiscing of this weeks fabulous vacation.I cannot thank your hotel, your fabulously and wonderful staff enough for making myself and my three daughter-in-law's and my precious brother-in-law have a dream of a lifetime come true. Being a mother of three sons I have never had a girls weekend little alone a week like I have this last week and your staff has made it an absolute fabulous time. The kindness and generosity of everyone here has done nothing but brought my three daughter-in-law's closer together as well as closer to me. Who could ask for anything more. The daily gifts that you all have arranged were spectacular and what a perfect way to end it with a box from Tiffany's thank you just will not be words enough. You will never know the personal gratitude that I owe this hotel and your staff.Again thank you for everything dreams do come true in the Mandren Oriental Hotel.Ingrid U. Little

This hotel is exceptional. Jason at the front desk greeted us like we were old friends. We talked about the view being spectacular in the lobby lounge which is right by the check in desk. He said for us to call down before we come as priority seating is given to hotel guests. We visited three times, and each time had great seating. The chicken lollipops are delicious. We used American Express Platinum Fine Hotel and Lodging service, and thru that received a free room upgrade. Wow--the same view as the lounge. Breathtaking. The AmEx also included breakfast which the hotel allowed you to take as room service or in the breakfast room. The credit was for $80 and breakfast for two takes every bit of that amount. It was delicious though! Service from all staff was outstanding.

The Mandarin Oriental lives up to its sterlng reputation on Columbus Circle. What a fantastic property. Simply put, this is the best hotel in New York City - if you get a suite overlooking Central Park. Spend your money wisely and treat yourself. We may never stay in any other hotel in the city.

I accompanied my husband on trip to NYC. The conference that he was attending was at the Mandarin and we received a discount to stay there. The location was outstanding, being very close to Central Park and about a 10-15 minute walk to the Theater district. The hotel itself is at Columbus Circle and attached on the third floor to an acccess to the shops at Columbus Circle. The staff are very accommodating and our room was cleaned twice a day. Although the room was average in size, the bathroom was spacious with a separate toilet area and a large shower stall beside a large bathtub. I really enjoyed the lap swimming pool which is next to the gym on the 36th floor. There are beautiful views of the city in the pool area and the changerooms were clean and well stocked with towels and shampoo, etc. What may be of concern to some is that the checkin desk is on the 35th floor. You have to take one set of elevators to the 35th to checkin and then a second set to your room. So everytime you want to go outside, you must take 2 different elevators. Also there was no clock or coffeemaker in the room which was inconvenient. My husband went across the street to Starbucks for his morning coffee and I found it disconcerting when waking up, not to know the time as we were on a tight schedule. I know that this is easily remedied by looking at your cell phone. I just found it weird that such an expensive hotel would not provide a clock.I thought that the direct access to the shops at columbus circle was ideal. On the Saturday night that we were there, we went to dinner at one of the restaurants at the mall and then to the jazz club, Dizzy's without going outside which was excellent considering that there were torrential downpours all day. Just make sure that you reserve at Dizzy's. It's cheaper to sit at the bar that pay the $45 cover charge at a table. The shops at Columbus Circle also have a Whole Foods on the lower level if you want to make yourself a salad or pick up hot foods without going to a restaurant. Being close to Central Park was amazing; we really enjoyed walking through the peace and solitude that the large trees and walking trails had to offer.

From the staff to the room to the views...great experience! The lounge area was such a chill spot for a cocktail and a view of Central Park. When we went to the theater one night, the doorman hailed us the Mandarin limo -instead of a taxi. Made the night just that much more special. The spa was a treat. We will be back.

Recently stayed here for a business conference. Lovely view of the Hudson from our room. Meticulous housekeeping and turndown service. Lots of celebrity sightings while we were there. Columbus Circle was convenient to Central Park, Lincoln Centre and some great restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. Absolutely lovely!

The Mandarin Oriental NY is the best hotel I know in New York even that I visited and stayed many times at Ritz Carlton , Hyatt and more,The service is great the suites are amazing and the room are clean.

Never ever can I forget these views. Probably 20th visit and still these views.Was lucky to book a Suite newly renovated...Much improved layout, beautiful seating for sunrise if you are jet lagged. Asiate also renovated and fab!! Worth the money!

I always find it astonishing that high end hotels want to charge for the wifi. At $400 per night it's sad they don't include it. Stayed at The Plaza ( Fairmont) last year and its included. A small thing but would make me choose not to stay here again. Sad really.

ed to a suite for free thanks to AMEX. Amazing both park and city views. Staff extremely courteous and friendly. Room very clean with all the amenities! Bar/lounge for pre/post show drinks was an added bonus. Room service was delivered on time and tasted great! Would stay again anytime.

We stayed there for few nights .Very good location . Good views . Large and well equipped bathroom . Excellent gym area . Beautiful breakfast area.What I didn't like was that the room was smaller that it shows on the pictures . Also I got the feeling it needs upgrade. To me the furnitures looked old . Good service . Over all good but doesn't deserve the big amount of money we payed for it
user_name:
Melina B
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I have stayed in a few of the luxury New York Hotels. This one rates as one of the best. Great location at Columbus Circle. Great view. Everyone is exceptionally nice. First place I have seen where the person checking you in leaves the front desk and takes you to your room. For the basics: A real Samsung 55 inch High Def TV and I mean real high def not the pseudo hi def that some hotels have become famous for. Jacks for HDMI also. the internet is exceptionally strong though they charge for it as for some reason seems to be the case in the better hotels. the internet you buy however seems to be good throughout the hotel. Other hotels seem to have you buy internet that only works in the room. Good water pressure and real hot water. Excellent fitness center. I was trying to think of something negative to say and the most I could come up with is the toilets don't have great pressure.

The Mandarin Oriental hotel in New York is an excellent 5 star hotel that is situated next to the 59th St Columbus circle subway and 10mins walk away from Lincoln centre. There is also a large mall next to it with bouchon bakery and a fantastic large supermarket in the basement. The lobby is located on the 35th floor. The gentleman who checked me in was extremely friendly and polite, he showed me to the room and offered to bring me tea. The view of the Hudson river was stunning. The room itself was not big, but the views made up for it and the bed was extremely comfortable. The interiors were also tastefully done. The toilet was huge with two sinks, a separate shower and toilet stalls, and the best part was the bath tub overlooking the Hudson river. Room service was excellent though the pasta that I ordered was a bit dry. Eating at Asiate is a must! I had breakfast there twice and though pricey, the views of central park were amazing. The gym is also very good with very high tech workout stations. All service staff were extremely polite and professional. The only negative was that you could hear noises coming from outside the room. I noticed this during turn down service time when staff would go knocking from door to door...I will definitely come back to this hotel again.

You dont care about beeing respected? Mandarin oriental new york is the right place to stay!poor reservations service,poor concierde service, poor menu .you get at the hotel as a stranger we leave as a stranger.

My wife and I arrived at the Mandarin Oriental in late May a 12 hour door to trip from the UK. We had stayed there several times before and had a confirmed booking for a Central Park facing suite, to serve us on our business trip.When we arrived we were offered a different suite by the inexperienced receptionist who when I showed him our email confirmation, just left us for nearly half an hour. My wife was unwell and coughing badly but no one took any notice and we stood around waiting. After a long interval a "manager" arrived who said that he could place us in a different suite - which was just as good but didn't have the view. We would have had to change rooms during our stay, if we accepted this - which was unacceptable.My wife was clearly unwell but he ignored her and she had to ask his colleague for a glass of water - but no seat was offered. No apology was given, no attempt was made to make us feel comfortable - and the impression was given that it was our fault! We felt that neither the manager nor the receptionist displayed even the most basic of courtesy. We felt that they were unwelcoming, uncaring, unhelpful and tried to be patronising - although they had no basis for such.We had to leave the hotel without other accommodation as a result of this.On the basis of this experience, we are minded never to stay at this establishment again and would not rate it as suitable to accommodate international business people. As returning guests, we felt shoddily and shabbily treated and it us noticeable that no subsequent attempt was made to contact us or apologise.

Just amazing . I stay at the 53 floor middle of everyware , walk distance to the central park and times square , easly you fall down in love with the city Great view , the hotel service amazing staff friendly resurents nice , I hava to come back again , i stay for 3 days the city needs 2 weeks

I recently stayed here for the weekend just to view the Chinese fashion exhibition at the museum of art. I do believe that this is one of the most expensive Mandarin around. I've stayed at a few. The room was smaller than I would've liked but nice. The bathroom was spacious and they service your room twice per day. We ordered room service and it was sent up pretty quickly. We had dinner at the restaurant there and did the wine pairing. Everything was prepared to my satisfaction. Breakfast was very good as well. Tea in the lounge was relaxing and light filled.Oh, I slept like a baby!

Great hotel, staff friendly and accommodating. Rooms clean etc.I'd stay here again if only for the amazing views over a snow covered Central Park.Location great but very upmarket touristy. Not my thing but if it's yours, you can't go wrong here.

We loving staying at the Mandarin Oriental NYC. The location is perfect for walks through Central Park, the accomodations are luxurious and the staff will bend over backwards to help. Breakfast at Asiate is delicious and the view is a wonderful way to start off your day. We highly recommend it.

I had a work-related trip to NYC at an end of the week, and brought my 83 yo mum with me for the weekend at the MO. I typically choose to stay at the MO when an MO is available in cities around the country/world. We had just been to their Atlanta facility a month ago and found it to exude oriental hospitality and Georgia charm. So we were looking forward to MONY (the last time I stayed there years ago, I raved about it to my mum).What remains extraordinary in MONY:* Hotel personnel with special kudos to Reception, Concierge and Doormen as well as the Asiate (perhaps food/beverage) Manager, sommelir and Asiate maitre d's in the AM and lunchtime of Friday, May 29, Sunday, May 31 and Monday, June 1 (but see below)* Desmond in the Lobby Lounge* Luxurious rooms in a luxurious facility* Amazing vistas and views* Convenient location adjourning Time-Warner CenterWhat is not so MO-like:* Your staff on Sundays seem a little green and unknowledgeable in general* The extremely rude and argumentative maitresse d' manning Lobby Lounge the mornings of Saturday, May 30 and Sunday, May 31. At every MO, we are gifted a tea with skim milk (how much does this cost at cost? pennies) and half a cup of soy milk gratis in the mornings. Indeed in Atlanta, when they saw my mum coming in the morning after we worked out, they automatically went in to get her soy (that's called proactively anticipating, what MO prides itself in). We made the mistake of (instead of going to Asiate who granted the same courtesy on Friday) to approach this rude prig at the Lobby Lounge who was stand-off'sh, ran into the back, only to come out to say no, that'll be $8 in that attitude-filled manner. We explained to her what Asiate granted us just the day before and other MO facilities and asked to see the manager. She scuttled away and returned sullenly to throw tea and soy at us. On Sunday, we made the same mistake of approaching the prig because we thought she had sorted this out the day before. Same thing - so I asked her whether we had to argue with her every morning. She couldn't care less and ran away again. We gave up and went to Asiate where we found the food/beverage manager who said but of course, and profusely apologized. Nonetheless, this outstanding and luxurious experience is just soured by this prig who is poorly trained and rude to boot. She has no place in an organization like MO.* Your prices are too high and your mark up in the restaurant unrealistic (especially given the broad quality of your wait staff in both restaurants really)

When I told people I was staying here they said we were staying at one of the best. And it is.I would say this hotel is in the best location in New York, its directly opposite the park which looks so beautiful when you pull up in a car outside. Nothing is too much trouble at this hotel.Hotel starts on the 35th floor so great views from reception and the restaurants there. We only had breakfast once at this hotel and didnt venture to any of the other bars (although now wish we had for the view!) but the breakfast was luxurious. Not the cheapest but then you dont expect it to be and the service is great. Little touches like the orange juice and smoothie shot are great. Mum had cereal and toast and I had the healthy breakfast - scrambled eggs and spinach, granola, yogurt and fruit - I thought this was expensive at $37 BUT the portions were huge so would definitely fill you up in fact I couldnt eat it all.We were upgraded from a City view room to a river room view which was beautiful. You can still see buildings but lovely to see the river too. We had a twin bedroom - really comfy beds, and the bathroom is huge - big shower, big bath and even a TV! TV in the main room is HUGE. Only negative on the room would be not enough space for clothes (wardrobe smallish and only 4 drawers but then perhaps people dont stay here long?) and no tea or coffee making facilities - we had to ask for these. We were brought a coffee machine (not one I knew how to use) and a kettle. We then had to call for fresh milk, cups and teabags each day which was a little annoying as my mother who I stayed with loves a cup of tea first thing.Swimming pool a great find especially the views up there. Hotel staff cannot do enough for you. The lady on front desk was so helpful to my mum when she tried to call her bank back in the UK, she connected two calls for her and warned of the charges!Rooms cleaned twice a day. First night we were left chocolates on the bed. Love the quotes they leave on the bed each night too. Fresh water left each night. Shame the wifi isnt free.I would definitely stay at this hotel again as the location is divine. Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Sq and the park is beautiful in spring.Special thanks to Carlos the concierge who made our first subway trip very easy - this meant a lot to my mum who was very nervous about getting the subway. He told us the easiest way to get down to Battery Park.Special thanks to one of the other men (sorry didnt know his name!) who when we checked out and presented us with the bill kindly took one of the phone bills off that my mum had run up calling her bank back home as a gesture of goodwill.When you spend a lot on a hotel you get the best service without a doubt. It also has a shopping mall below which is really classy. I hope to be lucky enough to come back here again and to NYC!

Outstanding LuxuryThe hotel has exceptional luxury. Marble floors and walls in the washroom, separate shower, large soaking tub, private water closet with bidet extension, paneled doors, exquisite sheets and bedding, variety of pillows, plush carpet, large tv, etc. etc. etc. Great view of the park and city skyline. The restaurants were out of this world including the view. The staff were always attentive, smiling and genuinely willing to assist. They were always watching ready to jump in and aid on directions, elevator door is now open, assistance. I never had to request guidance. However they all were mechanical following a script. I am tired of service people following canned questions and responses especially at the end “is there anything else I can help you with today”. The rooms were made twice daily and exceptionally well. I just don’t understand why they would charge for internet considering what they charge for rooms and other hotels that charge a third of their rate include internet. It’s not the money just the impression of being nickle and dime’d. The spa was outstanding. Full luxury, professional staff and experienced. Don’t miss the spa!! Bottom line, the location and view is worth money. Overall I will be returning to a Mandarin Hotel.

Outstanding suites with amazing views of the park. Our suite was immaculate, beautifully decorated with ceiling to floor windows.Fun bar, great room service and friendly staff.Spa has a wonderful massage.

I stayed here for four nights and it was superb. I honestly cannot fault a thing at this hotel. The staff made us feel at home.The concierge staff were amazingly good and the staff at reception-probably the most efficient I have ever known to be.A perfect stay and I'll definitely be back.

From the minute we got out of our taxi we got treated like royalty, Mandarin Oriental truly know how to spoil their guest, I really liked the fact they reserved the window seats in the lobby bar for hotel guests which had a lovely view of central park.

The Mandarin Hotel is the premiere spot for Manhattan visitors with interest in business and pleasure. The service is spectacular and the atmosphere remarkable. The hotel was completely accommodating on every level, particularly the Concierge (ask for Carlos) and the location was stunning with great access to the best restaurants and museums, as well. All in all, the hotel is hungry to make this your favorite hotel in New York. And they succeed... in a very big way. A stunning hotel.

Probably the best located hotel in the whole NYC.Amazing views! In the center of everything!The service was beyond excellent. The staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful! i stayed on 47th floors and the windows could be opened n your request!

First, Cathy from the front desk and Bill and (Carol?, forgot the name) from concierge were fabulous!!! Exceptional service from Cathy who was very professional and accommodating during check in. However, her manager during that time was kind of unwelcoming and unfriendly. Even both of my parents felt discriminated because perhaps we were not dressed to the nines. My dad requested a suite for 3 nights to which Cathy said it was available for 2 nights only, but when she confirmed it with her manager, the cold manager dismissed her right away and said it was only available for 1 night. The way he responded to her and the fact he did not even acknowledge our request or presence was borderline discriminating and rude. A Motel 6 receptionist would have been friendlier than him.But I'd like to give kudos to the concierge for getting my family of 9 into Peter Luger and Limani at last minute! They were fantastic!

Traveled to NYC on a trip with my mother and stayed at the Mandarin. Amazing from start to finish. Personalized check-in. Great service and customer service from doormen to lobby bar servers. Views from lobby bar are second to none and quite a pampering experience. Rooms are nicely appointed (a bit on the smaller side despite selecting a "suite") but very comfortable beds. Breathtaking views of Central Park from our rooms. Certainly worth repeating a visit to this gem in NYC. If you desire a luxurious stay in New York then this place will not disappoint. Cheers!

Unusual for me not to rate. 5* restaurant with 5 out of 5, but there were little things that disappointed. The setting is stunning, if you can get a table at the window. The staff were professional and pleasant enough but very aloof. Couple of issues with the food, the wife's lobster was overcooked some of it was like chewing rubber. My issue was my desert, chocolate soufflé. When it arrived the ramekin was about 400degrees which probably explains why it was no longer a soufflé but a chocolate cake, don't get me wrong it was still tasty but not by any stretch a soufflé. Now I'm not a big complainer but when the total bill is $345 excl tip I felt I should say something. Which I did, and was told "thanks for the feedback sir" nothing taken of the bill. That's the only reason it's not 5, not what if expect from a 5* restaurant. Disappointed from Scotland

4 night stay in the wonderfully situated Columbus Circle, with spectacular views of Central Park on one side and the Hudson River on the other. Excellent designed rooms, allowed for maximum space for bathroom amenities a very creative solution with all the preferred high end touches. Staff is very helpful, professional and courteous. Highly recommend and will be back.

We stayed 4 nights in the Mandarin, feels little disappointed this hotel is in good location and good service but not great as it price. The room clean and comfortable but quite small. The overall of the hotel just standard can't make us impress.

Took my wife to the Mandarin for our anniversary. A little complicated trying to valet due to traffic but the staff quickly whisked our car and luggage to its appropriate destinations. The room was clean, comfy, big enough and even though it had a partial view of Central Park, still wonderful. The concierge was very helpful. We did eat at the restaurant which was a great experience: the service, food and decor was worth every penny. We are planning to go back and just have dinner!

we stayed 4 nights in the Mandarin with another couple. Both our rooms were of very good quality and spotlessly clean. The housekeeping and turn down service was excellent as was the concierge service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone for either business or pleasure as it is set in the heart of New York just adjacent to Central Park.

The Mandarin Oriental in New York is located next to Central Park at Columbus Circle. It sits proudly in the heart of the city with all that is on offer in this great city, restaurants, shops, transport links.The reception i located on the 35th floor and the hotel goes up from 35 to 50 plus floor.The bar on the 35th is a gathering place especially after a days work and many casually sit enjoy and socialise. The Spa is on the same floor and is reputed to be a great spa with wonderful treatments carefully administered.

My opinion: a very nice hotel. But for a Mandarin Oriental, I had hoped to say an extraordinary hotel.Lobby: situated on the 35th floor. Nice, impressive, nice lounge to have snacks and drinks. Service: okay. Be sure to make a reservation, it is very busy here.Restaurant: great! Had breakfast here 7 days in a row! Special thanks to Aneta and Geraldine (from Belgium, like us :-) ), we had a table at the windows 7 days in a row! Great!!! Service: impeccable! Best to make reservations to have a table with a view!!Rooms: okay. Size great, bathroom needs a bit more shelving to store stuff. Rooms look okay, but no ‘wow’-effect (except from the view!! ) concerning the interior design. Great walk-in dressing. (we had room 4802). One can here every word said in the hallway, so for a 5star, I would definitely change all the doors by soundproof ones. There was construction going on in the room next door, so the noise was horrible. But I understand that a hotel needs to improve, so as long as the noise didn’t start before 8.30, I did not feel the need to complain. Pool: well…. this was a bit of a downer for me. A pool on the 36th floor should / could be breathtaking, but the entire area (dressingrooms, shower, small sauna) looked rather basic. If you compare this to the Mandarin in Paris… The pool is in the basement there, but oh dear! Did that look great there!!!! So here, the 36th floor should give a feeling of extraordinary, super-de-luxe, over-the-top, but well… it didn’t. Changing room: only one shower.My overall impression: perfect location, nice views, but some improvements concerning interior design need to make (yeah, for the people who have read my previous reviews, a love a hotel that leaves me breathless, or where I at least get some ideas if I wanna change my home interior again ;-)).We had lunch one day in the Baccarat hotel one day (recently opened), and well: the interior design there left me speechless for at least 5 minutes (which is long for me, LOL). So if the Mandarin wants to belong to the best, they should go and have a look there (what i didn’t like in the Baccarat by the way, was that there is no view when sitting in their lounge. So the Mandarin has a lot more potential).Would I stay here again? Yes. We have met some very nice staff people here (Aneta, Geraldine, the french guy managing the lobby lounge), and their friendliness is something that sticks! And if you are at reception, and you are being served by an extraordinary handsome guy with the most beautiful eyes one has seen, well, that’s Gabriel. His smile, and the view from the 35th floor, they both made my heart go in overdrive.

Even in the coldest months, this hotel is amazing!!! Service is impeccable and they are always striving to ensure our needs are met. When we had lunch nearby they had the hotel car take us, and when we came back a few months ago they remembered us from our past trip. We had an unfortunate incident with some hangers,however the housekeeping manager contacted us back at home to ensure all was handled to our satisfaction. That was impressive.

Strategically located, it offers a top notch accomodation, with discreet and friendly service, over some of NY's best viewsThe bar - just a couple of stairs bellow the hotel reception - equally ranks to the top NY addresses for a peaceful drink with some of the city's best view

We stayed in the Mandarin Oriental for one week in March and had an amazing time there. Staff was very friendly and very efficient - concierge, reception desk, breakfast room....Our room overlooking Central Park as well as the Hudson River was incredible. Bathroom was very clean, bed comfortable and for NY standards the room was spacious. Enjoyed the hotel thoroughly and would stay there most definitely again.

All spaces are generous and well proportioned, especially the rooms which are also well appointed. Spaces of the spa are a bit disappointing though, and prices are on high side. Size of the hotel is also just right which provides a personalized level of comfort and services.

Had an amazing 3 night trip to NYC and staying at this hotel was just perfect! Great location, right opposite Central Park. As we walked in, they knew who we were and I was wished a happy birthday, which took me by surprise. Our room was perfect, overlooking the Hudson and the sunset which I viewed whilst sat in the bath will always make me smile. The bed was just the most comfortable we have slept in. Nice cocktails in the lounge bar. Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay here again but I can't understand why hotels of this standard still find the need to charge for wi-fi - it should be free.

Despite the fact that it is a very busy hotel in Manhattan, the level of personalized service is much more like one comes to expect in the very finest small boutique hotels. We were upgraded to a gorgeous suite overlooking Central Park. Room service breakfasts are among the best anywhere, and always very promptly served. the Lobby Lounge is our favorite place in New York for either a light meal or an after dinner drink.

Spent a father/daughter weekend for my dads birthday and it was perfect. So important in a very stimulating (!) city like NY to come home to a beautiful, tranquil, luxurious space, to always feel welcome and needs anticipated in such a quiet, gracious way - convinced they're psychic! Having a substantial lap pool in NY was great. The tasting menu with wine pairing overlooking Central Park at sunset? Heaven. If zen-like luxury is your preference, MO Las Vegas, Kuala Lumpur and now New York is highly recommended.

perfect even if expensive hotel. the lobby on the 35th floor is fantastic, service is personnalized and the food is very good.the swiming pool and the gym are perfectly located on the 36th floor with a nice view. Asiate has a great wine list from all over the world.

Excellent experience, exemplary service, great location (across from Central Park), and last, but not least, access to Per Se and Masa (both are next door, you can walk to them from hotel). Easy access to the subway (basically across the street).

Went to NYC for a surprise birthday celebration weekend. The staff was friendly and made us feel like royalty, including the kids. Spacious rooms with breathtaking floor to ceiling views of Central Park and Columbus Circle. Marble and granite bathrooms with large bathrooms, shower, LCD flat panel tvs, twice daily housekeeping, yoga mat. Bathrobes so plush, we contemplated getting dressed, so for breakfast we ordered room service. Everything was amazing, I wish I could duplicate my Bento box breakfast! Our teenage boys brought their Xbox. (I know, but you have to pick your battles...) It was a little more complicated to hook up, a call to the front desk and a tech was at our door in minutes. Easily hooked up the device and to make sure it was working properly, played a quick game of COD with my boy...

Lived up to its 5 star brand. I was there for business. The location was fantastic, right in front of Central Park. The view from Asiate restaurant every morning was awesome. The breakfast sets were good! Room was amazing, bathroom was clean and big. Loved everything about it.

Had my first stay in Mandarin Oriental NY for business. A quick 2 day trip. Very impressive hotel, staff & service. Highly recommend it!! The check in, lounge, business services and food was excellent!

I decided to stay at the Mandarin oriental in NYC because I have had such great experiences at MO in SF and LV. First of all the staff were fantastic and helpful. The food was great. AMEX ameneties were excellent. I was very disappointed with the room though. It was not the small size of the room (as i was expecting that in NYC), but rather the outdated decor. The carpets were worn, the wallpaper ugly, the hallways dark... etc. I expected much better for the price. I wont be staying here again.

First visit this year and hotel continues to provide outstanding service. Danielle at the from desk gets a shout out for great service. Dining and in-dining experience were outstanding as was the spa. Laundry service was flawlessly.

Service was actually slow and disappointing. Best part was the incredible view from the 35 floor on CPW and nyc. I still highly recommend the place. Especially for breakfast. It is expensive. Special experience.
user_name:
badbaruch57
New York City, New York

review_body: Had the occasion to bed down for the night at Mandarin, and the service, start to finish, couldn't have been better. Staff is amazing, intuitive and friendly, food and drink superb; try the salmon omelet for breakfast, and a late-night drink in the bar off to the right of the main bar/lounge. I don't stay in NYC often, but this place will draw me back for certain.

The luxurious retreat next to Central Park. Great view of the park and extreme refinement suites. Only concern, is breakfast, we preferred to take brunches in typical New York locations.This huge hotel is very popular with tourists "chic" and businessmen. We were quite satisfied. We enjoyed.

Stayed here for 3 nights under AMEX fine hotel rates with one night complementary. Good sized room facing Hudson River. Large bathrooms and comfortable king bed. This hotel is not the newest but is well kept. One minor complaint about the room is the docking station for the B & W speaker... With the world all using iPhone 5 and 6, the hotel lacks the Lightning plug. I also failed to play music on my iPhone on the AV system despite using my USB cable. Otherwise the room is great.What sets this hotel apart from others is the legendary mandarin oriental service. All staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgable. Rooms are serviced twice daily and even on the day of check out ( which I got extented till 6pm) my room was cleaned and serviced that morning.Breakfast at Asiate is excellent. American breakfast is included. I also had a dinner there with my clients one evening. At $95 for a 3 course menu, I thought it was good value and the food was delicate and excellent. I also had a chance to use the gym and sauna. It isn't big buy adequate. The pool is around 20m good for lapping only as it is quite small. I would recommend this hotel to the demanding traveller who wants a place like home in NYC.

Nicely located, top service, nothing oriental about it - and a funny reception on the 35th floor blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah

this was my 3rd or 4th visit & it always gets better & better. i was upgraded to a great park view room! i would like to single out, Rebecca from room service, who accommodated some special requests that i had. all done with speed & style!

We have stayed at the Mandarin many times and have had some very good experiences and some not so good. Our last trip was unfortunately very poor and as a result will be our last stay.The level of service that we experienced was just not consistent with a five star hotel at this price point.We had three service issues on this stay. First, one of our rooms were not available until after 3:00 (my understanding of check in time). This was somewhat disruptive to our plans and we didn't even hear an apology. Second, we ordered food at the lounge and had to wait an hour after we ordered to get any food. It was not at a busy time of day. We did at least get an apology for that delay. Third, we were treated quite rudely by a manager upon checkout which is just inexcusable.The hotel does have fantastic views and the rooms are very well appointed and stylish.Unfortunately service is inconsistent and at least for our last stay was quite poor.

If you booked a room four months in advance and paid over $600 for a room at the Mandarin Oriental, would you think you would get a room that has a view of the roof and a wall!!!!!If the Garden Rooms have an obstructed view, tell me. I could have chosen a better room. This is insulting!!!Do not stay here!!!

this hotel should be ranked first. The expansive views, the prompt guest services et al make this my favorite property. The Hong Kong flagship isn't even near the preview of such beautiful and undeniable energy. You can view atop the time warner center the verve and energy of the capital of the world.The rooms are nicely appointed and modern, not such a drab a la st. Regis !! This is a excellent property with close proximity to major adventure in the city. Fendi is a 9 minute walk away!!

We attended a gala at this beautiful hotel -- and the property lived up to it's name -- without question! The food was delicious and the service was perfect. The small touches and floral arrangements made all the difference. It clearly was all planned to the very last detail -- coat check was simple and seamless -- A+
user_name:
Swamee
New York City, New York

review_body: We don't often write reviews - only when a property absolutely exceeds expectations - our last review was in 2013 for Jays Paris.On 24-Feb we completed our first (of now soon to be many) 5 nights stay at the Mandarin Oriental New York.5-Star luxury - Indeed. Stellar accommodations. True attention to detail. Laser-like focus and follow through ensuring absolute guest satisfaction. Superb food and drinks. Perfect location (Lincoln Center & Theater district nearby). Subway close. Diverse shopping/dining adjacent. Breathtaking Columbus Circle/Central Park views.Our sincerest thanks to Diandra and the entire Mandarin team for all their efforts to ensure our stay was, indeed, the stuff of which fond memories are made.When in New York treat yourself to THE very best - the Mandarin Oriental New York.

After the first 5 minutes of check in, I had decided not to stay at this hotel ever again. By the end of my experience, I wondered if I should try out the DC branch when I'm there in April to see if they are just as excellent. Check in: Awful. AMEX botched things and did not reserve me two beds. I was there for the NBA All-Star game with my little sister. The hotel was booked. There were only single beds. At over 1,000 a night I was not happy. The bellman twisted my handmade scarf from Buenos Aires in the wheel. This is an accident. I understand that. I am not THAT unreasonable. Fix: A day later we were offered a room with two beds as there was a cancellation. I was surprised they followed up and frankly did not want to leave our room but my sister wanted her own bed. The next morning my scarf which the hotel offered to clean arrived exactly when they said it would at my room freshly dry cleaned. The botch was AMEX and the scarf was an accident. I was a bit grumpy as I had just come from a long flight from LA and my body was in shock from the cold but the staff did not miss a beat and responded with only understanding (I'm sure they wondered if I was some big diva), professionalism, and kindness.Room: First room was Hudson view king bed: Cute view. The room was on the penultimate floor and so no noise issues. The decor is modern traditional. The tv should be updated to a flat screen up against the wall. The furniture is dated but tasteful and appeals to the more traditional. The room is well stocked with Fiji water which is given in abundance throughout the stay. I like this a lot because I feel hotels at this price level should not skimp on bottled water which many do. The internet was free but I don't know if that is because of AMEX or everyone gets free wifi. I hope everyone does. It wasn't the strongest connection but not the worst. The bathroom was large double sink for this room. Single sink for the room with two beds that we moved to later. The bathroom was stocked with toothbrush, shaving items, red envelope bath salts (I asked housekeeping for extra and took them home. Yes, I am that person. I also took a pair of slippers). There is a nail kit and complimentary shoe shining. I used the shoe shining service and thought they did a decent job. Housekeeping is very good. In the 2 bed room, I noticed dust around the edges of the wall. Sorry, I look at detail. The 2 bed room was on a different floor. Overall, I loved the larger room and thought the smaller room was adequate. The turn down service was twice a day and a newspaper was delivered daily. I rarely made it home before the morning paper delivery. What happens in New York, stays in New York. haha. I noticed the second room was noisier and the view as not as nice but this was the room my sister requested. Lobby: Friendly staff that seemed to care in a way that appeared genuine and not fake. Bell service: Extremely friendly staff. I talked to many of them.Room service: Extremely friendly staff. Notice, attitude goes a long way for me. First floor security as you are leaving: Not as friendly until they realized I was a guest. I don't like that kind of behavior. At an establishment like this, everyone guests and non guests should be treated the same with the exception of reservations of course. LolLobby restaurant: My sister didn't want to go out V day night. She went to bed and I had a glass of wine alone sitting next to Queen Latifah. The restaurant lobby remembers you and even called me doctor (I'm a physician). I didn't need that but it was cool that somehow they knew. I didn't tell them. They knew my last name. The head guy would come talk to me and joke around even though they were swamped. Apparently, I am considered a low maintenance guest. Most people would consider me....particular. This speaks I think more to the clientele that the Mandarin hosts and their commitment to providing the best service to all guests. I thought the food was OK. My sister loved her burger. I had some salmon dish that was new with egg on it that I didn't think was the best. I didn't find it to be a great value but I loved the fact that as a guest I was always seated even without a reservation and near the window. I also liked the ambiance and I found the drinks to be good. I wish they served Justin Cab. It might be low brow for some of you snobs but I like it and I think it's good to have a decent but not overly priced wine on the by the glass menu. I can't knock the lounge down because I loved the staff and ambiance. Main restaurant: The restaurant Asai also remembered me daily. They set me at a table both times overlooking the skyline. The fresh squeezed grapefruit juice was delicious. The staff was excellent. Sometimes the kitchen was a bit slow but I was having a leisurely time so I did not mind. I would recommend if you are having a power breakfast letting them know your time constraints. They seemed to be used to accommodating particular people. Don't worry, I didn't do anything drastic but I overheard other patrons and the staff did not miss a beat. Breakfast was free for me due to my AMEX but I thought it was a good value even if it weren't. Bar: I didn't go to it. I kept wanting to be in the lobby. Business center: This is the best business center I have ever seen. I went at night and it was quiet and free printing. I didn't really use it but I love anything free. During the day, I went and the lady said oh its 30 minutes complimentary. I recommend going at night I guess. That seems a bit silly at this price point but there is someone in the center during the day to help you fax or whatever. There is a private room you can rent out for meetings. I think this should be free. They have prices for paper and so forth but again I didn't pay for anything so wondering if that's enforced. Overall excellent and a true business center unlike at many hotels were it is an after thought off the lobby. Gym: Small but adequate. Nice water. Gets crowded.Pool: Serene environment. I wish the water were a tad warmer. I couldn't tell but I think it was chlorine. I prefer salt water pools. Gym/Pool changing room: As good as any changing room at a luxury spa. Was pleasantly surprised by this and there is a sauna as well. Spa: Sadly, this was the low point for me. I had a massage at over 200 bucks. The therapist was late, spent a lot of time prepping and closing i.e. not massaging me yet charged me for the 50 min or 60 min that it was scheduled for. I couldn't believe it. She also was not as pleasant as the rest of the hotel staff had been. I told you I'm all about attitude. I love spas and tried this one but next time would see how the Peninsula's experience is. The spa amenities shampoos etc were all adequate. There was a small pool with a massage chair that Ive seen at the Four Seasons in Geneva which sadly I did not have time to use. I pretty much had my massage, was disgusted and left. I will leave this same review on trip advisor for the spa alone but wanted to leave it here so those looking at the hotel know. I should state that if you aren't used to going to spas you will probably think the experience is wonderful. For those who enjoy trying spas throughout the world I would give this one a B -. Surroundings:Central Park, Whole Foods, Mall with expensive items, Restaurants, Arts nearby. Not in the middle of Times Square but enough going on in the neighborhood. Of course, I loved just being at the hotel. Check out: Let's just say I left my wallet somewhere (uber) and had no id or money to get back to LA. The Mandarin booked me a car (yes they charged me 200 bucks), called the airline and got me to the airport quickly. They printed out my folio and I presented this and some mail that I had on me to TSA and after being patted down and probed I was allowed on. I am also TSA pre-check so that probably helped. Disaster and I'm still waiting for my wallet from uber but that's another story. The point was that the Mandarin went above and beyond when I was in a bind. The head manager and his team are truly excellent. If you have stayed at the one in London, I think the service is better at this one but that may be a cultural difference. The decor is entirely different and it appears each one is unique to the local environment. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to wow someone, treat yourself or a loved one, or have a company pay for your business trip. This is a great place for all types of travelers. I think it is expensive but worth the price point.

My husband and I spent (a very expensive) Valentine's Day Weekend here. No doubt this is a beautiful hotel with tremendous views of Central Park (and the Trump Tower which blocks part of the view). The room amenities are luxurious - from a large bathroom with both a soaking tub to a chaise positioned in front of the large window. We only left once all weekend to get sushi nearby. For the rest of the weekend we enjoyed the spa, room service, and Asiate. I'll be back!
user_name:
ZuzziTravels
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel had all the amenities you want, and in the best area. Its beautiful, and clean. The staff was amazing! If you're looking for 5star accommodations then this is the hotel for you. You wont be disappointed! Make sure to get a view of the park; and if you don't mind heights then you'll be amazed on the higher floors!

Service is above and beyond even the Plaza or other luxury hotels. Concierge (Kenny) is incredible. Got me a last-minute Per Se reservation, and the Per Se staff bent over backwards to accommodate our theater needs. I felt that would not have happened without the hotel concierge. Staff is fabulous, except for some here and there, but as I said, much better than other luxury hotels. One caveat most people might not realize -- its location connected to Time Warner building is such that through a separate, 3rd floor entrance, one can access a large shopping mall that has Whole Foods on the basement floor and a fabulous coffee/pastry shop on the 3rd floor. That makes it very convenient to "get stuff" and not wanting to deal w/ restaurants. Speaking of restaurants, its location is within a couple of blocks of two Michelin-3 star restaurants and a 2-star restaurant, and the concierge will likely help you get those reservations if you discuss w/ them in advance after you book the hotel. There is even a complimentary car service to the theaters if you plan in advance. In the winter in freezing cold evenings, these were fantastic amenities in NYC.

elegant, understated luxury, front desk and bell staff very helpful breathtaking view from our room including the bathroom and from tha bar and restaurant. best location to start our honey moon in NY.

My husband and I booked a room at the MO NY when we were attending a wedding nearby. We arrived five minutes before check-in and our room was not ready. They offered to comp us a drink while we waited. But we planned to get a late lunch so my husband said we'd return afterwards assuming that would be enough time to get into our room. She then offered to comp us lunch if we would consider eating at their lounge/bar. This lounge has a beautiful view of Manhattan and Central Park so why not? We had a leisurely lunch with one appetizer, a sandwich each and three drinks a piece (all fantastic). About an hour in, we received the keys to our room and were told again lunch was their pleasure. We left a tip for the waitress and walked out. They didn't bat an eye. The room was perfect - spacious, quiet, comfortable bed, soft towels and a beautiful bathroom. We had a great time. When checking out, the manager was called over. He apologized again for the delay with our room. Lunch was compensation enough and this was above and beyond. The best hotel and the best in customer service. And another great experience at the Mandarin Oriental (we've stayed at two of their other locations).

We come to NY at least once a year for the marathon and always, always stay here for obvious reasons. The service is top notch and this hotel really boasts the most beautiful views of New York and Central Park! Would definitely book a park view room and a table at Asiate (fine dining restaurant) before you arrive, as they go fast especially for dinner. The concierge service is world class, getting you anything and everything you need. Year before last, I asked them for Shake Shack burgers to be set up in my room post-marathon and they sent a runner especially to the upper west side store to grab the burgers. They were still hot when we arrived!Proximity to the finish line : The Mandarion Oriental one of the closes hotels to the finish line. Making the painful journey home post-marathon, just slightly tolerable. The cab ride to the departure buses by the public library on 5th is also just 5-10 minutes. Also if not for the marathon, its just 10 minutes taxi to the majority of the interesting places (Times Square, 5th Ave, Grand Central) and 15-20 minutes to more hipster places in Little Italy, China Town, Lower East, Soho, Tribeca... Services : As I mentioned the concierge is excellent. Also service at the bars/restaurants is worthy of praise. Hotel guests have priority seating in their lobby lounge, which can become quite the tourist attraction on weekends. The hotel thoughtfully privides every marathoner guest with a goody bag filled with energy gels, bars, drinks, bananas, balms and a t-shirt. There is also a table stocked full of energy drinks and fruits the morning-of.Restaurants : Asiate! Oh Asiate, what can I say except that I love you ? (cf. Asiate review... )Spa : I don't recall getting a spa treatment myself but friends have said that it is very, very nice with hammam and sauna facilities. The pool is beautiful and located on a high floor, separate from the spa (which is lobby level).

I have always wanted to give the Mandarin Oriental a try and recently had the pleasure of a three nights stay. The hotel is understated luxury in current soft muted tones. The front desk is discreet while being warm and welcoming. The bell staff & doormen always friendly and willing to be of assistance. Hotel is conveniently located by the Columbus Circle Metro stop. Room service was prompt, hot & delicious. The lobby bar is a wonderful place to catch one's breath and take in the stunning views of Central Park - drinks & small bite plates were tasty. Room was clean and all details were well thought of. Thank you Mandarin Oriental for living up to my expectations!

Since the doorman open our taxi from the airport until the minute we checked out everything was flawless, service was impeccable, the room super comfortable with everything you need. The location is unbeatable. I will definitely come back to stay here. i was 4 nights for business and loved it. The only critic i have is the exhuberant prices at the spa. 350 to 400 usd for a Massage is a bit excessive so i skipped it.

Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on business and was very impressed by this trendy, upscale hotel. The decor is crisp, clean and very chic. Our last night staying here we had a black tie event in their stunning ballroom with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Manhattan, absolutely breathtaking. I'd love to be able to stay at the Mandarin Oriental again and hope to relish in one of their relaxing spa treatments.

We've been staying at this marvelous hotel for over four years and it feels like our 2nd home. We travel with a small Maltese dog and she is always most welcome and very much a part of the experience.

My daughter and I spent a long weekend here. I have stayed here many times over the years. It has long been my favorite hotel in NYC. Fantastic location. Exceptional design. I particularly love the suites. Staff is wonderful. Unfortunately, my latest stay was marred somewhat by a bar mitzvah in the lobby & lobby lounge. Luxury isn't returning to your hotel after a long day in the city and walking into someone else's party. I realize some people are just too important to use a hotel's dedicated party facilities, but this really is a show of contempt toward the regular guests. A top hotel should not allow it. If this was just a one-time occurrence, I could overlook it, but on another stay the hotel hosted a dignitary whose security over-ran the lobby. There were goons with ear pieces everywhere. Guests were forced to show room keys before they could use the elevators. It was like being at the airport. This hotel is great in so many ways, but I think they need to warn guests in advance if there will be these sorts of intrusions.

From the friendly welcome from the porters at the door to the turn down service in the evening, this hotel is sheer perfection. The views of Central Park on a crisp winter morning are enough to get even the laziest person out of bed and the cuisine in their Asiate restaurant is just to die for. If you can, make time for the indoor pool with awesome skyline views. Perfectly located on the corner of Broadway and central park this is the most convenient location for tourists.

I had an awesome weekend at this hotel for the wife's birthday. I took advantage (once again) of the Amex's Fine Hotel and Resorts perks. We were able check in early and got an upgrade to a higher floor and got the City View room, which was stunning. As we returned to our room after lunch, we found a surprise chocolate birthday cake waiting for us courtesy of the hotel! Location is great, as we are near the Time Warner building which is actually annexed to the hotel. Had a wonderful dinner at the hotel's Asiate Restaurant. We were able to get the private party room (had 8 people total) and had magnificent views of the city. The highlight of the trip, however, was the spa, which is what they are known for. I booked the couples spa package and had the best spa experience in their private spa room with a jacuzzi! One of the most expensive hotels I've ever stayed in but if you have some Benjamins to burn for a special occasion, you can't go wrong staying at this fabulous hotel.

If staying 37th floor and above is a comfortable for you and large swimming pool is of important benefit , if you like hight tech and Central Park area you would probably call MONY best hotel in NYC. Everything is there. Stylish high tech lobby , excellent Asiate restaurant and bar lounge with great park views. Good spa with large pool. Both Central Park and Hudson River rooms have nice panoramic views and are made in an authentic Chinese style. Be aware of slight street noise from Columbus Circle even at high floors but that's sort of the problem at most hotels in that area.

We held our quarterly board meeting at the Mandarin Oriental NY and it was perfect! Guest rooms were beautiful and extremely clean (I'm very picky about that). We held our meeting in the boardroom and Lotus East & West rooms and set up was perfect. The AV and wifi connections were also perfect. Food was very well presented and tasted amazing. We have signed contracts to have our remaining 2015 board meetings at this hotel.

This is an expensive place, no doubt, but NYC is full of expensive hotels. With the rising prices come the rising expectations, as in - if you are going to charge these prices, you better deliver. This hotel delivers. The service is super efficient while at the same time friendly and personal. At every service point we were met with staff people that were obliging and left no stone unturned to make sure our experience was excellent. It's an unusual set up, to have the lobby on the 35th floor, but you do feel like you have left the hustle and bustle of the city behind and entered a quiet sanctuary. The views are just great, the food and drinks served with a smile and uniformly good; the housekeeping excellent. Again, it's what you should expect at these prices but that does not always mean you get it. Here, you do. And the spa - simply the best. Super pricey yes, but superb. My one complaint - I think they charged $15 per day for wifi which just seems silly and irritating at a place like this.

We stayed at Mandarin for 3 nights in December 2014. It was my birthday, so my husband decided to make it special, so we choose Mandarin. From the very beginning, it was a really nice stay. The room and the view to Goodson and Central park was just amazing! Check in was smooth and fast, the staff presented a cool panda toy to our child. She was happy!Concierge service was just brilliant they found us a place in no time in a great steakhouse on 25th of December!On the day of my birthday we wanted to have dinner at Asiana restaurant, but when we returned to the hotel it appeared that the restaurant was closing at 9pm, which was really disappointing for us! We considered it strange that the 5star hotel restaurant closes so early. Moreover, honestly I expected that the hotel would congratulate me with my birthday with at least a card, which was one more disappointment of the day. Again, the Concierge team had found for us cozy Italian restaurant, close to Central park, which was ok, but shame we couldn’t enjoyed the city view, having birthday dinner at Mandarin.

The view from the bar is incredible, make sure you try it in the day and at night, the city looks different both times. We spent hours playing "spot the film" with landmarks, parks and avenues - what a great place

We had a lovely anniversary weekend stay at the NY Mandarin Oriental--in Hudson view river room, floor 50, very comfortable king bed. Beautiful, large enough room, lushly appointed with soft, Asian-fusion décor. Deep bathtub (did fit 2) under a window and lovely rainshower shower. Fitness facility was a bit small but had great high tech equipment. No time for swimming but would have loved to spend time in the indoor pool. Were delighted to find a delicious chocolate mousse cake with a Happy Anniversary delivered to our room the first evening. Drinks at the MO bar and dinner at Asiate were outstanding (with more complimentary mousse cake). Columbus circle and the Time Warner building (mall) turned out to be a wonderful location. Of course, the price tag for all this is very very high -room, meals, drinks, spa are priced for people who don't look at the price. (But the hotel does not feel pretentious like some other luxury properties.) Still, for a very special treat, we enjoyed it.
user_name:
Laughingcat1421
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: On the 35th floor of this magnificent hotel we had afternoon tea, a present from our children. It was fabulous. Scones, sandwiches but not as we know them, cakes, champagne and earl grey tea. The views were superb and the staff attentive and efficient. A good experience.

We enjoyed cocktails here over New Years , the service was excellent and Martinis out of this world. There was not the usual rush you can get in some places in New York and the atmosphere was relaxed and trendy.The view from the 35th floor over Columbus Circle and Central Park were stunning in the clear winter sunshine!So if you fancy a drink with a view why not check it out, the food that wpe saw looked great too as you would expect of this level of hotel

Located at Coulumbus Circle the Mandarin is at te SW corner of Central Park and in the same building as an upscale mall with some excellent restaurants. Service at the hotel was excellent. The restaurant has wonderful 35th floor views of Central Park. Rooms are marvelously appointed and the bathrooms were huge. MOMA is not far away along with Fifth Avenue. No problems and we would book again.
user_name:
edward w
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: From the doorman, to the front desk, to the lobby restaurant staff, to housekeeping, to the concierge and management - everyone is a top professional whose sole goal is to provide a best-in-class customer experience! I've been coming here since the hotel opened 10+ years ago and never been disappointed. When you check in, complimentary tea and a sweet are delivered to your room (be sure to request as it may no longer be offered automatically). Enjoying the high-priced wonton soup and bento box steamed dumplings at the lobby bar are worth it and a must every time I'm here. Note, the soup is served with a side of spicy sauce to add on your own (careful, it's very hot). The rooms are beautiful and comfortable and have great bathrooms. If you can splurge for a suite, it's a real treat but may deplete your bank account. Also, it's located in the Time-Warner building where there are great shop, restaurants, Boulud bakery with best oatmeal raisin cookies and jazz venues. Fabulous! I'm always saving to be able to stay here because it's worth it and so am I!,

Stayed here in November for work trip. NY is not usually a place I get a decent night's sleep but the Mandarin Oriental has changed that (at a price). My room on 51st floor was completely silent and had great view of Central Park and the skyline.Pluses: quiet! great bed, excellent water pressure to fill the tub 51 floors up. Excellent service-upon arrival was craving coffee and they delivered a pot at no charge. After explaining that I needed to work very late then they brought a coffee maker to room so I could make my own when it suited. Awkward - power cord did not reach most outlets where machine could be on a desk or counter that fit. Coffee was delivered in a bowl with filters separately. Housekeeping: Get some Nespresso machines! Great location at Columbus Circle so can walk to many great shops and restaurants.Minuses: hotel hallway on my floor smelled like smoke and there was a fan running in hallway the entire time I stayed there. Pet peeve: was unable to turn off bedside reading light without getting out of bed. Hotel address is not where cars drop off.
