Driver of car services had difficulty finding entrance without explicitly spelling out how to find it. Astronomically expensive but worth the splurge for the great quiet room and stellar view of Central Park.

We visited New York for the US Open, it was my first time in New York as well as my first time with a Mandarin Oriental. I was so excited for this trip and I hate to say that the hotel was awful. First the front desk was very disorganized,scrambling to find our reservation, they placed us in the wrong room, and had continual deliveries, of food platters, champagne, thank you notes addressed to what I can only imagine to be the people that were suppose to have our room. The trays then were left in the room along with empty water bottles, and bottles we had consumed for days, finally removed when they literally began to mold and I asked for them to be removed. They emptied our garbage bins twice in 6 days, once after having asked to do so. The service staff were so loud, and at all hours of the day from 5am-5pm banging the doors to both the service room (which was across from our room) and other guest rooms, even after calling at 5:30am to the front desk complaining that the staff have woken us up with the slamming of the doors and their ongoing chatting right outside our room, it still continued the rest of our trip. The bell men and hotel staff were very cold and unwelcoming after seeing them for 5 days in a row there was never any attempt from any hotel staff to address you by name or give any form of personalized service. Given the caliber of hotel this is I was very very disappointed and would not stay with them again. It is a great location with amazing views, and our suite was beautiful, when it was clean

I normally stay with family at the ritz when in new York for our annual shopping excursion, eschewed the ritz and stayed with my best friend at this hotel. Completely sublime and modern. They chauffeured us to the airport in a house Bentley and booked our airfare. I was extremely sick and wanted to get home. Most certainly will stay again. Completely professional.

Amazing from start to finish. The team in New York are superb. Didn't meet a single member of staff with anything other than the highest standard of customer car, service and professionalism The breakfast in Asiatr was the best I have ever experienced. A wonderful relaxing experience to start each day off with and thebest possible standard of food and service served in their beautiful main small intimate dining room. A stunning restaurant too with great views over the park. Breakfast is often a poor experience even in luxury hotels. It is thelasting impression of a hotel and really important. Mandarin treat breakfast like they are serving a high quality dinner ....freshly squeezed orange juice.... Fresh fruit smoothies..... High quality espresso coffees.....artisan breads ..... Freshly cooked breakfasts to order using the highest quality ingredients. And for those that prefer a buffet option they also offer a separate high quality buffet option in the lobby lounge ...The hotel is expensive ....however great value for money when the service levels are taken into consideration The service at this hotel during our stay was as good As if not better than the luxurious small cruise ships like Seabourn ....and they are fantastic too! .... Other hotels should look at mandarin for tips on customer service ....simply superb. Many thanks Special mention to Bill on the concierge. .....going the extra mile to help customers enjoy their stay and have the best possible experience If you have any issues at all ,et the staff know whilst you are they. ....as they will put it right and want you to have the most fantastic experience staying at the hotelThe rooms are nice .good size with a great view of the park ..the shower pressure is the best I have ever Experienced in a hotel ....i fully recommend this hotel to everyone . They will surpass even the highest of expectations.

Because of problems with BA at Heathrow, we didn't arrive at the hotel until 2 am in the morning but had a nice greeting from the reception staff, although check-in took a while and we were all so tired. My family and I all had suites with Park or River views and they were excellent, with well equipped bathrooms and the best ever bath robes. After a day or two, I noticed the paintwork on the wardrobes was very shabby and that the carpet was stained in places and I think some of the rooms are in need of need repainting. The bar is very pleasant, with great views and it is the only place to sit and relax apart from the rooms. The waiting staff were excellent, but the female Greeters could be a little abrupt. High prices for drinks - to be expected there. We had a wonderful family Christmas lunch in the private room attached to the Asiate restaurant - our only gripe was that the room was cold and nothing could be done that day to warm it up. Lovely staff, especially Ivana, who coped well with the heating of our Christmas Pudding, even bringing brandy to pour on it!! We were impressed with Kenny, Head Concierge who was most helpful with our queries/requests.  I don't think I would stay at the Mandarin Oriental NYC again - the standard of rooms, service etc. is not up to the MO Hong Kong for instance.

This luxury hotel combines the ideal location in Columbus circle, close from Central Park and most museums, shops etc, and the perfect style : service is top rated, friendly and efficient, the view from the reception is wonderful, the rooms are almost perfect (we had connecting rooms, very well equipped and comfortable). The have in indoor large and quiet swimming pool where you can really swim (not much frequentation when we were there, despite the hotel was full). Nothing to add, we'll come back right there.

This hotel has a great location, it's right next to Columbus Circle and Cental Park. We enjoyed the proximity to the mall, you're able to access it without going outside- which is nice when it's raining or snowing out! The service at this hotel was top notch. The employees were friendly, helpful and very knowledgable of the area. We stayed in a top floor room with park views and we were very impressed. The views included the park, Columbus Circle and the 2 new mega residential towers that are being built downtown. The room was clean, comfortable and the size was adequate. The room would have been perfect, but the pillows provided were not to my liking- they were too soft and flat. Next time we visit the city, we will be staying here again!

The type of service that you should expect from a five star New York hotel, rooms a little small but that appears to be the norm in this city. Spacious and well equipped bathroom, beatifully fitted out. The staff from the door staff, receptionists, concierge, restaurant managers and housekeeping were totally professional. My only quibble - why bother charging for wifi at such a high end hotel.

All that you would expect from this hotel and a level of service that you would expect. The spa is the best in the city and that is not an understatement.Best views of the park available and Mo Bar next to the lobby serves delicious drinks.

The location of this hotel cannot be any better. Even on cold rainy or snowy days the convenience of the mall next door cannot be beaten. Great gym and spa. The only NEGATIVE is that the rooms are on the smallish side and a little bit dark

This was my second visit to this hotel in a year and I still think the location is very convenient and the service up to the chain standard. Front desk and concierge always at the top (very attentive and efficient in all circumstances)The rooms are nevertheless smallish and some of the room features probably need changing or maintenance (eg difficult to keep the room temperature constant, some minor issues with hot water that took ages to flow). The main issue my room had was the noise coming from the elevator shaft during the night especially on the weekend which I found just bearable. Get a room far away from the elevator doors and you will not have issues.I'll definitely go back but next time I may consider alternatives (which I did not in the past)

As I have not the financial assets to stay at this winderful place, I can only talk about the lobby lounge on the 35th floor. Here you find the most perfect hospitality imaginable. From a warm welcome to the courteous and utmost professional service and fine drinks and food, one cannot expect more. It is all in all a superb experience. Alone the view and the atmosphere of this very special place is worth the visit. Expect to pay a little extra, but it is truly worth it!

This Hotel is absolutely wonderful. I was there on business, and the accommodation were superb. It's right in he middle of everything. Right next to Lincoln Center. There is a huge Apple Store steps away. Best Buy is right across the street. There is plenty of good NY food within va very short walking distance. There are multiple convenience stores that sell everything around the location. One of those stores is literally attached to the hotel. The rooms are luxurious, the views are great, the service is wonderful, and the price is fair for the quality and ambience you will be surrounded by...AA + in my book!

Best hotel in the NYC. Absolutely relaxing, great service, rooms, service. Connection to the mall and whole foods beneath is amazing, can just stroll around in a t shirt and get to all those places. Inside room it's like an oasis. Incredible place. I got 3 nights for the price of 2, so reasonable value.

Stayed here for one night in Nov 2014 before boarding the 2-night inaugural of the new RCL Ship, Quantum of the Seas. The staff are very friendly and even though my friend and I only had a small roller board each, the doorman insisted on escorting us up to the check-in desk/lobby on the 30th-something floor and then to our room. Front desk staff were very accommodating and from the lobby there is a great view over Columbus Circle and to Central Park south. Our room was on the 50th-something floor looking south. Could see part of the Hudson River as well. The room was nice with 2 beds (as we'd requested) and was in good condition but certainly didn't have the WOW factor that I thought might have come with a $977 price tag. The bathroom was a good size with separate tub and shower and enclosed WC but the lighting wasn't great at the mirror I thought. There was a TV in the bathroom mounted to the wall but neither of us could figure out how to turn it on. We didn't eat at the Mandarin (why eat in the hotel when Manhattan is at your doorstep?) so went to our fav Italian place across from Carnegie Hall called Trattoria Dell'Arte (you HAVE to have the thin crust pizza here - see pic below)!We stopped into the hotel lobby bar for a nightcap when we got back. Service was okay but drinks are as expensive as you'd imagine. Bar and lounge were packed and you can't get a table near the window unless you reserve it. Bar snacks were good.Overall a nice property but for the amount of time you spend in your room in NYC, I'd stay elsewhere/cheaper next time.Oh PS - you are offered complimentary tea in the Spa (if you'd like) after check-in. We didn't go because I'm sure all they want to do is sell you on their service.

The best hotel in NYC, the staff incredible. We forgot our camera in the room and upon our return to DC called the Mandarin, they retrieved it and overnighted to us, terrific service Highly recommend.

Beautiful hotel. Brilliant staff. Top marks all around. Lovely location near the park and shops. Great views. Definitely a high recommend for both business and personal travel all year round. Great rooftop indoor pool.

The Mandarin Oriental has always been a top notch hotel; whether in Bangkok or Paris and New York was no exception. The minute you stepped out of your cab at the front door you are greeted with a warm welcome and luggages are immedaitely taken care off. Everything throughout our stay was service with a smile and prompt... as to be expcted when you pay top dollar for a stay here. The hotel is adjacent to the Time Warner Centre so shops are plentiful. Across the main road is Central Park. 8th Ave and 5th ..are all within walking distance. Great location as well in my view. Breakfast on the 35th level has a great view of Columbus Circle and Central Park.

I liked this hotel, but felt that it was all a bit too much and lacked some atmosphere. It's definitely top notch when it comes to service but I do prefer other Mandarin Oriental hotels. The biggest negative for me was the small and dark room - but this is to be expected in NYC I guess. My room overlooked part of the Hudson and was a bit bland compared to the views over central park that some of the other rooms have. The food was excellent and staff very helpful and friendly.

Quite simply, no one does it better than MO. Top notch service, great property and convenient location. Will definitely stay again. The tastings and wine pairings offering in Asiate was outstanding and enjoyable.

This property comes as close to perfection in NYC as any hotel I've stayed with. The location/views are outstanding. The staff were all exceptionally helpful and above all they make this hotel special, of course the only name I remember is Danielle at the front desk during check out so she gets a shout out. . The food was amazing, including room service. Of course it's not inexpensive but if you want to experience the best in NYC, it's worth the visit.

we stayed in this hotel as part of my 50th birthday celebrations last month and really enjoyed the quality location and service of the concierge hereThe hotel enjoys a great position on the corner of the Central Park and close by to 5th Avenue. The upgrade to a Park facing room and higher floor was very much appreciated and the iews incredibleThe complimentary concierge hotel car is a great perk for short journeys around the hotel and the selection of drivers they have in larger Esplanade cars very useful for the longer journeys in more comfort than the grubby city yellow taxis with little legroom The reception bar provides a beautiful backdrop to the city and full height windows make this a very popular and busy meeting point in the hotelI still regret not having tried the hotel pool and spa which looked amazing but hopefully will do so on a return visit Well done team a really enjoyable stay
user_name:
DGYSY
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The Mandarin is a top flight NYC hotel; the room rates are priced accordingly. The hotel is in a modern building just off central park. It has the same quality as other Mandarin Oriental hotels and the service to match. The rooms are neatly appointed and have quality bedding, towels, etc. However, being NYC the rooms are tight. (It's more like the compact Mandarin Oriental San Francisco as opposed to the spacious Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas). The hotel restaurants are of high quality, though they have a New York City feel with regard to the service. It lacks a bit of the warmth and polish you will find at the Mandarin in Miami, Atlanta or Las Vegas. This isn't so much the hotel, as a regional difference.The spa is also compact but has great service and nice treatments. It's a "bright" spa as opposed to others which have more muted lighting. There is a small gym. It's adequate to get in a workout. There is also a lap pool which is a nice (and rare) amenity in the heart of the city.The concierge desk was quite helpful. Cars to the airport are quite pricey - you're probably better off with uber.

With the exception of the view/location, this hotel should be classified as 3 stars hotel. poor service, expensive breakfast, room poorly decorated. very disapointed compared to other Mandarin Oriental Hotels around the world.

I was on business event in this hotel and the interior is just amazing. The hotel is on one of the best locations in New York right next to central park. Also I have to compliment the food they served us, cause it was phenomenal.

My wife and I always stay at MONY when we are in New York. The location (you can walk to Lincoln Centre, Times Square, museums, shopping), outstanding service, the view of Central Park, the Lobby Lounge, warm and friendly and attentive staff - all make it a wonderful place to stay.

Very expensive for a small room with a broken bed. Excellent service. Wonderful bathroom. Convenient mid town location, Broadway. But even by NYC standards, this is very expensive for a very small, dark room.

Decided to stay at Mandarin in NYC, after staying in a Mandarins in other countries. I must admit, we did treat ourselves, to quite an expensive suite, but had the best time ever.I have to say, we have never been treated so nicely by Hotel staff in our lives, they were all fantastic, the hotel is great, and this made for a thoroughly enjoyable short city break - we will definitely be back next year.Brilliant and thanks

The in-room dental kit has the same toothbrush state prisoners receive when being booked into prison. Otherwise things were average. Valet was excellent. I had an awful breakfast at asiate and the waiter gave me someone elses order before bringing my order which wasnt what I ordered in the first place. The blind leading the blind.

Recently went for Afternoon Tea and sorry to say am not impressed at all. Am more of a traditionalist myself so wasn't entirely happy with the very strange and very small offering of sandwiches. No complaints about the cakes and scones but the sandwiches just did not hit the mark with me and given the price would have expected a better overall experience.

Three generations of our family enjoyed gorgeous weather in Central Park and then Broadway while staying at the extraordinary Mandarin Oriental Hotel. Exceptional location, pleasant rooms, impeccable service, and a sense of friendliness and courtesy throughout. The hotel is very well managed and attentive to detail in customer service and quality. Next time we will trythe restaurants, spa and shops. An unexpected find was the nearby Museum of Art and Design. Fabulous view from the upstairs, attractive restaurant.

This hotel is definitely part of my Top 2 for Manhattan. It's got a fantastic prime location, great access to the mall, great service and unprecedented views. Actually, having tea or coffee by the huge windows of the lobby bar or having breakfast at ASIATE become a real experience just thanks to the amazing view. Definitely going there again at least for the Food and Beverage areas.

This was my first stay at the M.O. and I hope to be back soon. The property was fantastic, and the service was outstanding. Room service was delicious and prompt. The view from the lobby-lounge is breathtaking. All in all, a great property.

This is one of the most expensive hotels in New York, so I was expecting to be totally blown away. I was not. It was very nice in almost every way, but it was lacking in some areas. For example; our room was "nice" but the decor seemed average and aging. Little things like chips on the credenza, the vanity was down right unactractive (painted black wood angled back to the wall) the marble floor was boring, no details, and a shower curtain, no glass door. Same in the corridors, nice, but looking worn. The room was immaculate, however we found the sheets scratchy, and the pillows not the most comfortable. Two days in a row the morning coffee arrived warm and had to reorder. The food was excellent, and the service team was very friendly and accommodating. The views from the rooms and restaurants are spectacular, so I guess that's part of what you're paying for. I don't think I'd stay there again given the cost. There are so many other great hotels in New York, I think there are better values.

I travel frequently to NYC and have stayed in hotels all over Manhattan. One of my favorites is the Mandarin Oriental at Columbus Circle. The service is always outstanding and I love the location. My only complaint is that the room was starting so show signs of wear. The bathroom needs sprucing up and the mattress in our room was uncomfortable, bouncy and noisy when moving around. Everytime my husband moved it woke me up. Unfortunately this caused me to have a bad night sleep. I probably wouldn't have said anything but 2 weeks ago we stayed at The Crosby Street Hotel, a comparable luxury hotel, and the bed was a dream. So luxurious and comfortable. It was infinately superior to the Mandarin. Clearly I don't mind paying expensive rates but in exchange I expect to have a 5 star experience.
user_name:
JacquelineWH
New York City, New York

review_body: I decided to splash out and stay at the mandarin oriental about a month back...and it was simply amazing. The city view room lived up to its name and was pure comfort. The location was amazing and was literally a throw stone away from central park. Pure luxury!!!!

The Mandarin Oriental Hotel is conveniently located at Columbus Circle on the corner of Central Park. The subway is directly outside. An amazing hotel with breathtaking views of the City and Central Park. Times Square is a short 10 minute walk away. I went for an early morning run around Central Park during my stay and upon arrival back at the hotel lower lobby was given a bottle of water and a hand towel. What service! The breakfast was superb and I'll certainly miss my 'smoothie of the day'One of the best rooms I have ever stayed in. Long bathroom with twin sinks, large comfortable bed. Pure luxury.

Having has a big breakfast and having a large dinner in the evening, not really in the mood to have a big lunch.The Mandarin Oriental Dim Sum Bento did the trick. Delicious Dim Sum with a lovely cold bottle of White Wine. Just the right amount.Chocolate Lollipops were nice but unless you’re very hungry – share 1 between two people.Try booking ahead if you want a window table. Great views of the Circle from above!

Best hotel in New York! Great location, excellent staff and the rooms are outstanding. Did I mention the VIEW from the 35 floor lobby. This is where you want to stay in the big apple!!! Walk to central park, to the broadway shows and to the art galleries, it is all right in front of you.

This hotel is all about clean lines, subtle favours at the concierge desk and views. The robes are a steal - so soft - and the bar for a drink is unparalleled in giving you the feeling that you are in NYC. We stayed here for a month for a roadshow and saw Beyonce and a number of other celebs in the lobby at various times. Great for couples. Would not bring kids here. Whole Foods downstairs is super convenient.

Service the way it's supposed to be. Greeted at the front door and shown to the elevator to the registration lobby. There I was again warmly greeted with no wait. The check-in was quick without the usual unnecessary details. I was offered tea, nice touch. Basically, I felt like they expected me. But isn't that the way it's supposed to be?The room was on a high floor overlooking central park east. Spectacular view. The room itself was also ready. Not opulent but luxuriously comfortable. Slippers by the bed, lights on. Welcoming. The bathroom was spacious, gleaming and well supplied with Mandarin's wonderful products. The shower was strong and roomy.I didn't have the chance to eat in any of the restaurants so I can't comment on the food. My only comment would be about the gym. While the equipment was good, I expected a more updated facility overall. The staff was great. They cleaned every machine after each use even if the user wiped it down. But I thought the facility was small for a hotel of this level. Not enough to ding the experience but given what I've seen lately it is less than I expected. Overall, if you can stay here, do it! What a hotel should be. I've stayed at the Mandarin San Francisco and the Mandarin London and I would say they excel at delivering a personal experience and making guests feel truly welcomed.
user_name:
kquaglio
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We arrived around 11am (having booked online the same morning) to escape from the disaster that was our first hotel in NYC. No issue, yes you can get a room now and we’ll upgrade you to a better view at no charge. By 12 we were settled, unpacked and ready to enjoy our holiday. Yes it is expensive. Yes I am sure there is better value in the city for those in the know. But the location just over from Central Park was lovely, the service charming, the breakfast (all a la carte – perfect) delicious, the views amazing and the whole just a complete class act. Anything we didn’t like? Can’t say I love the décor in the hallways.

wonderful room with great view. On the other hand, the ASIATI restaurant was a terrible disappointment - go elsewhere for dinner as the food ranged from tasteless to an overabundance of tastes within a single dish and the service was fair. In addition, the prices are outrageous for what you get at this restaurant.

The Mandarin is a fabulous hotel in a phenomenal location right by Central Park. I have stayed here a few times and have nothing but praise for this luxurious hotel. If you can afford to stay here or your work will pay for it, do so. You should not be disappointed.

I usually stay upper east side. i.e…. Plaza Athene, The Surrey, or midtown at the St. Regis. i have not stayed in Columbus Circle. This being said I am used to the size of the room being larger for the price you pay. Which my price for the weekend was $1,300 per night. It was a lovely room but for the price you get 1 sink.. not my favorite part. and a nicer than average room on a higher floor. So, you are paying for the view… which I will say is amazing. Trump does block a bit though. The service of the staff is well done. It's a Mandarin and New York, so they have to bring their "A" game. Enjoyed the bar and having a cocktail with incredible views as well. Did not have the opportunity to eat at the restaurant. They did bring a beautiful green tea when I arrived to my room, that was a lovely touch. Other Mandarins give you a tea at check in. I really enjoyed my hot tea in my room taking in the view.I was not impressed with the size of the room for the price I payed per night. Not having double sinks, if I had a double sink I would have lost space in the room. I asked. The next size suite would have been $4k a night, so no in between in the rooms. It's a little better than average size in the rooms for the higher price per night or a big jump in price for the good sized room with double sinks and view. I did enjoy the area of town.

The Mandarin is the finest hotel in New York City. While the accommodations are of course elegant, the staff is what makes this establishment unique. You are greeted by name the moment you arrive and at all times thereafter. Everyone is eager and able to make your stay memorable. The management went out of their way to fulfill our needs, especially Eric Segreti and Raafat Rohoicun. The concierges were knowledgable and extremely helpful, particularly Bill Hawkins. Can not wait to return.

You expect a lot at this premium level and MONYC delivers. From personal greeting, attentive service, exceptional clean and comfortable rooms are their starting point. No need was overlooked and all done with style and grace.

Since the hotel lobby is on the 35th floor, the Mandarin rooms offer wonderful views of either the Hudson River or the Park. And that open view from the large window is important because the rooms are rather small. Ours offered a king size bed and a small chaise in addition to the dresser/tvstand/honor bar/desk combo. Getting the breakfast table into a place where we could each sit was done very expertly and graciously by a staff that is not only efficient but also very helpful from the front desk to the concierge to the wait and housekeeping staff.  The location is perfect for either walks to the theater district or the upper east side museums and shopping.

We were greeted in a professional and courteous manner and given a room with a spectacular view of both Central Park and the Hudson RIver. He room was clean and well laid out and all our needs were attended to promptly and efficiently. Our breakfast was delicious and well presented: eggs benedict for me and eggs over easy for my wife. Perfect foamy capuccino! The staff was most attentive and they made us feel like family.

My mum and I had afternoon tea in this gorgeous hotel, such a beautful interior of the building.The afternoon tea itself was delightful, the scones were warm and the sandwiches were so delecate it was lovely. Couldn't eat all of the cakes at the end but we did try.The view was amazing, we got such a lovely day too.

Staying here was truly a great experience. Make sure to get a view of the park...it is unbeatable and worth the extra money. Cocktail lounge area is also first class and a good scene. A 5 star hotel all the way around...we just felt lucky to be able to stay there. This was our first trip to NYC and it'll be tough to match next time back.

There may be many good hotels in NYC but there is only one Mandarin. It would never occur to me to look elsewhere. When we stay there it is like going home. They know us by name when we pull up in front. I love that.

On recommendation we stopped at the Lounge Bar on the 35th floor of the Mandarin Oriental for an early cocktail. Although we we were clearly there just for a drink having walked half of New York, we were afforded every courtesy and a very nice cocktail and Rioja. We had a very relaxed hour just chilling and enjoying the amazing views over the south side of Central Park. Very enjoyable.

UK residents: Elopement in NYWe wanted the best for such a special occasion and wanted to ensure that our wedding in New York although small (just the two of us, registrar/officiate and witnesses) - we wanted it to be beautiful, personal and intimate.We had already booked what we considered the best hotel for our stay in NY and wanted to ensure that the wedding day would and could be the best for a small affair. Lance Miller (MONY sales coordinator) was fantastic in helping with suggestions and hotel options given budget restrictions. By the time we flew in - I/we felt we were meeting a friend given the numerous emails in the run up to the start of our special holiday. A true find - Lance helped with overseeing and checking the finer details that I had arranged separately, ensured that my hair and makeup professionals on the day were seen to and sent up to my room straight away, access to the wedding suite (Central Park Suite) was provided on time, delivery of the flowers, in room dining for drinks, food and snacks for our witnesses again delivered on time. Checked our booking at the Asciate and even arranged for a surprise cake at the end of the meal. Lance also managed to provide access to the private roof terrace through security for our wedding photos - which made it extra special ( a place that even Lance hadn't seen before).Our stay at the hotel and wedding day was made special by all of the staff that we came in to contact with. They were unbelievably exceptional. I would love and hope to come back soon (every anniversary maybe :) hint hint to my new husband.Shana

I arrived this weekend paid &1000+ a night for " we forgot your breakfast... Sorry sir sending right up" to waiting 45 min for a request for a bandaid after 3 calls. Finally, I am leaving requested the car with 10 min of anticipation and arrived to the parking to hear " I am sorry sir, I was not told to pull your car!". I understand the united nation had activity but a 5 star hotel should be able to manage the incremental demand... Then again I am just a plain customer.

It is difficult to find a fault in this amazing hotel. My corner suite had an elegant, modern feel and most importantly a walk-in wardrobe closet. Service was impeccable and the level of cleanliness very high. The spa is an absolute heaven. I loved the lobby lounge with its breathtaking view and wonderful service. The only fly in the ointment was the very disappointing Asiate restaurant but it will be unfair to blame that on the hotel itself. Recommend wholeheartedly!

this is my fourth MO experience and I have yet to be disappointed. The staff are excellent, efficient and friendly. The rooms are well appointed and set up for business travel. Room service is excellent as is the breakfast on the 35th floor. if there are disappointments its the Gym. A bad layout and the equipment dated. Not very enticing. Also the meeting off of the business centre is also a little small.

This super hotel is 35 floors up and our room overlooked the Hudson River. The restaurant is well managed and we were looked after incredibly well. The rooms are quiet and the beds are superbly comfortable. Staff are very attentive and helpful. It is ideally situated for Central Park and shopping/sightseeing. It is close to a subway station so that you can get all over New York without any problem. A really great place to stay

Possibly one of the most luxurious hotels i have ever been to, we spent two nights for my sister in law's wedding at the same hotel, a very nice party for 120 people on the 36th floor. The 6 am morning run at Central Park was another highlight of my trip. I used the subway which was extremely convenient avoiding the traffic jam and saving money.I must add that all concieges were very kind and helpful

We flew to New York on the 17th February for my birthday (19th feb) courtesy of my lovely boyfriend. The hotel was excellent & very clean, the staff were very polite & always there if required. Our room was brilliant & had a fantastic view overlooking the hudson river. Our stay was only over 3 days but we managed to do such alot in such a short space of time.....to name just a few,a boat trip around the statue of liberty, went to the 86th floor of the empire state building. Visited Madison Square, the Rockefellar Centre, times square & even made time to walk around Central park in the snow. Would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.

The Mandarin Oriental is in the luxury category of hotels in NYC, which would include the Ritz Carlton, The Four Seasons, among others. As you would expect for any hotel in this category the service is outstanding, with everyone being very helpful, friendly and efficient. The location is great, the rooms are very quiet and nice. This was my first stay there, and the one thing that was different than what I expected was the style/decor of the hotel, which is very much oriental. This is of course consistent with the name and branding of the hotel but it did not resonate with me. I did not have an opportunity to try out their spa or restaurant, both of which are supposed to be fabulous.

Just spent a perfect weekend at The Mandarin Oriental Hotel in NYC! Location, location, location!The rooms are a very nice size, especially considering that it is NYC! I found the layout of the room, with the bathroom behind the bed, to be a very comfortable and practical one; The decor is nice; The view of the Hudson river is great; The concierge service is excellent!! I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!

If you want a location in the middle of the action - this is it. Although we're used to staying midtown east side in a 5 star hotel (unnamed, but where the Pres. usually stays), this time we tried the west side and the Mandarin Oriental. What a nice place! The negative to the location was there are more tourists and fewer local residents - but the postives are fantastic: literally next to Central Park, across the street from Columbus Circle, great shopping, Lincoln Center, good restaurants, close to MOMA and the MET and so forth. In addition, all the rooms have amazing views - the park or the Hudson, AND last, but certainly not least, the staff was SUPER - extremely helpful and positive in all respects! All the rooms are also on the upper floors of the building (rooms begin at the 37th floor) with the result that the hotel is quiet - providing for a restful night's sleep!!!

My experience with the staff was exceptional. They went above and beyond to make sure our meeting ran as smoothly as possible. Our group flooded their inbox with multiple requests (prior to the meeting and during) and each time the staff responded quickly and very professionally. I will HIGHLY recommend this hotel and meeting space to anyone. Each and every person I came in contact with was extremely helpful and readily available. Excellent staff, excellent service, excellent hotel!

We stayed in an Executive Suite that looked out on Central Park. We wanted an extra room because my wife and I were traveling with our toddler. It was truly unbelievable. I highly recommend this hotel! Great for families too.

This is a very fine hotel belonging to a great chain (especially throughout Asia) with some nice views of the city and the Hudson river. The service is good and the location (Columbus Circle) excellent. I find the rooms, while comfortable, to be very, very small and when travelling on business I seem to spend more time in my room than when on vacation. Have drinks in the lobby bar on 35 where you can enjoy some stunning city light views and breakfast in the restaurant on 35 is excellent. If you stay here be prepared to pay for the pleasure of doing so but be assured that it will be a pleasure.
user_name:
John S
Hilton Head, South Carolina

review_body: Having scoured numerous hotels in New York for the best view of the city afforded by a hotel bedroom, I finally opted for the Mandarin Oriental, despite the eye-watering price. Fortunately, my package deal meant we were entitled to a free upgrade to a Hudson River View Room, on the 48th floor, and this was confirmed hassle-free with the hotel a couple of months before departure. I happened to mention at the time that we were celebrating my partner's 40th birthday, mainly because I wanted to find out the cost of having champagne left in the room on arrival. On learning that it would be $177, I politely lost interest. However, August came and some gifts were left in the room which really made the occasion special. It impressed me because the hotel was by no means obliged to do anything, but it eloquently demonstrated the personal level of service the hotel can provide.The bedroom itself commanded fine views of the Hudson River and the immediate vicinity of the city (mainly domestic tower blocks) and, to our delight, we even spied a pint-sized Statue of Liberty in the far distance. The room was a generous size, as was the bathroom, which boasted a bath as well as a shower (three in fact: a hand-held one and a ceiling one, plus another hand-held one by the bath to rinse off the suds), plus two washbasins and, obviously, a toilet, which had a temperamental flush. Everything was clean and tidy, the bed comfortable and the air conditioning whispered rather than growled. In fact we had a very quiet time there, with only the occasional sound of guests' voices outside in the corridor.We chose not to eat any meals there, preferring the cheaper option of the smart shopping mall, of which the hotel is a part and which has a number of eateries and places where you can buy food to take away (the Whole Foods Market on the basement is a gem). We had one drink in the Mandarin Oriental's lounge, simply because it has an amazing view over Central Park and Columbus Circle, but at around $25 a drink we couldn't afford to make a night of it there.Location-wise, it's perfect for exploring Central Park, a gentle stroll away, but the subway station within spitting distance means the rest of the city is within easy reach too.A perfect hotel then? Well, no...not quite. Two things irked me, hence my overall score. Firstly, the hotel charges a staggering $50 corkage fee for any alcohol you bring onto the premises to consume. Secondly, there is an extra cost for WiFi access in bedrooms. I have stayed at a number of cheaper hotels which offer WiFi free of charge, and having paid a not-inconsiderable sum to stay at an upmarket hotel, it felt like the hotel was purely money-grabbing and I admit this left a bitter taste.Even so, I found it hard to fault much of the rest of what we experienced there.

Excellent hotel with amazing personal service from every member of staff we met. Wonderful location with Central park on the door step. We had amazing views even in the skyline room which were the cheapest. The exquisite bathroom and walk in wardrobe added an extra touch of class. Thankyou

Let me first declare that I may not come at this with an unbiased opinion as our hotel of preference in NYC which we try to visit once a year on our anniversary is The Ritz Carlton which is more a home away from home. If the Ritz is comfort food & home cooking, the MO is sushi & sashimi. Modern with outstanding views over Central Park but you need to pay a premium which is worth it if like us its a treat for a special occasion. Spa was great. Pool is showing it's age. Room was lovely but again there was a TINY tint of room odour which I suspect could have been removed with oils. Lobby bar again overlooking Central Park is a hub of NYC activity and there is no doubting where you are. All in all its fantastic. We have stayed in the Mandarin in HK a couple of times and I wouldn't put this up there with it but it's certainly close. Notwithstanding that we would still opt for the home cooking on future trips but that's just taste. Staff were excellent and great concierge

What a gem! The suites are gorgeous, the staff is white glove superb. Great location to Central park, shopping, wonderful restaurant and lounges. The spa is one of the city's best. Amazing city views with floor to ceiling windows. Room service prompt and delicious.
user_name:
Nicnycandthebigapple
New York City, New York

review_body: There are lots of beautiful hotels in NY and around the world. What makes a hotel top notch is their staff. I can't say enough amazing things about the staff here at this hotel. Jason at the front desk is a fan of Broadway, such as myself. He had a few recommendations and he was spot on. Bill or Billy (not sure) the concierge was able to secure tickets for us to Cabaret at the very last minute. We were there for a corporate event and the hotel catered a few of our events. The food was very tasty as well. The view from our hotel room was of Central Park, which was a nice change from the sky scrapers in NY City. It is attached to a small mall which allows you to go grab something that you may have left behind at home. It is a bit on the pricy side but, everything in NY is.

My husband and I had the luxury of staying at the Mandarin Oriental hotel in New York. This was our first time staying there. This is the most amazing hotel with the absolute most delightful staff that create the ultimate in customer experience. I would highly recommending staying at this hotel should you have the opportunity.

This is my first time stay in New York with my family, my wife had a complimentary stay at this very nice hotel and residential from her boss. We stay 3 night on the 66th floor with view to the west, though it's not facing the central park but we can see statue of liberty and harbour from the window.Location is very great tithe Columbus circle, we can just walked in to the central park, next to time warner center, few minutes walk to times square,Broadway, avenue of America's and metro station.Facilities is very good, room lightning, everything is automatic, just the button.

NYC is expensive, as is this hotel. But it was in the perfect location, accessible but above the din of street noise. The view of Central Park is incredible, even if its just from the bar on the 35th floor (which is where the actual hotel starts). The rooms were immaculate, well appointed with plenty of room...unlike most other NYC hotels getting up in the middle of the night is not an exercise in what do I stub my toe on or bang my knee into. We had both a tub and a shower and a private toilet which is also not the norm in NYC. The bedding was great, the desk convenient and the only drawback was a TV that was wonky at times (frozen and garbled pictures) that the staff blamed on the cable provider. And the staff were very friendly, very helpful and tried very hard to make this a comfortable stay. Overall, a very good experience.

What an experience! From the moment we walked, to an upgraded room for not having the room we were assigned, the view of central park from out our living room windows and my favourite, the free books in the sitting area of the bed room. The room was beautiful, the staff was friendly and ready for anything you could ask for! It was a beautiful walk home each night and steps from the park, train and anything else you might need It was very pricey but we definitely got the service you would expect and beyond!

This hotel has all of the accouterments that one would expect with a luxury hotel: Plush bath and bed, large size room, etc, However, the check-in procedure was a letdown. We had arrived early and did not expect a room, but the reservationist said our room was being made up took our phone number and said she would call when it was available. We came back hours later, after three o'clock check-in, and found our room was still not made up (???) She assigned us a different room, and although that solved the problem I was put off by the disingenuous assurances that she first gave us. In addition,I found two small shortcomings, neither of which the hotel can rectify:First, the Central Park view is an oblique view of the Park. Not a head on 12 o'clock view that one would get from the Plaza or the Pierre which are situated closer to the Park. Our room was on one of the uppermost floors and the view we had was about at 8 o'clock on the dial. Again, not the hotel's fault, but do not anticipate anything more.Second, even as a guest it is very difficult to get restaurant reservations. I know that reservations should be made well ahead, but a month ahead it is difficult to decide at what hour you will be able to round up all parties to dine. As a result, we never had to go to the Plaza for lunch and sadly experience the decline of the Palm Court. Again with the restaurant being open to the general public and even with the hotel's policy of reserving the better window tables for guests, it is difficult to dine in house leading to a degree of estrangement. Hint: If you want a quick sandwich and do not want to leave the building, try the food court or one of the (non-hotel, but very noisy) restaurants on the third floor.

Absolutely exquisite hotel. The location is literally at the front door of Central Park, 5 mins from 5th, and a short walk from several other major attractions including Times Square. There is even a huge whole foods supermarket under the hotel which is great to live how the locals do. The hotel is a beautiful 5 star hotel with amazing facilities, the room and staff were all amazing full of everything you would expect from a 5 star. Ideal for couples and romantics, I personally wouldn't take the kids there

Minor details make the difference. Sent slacks to dry cleaning, back pocket was missing a button. It came back with new matching button!! Love these people and their detailed attention to guests!!!!!!

What a wonderful hotel! Staff are excellent and so friendly (Especially to my Children), Facilities outstanding and views to die for! Great food, pool on the 36th floor with floor to ceiling windows. Even met Will.Iam in the lift which was very exciting for the kids!

We had a wonderful time, everything was perfect. The hotel is beautiful, the room was very comfortable, great bed and shower. Staff was extremely nice. We will be back soon. The view over Central Park is amazing.

After staying at many Four Seasons hotels over many years the New York Mandarin Oriental was a first time experience with this chain of hotels. From the first reception desk experience to checkout the service was great and the people could not have been nicer or more efficient.Our suite had a great view of Central Park and Central Park South and was spacious and comfortable. Room service was quick and the food was very good there and in the restaurant. We certainly will stay at other Mandarin Oriental hotels because of this service.

The rooms are very small. When room service is delivered to room, it is impossible to walk from one side of the king sized bed to the other.One day my wife returned to the room at 4 pm and the room was not made up. The main restaurant was closed. The breakfast buffet was pathetic -- worse than a Hilton or a Holiday Inn. All for $995 per night for the room.

I Stayed here twice and will do again and again. Check in was done right inside my room, although small , very modern but the view was amazing.Restaurant located at the lobby is good but pricey.This is a hotel for the couples looking for a romantic break or a holiday not for family.Located opposite Central Park and next to Columbus circus.You can walk from your hotel which is linked to Time Warner building where you can do a bit of shopping, visit art gallery or restaurant.The spa was excellent but pricey as the hotel itself but worth every penny. The view of New York while inside the spa is awesome.Excellent hotel. Really good..Would definitely recommend this hotel but be prepared for everything thing from tipping the door man to the bell boy right from the day you checked in.

Had a great time staying at one of my fav hotel in NYC. The service and staff at this property are always the best and they make an effort make sure ur well looked after. I will stay at any of their properties worldwide anytime.
user_name:
Munawar H
Beverly Hills, United States

review_body: It seems that I am constantly writing reviews for hotels in NYC. I think this is my third in two weeks. We stayed at the Mandarin last night and it was terrific. Another reviewer complained that the hotel was not centrally located....no idea what she was talking about. I am an ex-New Yorker so I know Manhattan well. The location is prime, with restaurants, shops and Central Park steps away. The really wonderful aspect to this hotel is sound proof windows. NYC is LOUD! It doesn't matter if you are on the 40th floor. You will hear noise all night long. But not at the Mandarin! Ahhh, I'm so well rested. The food, the service and the room decor is all 5-star quality. Yes, it is pricey but in this case, you get what you pay for. This really is the best hotel in NYC.
user_name:
JacquelineWH
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is not very central and the service is not perfect either. The view is very nice and the food at the restaurant is very good. The rooms are not very nice and lots of 'strange' people at the bar.

Stayed here with my husband for two nights and was amazed with the high security in this hotel... (All staff looks like secret service agents) Very clean and modern rooms.. of course its pricey ,but worth every penny... We ran into an Liam Neeson in the elevator where he denied it was him...(a little rude) but I guess it could be annoying to always be asked if you are who you are...lol.. years later I come across a magazine showing Liam Neeson in a Mandarin Oriental ad.. Thats when I wonder if he stays there for free? plus he gets to be rude, wow thats a major deal if you ask me... I think his only skill is being rude to fans...

Not normally a fan of large hotels but this the exception. We were booked in for 4 nights but due to delays only stayed for 3. The staff here are friendly, knowledgeable and efficient which is what you would expect but don't always get.The view of Central Park from our room on the 54th floor was fantastic and when we are next in New York would definitely stay here!

Mandarin remains one of the best in town but is loosing it a bit. Tv is not working properly, downstairs lobby is gloomy and uninspiring and decoration needs to be redone. Service and views are top of the bill. Be aware they are doing work on the breakfast dining room so this will be served in the upstairs lobby and they will not tell you while making your reservation.Of course location and view on central park is top this compensates for a lot but price value is under pressure.Lobby (like many us hotels) is freezing cold.

We stayed at the Mandarin for a weekend trip and it was worth it. We enjoy traveling and many of the places we have visited have had Mandarin's, but we have never sprung for it. In my honest opinion the price is worth it. The views we had from our room that overlooked Central park were amazing. I would also say one of the highlights other than the amazing service you will receive is the bathroom. The rain shower was amazing and my wife thoroughly enjoyed the oversized tub.

I was in NYC for work and lucky to be booked at an executive suite at the MO. The views were spectacular and probably one of the best suites that I have ever been in. Upon your arrival they provide a tea service which I thought to be a nice touch. The suite was high tech and I would happily live here if I could. Only disappointment was the spa. Had a massage with a lady with very bony fingers so not helpful. Otherwise perfect.

This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The views are spectacular and the rooms are amazing! A little pricey but well worth it if you have the extra money. I stayed at the Mandarin and attended a business event. The staff was very attentive and the room they had the event was very nice with great views as well. I look forward to staying there again.
user_name:
MediaMom2012
New York City, New York

review_body: We have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental NY several times and we think it is clearly the best overall hotel in NYC. My wife and I stayed in May and the service was excellent(especially front desk and concierge) and the rooms are modern and have phenomenal views. Key positives: -consistent fantastic service-amazing views from the lobby and rooms-best breakfast in NY - great food and views-well styled rooms-great location for exploring mid-town and central park-large gym with good equipmentNothing on the negative side Great Hotel!

I want to love this hotel as I love the chain's hotels in Singapore and Hong Kong but this one makes a good try but just is not as special as some of the other locations. For NYC it is pretty good. I just wish it was something special.

Stayed at MONYC during long weekend last February. It was a busy weekend with Superbowl taking place in NJ and we were asked for full payment in advance which, under the circumstances, I did not find out of the ordinary. I have been in other hotels of this level in NYC (Four Seasons, Plaza, Ritz) and found MO as my favorite maybe at par with FS.We had tickets to the Metropolitan Opera on Sat night and I cannot think of a better location to stay at walking distance from the Lincoln Center.Our check-in process was a delight with the receptionist coming up with us to show us our room.On check out they volunteered to print our boarding passes without us asking. Concierge was also a great asset of the hotel and we were given very professional and invaluable advise about restaurants and activities in the city. In our room, the views of Central Park through floor to ceiling windows where exactly what we were looking for, great setting and sumptuous decor. Loved the washroom and walk-in showers; one of the bests I have seen!During our stay we used the Spa several times which was a great experience. Sunday brunch at Asiate was a delight and staff honored our request of a table by the window overlooking the park.It was a cold and snowy weekend and we enjoyed the direct access to the Time Warner building mall for shopping and walking by.Only improvement that I can think of is the MO Bar which we found hard to get to and closed quite early at night. I would suggest improved signage to make clients aware of its existence.We will be back!

The hotel is nicely situated on the Columbus Circle with is very convenient for exploring the city & shopping. We booked a park view suite, which was on the 40th floor and had absolutely fantastic views over the Central Park. The room itself was spacious (which is not common for NY hotels) with big bathroom with bath and a shower. The Asiate restaurant at the hotel is very good-fantastic food and great views. But the lobby bar&restaurant is not so good-we did not like the food at all.Unfortunately, I had a terrible accident at the bath, that was slippery-I've fallen down, bruising my leg, arm and breaking my teeth. That's where the staff were not as helpful as they could've been in such a hotel. The only help we received was a pack of ice and an address of emergency dental service which turned out to be a place where students do their practice exercises. They also offered "a call to a doctor" (he called in 1 hour since we asked), as the doctor visit would be 350$. I did suggest that they should do something about the bath as indeed it is very dangerous without the special coating. I've spent several thousand dollars on fixing my teeth and buying medications for my leg & arm - very high price for the absence of the non-slippery coating or a rug. So our impression of the hotel was spoilt at the end.

As we are regular visitors to the MO NY this is an update to our previous reviews. We were there at the end of March and for 4 days in June. We always like it and bumping into a celebrity is quite common. This time it was Morgan Freeman who was very chatty and explained a bandaged hand was the result of a car incident (not that he was driving). The hotel reception, concierge and valet staff are always efficient but sadly the housekeeping and in room dining is starting to slip. When you pay these prices you expect everything to be perfect. For some reason their Reading Program which we love, missed our room everyday??? Did not get a reason. The best pillows in the world have been changed, I was told that they are testing new products and our input will help them decide, why change when it was perfect.The in room dining service forgot our complimentary smoothies completely the first day, then only 1 the second, on the third no butter and by the time they did, the toast was cold. Not major problems but as I said earlier if you stay at this level it has to perfect.The major issue though this time concerned the cost of international calls, I had forgot my charger and before I bought a new one I used the house phone, big mistake, don't do it. One call was over $100, I complained bitterly and they did take off 25% all the call charges but this still left a sour taste.They said that the phone company operator charges those rates and they don't make any profit from it, I don't believe it for one minute.Please note they do however respond to complaints very efficiently.So if you like hard pillows, don't order room service and never make calls on house phone and can afford to pay the rates and enjoy a bit celebrity spotting, then this is still the best hotel in New York even though it is looking just a wee (we are Scottish) bit tired.

When my husband suggested we stay at the Mandarin I was hesitant based on the rates. This hotel is worth every penny and more. Incredible location at Columbus Circle and we could walk to broadway shows and Central Park. When the hotel heard it was our anniversary they upgraded us to a high floor park view room which was so incredible. The view was something special for sure. You can get the same view from the 35th floor lounge so grab a drink there--sunset was especially great as the sun reflects on the buildings in the city below. The room was very clean and the decor throughout the hotel is gorgeous. very comfortable beds and pillows. The concierge service was extremely helpful without making us feel rushed or a pain. Great service and staff! We will be back.

With Mandarin Oriental you expect good quality and New York MO did not dissapoint. Spa was great for a couples treatment ...beautiful couples room including huge hot tub and steam room and sauna all inside. Our bedroom overlooked the park. Room we found a little small , not so bothered about the ShangHai Tang toiletries....prefer Aqua di Parma or Bulgari ...as found in Hong Kong M O etc... Staff very helpful. Overall a great location though in New York. No ladies hair salon but found one nearby.
user_name:
MissAtlas
Jebel Ali, United Arab Emirates

review_body: What's wrong with MO NY? We have always been extremely satisfied with MO in the past.Check in was ok after that downhill... We had to wait 15 minutes to get a table for breakfastAnd another 50 minutes to get the food. The waiter was non attentive and didn't mind us..It was impossible to get a table at the The lobby lounge. On our first day, the room was not done by 4 PM!! After spending more than $ 11 000 on MO NY we left with a very bad taste. We talked to assistant manager front desk and all they said was - we are sorry!We travel extensively and have never experienced something like this.

I have stayed here about 5-6 times, it is consistently a terrific hotel, the perfect getaway. You will leave feeling refreshed, well slept, relaxed. They are extremely kind at every step of the way, nice at check in, always upgrade you if you ask nicely, great service. There's nothing not to love.

My daughter and I stayed 2 nights at the hip and trendy Refinery Hotel before switching to this hotel to sample luxury. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was on the top floor which was a bonus and although it was not very spacious it was fine for a 2 night stay. The reception staff were friendly with one exception...Gabriel who was abrupt, grumpy, miserable and off hand when I asked for my bill to be printed. My daughter received a cake for her birthday which was delicious. The room was spotless and the rainfall shower was great as were the toiletries. The breakfast was very good. We loved the bar with top service from John. The cocktails were absolutely divine and believe me we tried quite a few !! All in all it was a taste of luxury at a luxury price.... not in the league of MO hotels we have stayed at in the Far East.... but still very enjoyable.

Who needs the traffic, the noise and the craziness of Times Square? Escape from all of it at the Mandarin Oriental. Overlooking Columbus Circle and Central Park - the beautiful views of the Upper East side, the Mandarin is synonymous with plus, extravagant luxury and most of all service. Upon check-in you can expect your butler to promptly serve you complimentary tea, some do the best I've ever had. The rooms are very clean, and decorated with luxurious and comfortable and purposeful furniture. The floor to ceiling windows are the gateway to escape and overlook both Central Park, as well as the Hudson River. Room service is phenomenal, and the menu is quite extensive. Is it cheap? No. It's not a place to show up with your 12 children either. But if you need a luxurious getaway, with fine dining and a fantastic spa experience, this is the place to go.

My partner and I stayed in the hotel in February to get a break from the endless weather beatings. We were looking forward to a weekend of pampering and fun in New York City. Unfortunately, again our experience was less than 5 stars and far from the "Mandarin experience" so heavily advertised and that I had become accoustomed to. Besides having issues in morning for breakfast, we had to repeatedly call for the room to be serviced and yet ended up with no soap/shampoo in our room. My partner was showering and once he realized he tried to call down to the front desk except the phone was not working or permanently busy. Soaking wet, he had to get his cell phone and call the main line and ask for shampoo and soap. Fifteen minutes later, a Chinese man showed up at the door with a RUG shampoo machine? He looked at him and didn’t understand what he was asking for, once he pointed to his head and he saw he was wet he put two and two together. Finally, he was able to get ready but a major inconvenience.After that comedy of errors and seeing random empty Red Bull cans around the lobby, the day we checked out we tried to get into the Lobby Lounge to have a bottle of wine and relax and enjoy the view (keep in mind --it's the 35th floor overlooking Central Park!). We were greeted with a not so polite hostess and told all seats were reserved. After a few minutes, we stated that we were guests and she changed her tune. After spending $1000 at the SPA, hotel room, and food we were checking out with a very bad taste in our mouth. My partner mentioned our experience to the gentleman that checked us out and he brought an assistant manager over who offered us a triple upgrade on our next visit. We left feeling comforted that good service may have lapses but they do redeem themselves...Fast forward several months -- we sent the assistant manager an e-mail on May 20th about our intentions to stay at the Mandarin again and did not hear back. My partner then called a week later and he stated that he would put us in a central park suite and to book a regular room . When my partner phoned the assistant manager stated that we were staying in the same room we were in prior. We had just booked 3 reservations for the SPA ($1000+) as we are meeting a friend from out of state and thought a spa treatment would be nice. What we are most disappointed with is the e-mail that we received last night, stating that was all they were willing to do. In a High Service Industry like yours - the Mandarin leaves us with a tarnished image and the word "service" is more like lip.

This is THE best hotel in NYC for the views. Yes, it is expensive, but we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The concierge was great in finding us only the best of the best. The hotel conveniently has a connector to the shopping center, has a subway station close and the doormen work hard for their money. If someone else was paying we would definitely stay again, but only in a suite. The standard rooms are tiny!

I've been staying at the Mandarin Oriental New York since it opened. Before I discovered this incredible oasis, I tried at least a dozen other high end hotels in Manhattan which were always a disappointment. From the moment you arrive at the Mandarin you will be treated like "royalty". Their entire operation is of the highest caliber in every way. The Doormen, Concierge, Front Desk, Housekeeping, In-Room Dining will take care of you like you were family. Everything about this hotel is SPECTACULAR!

I have stayed here three times in the last year and it is one of the best hotels i have eer slept at.Breathtaking viewextraordinary service--polite, friendly, makes me believe everyone there truly cares about creating a first class hotel.Delicious room service.Great Air ConditioningWindows open up for fresh air.Breakfast looks perfect but can taste a bit stale if ordered after 6am.Almost shocking how expensive it is.Room service menu could be more varied.Sort of a pain to have to switch elevators at the 25th floor or something every time you enter.such nice sheetsnice pillowsgreat water pressure--all of that stuff is just about perfect...

Awesome place to stay. Probably the fanciest so far that I have been too, but you will pay for it too. Basic rooms run about $895 for just one night. Would be great for a special occasion though. Close to everything, including Central Park, and within walking distance to many attractions including broadway, Times Square, etc. it's also connected to sort of a mall, that has many stores including a whole foods on the lowest level.

This is a good hotel but it needs to improve to be in the class it is aiming for.There was no email to remind me of my stay. So when I checked with the hotel they transferred the call twice to central reservation who said that the reservation number that I had provided did not exist. This led to some anxious moments.Check in was good. Staff were friendly. Rooms were good. Fitness Centre is small. Pool does need up keeping. There was debris in the pool and it turned me off from using the pool.Restaurant is good, though attention to detail was not present. I got the wrong order.No extras like shoe shine etc.

We stayed from 30/4 until 2/5 in a Hudson View room on the 54th floor to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We couldn't have chosen a better hotel for location, service and comfort. From the moment we arrived until the moment we (reluctantly! ) had to leave, the Mandarin Oriental staff were a credit to the hotel, they really could not do anymore for us, making us feel so at comfortable and relaxed on our first visit to New York. Our next stay at the MO is already being discussed! Gary and Catherine Potter.

The views of the city, from guest rooms (floors 38 to 54), restaurant or lounge, are all fantastic. Service is perfect. Advanced contacts from the concierge can arrange various travel needs. All staffs are friendly, polite and do their best to accommodate, all very pleasant encounters. House keeping/cleanliness of the room is exceptional. Lincoln Center is within five to ten minutes walk and the Columbus Circle shopping mall (same building as the hotel) has great restaurants, coffee spots and high end shops. The hotel is expensive but compared with other NY hotels in the same category it provides good value. We came away happy.

Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental NYC this past week and I have to say there is no other place like it!... Excellent service, excellent staff!... Amazing views and Amazing food too!... If you are visiting New York and have time to splurge this is the right place for you... Can't wait to go back!

I was the guest of a very good friend at this hotel last month. Granted it was only for the one night I was in the city, but the view of the city at night has got to take some of the sting out of the bill. The room was lovely in comfortable furnishings in muted, classic design. The view was marvelous and lent itself to the champagne served when I arrived.The chocolates are a marvelous and welcoming touch. The closest to this type of hospitality is what I experienced at the Halekulani hotel on Waikiki, and that should tell you this impressed me. Even if you are only staying one night, you need to do this. This hotel is wonderful.

Fantastic view of Central Park. The room was large, separate bedroom from the living room. A little pricy though....$2900.00 for one night. Can't beat the location and the views! I would never spend this kind of money again though.

Stayed one night due to availability and loved every minute. This is a grand resort and the service was effortlessly perfect. Jason at the reception desk was so kind, attentive, and professional in welcoming us for our short stay. The upgraded view from our suite was a perfect view of central park. The room was fantastic in every way and all designed around a multi million dollar view. Dinner at Asiate on the 35th floor overlooking Central Park was spectacular. Everything was divine and we didn't want the evening to end... We can't wait to return to NY and we will stay a proper number of nights! Having to move on was our only mistake...

My parents visit me in New York at least once a year, but since this year was of particular importance (my mom is turning 60 and my dad turning 70), I wanted to book them something special for their visit this time and thought that the Mandarin Oriental would give them the pampering they deserved. I booked a standard Cityview Room, but upon checking in I notified the front desk supervisor of the special occasion and she upgraded my parents to one of the best non-suite hotel rooms available – a Premier Central Park View Room on the highest floor of the hotel (floor 54). The room was beautifully and tastefully appointed with amazing floor to ceiling windows overlooking Central Park. Yes, the Trump Building still blocks a good portion of the view of the park, but even so, the view is breathtaking. The front desk took good care of my parents and we had early check-in and late checkout (as a result of booking through Amex’s Fine Hotels and Resorts program), but that being said there were a few service hiccups that prevent me from giving this a perfect review:(1) None of the guys working outside at the entry of the hotel or in the first floor reception desk near the elevators bothered to help my folks with luggage to bring it up to the 35th floor lobby for check in and no one offered to help us take our luggage down from the lobby to the ground floor and into a cab when we checked out. That’s unacceptable for a hotel of this caliber. It could have been because we weren’t stepping out of or into a shiny new Benz or Bentley. The guys downstairs never seemed to ignore those folks…(2) One morning the elevators that take guests from the 1st floor up to the lobby on the 35th floor stopped working. I was the only guest downstairs on the 1st floor waiting for an elevator. After about 5 minutes, I asked the guys at the desk near the doors if the elevators were working and they replied with a flippant “yes”, despite being clearly aware that I had already been waiting for 5 minutes so something must have been wrong. An elevator eventually does open its doors and I step inside and push 35 --- but nothing happens. I wait another couple minutes and when nothing happens, I go back to the front desk and tell them that clearly, the elevators are not working. They leave me standing in the 1st floor lobby for about 10 more minutes as they then scramble to figure out what to do. FINALLY after the 10 minute wait, they tell me the elevators aren't working and escort me to the service elevator – even though I had asked before having to wait 10 minutes whether there was an alternative elevator I could use and they replied that there wasn’t. They should've offered use of the service elevator well before I waited a full 15 minutes.(3) Although the service at Lobby Lounge and Asiate is refined, polished and attentive, they are constantly looking for the up-charge. One egregious example: at Lobby Lounge we were looking to order drinks before heading out to dinner. Cocktails are listed as $20. As we’re ordering the waitress said “ I very highly recommend getting our signature “Gratitude” cocktail. It encompasses everything the Mandarin Oriental New York is about. I really think at least one of you should get it” What she failed to mention was that the cocktail costs $100. When your signature cocktail costs 5 times as much as your other cocktails, and you’re going to sing praises about it and say that we “must” try it --- then I feel like you should also mention to me the cost before ordering it. (note, though, that the cocktails are all wonderful, although I don’t think the Gratitude is worth it or something that you must try… Also, I will say breakfast at Asiate was superb (as an Amex FHR reservation, you get an $80 credit))All in all, I recommend staying at this hotel. There are areas where service could improve especially given the caliber of this hotel and the Mandarin Oriental standard (service at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo was FAR better – it was almost flawless), but you will still feel pampered here nonetheless. The Mandarin Oriental NY is a good choice for a luxurious stay in New York, but given the plethora of luxury hotels in New York, you may want to fully investigate all of your options....
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
ptn4
New York, New York, United States

review_body: This was a beautiful hotel. Awesome location and convenient to transportation and activities. Beautiful views of Central Park and the city. We loved the restaurant and the spa as well. And everybody was very helpful, friendly and kind--not stuffy at all. For us, the expense makes it a special occasion location rather than one we could visit regularly, but I hope we'll get there again. This trip we were in the city to get married and the Mandarin Oriental was a memorable and special part of our weekend.
user_name:
Susan A
Hillsborough, North Carolina, United States

review_body: I have stayed at the Mandarin in New York a number of times now and have also stayed in some of the other 5 star properties in New York too. For me, the Mandarin beats them all. The service is really outstanding - friendly, personable and always professional. This time I really noticed the consistency of service from every member of staff I met there - they seem to be doing something right in their recruitment and training.Location wise - i love it. I always like to be close to Central Park and it's perfect.The rooms aren't huge - perhaps slightly smaller i'd say compared to other similar room types in other hotels i have stayed at but it doesn't matter - the rooms are super comfortable and have everything you would need. Bathrooms are lovely!The food is always great - i love the breakfasts there and the views from the restaurant are amazing.I used the fitness centre on this visit and it has good machines and equipment. I had 2 massages at the spa - one thai massage which was fantastic and one normal massage which was ...ok. So yes it's expensive but it really sets the bar for other hotels not just in NY but globally. I recommend 100%!

service!room!view!comfort!i loved staying here, although it was insanely expensive.I love love love the location and the comfort/service/view/bar!truly best is the location, get on any train at Columbus circle.

There are few places that beat the position of this hotels the views. The service is exceptional. It is the only hotel I know on manhattan with a swimming pool with a decent length. The rooms are not suited for a long stay. Some attention could be paid to maintenance paint work etc. Breakfast is a great in the restaurant but service is variable. Bar and lounge service are excellent.

We visited New York in January, the weather was freezing the Hotel was incredible. The attention to detail was excellent right from the start the pick up from the hotel was seemless the lady that greated us was very freindly and polite, our driver was friendly, knowledgable and happy to point out things for us. When we arrived we were taken up to the reception via the elevator, upon arrival the check in was quick and easy, the stay continued like this for our entire visit. We used the hotel concierge for some food suggestions which on occassion were a little bit questionable, however if you know the food that you like be sure to look yourself, at the end of the day they can only give you their opinion. The room was clean, spacious and well planned out, the only crisism would be the size of wardrobe space available. However the views over Central Park were amazing. The food at the hotel was another highlight, from their asian inspired dishes to the classic american pancakes. We loved the hotel and our stay, we were very fortunate that the superbowl was as our first choice oh hotel was fully booked, however this is a gem and jumps straight to the top of the list! Also the hotel car which was available to take you within twenty blocks was excellent (when available). Special mention to house keeping as well, lovely, helpful and there was no occasion we didnt have ice!

From the second you are greeted at street level, take the elevator up to the lobby, stare dumbfounded out of your window at Central Park, you are treated with care and respect.
