The staff anticipates every need. I want to take the bed, the linen, the towels and the view home, but alas, my suitcase is too small. I will have to settle for spectacular photos and the memories.

I stay here at least 2x/year, even though I'm a New Yorker. Our local luxury "staycation"!Ideal location, especially if attending the theatre or anything at Lincoln Center. And the views cannot be beaten, from the rooms (try to get a Central Park view), and from the iconic lounge on the reception floor (a perfect place to invite friends for drinks).The servic is great, the rooms (though on the small size) are beautifully appointed and very elegant, the bathrooms sleek and sexy, and the spa is one of the best in the city. Oh, and a drop-dead gorgeous full-length swimming pool!! With views to the west through floor-to-ceiling windows. Have a dip here at sunset, and you won't soon forget it
user_name:
christopher k
New York City, New York

review_body: Luxury hotel with nice views of Central Park. Lobby is on the 35th floor. Suite was bigger than some homes. Drafty near the window. Several TVs in the suite but the picture quality was so-so. Staff is superb. Quick and courteous check in and check out. Lots of nearby dining and shopping options.

Stayed in January. Had amazing views of icy NYC and river from my room - very comfortable bed, lots of space and well furnished. Service was top notch and meals were all of a very high quality. I enjoyed a trip to the spa and had an excellent treatment.

Stayed in a room on the 50th floor with the most beautiful view of the Hudson. Room was clean, quiet, peaceful, well-appointed. Service is high quality. Spent time in the lounge at night, it had the most spectacular view. Wish I could have stayed longer!!!

One of our favorite hotels in NYC. The rooms are impeccable as is the service. The lounge gives a view of Columbus Circle that lacks a rival. The restaurant on property is an excellent choice in Manhattan, considering the caliber of dining in the city.

I stay here regularly and the Mandarin is consistently a high touch, high service hotel experience. The location is great and given that the rooms start on the 37th floor it is wonderfully quiet and without traffic and Columbus circle noise. Bathrooms are superior to most other hotel options in the area, and while rooms are not especially large they are well appointed and well situated for views of either the park or the Hudson River.

This hotel was amazing!! From the minute we walked in they treated us like Kings & Queens.You have to take the elevators up to the 36th floor (I think it was 36) to actually check-in the hotel. Our rooms where clean but small. The bed was comfy and inviting. You can't beat the view! If you eat downstairs order the hamburger!! It was very big and out of this world! I think my brother actually ate one day for the 3 days we where there. The bartender made a wonderful chocolate martini!! The spa has the most spectacular views and my treatments where amazing. Massage was great and very relaxing. Only complaint it didn't last long enough. The facial was perfect!! The staff was pleasant and kind. I liked the fact they didn't try to "up sell" me on may of the product they used. If you get time and have the extra money I would highly recommend this spa to anyone. Being that closet to Central Park was a plus. Wish it would have been warm enough to enjoy a walk in the park. I plan on taking my twin boys there for Macy's Parade as soon as I can.

Probably the biggest advertisement for the Mandarin are its incredible views over Central Park. The restaurant is also quite a spectacular setting. Service is impeccable. Easy walk to pretty much everything uptown. Couple of negatives: the restaurant / bar food service stops surprisingly early for being in NYC (though the super-friendly bartender took care of us our first night). And the rooms are surprisingly small unless you go into the suite category. On the weekend, we had some noisy neighbors and it was surprising how much you could hear from the hall and adjacent rooms.

Located directly above cnn headquarters nyc, the view from this hotel is absolutely breathtaking, provided that you book a room on the higher floors and at the side of central park, which you will regret if you find out later what you have been missing out on. Breakfast in the restaurant (we would suggest to eat a la carte not the buffet) is wonderful and again breathtaking views. Free gym/sauna/pool facilities leave room for improvement, somewhat small. However the hotel houses one of the best (paid) spas in town so not very surprising the attention is focused there. Of course, this hotel is horribly expensive (eur 1,000 minimum) a night but hey its nyc and you get a view!

Nice hotel. Great location. Rooms have beautiful views on Central Park and Hudson River. Beds are very comfortable. Great spa. Friendly staff. Nice pool area. Breakfast is ok. Ask for upper floors where you can enjoy a nice views of upper east side.

Great hotel, definitely 5 stars. Locations is excellent. Take a room with a view on Central Park. Rooms with view Hudson river are great too on upper floors, but still to get the best from New York, go on another side, look at Central Park and all the buildings around. Excellent in any weather. Ask for upper floors if possible. We were staying at 51 and 53 - great views! Hotel is expensive, yes, very expensive. Breakfast is good but overpriced. Rooms are almost clean. By almost i mean if you look under your bed - you'll find out what i mean ;) Staff is very polite and helpful. Pool and gym are OK, but we've seen better. Keep in mind that to go outside, you'll be take two elevators instead of one and same - to get to your room, just can be slow in busy hours :)

Looking forward to our treat at this hotel, chosen because of proximity to Central Park and it's reputation.Given lovely room on 54th floor with view down the Hudson and Manhatten.Breakfast was a disaster, awful service, awful food, complained and didn't get charged and given bottle of Moët later as apology.Reception on 38th floor so had to use lifts a lot in and out.Coffee lounge in reception was poor for service too!!Probably wouldn't stay again.

I stayed at the Hotel for business for 3 nights. It is a beautiful hotel with wonderful city views. Since it is a newer hotel in New York the rooms are quite spacious in comparison to other New York Hotels. The food was very good and the views from the restaurant over Central Park are spectacular. The pool and fitness center where clean, new and well taken care of. The Spa seemed very nice but i did not use it. If you have the money for this kind of hotel go ahead and enjoy. I don't think you will be disappointed. For the rest of us, I would save some money and look elsewhere. I'm not sure it is worth the big bucks.

First time we were staying at the MO NYC. We are very used to the MO Bangkok and Geneva, willing to discover a nice view on Central Park and the River.Hotel is fine, just what we were expected from MO, room are nice and quite large for Manhattan, the view from the suite on the 45th floor worst definitively the trip and the sunrise was beautiful. The bathroom are a little bit too small, but having an guest toilet in the entrance was a plus. The bed was good a bit to small for us, used the the european or asian standarts.The spa could offer a bit more luxury or comfort in the changing rooms - looking more like a sport zone than a real MO spa. But the treatment (facial) was fabulous.We will definitively go back, specially for the caviar and champagne breakfast and the large offer of gluten-free products!

I stayed at the hotel with my boyfriend at the time. The hotel is huge and very impressive. The interior and design throughout the hotel is just beoynd classy and rich.The fact they have a restaurant mid way in the hotel with a glass window overlooking the columbus circle and entrance to central park is just magical (I live in New York and it still amazed me).The service was top notch, newspaper at our door on time, bell boy on time and luggage service as well as car service.Nothing was too much hassle.The bathroom was very spacious (for New York standards) and the mini bar was well stocked too!Beautiful rooms, views. The only thing I would say is the way the elevators are located in terms of floors and certain rooms you could easily get lost (especially for an older person) as you need to switch elevators if you're on one of the upper floors.

We love MO hotels and have been lucky enough to stay in quite a few of them across the globe when travelling on vacation. The New York property is fabulous - stunning views, fantastic staff and impeccably furnished. It is also fabulously expensive, although we were lucky enough to get a third night free offer which made it vaguely affordable!! It is however worth every penny. The views from the lounge and restaurant are stunning. And Christina (the lounge hostess) along with the Paris born restaurant manager (I can't recall his name) were lovely, chatting away to us and making us feel so welcome. We dined in Asiate for lunch yesterday (01/13) and it was just right - both delicious and light. The wine list is extensive, but I'd looked at it on line before we left Scotland, so had already spotted that they had Cakebread Cellars wines in the cellar - always a bonus. We didn't use the spa as we were only there for a long weekend, and there's a lot to see and do in NYC! We stayed in a Hudson River View on the 49th floor, so the view was impressive. The layout wasn't as I'd expected (on the website the bathrooms are long and narrow with the bath under a window, whereas our bathroom had no external window - but was massive and very well appointed, as was the bedroom), so I guess there are several floor plans for this room category. Housekeeping kept the room immaculate, and the Shanghai Tang bathroom products are lovely. Special thanks also to Caroline and the other members of the Concierge team - they were all extremely helpful getting restaurant reservations and giving advice. All in all a FANtastic experience and a lovely way to celebrate my partner's 50th birthday (the hotel marked the occasion with a delicious surprise chocolate and raspberry cake). Can't wait to go back!

Comfortable beds, beautifully furnished, quiet, perfect and friendly staff, good location, great complimentary services and very good rates. Best Spa. I came on a business trip, but would always choose to come back to the Mandarin Oriental on private visits too.

We took advantage of a third night free deal from AmEx Travel which came with several perks including hotel credits, early check-in and late check-out, etc. Although it was still expensive, there is value in the extraordinary location, quietly placed high in the sky above Columbus Circle and the southwest corner of central park.The service was impeccable and our room was very elegant, clean and luxurious. The space is used efficiently, making a New York sized hotel room feel cozy and spacious at the same time.The view from both the restaurant and the lobby lounge is mesmerizing. The lounge was fun just to sit and relax with a cocktail before or after dinner.I really love this place and look forward to an opportunity to not only return to it, but to try other Mandarin Oriental locations as well! I am now a FAN.

Let's start with the basics - hotels in New York City are outrageously expensive and notoriously small. However, we stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in a nice sized one bedroom suite for what I have paid at similar hotels in NYC for a standard room AND we received our fourth night for free! So, that put me in a great frame of mind should anything have gone wrong. The best news? Nothing went wrong! Our suite was outfitted in comfortable furniture with grey chenille and cream fabrics. The bed was so comfortable that I did not want to leave it the morning. The room was drafty when the curtains were open and the weather was chilly over NYE's, but we just adjusted the thermostat up two degrees when the curtains were open. The wood floors in the parlor and bedrooms were kinda odd, but I became accustomed to them after a few days. We had a generous supply of aromatic toiletries in our narrow bathroom in which one had to be careful and make sure the door to the water closet was closed before opening the bathroom door while entering in or exiting into the bedroom. Our traveling companion actually smashed his fingers into between the two doors in his suite. Ouch!The service was impeccable. We must have had just the best cleaning staff. The fore mentioned wood floors never had a speck of dust on them and the women were as kind as could be. The spa staff was very accommodating and I would like to thank Nicolette and Fini for their superior massage and facial services. Also, the entire bell and doorman staff is to be commended for always being very helpful. Their smiles and pleasant words were appreciated.On NYEs, we left our dinner and arrived back at the Mandarin to help down the party in the lobby lounge. So glad we stopped in for one final glass of champagne as dancing to the fun band and with the late night/early morning revelers was a great way to welcome in 2014.

Gorgeous hotel with beautifully appointed rooms overlooking Columbus Circle and Central Park. Incredibly comfortable beds and sheets. Black out drapes that cover the entire window. Shoe shine over night complimentary service.

The rooms are nicely appointed, but made smaller to accommodate the larger bathroom layout, which is outstanding. Staff is very accommodating and friendly (front desk, concierge, bellman and valet) but housekeeping is not on the same page with the other departments (i should not have staff barging into the room when I am indisposed and unable to answer the door). The promised amenity for my 7 year old was not provided on check-in, but was graciously delivered when asked for, as well as a second little gift for his friend at home.Limited dining options and a less than attentive service at the lobby bar/restaurant are definite strikes. Also, notwithstanding the advertisement on the web site, the internet access is not free. when you sign into the the wifi, you must go to a web page and pick an option of of how you are going to pay for internet access. There are no free options. notwithstanding the room appointments, there was an unexpected and unusually large amount of noise that interrupted sleep. we heard the toilets flush from other rooms and the acoustics do not stop hallway noise at the door. if there is one complaint that will kill a hotel faster for me than anything else, it is the inability to get a good nights sleep.So, if you paid the premium for the view, and suffered all of the other indignities, you have to ask, is the view worth the price and ll of the other baggage? On balance probably not. it is a shame, as I had very high expectations for this hotel.

We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for our engagement vacation. We booked through American Express platinum, who asked the hotel to "please do something nice." Instead we got aggravation, beginning with a room that was less than impressive at an average of thousand dollars a night. Expected to walk into a room at the Mandarin and say "Wow!" But we said "This is it?" The room was small, the furnishings worn and not upscale and the toilet area did not even have a real door on it, but a piece of see-through glass. When we expressed this to the manager, she had said they had no other rooms available to upgrade us to. After wasting nearly an hour on the phone with American Express who had to make several calls to the hotel, we were finally offered a slightly larger room on a lower floor. We were never sent as much as a nice note saying congratulations on your engagement, nevermind a glass of champagne or even a couple chocolates. Upon checkout, We gave plenty of notice that we needed a bellman and a cab to the airport. 20 minutes later no one had arrived and we called the front desk. We waited 8 more minutes and ended up taking your own bags out of the room and ran into the bellman in the elevator who said no one told him the first time. We expected better quality and better service from a Mandren Oriental.

My husband and I visit NY pretty often and have stayed in lots of different hotels and hands down...this is our favorite! Try to ask for a view of the city and you'll overlook Columbus Circle or ask for a Park view and you'll see Central Park! It is pricey but it's the best view of NY! The rooms are clean, staff is friendly and the food was very good! They have a lounge where you can oversee the city as well.

We flew in from San Francisco on the Friday & partied here till Sunday afternoon when we left for Paris. Best NYC layover - ever‼️ Reception staff was excellent. Dinner @ Asiate was below par, we expected more (compared to The Mark for instance where the service, buzz, cuisine - everything is plain brilliant.) @ Asiate they tried, & there were a couple of exceptional staff but overall seems to be a top down management issue, where proper training is missing. Service disconnects were even more pronounced over breakfast which was beyond slow & vague but the manager set things right with a no charge. Spa is spacious, heated floors & beautifully decorated but offset by a cool professional staff who do not even greet you as they pass by. Had $500 competent facial but did not cone out feeling relaxed because of the overall lack of genuine hospitality. We would go back to this hotel, but not the spa or the restaurant.

Of course its amazing. The views, incredible. The rooms are small, but everything is furnished expertly. The welcome treats are delicious. The location is prime, whole foods downstairs. I stayed here for work, and while it's not my first choice, its stunning. For me, it's suited to an older generation. But it's quiet, professional and you wouldn't be disappointed. The service is attentive, ringing our doorbell in the afternoon offering water and snacks, like a resort.

On a recent visit to New York, I was fortunate to stay at the Mandarin Oriental. The rooms were of a typically high quality, the staff were very attentive without appearing false and the location is brilliant on Columbus Circle. However, the one part of my stay that stood out was the Mo Bar - the 35th floor bar with views of the Manhattan skyline and Central Park. The drinks menu was excellent, staff were helpful when needed and left you alone when needed, providing just the right levels of attention. A great place to have a per theatre drink, catch up with colleagues or enjoy a romantic cocktail with a loved one. I can recommend The Bramble - a lovely cocktail!

My husband and I stayed here for four nights on my first trip to New York. It is well located and easy to walk to many of the sights, the hotel itself is beautiful and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a good size with windows that can be opened (security needs to unlock them but we waited less than five minutes for them to come up). The bed was so comfortable and the room had all of the amenities you'd need. I wasn't overly excited about the bar and restaurant, they have a good view (no better than our room had though) but the food was mediocre and service very slow. Many better options for dining. The spa is incredible and the facial was the best I've had, so relaxing and amazing results. We would certainly stay again on our next trip!

I wanted to surprise my wife with a couple of nights out on the town and made MO NYC our home for the weekend. We get dropped off at the hotel and before we knew it our bags were out and greeted by the hotel doormen. One helping us with our bag and the other holding the door. Took the elevator up to registration . Everything was smooth and fast , but the real treat was the room from the view to the comfortable bed. My wife had a smile on her face and a relaxed look in her eyes and our weekend just began. The room was well appointed and excellent views of Central Park . The service was on point! Anything and everything we request was accommodated, excellent room service and great views during breakfast. The bar , spa,and pool were great. The only time we left was to smoke a cigarette . We had a great time in our town and didn't even leave our hotel .
user_name:
Knicpo
New York City, New York

review_body: No doubt, you are in one of the hotel of the mandarin oriental group.... everything is perfect until the most unsignifiant detail... From your arrival to your departure you can expect to get the higher level of service...ideally located, rooms with a view on central park have a terrific view... ideally to have your breakfast in room (the restaurant is not very intersisting by the way).

Being gluten intolerant I am choosy where I go for special occasions. High tea is my all time favourite and I made enquiries at several 5 star hotels in New York regarding gluten free options. The Mandarin Oriental was the only one to have a serious option, and how good was it!From my initial enquiries and booking which was handled extremely professionally and empathetically to the experience on the day, I could not fault it. The food was excellent with many gluten free cakes/ sweets and sandwiches. They even provided a special treat for my daughters birthday. The service was excellent and I love the comfy lounges by the window with a great view of central park,

We went for a short trip (weekend) and decided to stay at the MO. We were not disappointed, the room was amazing, spacious and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and the view from the 56th floor breathtaking, especially at night. The location was great. Unlike other rooms at other hotels in NY, you could really feel that you can breathe in the MO room! The price is indeed high - as one would expect - but we would stay here again.

I've stayed in the MO NY several times and this was a quick one night stay - a staycation really as I live now in the area and just fancied a night away from home to match up with a party I was going to uptown.Again, the MO did not disappoint. All New York hotel rooms are modest in size compared to some other cities, but even the smallest MO NYC room is actually quite decent. Great service from staff and definitely the best view of New York from their lobby lounge. I had particularly great help from housekeeping who sorted out my ironing and shoe shining in just 30 minutes as I arrived quite late, and also from concierge who went out on the run for me for cufflinks which I had forgotten - they appeared with a package from the nearby Thomas Pink store in less than 45 minutes.

Booked a suite for the 2 of us, and a room for our son &his wife &toddler. Asked for a good view (Hudson &central park), and got moved, after 1 night, to a very good suite 4930, with the young ones in 4932; closing a door in corridor created a supersuite -- excellent for little Ella. The view was wonderful.All meals there were very good, inc. service. Lounge is very good.Very clean.All requests were promptly taken care of, inc. 2 cribs -- 1 in each room.Mixup with concierge lost the young ones a chance to get to "sleep no more" -- were told bookings not needed, which was not so. They tried to fix, but the tickets available were too late -- we left that day.We were wait-listed for quite a while (1 night was problematic) but were happy to get in at the end.

When we booked on line it said 6pm checkout which is wonderful with kids on a sunday, when we got to the hotel they said noon checkout but eventually made one of our two rooms 6pm checkout which was nice. Staff was amazing, location could not be better, we used the pool, there are no DVD players in the room, wifi was not free. The rooms are expensive and small but I guess you get what you pay for. Rooms service was fast and delicious. Connecting rooms are Great for families. Walk to the park, FAO, rock center, times square.

I went from the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo (Japan) to the one in NYC in 2 days, it's amazing how two hotels from the same luxurious chain can be so different. The one in Tokyo is perfection the NYC one is the exact opposite.Everything is bad, from the moment you arrive and nobody is there to help with your luggage to the check in at reception where you won't be shown to your rooms, the furthest you will be escorted to is the elevator still hauling your luggage !You will find the only above 40USD breakfast in the world that includes no hot or cold drink in it, yes, you heard me, coffee, tea, juice are all supplements that with tax will almost double the price of your breakfast.The spa is really not nice, very cold place with absolutely no charm.Rooms are clean and ok, but in this category of hotels you expect the full package, great location, perfect service, and nice rooms. In the case of the Mandarin Oriental New York you won't find it. Don't even think about staying there unless there is nothing else left, I can guarantee you will be disappointed !

The NY Mandarin Oriental is truly a great hotel. You should, however, take into account that you are in New York where rooms are extremely small. The rooms of the Mandarin are beautiful (with great views) but not huge. The location, staff & service is top. I would definitely stay again.

Wow, from the lobby, to the lounge, to the rooms. Was attending a party and we given a special rate, (well not that special was still $750 for night) so we decided to splurge and stay over even though we live only 20 minutes away. Parking garage is easy access is in same hotel or you can do valet. The lobby is on something like the 40th floor and just grand. Views across Central Park are great. Even if you are not staying at hotel you can have a drink or tea in the lounge.Room was very nice, we had a standard room which still had a decent view of Central Park although partially blocked by the Trump International Hotel.

Stayed last month at Mandarin Oriental NYC for the first time. The room was not large butvery well equipped and nicely decorated. I enjoyed the breakfast served at Asiate with its great view of central park. The staff were very good. I enjoyed the spa and the staff in theswimming pool were very helpful to my grandkids. I also liked the location within the Time Warner center, it was very convenient for restaurants and shops.

Stayed at this property for 4 nights in October 2013. It was a deluxe room with park view. It was a truly fantastic stay, where we were totally relaxed, felt valued, and were more than satisfied with the service, accommodation, and meals we received.Pros:• The room was wonderful – well appointed, good storage space, great bed, and enough lighting. While the deco is a bit dated, it appears to be holding up very well. Plus, the maintenance of artworks, furnishings and fixtures seem very current. Loved the views. Must commend the housekeeping staff for their prompt service, consistency and professionalism.• The bathroom is great – good layout, feels luxurious and is equipped with deep soaking tub and powerful showers. Cannot impress how much a well-appointed bathroom can make or break a hotel stay. And this one truly comes out with flying colours. • Public spaces – great, airy, and with such memorable views. Doesn’t ever feel crowded or vacant. Some of the sculptures and artworks can be updated but apart from that, it’s perfect.• Pool and gym – great pool for a workout. Not so good if there are more than 2 swimmers as the waves get very bouncy. Ideally, this pool should have edges that overflow. Gym is sufficient with minimal equipment. Best part is that these facilities are only for hotel guests. Many luxury properties around the world are moving to membership access for their facilities, which gives hotel guests more options, but also more competition. • Restaurant – OMG, best meals ever! And so reasonable for such quality meals. Had breakfasts and lunches here. Loved it, loved the selections and also loved the wonderful views. Highly recommend, especially for the ambiance.• Staff – fantastic! Well done MONY! You’ve certainly shown how much you value staff in ensuring that staff treat all guest with consistent courtesy, professionalism, and kindness. Truly made our stay that much more extraordinary. The best thing about the staff at MONY is that we know we will want to come back over and over again because of how we were treated by them. We found staff at door, porter, concierge, frontdesk, housekeeping, and wait staff with the same professional attitude, friendliness, courtesy and knowledgeable of their roles. Cons:• Minor hiccup with Room Service when we ordered tea one afternoon – it arrived an hour late. By that time, our guests had left and we had no use for the tea.• Lighting switches can be simplified in the rooms. Ideally, the one panel control would be great. • Pool with overflow edges would be great, especially with multiple swimmers.Overall, loved staying here and would definitely describe this as our new luxury retreat in NYC.

While this hotel has a superb View and amenities such as a swimming pool and a superb lobby. The Rooms makes you feel lacking. While the View is graceful the rooms are small although the decor is beautiful.

The place was gorgeous and if had a fantastic lobby. The mini bar in the rooms weren't to costly, and the menu the same. The showers were kinda old looking and the bathroom smelled like smoke but I didn't mind and I really enjoyed my stay. If there was one thing that could be improved, I would change the pillows to real goose down.

The only reason to stay here is the location and the views.This is certainly not a 5 star hotel. Nothing about this property felt luxurious. Most of the staff was unfriendly and impersonal.The furniture in our room was chipped and worn. The tub was small.Our spa services were very good. However the locker rooms and amenities were sparse. There were no private dressing areas and minimal seating.The attendants were unfriendly.there is only a sauna. To steam you must use the steam which is on a different floor.The concierge did not call back on a request as promised. We had 2 breakfasts there, one worse than the next. I sent back the requested " dry" omelette the second day because the oil on it was actually visible, coffee service was prompt that day, but we discovered after the first coffee they had stopped giving us decaf.The front desk never called down to request the cab they had volunteered to get, nor did they do anything when we told them the confirmed celebratory amenity was never delivered.

This a near perfect hotel with very high quality rooms and service. The rooms are beautifully appointed. The beds, bathroom, electronic connections and the view are superb. Maid service is phenomenal. Everyone in the staff goes overboard to fulfill requests regarding the room or food in the restaurants. Service is also extraordinarily efficient in all respects at the desk, the concierge, restaurants and even parking. The only blemish is an element of excessive greed, such as ridiculously charging a daily fee for internet service!

We are on our way to Italy later today but we flew into NYC yesterday and stayed just one night at the Mandarin Oriental. Wow! From the moment you step onto the curb the bellman, concierge, etc is there to serve you. Check in is handled in such a personal way that you feel like they are family. Guest services at your beck and call. View from the "Central Park View" room is spectacular. Highly recommend an experience here!
user_location: Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, United States
user_name:
Tricia L
Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, United States

review_body: We chose the Mandarin Oriental largely because of its great location - a few minutes walk from 5th ave. We didn't know that that was just the beginning of what it had to offer. The rooms are spacious, luxurious, and well furnished including the bathrooms which were quite impressive. The views from our room were stunning, overlooking central park. The service here is king, including room service, concierge, and the bar. The restaurant was also very majestic, and the food was awesome!

One of the best hotels in Manhattan, superb quality of the rooms and services. Stayed there for 3 nights and enjoyed everything, although the time was limited due to the activities in the city. Bit expensive but it is surely worth.

Visited a few days for vacations. The sky lounge offer variety of food with the nice view. The room are comfort and give us a very nice moment in NYC. Location is convenience. Right next to Central Park!
user_location: New York City, New York, USA
user_name:
ciliant2013
New York City, New York, USA

review_body: The guest rooms begin on the 38th floor of this hotel. Our room was on the 51st. It was quiet by NYC standards. We had beautiful views of Central Park and the Hudson because we had a corner suite, the suite was nicely appointed, the bathroom was spacious, the bed was comfortable. The hotel also has a junior Olympic swimming pool. There is a Whole Food Market in the Time Warner Center next door, and a great place for breakfast, Bouchon, also in the TWC, which has both a bakery cafe and to go counter. We really enjoyed our stay.

We took our 11 year old daughter for a birthday weekend celebration and the Mandarin rocked. Not only did they provide the highest level of service at every juncture, they even delivered a wonderful gift to our room. Concierge is fabulous. Food is sublime. Spa clean and pool awesome. A huge FAN!!!

My mom and friend and I went to the lobby bar for a cocktail after dinner. A coworker had recommended it to me because of the great view of NYC. The lobby is on the 35th floor and the lobby bar has floor to ceiling windows. The team in the 2 bars were unbelievably gracious and kind. Christina (hostess) went the extra mile to ensure that we were comfortable and had a table with a lovely view. Richie (bartender) was so welcoming even though he was closing in a few minutes when we got there. He asked us to please take our time. He overheard that it was my birthday and surprised me with complimentary chocolate covered strawberries and a candle! So thoughtful. I had the Heavenly Hibiscus cocktail and it was phenomenal. Thomas (Manager) made a point to stop by our table and check to make sure we were happy. My friend was wearing jeans and we were concerned that it would be a problem. It wasn't at all! We had such a positive experience. I would recommend this beautiful bar and hotel to anyone! -Megan Hennessey@MPHennessey
user_name:
Megan_P_Hennessey
New York City, New York

review_body: The Mandarin Oriental is conveniently located on Columbus Circle. This makes access to shopping on 5th Avenue easy (10 minute walk) and of course is a stone’s throw from the bottom of Central Park. I stayed in a “Hudson River View” room. The view was lovely and the bedroom and its facilities were comfortable and above average. I loved the large bathroom and the orange packaged products. The Asiate Restaurant is good for breakfast and offers some very nice views. The lobby lounge has a great atmosphere in the evening (enjoyed sipping on champagne there!). Staff went out of their way service wise and were always courteous and helpful. I arrived at 09h00 after two long flights from Johannesburg and arranged an early check in with no effort. I was most impressed when in error I cashed a $500 travellers cheque thinking it was a $50! I had absolutely no problem sorting this out when I discovered it the next day. I can highly recommend this hotel.

When you enter the hotel at street level you will be greeted by properly dressed doormen who will escort you to their super fast elevators; check-in is on the 35th floor and you then begin to experience one of a kind views. Rooms are spacious, nicely decorated, and bathrooms are complete with shower stall, private toliet and huge sink. Every table in the restaurants or lounges feature those stunning views. Staff very helpful. Stay here on your next visit to the area. We were attending a black-tie family wedding on the 36th floor ballroom and were very pleased with everything!
user_name:
James R
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for five days they could not do enough for us. We had a premier Central Park view room. View was fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble had bed and breakfast rates so we had breakfast in the room every day food was fantastic. Check in took 5 minutes very efficient. All staff down to doorman were fantastic. Would stay here again or any other mandarin hotel

Not over the top luxury, but luxurious indeed. We typically stay downtown, but for events at the Lincoln Center, MONY is a fabulous place to stay uptown. Moderate, typical king room with generous size bathrooms - double sinks in NYC. Beautiful views: even numbers west for the river and sunset, even numbers high floors Central Park south. Front desk and bellman service impeccable. We did feel "over-sold" in the lounge for late night dinner upon arrival. Bottle water when we asked for tap, 2 entrees when we asked to share, two extra wines when we wanted to share. Caught in the excitement of arriving we let it go but definitely were aware. Same with room service. If I ask for coffee and specific fruit, no I don't want juice, rolls etc.

First the plus points: superb views, a great Bar, excellent gym and swimming pool and a very good restaurant. Service isn't as faultless as you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental or at these rates - for example, we weren't shown to our room on being checked in (and with a 1300 dollar nightly rate that might be what you could expect).

We stayed in MONYC for 5 nights as a whole it was a nice stay however some rooms for improvement.What we likeLocation:Close to all the places you want to check out. Right across Central Park. If shopping is your thing, here you have Sephora, William Sanoma, Moleskin, Pinks to name a few in the same building. Room decoration:A fine size with well-appointed bathroom. Our room has a lovely view of Hudson river. I love decoration combining Chinese touch with contemporary elements. Colour scheme goes from beige, brown with the accent of dark red.. bringing together luxury and comfort.Staff:Nice and attentive. concierge is very helpful!! :)Room Service:Wonton noodle soup was tasty. All what I wanted for night snack.Here are the hard partsFitness centre:Due to the limited space of the gym, I wish for more variety of the machines and free weights for ladies. Staff at the gym are very attentive. Pool was closed for maintenance for the entire period of our stay. Breakfast:Lovely restaurant overlooking Central Park. Food can be improved. I had been craving for Asian food for a while so I ordered "Mandarin Oriental" set which comes with Congee, dumplings.. Well if you look for an authentic taste, do not order it. Dumpling was chewy and uneatable. Room:Forgot to replenish the bathroom amenities and mini bar for many days. Rain shower switch was broken. Look forward to the improvements and better stay next visit.

I was a little reluctant to stay in the tower above the Columbus Circle Centre but if you want views, ours from the 56th floor was breathtaking. Staying was an event in itself, particularly watching the sunrise. The one bedroom corner suite was very comfortable but the bathroom was missing some sparkle I would say - common of large chain brands. The suite overall lacks some of the luxurious details of the Dorchester Group hotels for example or even the Firmdale Group hotels in London. That said, if the prices weren't so eye watering (not just the room but the restaurant too) I would consider this a 4.5 star rating and recommend to first or second time visitors to NYC.

What's to say? If you're looking for a luxury hotel, you could do far worse than the Mandarin in NYC. Great location, staff and amenities. Will stay here every time. The only tricky thing is that our GPS had us driving around Columbus Circle looking for it when it's the entrance is on the south side of W 60th just east of Broadway.

everything was exceptional from check in to departure. I had emailed the hotel to say it was my wife's 50th birthday celebration surprise & on check in they upgraded our already decent room (& rate as booked via BA with flight) to a Central Park view from the 48th floor, amazing! Polite staff everywhere to assist with little questions on travel around NYC. I would be astounded if clients had much to complain about from my 3 night experience but i guess some people always look to find a fault - ok some chap called Trump has a massive tower block in front on the hotel but far enough away to not spoil the view....we had meals booked as presents so didn't eat at the hotel but restaurant looked excellent and along with bar (great wines) the view was simply the best. I would be annoyed to see any complaints against this exceptional hotel where customers come first - what training course had the staff been on as some hotels could learn!!

My wife and I recently celebrated our wedding anniversary at this magnificent property. To say we were treated as royalty doesn't do justice to our experience. I had mentioned the reason for our visit to the reservations agent and it seemed the entire hotel knew why we were visiting. to celebrate our arrival the hotel sent up strawberries and wine, as well as a delicious chocolate cake. our spa services were also outstanding and spa reception also knew we were there to celebrate our anniversary.its no secret that hotels in NYC are not cheap and certainly the Mandarin is on the high end. but we felt it was money well spent especially as we tried to make our visit extra special. we spent even more and upgraded to a magnificent suite overlooking central park. if you want to enjoy an extra special visit to NYC, visiting the wonderfully located Mandarin Oriental is well worth the effort.

If you want to enjoy your visit to New York then this is the hotel to stay in!Stayed there for a few days. Everything is spot on. 1. My room was over looking the Central Park - STUNNING view. The room is big!2. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. 3. The location is great too. Subway nearby that can take you to broadway / soho / anywhere 4. easily. You can even walk to broadway! Not far - about 10 mins walk. Taxi to/from the airport was about $50 - not bad at all.The best thing bout this location is that it is not too crowded like when you stay in midtown. And you get to enjoy Central Park. You can have a relaxing morning in the park, then lunch in upper west/east side, then enjoy broadway in the evening. Just perfect.It's going to be hard to find another hotel that can match this in NYC.

Don't be scared away by the steep prices! This is one of those splurges that one should do when you want a memorable new york experience. I have stayed here 2 times in the past and can say that the experience is one of a kind. All the staff go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable with an asian flair. Let's not forget about the location of this excellent hotel. Literally within walking distance to broadway, 5th avenue, and of course next to central park. I cannot think of a better place for one to stay when visiting New York. A little tip: Sometimes you can get a deal through AMEX where you stay 3-4 nights and get one free. This always makes me feel better about the room bill when I check out. Also for a romantic experience visit the Lobby Bar or Asiate. You cannot go wrong at either restaurant and be sure to request a table by the window. I plan on staying here in October for a weekend getaway!

Among my family we had 3 different room categories and they were all excellent. Sizes were similar so the price differences pretty much only account for the views. Breakfast was excellent. Gym and pool were decently sized. Location is amazing - on top of the Columbus Circle subway station, across the street for Central Park, above a Whole Foods Market and a few restaurants. The double lift lobbies are slightly annoying but there are more than enough lifts and they're plenty fast. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

If not for the views, the food, the pool, the service and the great design, this place would be nothing. Luckily it has it all. So it is simply the best. The babysitters we got were the sweetest ladies in the world. The reservations at Per Se were also kinda cool. But the views, the views, just pull up a chair and never leave.

It is worth visiting for breakfast thanks to an unforgettable view and a very pleasant athmosphere, but I would not go back for a three nights stay as i did in may. The hotel is clearly one of the best in NY but incredibely expensive and i did not like the location that much. Service is great and both the restaurant and he breakfast room are worth the visit. The rooms are up to the standard but not special. Not a great value for money stay

We've just got back from our second New York trip and our second stay at the Mandarin Oriental where we had 5 nights in a 40th floor room with extensive views over Central Park. Our first New York visit was in August 2011 when we again stayed at the MO for 5 nights.As other reviews have stated - its not cheap, but then you know that before you book. In my opinion you get what you pay for. The room was spacious, luxurious and well equipped and the en suite was equally luxurious. The staff were attentive, polite and helpful.The dining room again had superb views across the park and we had a table at the window to take full advantage of this, service was second to none.The hotel is sited on the corner of W60th at Columbus Circle. It is in a quiet spot when compared with other hotels in and around Times Square, 5th Avenue etc, yet it is only a 15 minute walk to Times Square or for the less enthusiastic the subway at 59th Street is a 30 second walk away and the entrance to Central Park is just across the road from the subway. The downside ? Yes there were a couple of issues. Firstly our booking which was made through a UK travel agent months in advance was for three adult guests. When we checked in at around 4pm there was a surprised look on the face of the desk staff. We entered our room and found only a double bed in the room. When we returned to the room some 5 hours later after a walk to Times Square, some shopping and a meal, we were still a bed short. It took a phone call and another 30 minute wait before the room was complete.The second issue - WiFi. If the Apple Store on 5th Avenue can provide free WiFi for anybody that walks into the store (no purchase necessary) then surely a 5* hotel shouldn't be charging paying guests for their WiFi usage ?? OK, perhaps a pre set download limit per day could be free and then charge for all downloads in excess of that, but charging for any usage ?? We walked to the Apple Store and kept in touch with home courtesy of them, when we should have been able to do it from the comfort of our 5* room for the same cost - nothing. Come on Mandarin, you're charging enough for me to stay with you, where are the perks ??Enough said, these issues didnt spoil our stay and YES, I'd stay there again when we next get the chance to visit NYC

We spent two nights here on a business trip and it was wonderful. Nice size rooms for Manhattan with great views of the skyline and the Hudson. But the staff is what really makes this Hotel everyone could not of been nicer and more helpful. It may be pricy but worth it. The Columbus circle location is great connects to the Time Warner building with plenty of shopping and an easy walk to all the great shops in New York on Madison and 5th ave.We did not eat in the restaurant but it is located on the 35th floor near the reception desk and it looked wonderful with a window wall over looking the city also a nice lounge next to it. We will be back and give it a try. We did order room service for breakfast and they were right on time and everything well prepared. I have to mention the beds a linens my wife and I both said we had the best nights sleep here the beds and linens were so comfortable. Great stay !

My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights while on a trip to celebrate our anniversary. It was our second stay at the Mandarin Oriental. The hotel has went downhill a bit since we stayed there almost 5 years ago. The location is still fantastic, obviously, but the ammenities, service and overall feel were not the "5 star" experience we were expecting. A few things stand out that brought the hotel down a notch including some mold in the shower - in a 5 star - really? Lack of pillow choice / uncomfortable pillows. We visited the lobby bar several times during the trip, you can't beat the view for a pre-dinner cocktail but were disappointed with the breakfast buffet and had a bad coffee experience one afternoon. When you're paying the 5 star prices, you expect close to perfection and this time the Mandarin Oriental failed to deliver. All-in-all, still a very enjoyable stay but we will be looking at other options for our next trip to New York.

I was expecting a world of luxury and decadence when I booked for a one night stay at the Mandarin Oriental NYC however I was sadly disappointed and frankly shocked at the lack of quality, glitz, and cleanliness of this establishment. I was able to find a fairly low rate of $595 for one night compared to their usual rates of $800 however as a result I believe I was given the worse room in their collection. First the room was seriously outdated and in great need of a renovation. Bedding was substandard for a five star hotel. The bathroom was the worst thing that I ever saw. A brown shower curtain for the shower stall that did not hold in the water. A shower faucet that kept breaking during use. A rain shower that truly was satisfactory at best. A washroom door partition that was broken and off the hinges. The TV in the bathroom was also hanging from some wires; awful. And the truth be told that the shower was not perfectly clean. The concierge, while friendly gave me the incorrect information pertaining to the opening hours of a department store.At the end of a very quick stay, I complained to the necessary individuals and had my entire room charge deducted. I was not going to pay one penny for a hotel room that was not functional, nor esthetically pleasing to the eye. I later find out that the hotel gave my wife and I an accessible room, although we are not physically challenged. As a seasoned traveler I know that hotels who see someone paying a lower rate, give away their accessible rooms instead of their regular rooms. I find this practice to be unacceptable and quite frankly rude. Hotels should keep these accessible rooms always available to those guests that may require them. Not sell them out to anyone. And the hotel should inform the guest upon check-in that in fact the room that they are going to give you is an accessible room with the following modifications. It should be up to the guest if then they want to continue in this type of room or ask for another one, after all we are the ones who are paying the rate.What disappointed me the most was my initial impression of the Mandarin Oriental Hotels as something of luxury. Their ads always claim that these Hollywood Superstars stay at their properties. Well folks, first hand I experienced the Mandarin Oriental NYC and unless you a super-rich and do not care about what you are paying and what you are receiving this hotel then is for you. I care about how much I pay, and I have no problems paying for a great room. Unfortunately what you pay is not what you get at this hotel. I am quite surprised that in NYC for that matter the Mandarin Oriental is not luxurious, in fact quite the opposite, I would classify as ordinary on the verge of unpleasant.I had a better shower at a Town Suites of Marriott by the airport in Buffalo then I had at the Mandarin Oriental. $800 for a room compared to a Town Suites room at $169. You do the math. Save your money and stay somewhere else. If you are looking for an outstanding five star hotel in the city, check out The Chatwal Hotel. I recently stayed there and while I may have experienced some difficulties during my stay, the rooms were beautiful and tremendously luxurious for a much more reasonable price than the Mandarin Oriental.I am curious to return to the Mandarin Oriental NYC to see for myself if in fact the rooms are all of poor quality and standard that I received during my most recent stay. I am hopeful they are not because if they are there are a lot of folks on tripadvisor who are being ripped off for what they are receiving.

The best hotel I stayed at. The food was amazing (tasting menu). The staff is very accommodating and the location amazing. The price is expected (expensive) if you are overlooking Central Park , though not a direct view of the park.

We were a family visiting from England.I liked the mandarin overall, but it was hugely expensive, and on arrival our rooms weren't ready or thoroughly cleaned when we eventually got in- at 6pm. That said, the staff were really welcoming and friendly, the food was great and the location cannot be beaten. The pool is a bit disappointing as its only 3 ft or so deep, but the lifeguards were great fun. On balance I would stay here again. I can't decide if its family friendly or not! Some of the small touches like bottled water at the door for runners/ kids were great.

IDEAL LOCATION, central, directly on Central Park and closed to all attractions, museums, shopping on 5th avenue, Broadway theaters, Lincoln Center ... The Concierge is GREAT, WONDERFUL and THOUGHTFUL : he helps us for our visits, finds events tickets with excellent seats, gives advices, nothing was impossible ... Daily newsletters with indication of the weather forecast, the visits to do, the performances not to be missed ...BEAUTIFUL view on Central Park and Manhattan, beautiful and comfortable rooms with an excellent service, refined and thoughtful. The restaurant Asiate and the In-room dining are just PERFECT, delicious food and elegant service.WONDERFUL HOTEL !! WONDERFUL SERVICE !!

Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Manhattan is an ideal luxury hotel for an amazing stay in The Big Apple. It has spectacular views of the famous skyline and a great central location at Columbus Circle. It's rooms are spacious and the beds are so comfortable. Service and restaurant facilities are superb.

Had a special trip to NYC and wanted to stay at the Time Warner Center. Service was excellent--allowed VERY early check-in, friendly, helpful, courteous, etc. Even gave a special amenity since it was my husband's birthday. Room was pretty but not overly large, had all the modern conveniences--GREAT bathroom and a very nice view of Central Park West/Columbus Circle. Again, extremely convenient to Time Warner Center. HOWEVER, not worth paying two-to-five times as much as other NYC hotels--most visitors to New York don't spend that much time in their actual hotel room, and would be crazy to overpay like this. IF you are planning business meetings and want to impress people with the lobby bar, etc., then this is a good choice, but for families and/or tourists, you'd be wise to pay less elsewhere.

Traveled to New York with my extended family for New Year and was greeted by this stunning hotel! Cannot recommend this enough. Pricey but worth the money for a special stay in an amazing city. Food and cocktails were tasteful, served with magnificent views of Central Park. Location couldn't be better for tourists and the staff were very generous in their hospitality. The rooms were of a good size and very clean. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Great location and nice room. Lobby lounge too small for the number of hotel rooms and so difficult to get a seat there. Lounge manager laughably off hand but there are lots of other places nearby to get a drink. The meridian and ritz Carlton are a much safer bet and offer much better service. Wouldn't recommend this as many other better options. Should have realised this when it wasn't in any of the guidebooks!

35-54 floor of the building is the hotel. Conference facilities were really nice and well organized. Beautiful view and really nice rooms. We got a good deal on accommodation - kind of out of my regular price range - but a wonderful treat.

We stayed here the first week in January for our daughter's 8th Birthday. We booked through Amex Platinum and took advantage of the 3rd night free promotion which is an outstanding value. We stayed in a high floor 1 bedroom suite. We felt as if we were in our own NYC apartment. The floor to ceiling windows in the living area offered spectacular views- it was hard to leave the room! The bathroom was especially luxurious- my daughter loved the heated toilet seat and spray settings. The picture window over the tub is a wonderful touch. Housekeeping was impeccable. Each day room service sent our daughter a special treat: cupcakes with a birthday candle, cookies, chocolate cake- all complimentary. We were also offered the hotel car to take us to dinner and Broadway shows- a luxurious amenity! Our daughter also enjoyed the pool with its spectacular views. The location cannot be beat. The views from Asiate are breathtaking. We walked to Central Park and down the street to FAO Schwartz and wonderful shopping. It is pricey but worth it. My only complaint is that the linens on the bed are poor quality. The sheets and pillow cases are so scratchy that even our daughter commented on this. This absolutely needs to be addressed by management as all other aspects of our stay were perfect.

We stayed here last Saturday night - we spent two nights at the Plaza before - what a difference.From the second we got off the elevator all was at peace in my world. Beautiful lobby - stupendous view and some of the most genuine, professional staff one could ever imagine. My kudos go to the MOHO - everything was perfect - the check in/out - the room - the late night cocktails and won-ton soup in the lounge down to the artfully presented scrambled eggs for room service breakie. I wouldn't change a thing!I will be back! THANK YOU!Slocker

This was our 5th time at this property. We usually go this time of year for several days. Staff are among the most professional in the industry (in my experience). Always on top of things, very positive attitudes, they are the epitome of hospitality. Location is perfect for anything you desire; museums, theatre, music, dining (and don't miss at least one dinner at Asiate), walking in a fascinating area, and let's not leave out Central Park. The Spa is close to perfect physically and with excellent staff. Lounge is one of the best in the city with incredible views, food and cocktail selections. This is a financial splurge (for most) but likely you wont regret it. Memories like this are fairly priceless.

We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for our ten year wedding anniversary during the third week of May. This would be our fourth visit to New York in the past two years. We love New York! We stayed at the Setai last time, and were so disappointed- not a five star what so ever! Now, Mandarin Oriental, is fantastic, superb, amazing, and by far a true five-star hotel. Really, all the reviews are consistent and say the same thing, stay here and you won’t be disappointed. You get treated like royalty. Eric, the Front Desk Manager was amazing to us, and did everything he could to make our stay memorable. We stayed in room 4108 which OMG had the best view ever, Manhattan skyline and Central Park! This hotel has the best lobby lounge, to enjoy evening drinks overlooking the best view of the cityline! It is located close to the Shops at Columbus Circle (Time Warner Center) which has a variety of convenient stores that I frequented almost daily like Sephora, Whole Foods and Bouchon Bakery. The hotel has a well-equipped gym, the rooms are well-maintained, the service is impeccable – I can not think of a single flaw. I guarantee you, this is the hotel you will keep on coming back to, we sure will! PS - since you are reading this and planning a trip to NYC, don’t forget to check out Mario Batali’s all-things-Italian marketplace, Eataly, and of course my absolute fave – the famous, “best chocolate chip cookie in New York” at Levain Bakery!

Stellar service, beautiful decor and just what you need to relax and enjoy yourself. Best spa I have ever been to. Expensive but delivers on the cost so you are not disappointed at all. Worth the money a hundred times over. Not one complaint.

Did NOT stay at the hotel, but did arrange to have a special welcome gift, food and wine waiting for my out of town friends who were checking in for a few days. I made arrangement with Geraldine B (Asst Guest Relations) at onset to help me find out exact date/time they were schedule to arrive and then time of arrival - Diandra D (Director of Guest Relations) stayed in touch with me constantly assuring me my order was there waiting in there assigned room and all was well - even though my guests were late arriving. Finally, Gabriel R (Guest Service AGent) sent me an email indicating all was well- my friend finally arrived. I must this surprise I planned for my visitng freinds went off without a hitch on the Hotel Staff's part - they were late on account of driving in from Boston in nasty traffic. Thanks so much MANDARIN for handling this small but very important to me task of hospitality. You three deserve this mention.

Just spent a weekend with my wife at Mandarin in NYC. In a tropical storm, they wouldn't send the house car 1 block to pick us up or send a taxi. Room was small. Hostess at lobby bar sat a friend and I and then told us for 5 min that we weren't dressed well. Spoke with the GM after filling out their survey and he offered nothing to make it right. Spa was great but I will never stay there again. I was warned. 4 Seasons, Peninsula and Parker Meridian for me from now on.

This hotel is ok. Location saves it. Our 6k a night suite is so-so. We will be looking for a different hotel next time. Nothing special. When you can afford to pay high prices a certain level of service is expected. This place is hit or miss.

We stayed in the Central Park view corner suite on the 51st view. Great room with an excellent view. The living area, bedroom, and bathroom are spacious. A guest bathroom is off the living area. Good views from the bar and restaurant off the lobby. The hotel is just off Columbus circle and across the street from Central Park.

Stayed for 2 nights with my husband on business and received a complimentary upgrade to a room with a central park view! It was our first time staying at the New York Mandarin Oriental and we were pleased to find that the customer service is fantastic, especially the front of house staff. The location is fantastic - you can get to wholefoods and various other shops without leaving the building, perfect for rainy days. With Starbucks opposite the hotel and the park across the road its hard to beat the location. The view from the restaurant is amazing and the food was surprisingly cheap for the quality. The internet was very fast in the hotel room. The bathroom is very luxurious - perfect for romantic evenings. Th gym, although small is fully functional although it doesn't have a great view. The swimming pool is worth a visit even if just for the view. This is now our chosen hotel in New York and we will be returning in August.

This is as good as it gets. The rooms are beautiful. The beds so comfortable. Tvs are great. Great views. Great service. Peaceful and relaxing. Great location. The best hotel in NYC. The bar has great drinks and great views. The decorations are prime.
user_name:
AJ C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Spent a night here Mother's Day Weekend - spent an incredible few hours at the amazing spa - and enjoyed the location, the hospitality, and the comfy room. Such a treat! We upgraded to room with a view - but honestly if you are out and about enjoying everything the city has to offer - probably don't need the view from your window too, if you are looking to save somewhere.

When in NYC my husband and I will only stay at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. We always have a great time, but after this past weekend I had to write a review because there isn't a hotel in the world that could have given my husband, my family and my friends this experience. My husband and I had our wedding there which was the most spectacular event that any of our family and friends have ever experienced. The ballroom is a dream with the most spectacular views of Columbus Circle and Central Park, In my opinion the best views in NYC. The service and the food were by far the finest any of us have ever had... But the wedding was what is was because of the extremely talented and creative Associate Director of Catering, James Munz, who in my opinion is the gem of any event that takes place at the Mandarin. His knowledge and experience blew us away, but his personality made working with him the best experience for my husband and I. I have been to and have hosted many events but this was the smoothest, finest and most organized team of people I have ever worked with. Over 100 of our family and friends stayed at the hotel for the wedding and all of us were cared for beyond our expectations. The hotel rooms are stunning and the beds a dream to sleep in. The brunch the morning after the wedding was fabulous as well. If anyone doubts that you can't have it all at one location, well I would like to tell you that you can have the finest event in the finest hotel in NYC with the best food and service in NYC with by far the best views in NYC and its all at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in NYC. Oh... and I forgot to mention the Spa is out of this world.

We've stayed many times in NYC with our children and dog in various luxury hotels. The Mandarin is by far the best. From check in to check out...flawless. The views from our suite...4816 were spectacular! Our room was not ready upon arrival, but they did their very best in making us comfortable. They offered complimentary cocktails and wine in The Lobby Lounge, along with lunch. The view from the lounge was amazing. The last thing on our minds was the room. Overall, spacious, comfortable, excellent service, great food and drink. Pricey, but worth every penny! I no longer have to search for the best hotel in NYC...I found it. it's the Mandarin!

We have been staying here for past week and have enjoyed ever moment. We are on the 49th Floor with a magnificent view over Central Park and Columbus Circle and one could sit for hours just watching New York move its so fascinating. The Hotel is a lovely place to stay and well worth the price and nothing is to much trouble for any of the staff. We would recommend this Hotel to anybody and would return any day without a doubt.

This is not a review of the hotel, just the restaurant Asiate.I took my family (Mom, Dad and Brother) to New York for a family vacation this past winter. We stayed at the Plaza which of course is fabulous. We dined out every meal for a week and I made a reservation at Asiate for our second last dinner. I read before hand their menu and made reservations, however I believe maybe we missed the "À La Carte" menu time period? When we arrived ready to dine, the hostess notified us that it is not an a la carte restaurant for dinner and that it's a 90$ only set menu with wine pairing. After eating out all week at expensive locations I felt that it was a bit pricey and was confused over the a la carte menu and the set menu. The staff we're EXTREMELY friendly and polite as well as understanding that it was a pricey restaurant. After my parents and I conversing in Danish the only language they are fluent in, we decided that it was just too pricey and wanted to just eat at the Plaza, the hostess then got her manager and to my amaze kept offering us different alternatives and maybe try out the lounge as it's more affordable and they would give us an a la carte menu, however we would not be allowed to sit there because my brother is under 21. As my parents did not understand what they we're talking about, they simply told me we should just leave and eat somewhere else and they walked towards to elevators. As they left the hostess and manager kept offering me alternatives - which is so rare in New York, let's be honest, people there are incredibly rude and have a "don't care" attitude. They even offered us to eat at an a la carte menu in a more private dinning room. But it was too late my family just wanted to leave as my brothers age prohibited our dinning options and felt it wasn't a very family friendly dinning experience. The hostess and manager of Asiate we're superb and just so overly friendly which was a comfort after staying in a cold and unfriendly city for a week. I do hope this gets back to her I wasn't able to get her name, but it was really touching service something so unexpected in New York. Although I didn't even eat there the Asiate's service was impeccable. They are the image and definition of truly immaculate customer service.

If you want to feel like a celebrity, there's no other place than the Mandarin Oriental, New York. Right in Columbus Circle and next to the Time Warner Center, the Mandarin Oriental hotel is exactly what you expect from a five star luxury property. Don't expect anything other than top notch service from the time you arrive in the opulent lobby on the 35th floor until you arrive at your room overlooking Central Park, there's nothing to compare to this hotel. As a guest in a VIP room, my first night. Other nights, there was chocolate waiting or another amenity. You do pay for perfection, but it is worth every cent. No matter what your desire, the MO is happy to accommodate.

After travelling from Australia for 23 hours there was no better way to start a New York trip than by checking in at this amazing hotel - this hotel offers such a sense of arrival when walking into the opulent but welcoming lobby on the 35th floor and It was so lovely to be greeted by my name without even having to announce myself!Unlike some hotels the opulence continues in the hotel's rooms - high ceilings - floor to ceiling glass opening out onto the epic views of Central Park, Columbus Circle and the Upper East Side.I really loved the bathrooms as well - oversized shower, separate deep bath, TV, beautifully lit mirrors and I don’t normally use hotel supplied amenities but the red flower products were really nice.I had breakfast included in my rate and whilst you have the option of in room delivery I really enjoyed starting the day with breakfast down in Asiate on the 35th floor - it's a really beautiful room with gorgeous light and with equally great food and service to match.Yes this hotel is on the pricier side but I never once questioned that my money was not being well spent so I'd highly recommend this property - it's definitely worth the splurge and I cannot wait to stay again!

The views at the Mandarin are spectacular. Our room was over looking the Park and was breath taking. The staff was very accomodating. We were treated very well during our entire stay. We received complimentary tea in our room when we arrived. Check out was very quick and efficient.

Everything about this hotel is very nice. The pool is wonderful and the staff is very well trained. The location of the hotel on Central Park is a main reason you are paying top dollar. But if you get a room with a view of a side street and not Central park you will be disappointed. It is imperative that when you book your room, you call and make sure that you are getting the correct room exposure. Otherwise the hotel has pretty much everything you would want in an upscale property.
user_name:
jack2act
New York City, New York

review_body: This is taken from a review I wrote for Wedding Ideas magazine...Being a wedding guest is always an honour, but when I was invited to an old friend’s wedding to a beautiful girl from Manhattan, I jumped at the chance to visit another old friend – New York – the city that never sleeps. Nor do I, so we’re the perfect match…The Mandarin Oriental is quite simply the best. Good enough for the A-list (of which we saw our fair share), we had room 4308 overlooking Columbus Circus and the incomparable Central Park. With a chaise longue and floor to ceiling glass walls tempting you to do nothing but take in that view, we were thoroughly spoilt. Exceptional customer service, a pool on the 35th floor overlooking the Hudson River, an ever-so trendy lounge bar where you can mingle with the cool folk and Sunday brunch taken in the Asiate restaurant with its panoramic views were just some of the things I loved about this plush hotel.Location, location, location… The Mandarin Oriental sits as part of the Time Warner Center on the edge of Central Park, where we took a long walk. It’s a people-watching, bird-spotting paradise. In the other direction is Times Square, the Highline Park which we so enjoyed walking through, and the Rockefeller Center, which offers, in my opinion, the best views of the Manhattan skyline. Despite this being my sixth trip to NYC I had never been on the Staten Island ferry that glides past the Statue of Liberty so we did that, and of course we did our fair share of partying. The Meatpacking District offers up some cool bars and check out Bleecker Street for delicious and inexpensive world cuisine. Each time I visit New York it gives me something new to spot and adore. It’s safe, fun and can be oh-so romantic too.

The Mandarin occupies floors 35-54 of one of the Time Warner center tower which means you'll get some of the best views of midtown, Central Park and the Upper East Side. This was my third time here for easter holidays and the rooms have postcard view, the heated pool on the 36th floor is without doubt the very best in the city and both the rest Asiate and the lounge offer some of the most exclusive views of Central park that you can afford. Service is top notch! Ken the head concierge is truly friendly and most helpful and Diandra and her team will look after guests like few hotel can do. Yes it's expensive but worth it.

Location wise cant get better than this - Loved the Spa and the Bar - impressive views.Concierge very pleasant and great tips on Central Park. Cant remember the name of lady at the reception who really handled all our queries very professionally. All around a great property

I just completed a disappointing three night stay at the Mandarin Oriental NYC. I first visited this property around two years ago. I arrived very late that time, but was still greeted by name (which continued throughout my stay). The service was excellent, even to the point that the lounge kitchen stayed open late to cook me a bite to eat. However, when I went to my Premier Central Park View Room, I recall surprise at finding the bathroom in slight disarray to the point where I wondered if someone had been in the room after housekeeping had come through. But the hour was late and I was too tired to complain. I chalked it up to sloppy housekeeping in what was an otherwise short but nice visit. Unfortunately, that should have been a sign. Fixated on the Mandarin's impressive 35th floor bar and its jaw-dropping pool and common areas (rather than on the sloppy bathroom from my first go around), I returned to the hotel for a three night stay in the Hudson River View Room Double. I have friends in the city and could have crashed in their small apartments, but I was hoping to get some pampering and good sleep. It turns out I should have couch-surfed.No greeting by name awaited me this time (or really, at any other time except when I spoke by phone with hotel staff who would then pause and mispronounce my name off their computer screen). In fact, even though I called hours before to let the front desk know the approximate time of my early evening arrival, housekeeping was still "readying my room" when I got there. This, at 7pm at night! The front desk apologized (Apology #1) and comped some drinks in the lounge. When it was eventually ready, my room turned out to be fine (the bathroom was sparkling) and came with a surprisingly nice view. I was satisfied that all was well. That is, until I was awoken by the sound of what sounded like a combined saw and jack-hammer inside the walls at 9am. The noise only got worse, and I called down to the front desk to find out if I could expect this to continue for the rest of my stay. The front desk manager apologized (Apology #2), and explained that a suite above/below me as under construction -I got different answers on this depending on who I spoke to. He seemed genuinely sorry and discounted the room by 50% for that night. Unfortunately, the noise was so bad I couldn't even get ready in my bathroom and so I went down to the spa to shower up. The spa cost was comped (as it should have been, since my room was unusable). When I came back that evening, there was an apology note from the front desk with some chocolates. "A very rough start," I thought, but two more nights to go.Although I didn't have the pleasure of waking to jack hammering for the rest of my stay, I was instead treated to a symphony of slamming doors and loud hall conversation. I am fairly sure that I didn't get more than a few hours consecutive sleep before someone decided to conduct an entire business negotiation in Spanish right outside my door, or before the child from the lovely West African family still operating on Ivory Cost time (the Mandarin Oriental is highly international) decided it was entertaining at 5am to repeatedly slam the door to her parents room. "Perhaps, the Mandarin has decided to go truly realistic and use paper walls in furtherance of its East Asian theme," I mused in my half-awake state. In total earnest, the noise problem is very serious. No one who is a light sleeper should even consider this hotel. When I finally checked out after my third night, exhausted, the front desk asked how my stay had been. I related my continuing noise issues, and received in turn a beautiful apology (Apology #3) worthy of an off-Broadway play.Although I respect the fact that the Mandarin staff did what they could to address my concerns, the truth is that these issues should never have occurred at the first place. I would have gladly paid full price and returned all the comps and theatrical apologies for what I truly wanted, which was a decent night's sleep. Sadly, that was the one thing that I could not have. At a hotel that bills itself as one of the best in New York, an inability to deliver on this one critical point is unacceptable.

My son and I recently stayed at the MONY for three nights. We booked it through AMEX FHR program. We stayed in a double room. The hotel is situated on the 35 th floor of the Time Warner Center. Once in the lobby, one is transported. It overlooks Central Park, but due to the location is quiet and serene. From the registration to the valet to housekeeping and room service, service was impeccable and low key. Our room was not large, but was certainly well appointed, with a very large walk in closet and nicely done bathroom. The hotel is contemporary and well done. Arrived very late our first night, and ordered room service and watched the NCAA tournament til the wee hours.
