The room service cheeseburgers were among the best we have ever had, and we seriously considered doing that every night! The concierge service was top shelf. We used the gym on many occasions. It is stocked with plenty of state of the art equipment, and has floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Hudson. All in, there is not one single thing that wasn't perfect. By the way, had lunch at Blue Ribbon sushi across the street, which was a treat. The cost is typical for the high end NYC hotels, and we are now spoiled forever. Most highly recommend.

It may be a good hotel just for an experience. But human factor of seivice experience at this hotel is just as good as half-price hotel or maybe even little worse. I did not have any bad experience from empoyees of this Mandarin Oriental Hotel NY. I just woud like to say that I did not experience any impressive human-touch service. I felt that every service is done by manuals or handbook.  Yes, this hotel is a good hotel. Safe, nice bed, nice bath, nice this, nice that. But nothing is not really considered. There are so many hotels that give services considered for customer relaxation in Manhattan .

The Mandarin lives up to its reputation – service is top notch and every inch of the hotel is clean and well maintained. That said, the location – smack in the middle of Columbus Circle – is probably the hotel's best feature. I do love the indoor pool, which is somewhat rare for Manhattan hotels. Can’t go wrong booking here.

Lobby bar is great place to be and hang out, the mandarin is my new go to spot in NYC . Views are fabulous, over looks Central Park, staff attentive and accommodating, concierge very helpful, attached to 10 Columbus circle which has shopping and great restaurants including per se

My husband treated me to breakfast here on my birthday. As it was my first visit to NYC I was completely awestruck by the incredible view from the dining room. We were given a wonderful table by the window and were able to take in the iconic view of Central Park. The service was efficient but friendly and the food was excellent. We received a gorgeous complimentary smoothie as we were perused the menu and we both thoroughly enjoyed our classic American breakfast. This really was an excellent venue and a great start to an amazing birthday!

We had a great stay at the Mandarin Oriental. Staff was very friendly and views and location fantastic. The room was beautiful - I expected a larger bedroom, but the bathroom was the largest I've seen! Luxurious feel most definitely. We had room service breakfast 2 days and it was amazing - the server set up a small table by the window for us - very cool! My husband and I both had massages at the spa and they were incredible. Overall great experience!

We visited their Restrurant on 35 fl last Saturday. The weather was clear and beautiful for early march. The brunch is $59/pp. appetizer comes with 5 different small portions; you can pick 2 out of 5 or 6 choices of main courses. The services are impeccable. Seating is very comfortable not cramped at all and very conducive to carry on a conversation. The view of Central Park is simply spectacular. You may want to ask for window seating if you have smaller size party. Enjoy!!

We were greeted by lovely helpful staff at the door who took care of our luggage and checked in by friendly and professional staff.We were given rooms with the Central park views and the harbor views which were both fantastic! The room were nicely furnished with tasteful decor and we all enjoyed our great nights sleep. Breakfast was lovely with choices of traditional Chinese, English and American which we really enjoyed and the breakfast hall was lovely and comfortable too. The service was spot on!With the hotel being located so close to fifth avenue and Tiffany Co, we enjoyed a great shopping trip. There were nice cafes and restaurants which food we particular enjoyed too.The concierge was knowledgeable and gave us some sound advice for our visit around the city which included organizing private transportation to Empire state building at night etc. Highly recommend to stay here if you choose to visit New York!

I wanted to give this hotel a second chance. I had stayed here before and didn't like it but I had also recently stayed at other MO properties and been favorably impressed. Sadly, MO New York just doesn't measure up. The rooms are small (then again Time Warner Center is some of the most expensive real estate on the planet). The bathrooms are adequate but hardly luxurious (cheap marble tile, small showers, etc). Tiny closets. Visibly deferred maintenance (minor but not acceptable at this price point). Poor acoustical design: lots of noise in the hallways.....and you can hear the elevators riding up and down at all hours of the day (and night). The real problem with this hotel, however, is the service. On arrival, be prepared to show yourself to your room. Despite purchasing the night prior to arrival (because of an overnight flight) be prepared for multiple privacy intrusions (despite using the electronic privacy sign). Guaranteed a late check out through AmEx? Be prepared for multiple phone calls verifying your check out time (despite confirming this on arrival) because the front desk wants to turn the room over. Have a special request? Welcome to the land of no. Fancy dinner on a Friday night in the city that never sleeps? Well, get ready for a restaurant that closes at 10pm.....yes, 10pm on a Friday Night.....in New York City. Even the bar closes at 1am on a Friday night.....again, in New York City. Overall just very, very disappointing. Taj, Trump, Ritz all have better views. Four Seasons has much better service and rooms that are HUGE by comparison (at the same price). MO New York is such a shame, especially for a flagship property.

The hotel has a great location on Columbus Circle overlooking Central Park. The rooms are nice, however, for $500+ per night one expects more in terms of service and rooms.Check-In: Located on the 35th floor lobby - quick and efficient.Room: About 400 Sq. Ft. including the bathroom. King bed, 42" TV, Mini bar, desk, small half settee, floor to ceiling windows. Nice, but nothing special. Pillows were all too soft; linens were adequate. Bathroom: Really nice shower - rain head and wall mounted. Super hot water with good pressure. Sufficient shampoo/conditioner etc. Thick towels. Single sink, separate toilette area and large deep tup. Could not get the tub water really hot... annoying.Closet: Tight on space - cramped with ironing board and suitcase rack taking up room.Concierge: Ample staff, however, when I asked about a car to the airport they would only recommend the $225 house Mercedes service; they would NOT suggest any other option aside from a taxi. There are many black car options for $100 or less to JFK... but what - no kickback? Worried I'll be mugged? Complete joke. Also, they had no idea if the trip to JFK in a taxi was a fixed price. I found one for $52 fixed with the front door porter's help.Bar: Nice under-lit room with great service - located to the right of lobby bar as you enter. Closes very early -odd for a hotel in NYC.Overall: Great location - but at those prices I expect a lot more in terms of room and service. The Mandarins in other cities are much better. I would not go back.

I'm a suburban New Yorker and was looking for a place to spend a special evening in the city after going to the Opera. The Mandarian Oriental was a spectacular choice. The service is outstanding - once you check in seemingly every employee knows you by name and addresses you as such. The lounge has fantastic views of Central Park and delicious drinks (loved the ginger mojios) The room decor was art deco with an Asian influence - very tasteful. Wish I used the spa but didn't have time! We look forward to returning!

Everything about the MO NYC is outstanding. The rooms, the Lounge, the ammenities but it is the staff that sets this home away from home apart from all others. From the moment you arrive until the moment you leave, they anticipate your every need and they deliver!

We had a room and view across Central Park which had all the things you would expect in an MO. Service was great generally and the only downside is the bar/lounge food menu is small and if you don't want the forced 3 courses in the restaurant then you are stuck with the same small selection.

My friend had booked a standard room here, so review based on a few hours hanging out here this month (no sleeping there), nicest interior vs other other NYC rooms in similar category that I've seen (Peninsula, Pierre, and Ritz Carlton @ Battery Park), liked it so much that I'm writing a review based on the few hours there. Mandarin was more modern, cleaner feel vs. the other 3. But there are others I can guess might prefer an older, classic feel, but for me, Mandarin is much more preferable and so comfortable. Price my friend paid was obviously quite high, but if you can afford it, room was luxurious. If I never need a weekend getaway from my apartment and gonna splurge, will make this the place.
user_name:
Daikan21
New York City, New York

review_body: The view from our room on the 46th floor was worth the price of a room in this hotel. Fortunately there are many reasons to stay here. The rooms are very comfortable with plenty of sitting space. Beds are great, and climate control in the room is very good. The bathrooms are fantastic. The red flower bath products are fantastic, and the bathroom is huge by NYC standards, and very nice by any standard. The staff is helpful, but not invasive. The location could not be better with easy access to many wonderful restaurants, shopping, theaters, and subways. If you love NYC and are looking for something special this is it. We been stayed in many different luxury hotels over the years, but this is the best.

My darling husband made a reservation at Per Se for our anniversary. We chose the Mandarin because it's in the same (huge) building complex as the restaurant. The Columbus Circle 7th Ave subway stop is right in front of the building and the hotel entrance is on the uptown side of the complex. The entrance is just the elevator portal to the hotel, whose lobby is actually on the 35th floor. They upgraded us to a Central Park view at registration. The room was great and tea and cookies shortly arrived, which I enjoyed from the chaise at the floor-to-ceiling window. Delightful.The Per Se experience was special indeed, but the Mandarin's own restaurant, Asiate, is itself worthwhile. I had a delicious hamachi sashimi plate for lunch the next day. Service was very attentive, pleasant and professional in every way. We took advantage of the location to walk up to Strawberry Fields and then across Central Park in the snow. A great experience.

I have stayed there twice; just above a small shopping mall and at columbus circle.You can directly walk to central park. More business people prefer to stay in this hotel. Not many alternatives for breakfast.Hotel rooms are really nice.

We have spent the past two 4th of July holidays in a suite overlooking the Hudson to see the fireworks. The view is spectacular, the hotel staff are exceptional going out of there way to meet the travellers needs. Our grandchildren live in New York but when visiting the hotel needed a crib to nap in - a crib was immediately brought to our room. As long as the fireworks are displayed on the Hudson River piers - we will keep returning! The location is fabulous - close to everything either by taxi, walking or the subway. We appreciate that guests are not allowed up to the rooms without being announced. A nice touch - when you arrive tea is sent up to your room.

My partner and I stayed in a Central Park View suite this past weekend to celebrate my birthday. The average rate per night was $1600, the most I have ever paid for a room anywhere in the world. Overall, considering the value for the price and the service flaws, I would say that there are many much better values in the city.In an effort to be as balanced as possible, I will write first about the pluses for this property. If you are interested in being near or on Central Park / Columbus Circle the hotel is in a great location. The views over Central Park are beautiful, albeit blocked partially by the Trump hotel. Room service did a great job with breakfast orders each morning and one late night dessert order. In particular I was very impressed with Derek from room service. The furnishings are very nice and the bathroom, especially the shower, were well presented with great pressure from the rain shower. Finally, my previous request for Red Flower bath amenities to be placed in my room was honored prior to check in.On the downside and overall the reason I would rate this hotel Poor/Average are based on service and follow up. On the evening of check-in the TV in the living room was not working. I called the front desk and the IT department came quickly and reset the TV. The next morning, we wanted to have breakfast in our room and watch our morning dose of news channels and again the TV was not working. I called the front desk and asked that someone from IT be sent to fix it. By 11 that morning without a response and upon leaving for the day I called the front desk again. Was placed on hold. Called the operator and asked to speak to the Manager on Duty. Was told that person was unavailable. Left a detailed message with the MOD describing the situation and asking that it be resolved by the time we returned in the evening. On return at 530 pm, had two messages, one from the MOD and one from the IT department asking me to call them back and describe the problem. At this point, very frustrated, called the MOD again and asked that the TV be fixed. Upon return at about 11pm that evening, TV still not working. At this point, extremely frustrated, called the MOD again and spoke at length to him about service expectations not being met, value for price paid, etc. While it was late, we agreed that someone would come to fix the TV the next morning after we had left for the day. At this point, no TV for two of the three mornings that we had on our holiday. The next day when we returned in the evening the TV was fixed (actually replaced the set top box as it wasn't working properly). To be fair, the hotel MOD sent a bottle of wine and a note of apology and credited my folio with a 50% discount on one night of the stay. While I appreciated the gesture I was overall very disappointed with the follow up and with the experience. For those who wish a luxury experience I highly recommend the Greenwich hotel. For those who enjoy luxury in a cutting edge neighborhood the value provided by the Nomad Hotel is very good.As a result of this experience I cancelled an upcoming reservation for a suite at the Mandarin in Las Vegas for a stay in March.

My partner and I, we spent many weeks in this hotel and we love it. One thing only always bothered me - is spa in this hotel. The hours are very inconvenient - from 9 am to 9 pm and Sunday even less. If you want to enjoy swimming after the movie or dinner, there is no chance. Other hotels around the world have hours mostly from 6 am to 11 pm. It could be true only for swimming pool, sauna and fitness, but obviously in this hotel it is a problem. Mentioning sauna - that is another story - nowhere around the world I had such a bad experience with the sauna-it is not warm enough, after being there for one hour you can't get sweaty. Because I need to use a sauna for my health, I complained many times , but I was always told that sauna has regular temperature. Every single person using this sauna was complaining to me as well, but they are not here so many times, therefore they don't care so much. It would be nice if the owners really care and after many years and many unsatisfied guests, the sauna could be redone and hot enough to get sweaty.

This was my second stay at this hotel, and unfortunately, I feel it's overrated. The rooms are small, there were little problems, like a delay in our room being ready (even though we arrived at 5pm) and a broken thermostat. The lobby areas lack seating for while you're waiting for the bellhop or your family, and the staff, while nice, is a bit wooden. The best things going for this hotel are the views and the location.

If you're not familiar with the area, be aware that this area is very busy, very noisy and hectic. So, with that said, if you are ready for that experience, it is a great NYC spot right across from the circle of Columbus Park, Central Park and shopping stores everywhere you go.As for the hotel itself, I live about 40 miles away, so it was just to check it out. I was in a suite which had awesome views of columbus circle etc. The room size is average, the beds were comfortable but the furniture needed to be steam cleaned.To sum it up, if you are in to the hectic area and the noise, then it's a prime spot for the New York experience. As for me, once was enough.
user_name:
Madeline S
Red Bank, New Jersey

review_body: our absolute favourite in new york! the hotel is very modern so if you like to stay in a classic cozy hotel this may not be the best choice for you. otherwise, i can say that this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in and the design is just amazing! from the lobby and breakfast room you have the view over central park and the city. huge windows give you an entire panorama view which you will be able to enjoy from the rooms higher up as well. the rooms i found a bit small but the view and the service and everything else in the hotel make up for that. the service is great, the concierge will be happy to give you advices where to dine and what to visit and as it is one of the best places in town they usually manage to get reservations for restaurants even on short notice. the location is very good, you will be able to enjoy nice walks from the hotel to the main streets / attractions.great hotel, it has its price but in my opinion is totally worth it. as well compared to other mandarin oriental hotels, this one is by far the highest standard and the design of other mandarin hotels definitely cant keep up with the one in new york ! really nice place !

Mandarin Oriental was designed as a first class luxury hotel for the Asian business traveler. Now it is more of a uber wealthy property for the 25-75 year old single business traveler.Nothing is too much to ask for at this hotel.The food is marvelous and the eye on detail is much like you would expect from a 4 Seasons.The beds were not very comfortable which was a real problem.The concierge will go out of their way to please and even sent us a lovely floral arrangement because they "liked" us.Very pricey so Ii suggest you book this through AM Ex Platinum card Fine Hotel and Resort program for all of the extra perks.Note: Rooms are not large but they are lovely and all have a skyline city view.

We visited the Mandarin Oriental New York for a "special" birthday treat and we were not disappointed. Superb non invasive service and a fabulous suite met and exceeded our expectations. The highlight though as ever is the MOBAR on the lobby level with great cocktails and marvellous views over Central Park and Columbus Circle. Without out the best hotel in New York.

We stayed the Mandarin Oriental New York for my 25th birthday. I am familiar with the MO group, I have stayed at their Las Vegas property twice in the past. And to me the MO Las Vegas is one of my favorite hotels in the world. But now that I experience the MO New York, I think I have a new favorite. It was above amazing, above anything I dreamed of. The check In was quick and efficient, very polite and hospitable (very common of the MO brand). They have this asian hospitality touch that I do not find in any other hotel chain in the world. As we get in the elevator, we smell the familiar and beautiful Mandarin Oriental scent (the one there seem to be in most of their property). Before getting into the room. I really must insist on how beautiful, high class and solid everything looks. The design of each area of the hotel is really a work of art, pure luxury. They gave us a small upgrade, highest floor of the hotel and corner room facing the hudson river. It was nice being on the top floor of the hotel (54th), and the corner room really seemed to make the room bigger. We also had a larger view, from hudson river to columbus circle. The room was quiet large for New York standard. Maybe the corner rooms are larger than the regular ones, it's possible. The room looked so stunning, there's no word to describe the feel. Everything was so well designed and placed, we felt the feng shui 100%. Every detail, scent, the decor, the appliances, the quality of every single piece in the room is absolutely perfect. The bathrooms is so large and clean. We had a nice view of midtown from the bathtub. And all the bath amenities were amazing. The tv was great, lots of channels and the original Mandarin Oriental video and song which really fits with their MO atmosphere. Also there's a nice option of the tv to check the weather in the city and in your hometown, an updated folio of your spendings etc. The slippers and bathrobes are amazing, so comfortable. The bed is heavenly and the linens also. You could sleep for days. As I said they really went through every detail, and as a Mandarin Oriental fan, I got my ''fix''. Outside the room.. The Lobby lounge is great, excellent for a coffee, drinks, or a small snack. It is usually very busy so making a reservation is prudent. But if you make it from your room, they can call you in your room when your table is ready and you can go down in a minute as simple as that. Such amazing service. The pool area is also superb, I went back to the pool every single day. The pool which is huge by the way, is on the 36th floor and you have a view on the nyc skyline. Also in the pool area you have the fitness center, it has new top quality equipment. There's showers, with Espa products and a sauna also. All this is complimentary if you stay the hotel or reside in the residences. The residences are located above the hotel and have a different entrance/elevator. The Spa at Mandarin Oriental New York is great. Unfortunately the one in their Las Vegas property is better, bigger and fuller. But this one in New York is good enough. I spent 2 hours there and felt very relaxed. Next time I will try a treatment because everyone that was coming out of the spa after a treatment looked like they had the best time of their lives. They also have great products for sale at the Spa Boutique.I didn't have the chance to eat at their restaurant ''Asiate'' but I've heard good things and next time I'll make sure to go. But we ordered Breakfast in the room three days in a row. It was always excellent, the pastries are so delicious.I don't understand why the hotel is not better rated in Tripadvisor, after reading a few reviews I am confused by the deception of some people. It is truly a gem and makes you feel so good and serene. I hope their prices don't go up because it's already high enough, probably the most expensive hotel in New York. Because I want to return there over and over again.Thank you Mandarin Oriental.

We celebrated my husband's 50th birthday in November here. We stayed for three nights and were upgraded to a corner suite with views of Central Park and Hudson River. We had breakfast every day in suite overlooking the park. What an amazing start to each day! We enjoyed fantastic massages at the spa, drinks and yummy snacks in the lounge, and a special dinner at Asiate. Concierge arranged last minute tickets to a jazz show (it turned out to be a sold out show, yet we had a front row table), and gave good restaurant recommendations. It was a significant birthday, and we could not have had a better time. We travel extensively and stay at 5 star hotels. What we really liked about the NY Mandarin was the simple elegance.

This is a superb hotel with great service, beautiful views and a great location. My only major complaint is the smallness of the rooms. I have stayed here twice and both times have had small rooms for a high price. In fact room service had to move furniture to accommodate the breakfast tray. That is fine if you are staying at a boutique hotel in Soho or TriBeCa but does not seem right when larger rooms are available for the same price at the Four Seasons or Trump across the street. Again the service is up to Mandarin Oriental standards and the location is great if you want to be in this area but be prepared to pay a great deal for a boutique style small room.

We really enjoyed our trip to New York, and especially our stay at the Mandarin Oriental. The room we had was a little bit small, but the view of Columbus Circle was fantastic. The staff is very nice and our room service breakfast was perfection. Bathrooms and showers are elegant and very clean. You should visit the Lobby Lounge for the view, and know that if you are a guest of the hotel you can reserve a booth or table by the window. We also were very happy with the beautiful spa. We are spa junkies and our massages were the best we'd ever had. I relax just thinking about it. The hotel is located above a nice shopping area, and also above the fantastic Per Se restaurant which serves some of the best food you will ever eat.

My wife an I just returned from an overnight trip to New York City and had the good fortune to stay at the Mandarin Oriental. The views are stunning, the atmosphere is very relaxed but exceptionally professional, and food in the The Lobby Lounge was fantastic. It is expensive, but you get an oasis in the middle of New York steps from Central Park where I found a fascinating and fun running scene. If you are fortunate enough to stay here you will want to come back.

From the moment you step into this hotel you enter a world of pure luxury. Service is unbelievable, only word; amazing. Unfortunately you pay for this service. This hotel is not cheap. When you stop thinking about the price you will never sleep better. The rooms are amazing. Technology in each room is amazing. And the views are amazing. Enough now with the amazing.You must experience this hotel. The spa, the food, the service. One of my favourite hotels ever.

This hotel continues to amaze! First impressions can go a long way, but continuing excellence, visit after visit, marks a great hotel. The Mandarin Oriental in New York City provides that excellence. The staff of this hotel makes the difference, and you feel it from the first moments at the front door and it continues when you interact with the Reception desk, the Concierge staff, the Bell and Valet staff, the miracles of the Housekeeping department as well as the personnel in room service and the restaurant, as well. There seems to a real desire to please guests and to maintain a facility in a brand - new condition, though the property is a decade into existence. You will come to look for reasons to be in Manhattan, if only to experience this kind of hotel experience.

We stayed in one of the top-floor suites and while the room rate was steep the view alone was worth it. We have stayed in a number of 5 star hotels in Midtown but this remains the most spectacular in terms of views and room design. While the Four Seasons would be better for Christmas shopping (since it is closer to the stores on Madison and 5th), this hotel has Central Park views to die for.The bar is really cool and the restaurant is extremely good (ask for the table in the corner - 2 floor-to-ceiling glass walls). The pool is great and surprisingly big for a city-hotel.

We spent the night at the Mandarin to celebrate my birthday. We have been to New York many times and were only in for one night. The experience with the hotel was seemless from the front desk, to the servers in the bar and restaurant, to the room service personnel. Every single person I dealt with was truly concerned with my experience, They were cheerful, helpful and extremely professional. The rooms are well equipped with every item I have called down to the front desk to have brought up to the room in other hotels. And the view...the view! Pay for the park view king suite and ask for a high floor. You will not be disappointed. I would go back to this hotel and I would highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel was beautiful, had nice sized rooms and was very close to shopping and Central Park. The food was good for hotel food and the staff really was super polite and helpful. The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 was the beds, the sheets were very very scratchy, there was no real comforter, it was just an overall really uncomfortable bed. Other than that is was wonderful. We stayed in the Central Park Suite and it was big and luxurious. The bathroom was great as well, it has a killer rain shower and bath tub with a window overlooking the city.

We stayed in NYC in July 2012 and loved it. Rooms are extremely clean, the view of Central Park was absolutely amazing, we spent our days glued to the window. Front Office staff couldnt be friendlier, concierge arrange our restaurant booking via email within a day. Yes, the hotel rates are higher than others but the view is worth it. What I really enjoyed was the quiet room - something almost impossible to get in NYC. Service in the lobby bar could be friendlier. We will definitely try some other Mandarin Oriental hotels around the world.

After checking in to another hotel on the upper East Side we left after one night and went to the Mandarin where we had stayed before. What a mistake it was to go anywhere else. For the same amount of money if was, as always, far superior in all ways.

I love the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in NY, I think people underestimate the luxury of overlooking the beautiful Central Park from your coffee table at breakfast, surrounded by sky scrapers. Located at the Columbus Circle, this complex has one of the most luxurious locations someone could desire. It is pricey, the rooms are NY standard so do not expect Tokyo there, but still good and comfortable, the service is good and classy. The bars are cool, and the breakfast was my favorite time of the day.

My wife and I stayed for 5-nights in a Central Park View Room. On arrival, we were greeted by the door staff before heading up to the lobby on the 35th floor. the view striked you straight away as you look through the lobby onto the floor to ceiling windows overlooking Central Park.The Reception staff were outstanding (recognised our Geordie accents and talked about Newcastle United and Liverpool FC with great knowledge) and gave us a higher room due to our 5-night stay. The room itself was very well decorated and felt clean and fresh. We've stayed in a number of 'high-end' hotels in NYC and this beats them all - and at half the price of some of the others. It might not have the history of the Pierre, Carlyle or Astoria, but being a Brit, century old buildings with old fashioned decor aren't something I crave for (being it's all we see at home), so bright and modern was perfect for us.Plenty of the water in the room each day, good range of TV channels, fantastic bathroom with sunflower head shower and bath, robes for both etc. Pretty much everything you'd expect and very well done.The breakfasts in Asiate were amazing, as was the light snacks served in the lounge. All staff were friendly and approachable - the opposite to some hotels where the brand has gone to the staffs heads and they act like Lord and Lady of the Manor e.g. snooty and aloof. The team at the MO are professional, but down-to-earth - the perfect mix.Location wise, the MO sits atop of the Time Warner, with its huge food court, high end shops, coffee bars and wealth of restaurants, including the famous Per Se that the concierge helped us book into. The subway hub sits 25-mteres away, whilst your in Central Park within 30-seconds of leaving the front door.Price wise, the hotel is what you'd expect. It's not astronomical for a breakfast and coffee, but it isn't McDonalds either. For breakfast for two with coffee, water and orange, we paid around $70 at the most. You're looking at similair prices for a light bite in the lounge overlooking Central Park. We didn't dine on the evenings, so we can't comment here.We also had use of the house car, which was available quite a few times, but we only sought out once. Again, a good service experience.We won't be staying anywhere else in NYC from now on.
user_name:
MrDEF
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We have stayed in a number of high quality hotels in NYC, however non of them can hold a candle to The Mandarin Oriental. From our arrival to our departure we were so well looked after without people being overbearing. The room was stylish, clean and of th highest standard, we had a park view which was delightful at any time of day or night! The concierge were fantastic and even managed to get us reservations at Per Se & Club 21. We ate in the hotel a number of times for breakfast & lunch. The View from Asiate was amazing as were the buttermilk pancakes, but then again everything we ate or drank in the hotel was amazing. If your looking for a modern, quality hotel then MO is top of my list!

Thanksgiving in New York with all the trimmings was a dream come true for our family this year.We range in age from 60+ to 4 years old so picking the hotel meant accomodating a wide variety of interests and tastes. Happily, we found perfection at the Mandarin Oriental. First if all, it is a wonderful location for watching the Macy's parade. Central Park is at your doorstep for those who wish to run as well as those who prefer a playground. The pool on the 36th floor welcomed children and provided a lovely afternoon break from the sightseeing, ice skating, and shopping.Best of all was the pampering five star luxury combined flawlessly with a child friendly attitude.Whether pouring a fine chablis or fixing the lid on a glass of milk, the wait staff out did themselves. Housekeeping was impeccible. The concierge was available for every request (including a seamtress to alter a "just bought it but must wear it on Thanksgiving" dress.) The top floor corner suite, 5416, has a breathtaking view. I could go on and on.BTW, if you are thinking about Thanksgiving book early.....very early.

We stayed overnight to celebrate my birthday this month. Given its reputation, and the price tag, I expected our stay to be a truly special experience. I was disappointed. It was a clean room, bur on the small side and very minimalist. We had requested a down free room and had to have housekeeping come twice to remove everything. When we checked in, we were told that we would not need a reservation for breakfast, but the next morning, were told we could be seated, but that others had reservations so we would have to leave in an hour. We then waited for 45 mins for our meals and had to rush to eat them. The breakfast prices were exorbitant as well. The swimming pool was chilly, and not enjoyable. For the quality and service we received, it was on par with a regular chain hotel, no special touches.

Stayed for just one night this time. Upgraded to beautiful corner suite. Linens toiletries and room set up all suitable for a 5 star experience. Check in was efficient. Lobby bar and lounge area have spectacular views and solid food. Look forward to staying there again.Only negative is it is a modern hotel in a modern building. So you dont get that old school, old New York feel like you do at the Waldorf, Carlyle, Plaza etc.Time Warner Center and the shopping and restaurants is a nice bonus too.

This was our second stay at this hotel. Our first experience was terrific and this one was mixed.The hotel is wonderfully situated, the building is beautiful and we love the contemporary design of the rooms/lobby/lounge. The hotel begins on the 35th floor which makes for a spectacular view of the city from any room. We especially love the floor-to-ceiling windows in all the rooms. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park before and although it is a very nice hotel, it is in an older building so the windows are much smaller and there are only 12 or 15 floors, so you really can't see much of Central Park or the city.Breakfast was part of our package and everyday the food was delicious and service was very good.There is a beautiful lounge on the 35th floor which has a great design and fantastic views of the city and central park. Unfortunately we did not have access to it for any of the 4 nights we stayed there as it was rented out for private parties. The lounge would be a terrific location for drinks before dinner...or any time. The fact that it was not available to the hotel's normal guests for 4 nights in a row is unacceptable in my opinion. I certainly understand the hotel's desire to make additional money from renting out the space, but renting it out everyday shows an indifference to the experience of their normal guests. We also experienced some inconsistent service and follow up at the front desk.

Staing at the Mandarin Oriental New York was a wonderful experience. I was just there for one night but I know that I will return in the future. Their staff was quite helpful and sincere. I'm already looking forward to my next trip.
user_name:
Donald O
Alexandria, Virginia, United States

review_body: nice entrance of the hotel. great stall nice people and service, good food , beautiful pool area, and a very but very good spa. tha massage was uniqeu,the food in the restaurant great and i will be back for sure

From day one on a great experience. A great care of the details...from the reception to the rooms (including a most confortable bed!)...to the health club...or breakfast with breathtaking views. All of this in a great location while projecting serenity. Our best hotel experience in NYC. Highly recommended.

The Manadrin Oriental remains by far one if the best hotels in the city. The Asian touch, attention to detail and service make this hotel stand out. This was our second stay at the hotel and all the staff from the porter to the receptionist were quick to welcome us back. While the rooms are on the small side (quite normal for New York hotels), they were very comfortable and have amazing views over the park. Asiate is also worth a visit – the restaurant has a distinctly Asian feel, very muted and intimate, while the food impressive (it is rather on the pricy side, but not more than you would pay at any upscale brunch place in the city.)Would definitely keep coming back to this hotel while in New York.

I was lucky enough to spend one night at the Mandarin during the Sandy Blackout. Their staff was excellent, the room beautiful. I had room service, it arrived on time and prepared exactly to my specifications. It was one of my best hotel experiences in New York City.

I stayed at this lovely hotel Xmas 2010. On the 40th Floor with a room over looking Central Park with a picture postcard view. The bed I slept in was one of the most comfortable I have slept in anywhere in the world. The hotel is in a very good location on the upper west side at Columbus Circle right accross from Central Park. with easy walking to fifith avenue and shopping and galleries.The brekfast room over looks central park very high and the staff were wonderful. They even arranged a car to take us to Radio City Music Hall during the snow storm so we wouldnt have to battle in need deep snow. that attention to detail.Clearly one of the best hotels in NewYork.

I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October 2012. I was upgraded on check-in to a Central Park View room. What an upgrade! Tea and cakes were delivered to the room when I checked in, which was a lovely touch. The view is the best I've ever had from a hotel. Was so great to sit and look over the top of the trees in Central Park. I ordered room service one evening. Beautifully presented, and delivered on time. Top quality, restaurant standard. It was great to take the lift down to level 3 - and walk straight into the Columbus Circle shopping centre without even stepping outside. The hotel is very peaceful. I never heard a thing from my room. Housekeeping was superb. I declined it during the day, but when I went out at 7pm, and returned to my room, I was delighted to see the room had been made, with fresh linens on the bed. I will return here on my next New York trip. Front desk staff and concierge were the nicest I have come across. Very genuine. Not snobby in any way. Concierge were great in giving me directions to The Barclays Center in Brooklyn. Thanks MO NYC!
user_name:
CraigNewcastle
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Spent 4 days at the Mandarin at a conference in October 2012Lovely location right next to Central Park. Reception staff were lovely. Room wasvery high up. Rooms start at 37th floor, so make sure you have a head for heights!Make sure you hire a bike from an organised seller (not the touts with plastic cards showing pictures of bikes). Eat at the excellent Mariu Restaurant near the hotel.Food quality excellent but expensive.

This time I finally had a Park view room. There is nothing like a view over central park at sunrise from this hotel. Check the photo I uploaded. Service is excellent. Rooms are absolutely perfect and comfortable. This hotel is in a great location in midtown, next to Central Park, Broadway, close to Time Square, NHM and 5th Ave. It's expensive, but if you looking for a perfect comfort with a feel of luxury, this is it.

This hotel is in a great location in midtown, close to Central Park, close to Broadway, close to Natural History Museum.It's expensive, but is what you get for a great service, great people. The Spa is amazing, good gym and a 25 foot swimming pool.The ambience is nice, the room is nice, the bed, pillow, sheets, as every Mandarin hotel. My only complaint was the air conditioning that I had to turn off every night. Propably it was only in my room, but it is better to check it out before you sleep.

rooms are gorgeous. based on my one stay, the views are comparable. service not quite at the four seasons level. very expensive. bar/lounge area is comfortable, and the view is awesome. asiate is a decent choice for dining, esp if you're tired and hungry. recommended, though keep in mind you can stay anywhere in the city at this price.

Beautiful, large rooms and excellent service just a couple of blocks from Lincoln Center. My only complaint was that the room smelled of cigarette smoke during the day (no odor at night). We probably could have asked for another room, but the view of Central Park to the east and the Hudson to the west was just too beautiful to risk getting a room with a less stunning view.

Went here for a weekend event and have nothing but great things to say about the hotel. The location is fabulous and has sweeping views of Central Park and Columbus Circle. The staff was courteous and friendly and the hotel was immaculate. From the street entrance to the lobby in the sky to the rooms everything was luxurious and classy. Will definitely return to this hot spot.
user_name:
beachtravelerrrr
New York City, New York

review_body: There s not much to write home about. Just a five star with views views views.... very elegant and sophisticated but lacks warmth... a hotel for successful business without charm... not for princesses like me...;) ... I like many hotels in new york a lot better..and for half the price or less!(At breakfast at the" super sophisticated " Asiate restaurant ...they bring the check before you ask for it... that s rude in China , Japan, and everywhere... and the juice... you have to beg if you want natural freshly squeezed juice... )Front desk , door men and housekeeping very kind and professional, but I would prefer to go somewhere else next time...

It was interesting to see that this hotel received top billing from a busniss viewpoint, but as a tourist it was not to good.In our room the bath room and the corridor where larger than the bed room, there was a 10inch gap between the bed and the wall and only 1 bedroom table .But I did find the hotel staff absolutely perfect.O I nearly forgot about needing a fork to close the toilet or bath room doors, a $5.00 doorknob would fix that.What? No coffee machine?

if you want to enjoy brunch with breathtaking views on central park at the same time, then stay at this hotel ... rooms are well equipped, bit small but that's nothing new for NYC .. Rooms facing Hudson River are the less popular ones but cheaper. I wouldn't go there again, but for a one time experience full of luxury and decadence, this is the place to go !

Stayed here for my wife's birthday courtesy of our son. Were upgraded by the hotel to a suite on the 53rd floor, with beautiful views of the Hudson river and a little of Central Park. Hard to imagine a better appointed room. Living room was all glass walls with fantastic views. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom well appointed. We've stayed in many places around the world and this was one of the most amazing experiences. We've been in the lobby for high tea once before, but this time enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant overlooking Central Park. Very tasty eggs benedict!

I enjoyed this hotel but it's too expensive for what it has to offer. The lobby lounge and bar beside the huge window are definitely worth visiting for the experience (a drink with a beautiful view of Central Park and Columbus Circle). The rooms also have an amazing view but are too small. Brunch at their restaurant Asiate is definitely worth going back to.

It's long ago that i stayed in Mandarin Hotel but I'd like to recommend it to everyone who travel especially for business but also for other reasons that Mandarin is the hotel to be in NY .All the times I stayed there i was feeling like home , the rooms are spacious and comfortable , all the services of very high quality and the Asiate restaurant is a real gourmet restaurant.As i say before THE HOTEL, a real experience , how hotels of that level should be.

Fantastic view! Amazing room. Big, comfortable, zen decor. You can just sit by the floor to ceiling glass window (wall) and watch people, cars, carriages, helicopters passing by like they were fishes in an aquarium. Spacious bathroom with waterfall shower.Service is great, could be better.Room can be noise, and your night can be ruined, if parties are going on on same floor.High tea has a delicious Asian quick to it. It's been my place for tea!

This is the second time I stayed here and from the first time I visited (2004) it seems they have not updated much. Rooms lack some maintenance on the doors and furniture yet the bathroom is ample and very functional.Service is great when taking orders and always kind and courteous but sometimes when ordering food, they made their own decisions and change some ingredients on the dishes, nevertheless the quality of the food its outstanding.Location its unbeatable but they can work on getting a better organization at the motor lobby as sometimes getting on/off transportation had to take place on third row on the street!Glad to see some celebrities like Federer and Bruce Willis at the lobby. This tells you that it has not loosen its charm at all and I still recommend staying there.

I was suprisingly disappointed with this hotel. My family and I did a two-day excursion to New York and wanted to stay near shows and Gallagher's restaurant (which we love, but that's another review). Our travel agent works with clients who expect the best, and booked us a one bedroom suite with another adjoining bedroom. When we arrived, nothing was ready. The suite we eventually were given was the wrong room type, and the "connecting" room was non-existant. They did move us to a suite that was an upgrade, but we had to settle for a second room that was next door, not connecting. Aside from the errors, I just didn't like this hotel. If you want to be in the action on the West Side, the location is wonderful, and some of the rooms have great views. However, the first suite we were given had floor to ceiling glass at a sharp, pointed angles (terrible for anyone afraid of heights), and severely modern furnishings. It came across as cold and harsh rather than luxurious, and I love contemporary decor. Not this one. In addition, it felt like they "dumped" us in the room. None of the amenities arranged by the travel agent were present (a little snack, sometimes flowers), and although they knew the accommodations were wrong, we were told just to wait there. Overall, we didn't get a "welcoming" feeling in this hotel at all. New York is one of those cities where it's important for me to feel the hotel is our "oasis" in the big city. These were VERY expensive accommodations, and couldn't compare with the Four Seasons, new Ritz Carlton or any number of other fine New York hotels in this category. At this price, it should have five stars.

This is truly a lovely hotel with excellent rooms, beautiful views, incredible food (we had breakfast every day), gracious service and a prime location on the park. No additional photos need to be posted to show the fantastic vistas from the rooms, bar and restaurant. All rooms are above the 35th floor, so whether you pick a Central Park view or a Hudson River view, you will not be disappointed. I was with my husband in a park view, and my parents were in a corner Hudson view room. Both rooms were spotless, and the attention to details in the decor of the rooms was very nice. The Mandarin is located adjacent a station where 5 subway lines converge, so you can literally go anywhere in Manhattan from there withiut changing trains. It's nice to come back to a hotel after a long day walking around and feel instantly relieved. That is the vibe of this hotel. Quiet soothing rooms, and a comfortable bar and airy restaurant above the fray. I was hesitant to book here seeing the ranking on TripAdvisor, but I am glad that I did. We were thinking of the Trump, but I didn't care for the lack of public spaces. Mandarin is a great choice right next door.

First time in the Mandarin New York after getting tired of the Trump but still wanted a park view. Pros:Lovely room (premier central park view suite,) great front desk and prompt service.Cons:Light burned out in the bathroom, in room fridge was warm and not cooling. All minor and annoying, but the topper was when my wife complained that the bathrobe smelled like someone else. I put mine on, put and found a condom in the pocket (unused.) They had never cleaned them. It made me look closely at the sheets and wonder if anyone is managing housekeeping.Fail:I filled out the "how was your visit" guest survey and as of now, two weeks later, never had a response from management.

Although the Mandarin Oriental in New York City commands a hefty price, it is SO worth it. Every aspect of the hotel is wonderful - the view, the simplicity of the rooms, the food and the staff - all of them - fabulous. Can't wait to return!

Great views. The best bathrooms so far in New York. And also great location since there is a subway and a mall right below. Also not to forget central park.We had great breakfast and also excellent dinner at the same restaurant. This is our second stay at this hotel and will always return back since it has the best of everything.

The hotel works overtime to ensure that each guest receives flawless service. We spent a weekend in a room overlooking Central Park. The restaurant is very good as is the lounge. However, the service is impeccable and makes the stay an experience. They spa facilities are terrific as well. Strongly recommended for a stay in NYC. Congratulations to Mr. Groessing on an exceptional property.

We stayed for a week at the end of June. Perfectly located, this hotel is luxurious and expensive. We had a central park view room on the 42nd floor. The room was fine albeit a bit cluttered with large furniture. You pay a lot for these rooms and one of the reasons is obviously the park view. However a word of caution - our view included the multi-storey trump hotel immediately in front of us - not sure how many of the park view rooms have their view almost obliterated by trump? Despite this, the location is exceptional - adjacent to the park, connected to the mall (oh, for a Whole Foods in our town), access to the subway on the doorstep and lots of lovely restaurants and bars to hand. One experience which is a must-do is a cocktail in the Lobby Lounge at dusk. The view is amazing. Book a table by the window. Another must-do is a swim the lap pool - looking out over the Hudson from 30-odd floors up as you swim is awesome. Staff very good and helpful. Gabriel at reception worthy of mention. Would recommend the hotel but if your main reason for booking it is the view, I would proceed with caution and check out what you will get for your money.

My boyfriend and I met another couple there for brunch. The food and hospitality were amazing. The staff gave the right amount of space but still very accessible. It goes without saying that Mandarin is a pricey hotel!
user_name:
Amy A
New York City, New York

review_body: Check in was fast and efficient. Staff are friendly and always willing to help. The beds are comfortable and breakfast is the best.Internet seemed to be slower than average and when I called to inform them they didn't seem to believe me.I would stay there again only when the four seasons is sold out.

My recent stay here was excellent as usual. There's not a lot that can be improved! The hotel car was a real boon over using NY cabs. Joel the concierge was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. There's no other place to stay!

Mandarin definitely understands hospitality at its best! From the moment I walked in I was greeted in a warm manner by the bell and door staff. When I checked in Patrick the front desk agent was very professional and informative on what was going on in the city and what nearby attractions. The in room dining was amazing, I definitely have to thank Gwen for making my experience a grand one! The room was amazing, had lots of space, and had a tub with a tv. The hotel is also connected to the mall as well, so it is very convient if you need to do some shopping or go to whole foods at the bottom level. The gym and pool are amazing, the pool has a beautiful view!

Nice room, great service, location ideal. Felt like luxury as you would expect, room amd bathroom very nice, bottled water at bedtime. Shipped packages home for us. Very pleased. House car was useful and much improved oiver a cab

I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for a family wedding that was in the hotel ballroom. I thought the place was expertly maintained and the room was very clean and modern. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was huge by comparison to most hotels. The view of the Hudson River was fantastic. The catered food was very good. Overall, an excellent experience - although the one strange thing I found was that the hotel "lobby" was on the 22nd floor of the building (not a bad thing, just odd).
user_name:
Brian G
East Quogue, New York

review_body: My better-half and I stayed here as an in-city respite as a treat after a long long month of grueling schedules. First, I am very familiar with the hotel as it's a go-to hotel for business meetings and conferences in NY. However, this was my first time staying as an overnight hotel guest. I arrived hours later than I thought since I was caught in a torrential rainstorm on way back from airport. I was tired and grumpy when I arrived. Front desk could not have been more efficient and accommodating of my special requests (fridge in room, open the windows, and some others). Just yes, yes, yes to everything I asked. I think the young man's name was Sam and he was the perfect combination of gracious and fast. We had a Hudson room with a view - but for us, that was not important. What we loved was the enormous bathroom (almost 1/3 of the total square footage I think). Generous/separate shower and bathtub. Just a feeling of luxury. And everything was immaculately clean. I didn't LOVE the bed (too firm), but I'm super fussy and have an amazing bed at home - so don't go by me.Room service was better than average, with an interesting selection of things for lunch (lots of asian selections). I loved that when I ordered room service breakfast, I could step out to get a few things outside and they told me if we weren't in the room when room service came they would just set it up for us. Do you know how wonderful it is to come back to a room with a piping hot breakfast waiting for you? You have to try the fruit salad with mangos and strawberries and kiwis, it was a bit of heaven. Yes, it is very expensive, granted. But when you want luxury and service that is pitch perfect, this is the place. We will go back.

We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Mandarin Oriental NYC and it was a flawless hotel experience. From the moment we arrived with our car at curbside until we left I cannot think of one instance where I didn't feel respected and well taken care of by the friendly staff at this amazing property. At some hotels, the staff can be so precise and business-like that they lose that natural human warmth, but I never felt that at this hotel. The lobby on the 35th floor is stunning with amazing views of Central Park and the surrounding city. We enjoyed dining at the Lobby Lounge and the signature restaurant Asiate and both were outstanding. Our room was a premier park view room on the 47th floor. The room was handsome and inviting with a beautiful marble bathroom. From the window I could see the Hudson River to the north, Central Park in the middle and the red CNN sign to the south. It was just an amazing panoramic view of Manhattan. Housekeeping did a great job maintaining our room and the hotel supplied child sized robes for my two children. The hotel also graciously presented my kids with a beautiful book about NYC and crayons and coloring books. We also received a tea presentation shortly after we arrived in our room which was delightful. The hotel was immaculate everywhere I looked. We enjoyed swimming in the pool which was perfect. The Mandarin Oriental is truly deserving of its 5 star and 5 diamond rating. The amazing cosmopolitan setting together with warm professional service made our stay unforgettable. The Mandarin Oriental Hotel NYC gets my highest recommendation.It was flawless.

Just spent the weekend at the Mandarin in NYC. Great location, large beautiful rooms with a wonderful view. Excellent staff, great spa, 5 star property. Nothing not to like, we'll be back in November!

I don't think I will ever be able to stay anywhere else in NYC again after staying here. From every amenity in the room to the accommodating staff and the peaceful sense of calm that comes over you as you enter the hotel...it is all nothing less than superb.

The Mandarin NYC is definitely one of the best hotel I've stayed at, the lobby is spectacular and the service was great, and the rooms and hotel in general is modern and has a very good energy to it. It is truly a luxury 5 star hotel.
user_name:
Jaber A
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Being a true and loyal MO Fan, we thought of no other hotel for our stay in New York and naturally expected to be awed again by the legendary MO standard. For one thing, we would expect a hotel of this category to place utmost importance on "attention to details" prior to, and especially throughout the guests' entire stay.One request I always make prior to our arrival is regarding the rollaway bed. I would e-mail the hotels prior to arrival, as I did in this case, and instruct that the rollaway bed NOT to be set-up until after we have checked-in to our room and preferably done during the usual turn down service because we like to have the room in a neat and uncluttered fashion and so we can take nice photographs. In this instance, I received an acknowledgement from the hotel that they would gladly accommodate the request. We feel this to be a simple request. However, upon our entry to the room, I was dismayed to find the roll-away not "set-up" as confirmed, BUT instead, vertically propped up against the living room window blocking out the entire Central Park views that was the main feature of this suite (this is shown in the attached pictures)! I had to call the front desk to instruct the bed to be removed and set-up during turn-down service. The front desk was apologetic and sent up housekeeping to rectify the matter. This first impression of our arrival was of imperfection and slightly disappointed with complete lack of "attention to details" that led to this.It may have pleased me that housekeeping who showed up then specifically asked me if I wanted the bed removed each day during room make up and brought back in during turn down service, to which I cheerfully said yes. However, this courteous offer actually led to further disappointment after it was never carried out as promised. Another instance of overlooking the details.Concierge services appeared attentive and helpful at first contact. However, the large team of concierges and rotation of duty without systematic passing over of information leads to confusion amongst themselves and for the guest. I commend each concierge individually for the assistance they provide, but the rotation system should reviewed as to ensure a seamless process for guests.Housekeeping services should improve response time. Many times, we have already forgotten that we had made a request before someone shows up over half-an-hour later.The suite was generally clean but a part of the carpet was soaking wet and the dusty curtains triggered allergy symptoms on our part, which we could live with but rarely experienced at other 5-star hotels in the same category as MO.Most of these are minor shortcomings but more importantly, they demonstrate the lack of attention to details and coordination which should not happen at an MO property. The million dollar views compensated for all the small annoyances we faced and allowed us to enjoy our stay for the most part and provide an overall rating of 4/5 stars. This is not to complain, but bring the management's attention to all the little things that can make a guests stay perfect, as an MO experience should be. We hope this will be taken as constructive feedback for further improvement, for the comfort of others expecting the 'MO way'.

After years of staying in hotel after hotel in New York City, I have found one that is a calm, inviting and inviting place to be. The staff is excellent, the food wonderful and don't miss the swimming pool. It was worth the wait to find this place.

Having returned from our summer holiday in France we find that our connecting flight home was cancelled because of storms. Since we couldn't get out until the next afternoon we decided to stay in the city. We then found ourselves scrambling to find a room and the Mandarin was one of the few hotels that had a room so we grabbed it. We prefer to stay in boutique hotels. Having said that we couldn't have been happier with our choice. We were upgraded to a suite overlooking Manhattan and Central Park on the 46th floor and it was luxurious and comfortable. Every single staff member we encountered couldn't have been nicer and we were even allowed a late checkout! Thank you Mandarin Oriental for a wonderful, albeit short, stay!

My wife and I decided to spend our 20th wedding anniversary in NYC. Since it was just a weekend we decided to focus on the Upper West Side and chose the Mandarin Oriental. The first impression when entering the hotel is that you are being transported to a calm and serene world away from all the hustle and bustle of NYC. A nice way to unwind after a long day of site seeing and shopping in the city. This is a hotel that pays attention to hospitality and service and is conveniently located to Upper West Side attractions like Lincoln Center. A great choice if you are going to be in that area.

Had a great stay and i have always loved the Mandarin Oriental NYC. Love the tea time in the Lobby, as well as teh Chocolate covered strawberries in the room at check in. They have great customer service from when you arrive to when you leave. A special thanks to Ryan and Guillermo who where great at greating my partner and i and giving us some great ideas of places to eat and things to do. Look forward to my next visit to NYC.

I just spent one night in this hotel and I was lucky as my room was on the 51 floor facing Central park. Just coming in your room opening the curtains and then seeing this amazing city below your feet is just amazing. New York becomes a quiet place from up there. The reception is on the 36th floor, the staff there is very friendly and helpful. The room had a warm oriental design, but modern and straight. The bed was lovely. My bathroom has a bath and a shower as well as a separate toilet. It was very clean. I also enjoyed a cocktail at night overseeing New York nightlife and I thought the prices at 19 $ were acceptable for such a view and cocktail. I think there are probably hotels that are even more luxerous, but what I really liked is that this hotel does not overdo it. So its luxury, but without the golden design and quiet voices. I also saw quite a few families with kids, so that seems to work well as well, probably because the park is so close. For all shoppers: great place to start your tour :-) And by the way a big thankyou to the hotel as I was offered a free pair of amazing shoes!

We were very very happy with our stay at this hotel. We had the most amazing view from our suite which looked over Central Park and the bordering buildings. It was so beautiful it was hard to pull ourselves away from it. The staff were so helpful and pleasant and nothing was overlooked. We were given complimentary cookies and cupcakes which the kids loved. Another wonderful thing the Mandarin did was to give us complimentary books (novels) to take home as part of a reading program they support. It was very generous. The elevators were also quite smooth and efficient as Reception is on the 35th floor.

The Mandarin throughout the world is a known quantity, the Mandarin in NY does not fail to impress!This is an efficiently run hotel with truly exceptional service from all members of staff.Great location, spotlessly clean and superb food.Fabulous spa, special thanks to Roni for looking after my son.I really can not find fault - well done and thank you Mandarin NY.

Truly appalling service. Having called ahead to confirm early arrival I had to wait for an hour whilst our room which apparently had been cleaned had to be checked. Only a request to see the manager (who was clearly too important to actually meet any guests) yielded some progress. Clearly the staff today need a refresher course on customer service and the manager needs to figure out whether he is interested in keeping clients or sending them elsewhere. If its the latter he has done well. I will not be coming to a mandarin hotel again.
user_name:
Joe S
New York City, New York

review_body: possibliy the best hotel ive stayed at in a while. luxury at its best. reception is on the 35th floor if i remember and below is a shopping mall.. food was amazing very exspensive but it was just amazing..our room had a 50' tv in the main room and 17' in the bathroom so i was watching the news as i was getting ready. the shower is out of this world..cannot fault this place easy excess onto colubus circle not far from time square would most difinatly stay here again

This place is not intimate and sexy like other boutique hotels in the city (you know which ones I mean). It oozes an over-the-top luxury that is reproduced in all the MO properties around the world. What stands out in NY is the jaw-dropping views over the city and central park. Worth checking in just to watch the sun rise then set then go to the lobby bar to float over the city lights while sipping their heavy cocktails.

We have tried all the top hotels on our regular visits but this is the best for our regular mad shopping trips, convenient for everything (even taxi's in the rain) and if there has ever been any problem it has been solved immediately. bert.demarco@gmail.com

We stay here frequently when we visit NYC. We have always experienced good service and I am surprised to read some other less flattering reviews. The rooms are always very clean and comfortable, although not huge, they are a decent size for NYC. Love the shower, with the huge rain shower head option, and appreciate the toilet in a separate "room". The best feature is the location....so nice to have breakfast in the lounge restaurant by a window overlooking Central Park and Columbus Circle. If you want a nice touch, you can order chocolate covered strawberries and champagne which they deliver upon your arrival.
great service, great view of the Park, sweet sleep.

This is a nice hotel and situated in a nice location. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the bathroom was also really nice. We had a view of the Hudson River which looked okay, nothing too special. The bed we thought was a little small even though it was supposed to be a king size it looked more like a queen sized bed. We had booked a premier room which we also found to be a bit small and cramped, the separate toilet in the bathroom was also very cramped and narrow. Overall we received good service however found the lady working at concierge very rude as she was not very helpful when we requested for her to make a booking at a restaurant for dinner and the bellman outside the hotel pretty much ignored us when we tried hailing taxis, offering no assistance. The food we ordered from room service was pretty standard, nothing special. We did enjoy our stay here and would definately stay here again.

I stayed at the Mandarin for work for 3 days in May. The hotel is very nice but felt quite "average" for a 5-star hotel and certainly not worth the US$895 room rate. If you want real 5-star quality and service, this is not the place. Go to the St. Regis or Pierre. I had high expectations for this hotel because it had been written up so frequently in travel magazines but it was literally the worst Mandarin Oriental I have stayed at, granted the only other Mandarin Oriental Hotels I have stayed at have been in Asia. I would have given this hotel a 4 rating because service and quality is not bad but for what you pay, you would expect, much, much better.Pros:- Location. This hotel is at the Time Warner Center at Columbus Circle. One block from Central Park and close to almost all subway lines.- Very comfortable bed.- Separate shower and bath tub.Cons:- Room is small-ish. Hotel rooms tend to be moderate in NY but for what you pay, it just seemed too small.- Rooms overall felt a bit worn, I know this hotel has not been around for too long but the rooms felt like there was not alot of maintenance put into them.- Only one sink in bathroom.- Small gym. But then again, you are one block from Central Park, where running is amazing.- Service was average. It seemed like the staff were generally well-intentioned but standards are just low. For example, when I arrived, the guy at the door asked if I wanted help with luggage. At the Mandarin in Hong Kong, Jakarta, KL and Macau - no one ever ASKS if you need help. They just help! However, I think this may just be an American thing.- So expensive. $895 a night. I ordered room service - eggs and toast and it was $55 excluding tip....Tips:- If you are going to spend this kind of money, go somewhere else - St. Regis, Pierre or Ritz-Carlton

The location of the hotel is great, and so is the view from the lobby bar, but this is about it. The rooms are pretty ordinary and old fashioned (considering how recently the hotel was built), and not very big. The hotel staff was very polite and tried hard to accommodate any request, however unsuccessfully. I had my assistant get a reservation for PerSe for a month through the Concierge (you would expect a decent Concierge in the same building to know how to pull it off), however only learned at my departure that PerSe has a section with an a'la carte menu that accepts walk ins. I asked for the separate blankets for the bed, and the hotel was despite 4 attempts unsuccessful in setting them up that the eiderdowns were covered by the bed sheets that I wouldn't have to wake up wrapped in the disgusting stained eiderdowns (with the sheets shifting during the sleep). Not what you expect from a hotel that charges 1000 $ a night! The manager invited me to have breakfast on the hotel. I was told that the hotel doesn't reserve specific tables by the widow an that they would be assigned on a first come first serve basis. When I entered the restaurant and escorted to my table, I spotted an empty table right at the window. When I asked to be seated at this table, I was told that this was reserved for an important guest who enjoys sitting next to the window!?! After 5 minutes the host came back to reseat us next to the window. At that time I was already so upset that I didn't care what table they would give me.I don't mind spending money for value, however in this case I got to be an idiot to ever return to this hotel!

It pains me to say this- but I am SO disappointed in Mandarin. I think the property has incredible service0 I love the brand and LOVE the bar / bar staff especially. Rooms are small and not nearly as great as I had hoped. However my big disappointment was the Spa. I received a 90 minute spa treatment gift for my birthday (so excited!) - the price was ~$375.00 (twice the cost of most nice spas in NYC) which did shock me, but expected the value to measure up.First off, the spa is MUCH smaller than I thought. Upon arrival, you take off your shoes in this small sterile check-in area, sit there barefoot with the little slippers, surrounded by other tourists/customers right next to you, and then 5 or so minutes later finally get to go inside. The lockerroom facilities are very small- to the point where you are very near the entrance, so if you are changing and someone walks in, there is literally no privacy whatsoever. The best part about the spa is the whirlpool jacuzzi and steamroom- great facilities that I loved. HOWEVER, the therapist I had was possibly one of the worst ever. I had to ask repeatedly for her to go deeper (the most gentle and boring massage I have ever had, and I get treatments monthly)- she never asked how the treatment was. My biggest pet peeve is having to continually ask for something, feel bad about it, and then have to ask again- I'm supposed to be relaxed and not thinking! They also use basic white towels as opposed to soft sheets/bedding, and the floor to ceiling windows makes it hard to have a nice dark room which I like during massages. Overall I am very disappointed- for that price tag I really should have walked away feeling incredible.Equinox, just under the hotel, is half the price and has much better therapists, from what I have experienced.
user_name:
clutchbomb
New York City, New York

review_body: The lobby lounge and all rooms overlook Central Park. I believe that t he hotel STARTS on the 35th floor with all the rooms above that. I got a great top floor room with a corner view, Staff is extremely accommodating and friendly. Definitely get that "small" hotel feel as soon as you check in. Rooms are beautifully appointed with extremely large luxurious bathrooms.Great NYC location for my purposes and using the hotel"house car" several times was a great plus that I don't think many people know of. Rooms of course are VERY expensive ,even for NYC. But, you do get what you pay for!! Too many great restaurants in the city to eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that aspect. All in all. I WILL be back to the Mandarin!

OMG - don't waste your money on this hotel. Don't get me wrong, the hotel and the rooms are nice, but ONLY nice, nothing to write home about, there are much better deluxe hotels in New York for half the price.Rooms are typical New York size, quite small. We reserved a grand deluxe and was given a room on the 43rd floor. These rooms were very compact and quite dark, considering they boast they have floor to ceiling windows. We complained and were given a Hudson view room on the 49th floor. The view from these rooms were much better, and the bathroom was very nice - it even had a window above the bath, although you couldn't see out of it when sitting in the bath.The bath room amenities were nothing special, and there is NO bath or shower gel, only shampoo, condition, body wash, and bath crystals for the bath. Minimum number of towels were provided - 3 for 2 adults.The rooms do not have any coffee making facilities, and no chocolates for turn down :-(Staff at the front desk were friendly enough, but when we had to change rooms we were told that we had to come down and get the new keys, as there was not enough staff to bring them up - so, paying $1000 per night to the hotel and they can't even provide a service!!We had made a reservation for Brunch in the restaurant for the following Sunday. before we arrived. Upon check-in, we asked if they could check on this for us, and found that there was no reservation. The restaurant called us in our room to confirm that we now had a reservation for breakfast at 11am on Saturday - we said that we want brunch on Sunday, not Saturday. The following night (Saturday) we checked with the concierge that our reservation for Sunday brunch was all confirmed. They called back and said that our reservation was for today, Saturday, and that we never showed up....... they finally made the correct reservation - truly 5 star service don't you think?I would not recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice hotel to stay at in New York.

Stayed here last week for a few nights with my wife while on vacation. Don't get me wrong this place is nice but so simple you miss the "WOW" effect that goes with this type hotel. Breakfast manager at "ASIATE" was on top of his game. seemed to care. Never saw another manager.This place is all about the view which is great.The bar /lobby great view, nothing special.If you want personal service,try the Ritz!

Friend and I were going to the New York Auto Show so we decided to spend the night at the Mandarin. I normally choose the Four Seasons when I'm in Manhattan but they don't offer double bed rooms, since we were only spending one night this was the best option for us. I've relaxed in the Lobby Lounge and eaten at Asiate before but had not actually stayed at the hotel. It was absolutely worth it! This is the third Mandarin I've stayed at in the US and was up to par with the others. The location and view is perfect here.Excellent staff that could not have been more professional with handy house car available for the ride to the Javits Center.The hash for breakfast at Asiate was awesome!

Stayed there over new year with my girlfriend. Despite some other recommendations from friends I decided to go for the Mandarin and actually must say this was a big disappointment. I really felt not getting much for the price of the room. Even the service was not up to standards. Breakfast is one of the worst I ever had in a luxury hotel!Having stayed at other Mandarin before I really expected something different and will surely not come back to Mandarin NYC. Prefer Peninsula or other downtown hotels should you be planning your trip.Only good souvenir will be the SPA with very good massage! At least!!!
