The Mandarin is a beautiful hotel. Having lunch overlooking Central Park is amazing. The room was small but comfortable. The spa is just okay. The services are lovely, but the spa amenities are lacking. When comparing luxury I prefer The Setai the room are much bigger with espresso machines and internet included. The turn down service brought gourmet pretzels and candies. I love their spa with water lounge. Its the little things that matter. The Mandarin did not even put a chocolate on the pillow and charge for internet. I hate feeling nickel and dime-ed on my vacation.

This was my 3rd visit to the Mandarin Oriental in New York and I think I love it even more each time. The views are stunning (we stayed in a Premier Central Park View room) from both the rooms and the public areas. Service at the hotel is always perfect - friendly, professional and considerate. We dined at Asiate - for both breakfast and dinner. Dinner was fabulous but I think the breakfasts there are even better. We also ordered room service when we first arrived and even that was delicious and high quality too.The spa is fairly expensive but a wonderful experience. The gym and pool are both great too.Location wise - for me it doesn't get any better. It's right at the corner of Central Park so perfect for running and within a nice walking distance of 5th Avenue.

In my opinion, while staying in hotels in New York City, you get two views, city or river. Everywhere you go, everything you see are just rivers, buildings and more buildings. It gets a bit crazy that even if you were to get up to Empire State Building, are still rivers, buildings and more buildings, though from a different perspective. Now back to Mandarin Oriental, New York, let's just say if you can afford S$1,000.00 plus a night then go for this hotel as it is luxury and high-end for New York City standard. First the rooms, I was fortunate to be staying in the Deluxe Hudson River View room which as it states, overlooks Hudson River. Being first time in New York City, I believed the rooms at Mandarin Oriental, New York are among the largest in similar category hotels. Big beds, spacious bathroom and great evening views from the Deluxe Hudson River View Room. There are also novels for your reading pleasure in which one may bring home at the end of the stay. Considering the price tag of paying for the room, why not! However, I would not recommend one to book the standard rooms as the view is partially blocked from Columbus Circus and is not very nice. Since you already decided to stay here, why not splurge more. Another thing I love about this hotel is the swimming pool and gym located on the 35th Floor with decent size. Did not try the restaurant but the view is great and Asiate is voted is rated by Zaget as having the restaurant with the best view. Location: Fantastic. On Columbus Circus in Time Warner Centre with shops and restaurants nearby and of course great spot to start walking Central Park from the south. Overall, go for it if you are willing to splurge! Enjoy!

Definitely one of the best hotels I ever been! They gave us a great room, with the most amazing view of New York and the central Park! The service was great, the breakfast unbelivable! Made our New York experience fabulous, thank you!

The mandarin oriental was a beautiful place to stay on a first trip to New York City. Absolutely luxurious! Right in the midst of Columbus circle. Only steps away from Central Park, and Columbus Circle shopping. I would recommend visiting the pool-great views!
This place is amazing. The rooms are clean, the views of the park are spectacular and the service is splendid. You really can't ask for more. Stay here!
View to the central park is so beautiful.. the morning sun lights up my egg benedict on that breakfast trolley table...truffle on top was so delicious...

We spent the weekend in New York and stayed at the Mandarin Oriental. The hotel staff were extremely efficient and made our stay most enjoyable. The hotel located on the upper floors of the Time Warner Center has great views. Our room had a beautiful view of the Hudson River. The lobby and restaurants have a great view of Central Park and Midtown. The room is a good size and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and luxurious. Check in and check out were a breeze. The two nights we were there we asked the bellman to get us a taxi. Instead he put us in the house car which was offfered gratis. It was much nicer driving in a clean luxury car. Everything about the hotel was first rate.

Our first stay on the west side and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The room was large, comfortable, most important clean and the view overlooking Central Park was amazing. Definitely visit the pool and gym if you have time. My one tip, each morning I highly recommend going down to Bouchon's in the mall area below for coffee and pastries.

Great location, amazing views from the room, bathroom was great.The size of the room was impressive, considering how small hotel rooms can be in Manhattan. The price was a bit steep (700 USD per night), but I guess worth it, if you want to spend a couple of days and treat yourself to something nice.

There is no doubt that this hotel company has a great product, the New York hotel has the kind of amenities, the level of service, and the emphasis on details that distinguish this company, but there is just one thing that not to have the reception at the street level is something that makes me feel that it does steal from it the atmosphere of a grand hotel. Granted that the building has other uses, but a Great Hotel experience starts at the entrance.I do not think this was a fortunate decision.
user_name:
Gabriel1313
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed on the 50th floor - and, the view was amazing! The hotel is simply beautiful! The housekeeping staff was excellent. The room was extremely clean! The front desk staff could've been a little warmer - but, they were very accommodating & proffesional. Overall it was a great stay.

The Mandarin Oriental New York has never disappointed me. The rooms are divine and the service is impeccable. The rooms are warm, inviting, spotless and extremely tasteful and well-appointed. Every detail exudes "quality". The views are gorgeous and the bathrooms are always spacious and equipped with every amenity and convenience. Room service is extremely prompt: they promised our meals within 20 minutes and were never late. We had dinner at Asiate and found the staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. Our meal was outstanding -- as was our whole stay. Finally, the complimentary new books to read and take home are a lovely amenity.
user_name:
amysnewyork
New York City, New York

review_body: The moment we arrived we were greeted warmly by the doorman and treated like dear old friends. He and every other staff member remembered and used our names each and every time they saw us. The food in the spledid Asiate was 5 Star and beautifully and lovingly presented. Our room was wonderfully appointed with every luxury convenience one could or would expect. This one place that truly seems to anticipate your every need.The guest rooms all start on the 40th floor of the high rise building. Thus, each room has a wonderful view of either Central Park or the Hudson River.Can't wait to go back!

A truly fantastic hotel for service, ambiance/design, location and overall quality. It is my favorite amongst all of the hotels I've stayed at in NY (both Ritz Carltons, Pierre, St. Regis, Four Seasons plus many others). The design aesthetic is relatively modern with MO's typical Asian themes. Service is impeccable. The staff must have be both selected and trained with care. The amount of small talk the staff can conjure up is quite amazing -- they somehow manage to make it feel very genuine as opposed to patronizing. Pros:* Design: modern with Asian influences. It feels sleek and modern, and much less "stuffy" than many of the other high-end NY properties.* Location: Columbus Circle is fantastic if you like going out to the park, and it is attached to the Shops at Columbus Circle for easy access to shopping and dining.* Rooms: very high quality finishings, spacious bathroom* Views: great views of the park and/or river, particularly from higher floors* Gym: very high-end equipment, great service, nice selection of complimentary refreshments* Catering: fantastic food in the ballroom and conference area* Food: Great cocktails and food in the bar and restaurant areaCons:* Conference staff: while attending a conference I noticed the staff that does catering and such for the conference center/ballroom seemed to have significantly less training. A simple complaint is that they were very noisy and always yelling back and forth, even when we opened the door of our room and asked them to keep quiet. * Expensive: there is no doubt that the hotel is expensive, but the MO NYC certainly strives to make it worth the expense.
this is one of the best hotels in NYC. great experience. prices accordingly...

How can a "5" star hotel not have a bar that actually opens 7 days a week when you pay around 1500 US dollars a night you would expect a bar in the hotel that opens 7 days a week. It actually closes on Sunday and Monday you then have to wait in line for a table in the lounge / foyer with any other people that we just walk in off the street and who are not guests. Even worse you you go and stay over new year 2011 and then find on new years the bar closed, so you then get told there is a 1 hour wait to sit in the lounge amazing. Considering I stay at the Oriental Bangkok and also Hong Kong I just wonder if the New York Oriental is actually part of the group. Philip Webb

I have stayed in many of the best hotels in NYC, but the Mandarin is by far the best. You literally walk across the street to the opera, symphony, or Central Park. There is a subway stop right in front. The spa is gorgeous, the beds are perfect and the food is wonderful. I love the lobby. This hotel beats the Four Seasons NYC in my opinion because it is warmer and more fun. If you want to do cultural activities it is in a better location. If your main goal is to shop, then I suggest a hotel in midtown such as the Four Seasons. I agree that the rooms are small but ll NYC hotel rooms are small.

I love the Mandarin Oriental chain. Love this property in NYC as it is prime Columbus Circle/ Central Park location. Gorgeous check-in, amazing sky lobby bar views, superb staff and service with many celebrity sitings. GREAT SPA. The only downside to this hotel is the room quality. Rooms are small and fairly old for the price you pay. However, for the location, this cannot be beat. A perfect evening here would consist of a dinner at Masa with your significant other at the connected Time Warner Center then swiftly walking over to the elevators of the Mandarin. Would definitely stay here/visit here again.
user_name:
sbajaj621
New York City, New York

review_body: This is the place my husband and I go when we want an absolutely amazing night away from the kids. And it truly is an "almost" perfect experience. When we checked in (we booked the room through American Express Platinum concierge) the front desk clerk was truly, truly delighted to upgrade us to a one bedroom suite without our even asking for it! That's the wonderful thing about this hotel--they seem genuinely thrilled to serve you. The food in the lobby bar was pretty good, the drinks are absolutely GREAT. We loved our one bedroom suite--probably a $3,000 per night value that they gave us (for a $995 charge). The two things I would point out that would prevent this from being flawless: the housekeeping somehow assumed I was a solo traveler and only did turn down service for one person (i.e., one pair of slippers, one bottle of water). I think at a hotel like this, they should know how many people are in the room. And, there was a strange ticking noise in the heating unit that night (it seemed to fade away as time passed). But truly, WHO CARES, when we were upgraded to such a wonderful room? Also, the spa is quite expensive ($360 for a massage) and when I checked in, the staff were whispering and arguing over something on the computer and took a long time to acknowledge my presence. Not exactly the experience you want when you are dropping this kind of money. We liked brunch at the Asiate restaurant. It's a good value (though the service is a little bit harried). Overall, this is a wonderful place, one we will return to time and again. We consider it "our place" and we can't wait to return. I don't think any hotel can nail the concept of utterly perfect, in every way, but this comes close.

The service was great!! Everyone is so friendly and welcoming. Room Service was exquisite they made sure our stay was as comfortable as possible. It really feels like your home. The rooms have a spectacular view of central park and the lobby has an extradionary view of columbus circle and central park. The lobby offers lovely snacks that was just the cherry on top complementing the view you could sit for hours and not get bored. The food in the restaurant was perfect too, quite delicious. As for the location it was amazinlg logistic with a 5 min walk to 5 th avenue, the best shopping areas, and a min walk to the like the best restaurants per se and marea, and right next to the hotel is a mall that has several nice shops. So overall it was perfect in so many ways !!!!

Top notch service and amenities in a perfect new York city location. I have stayed here for work on many occasions and this stay had the opportunity to enjoy the spa. One if the best massages I have ever received and a beautiful relaxation space overlooking central park. Truly an urban oasis!

Sorry but not. I don't understand the point of paying 950 dollars for a room smaller than my college housing room.I ha long wanted to try a Mandarin Oriental, it sounds so luxurious and somehow glamourous today, I though a romantic night with my girl was worthy the 1000 dollars to have views to the park and the hudson river.Yes you have a great service, as so you do in the much cheaper Taj and the W hotels and many other luxury hotels of the city.Yes beautiful design oriental W hotel style nothing that I had no seen. May is because I'm from Barcelona and I helped a girlfriend with a tourist guide visiting hotels around that I'm already immune to just design and they have to be more creative than that.I know the size of the rooms in Manhattan are small, but dam this was small to the point specially considering the prize.Beautiful view sure; The Pierre own by the Taj Hotel group has better ones. I'm sorry but I felt I through away the money.You want a luxury hotel in New York The Pierre is amazing, you want design Crosby Street Hotel, Hotel American and many other great boutique hotels in the city are much better.In the end is just a oriental style W with prizes that got steroids.

The hotel is conveniently located in Columbus Circle so that most parts of Manhattan are easily accessible. Some of the best restaurants in the world are within walking distance, such as Per Se and Jean Georges. The service is of the highest caliber. The rooms are NY sized, but are lavishly appointed with every comfort imaginable. The spa facilities are top notch as well. The hotel is definitely on the pricey side. It’s hard to justify the price with so many other options in the city so only go if you are in the mood to splurge.

I had the pleasure of staying at a corner suite and it was overall amazing! The suite was spacious enough,the view was breathtaking as there were no walls at all, only windows!! Very friendly staff and excellent room service. The pool of the hotel was also a must see!The only point i have to make is only about "air" in the room.Probably for security reasons the windows couldn't open at all and if you are a smoker..that's a problem! :)

We stayed here on our wedding night (and the nights around it) and while we are frequent guests of the MONY we would be remiss not tipping our hats to this exceptional modern luxury hotel. While pricey and lofty, MONY delivers on so many levels: staff, gym, food, location, service. Well done!

My husband and I stayed 4 nights over the NYC marathon weekend, in which my husband was running. We loved the hotel's location, which is unsurpassed, and expected the customary MO experience.Our suite had great views and a comfy bed, but that is where the MO usual experience ended. The room had seen some wear and tear, the safe didn't work, the door didn't close properly on its own, and the service was remarkably bad. The first time we had to call twice to get something, we wrote it off as a busy weekend, but after 4 days, it was just unexceptable at the prices being charged. The room service food is delicious, but the attention to detail is just not there--for example, my husband preordered breakfast with cold cereal and coffee--the milk for the cereal came steamed. Other irritations as well, such as no doormen or bellman at the ground floor to help with doors, packages, etc. On marathon morning, I preordered 4 bags of ice to be left in the bathroom tub in bags for my husband for post-race icing...when we returned from the race, there was one baggie- sized bag of ice melting on a tray in the living room. It took 2 phone calls to sort that out. There were several other incidents, but it's not necessary to list them all. I have already expressed my concerns directly to the hotel, and received an apologetic response, so hopefully things will improve, but its only fair to let others know about these shortcomings.

Staff were very friendly, polite if not warm. Housekeeping was prompt and frequent... The room service foods are overpriced but SO DELICIOUS. Mmm. We had a suite with several rooms...great views all around from the, nice cable television, wonderful bedding.I must say that the rooms were clean, toiletries wonderful, the robes were comfy, the sleeps were great... They were helpful in scheduling rides and such for us... This is a great hotel.

I took my sister here for her 40th birthday, so this was definitely meant to be a special location. When I arrived, I called earlymorning to see about an early check-in and after a few back and forth calls, I was told that the room was being prepped and should be ready shortly. I arrived, and was told the room wasn't quite ready but would be soon (as I was told this, the couple next to me were checking in, no problem). "Shortly" turned out to be 2 pm, only an hour before the actual scheduled check-in time. I was given a room with a handicap bathroom, which, as my sister later described it was a cross between a luxury hotel and a nursing home. I asked to switch, but was told there was nothing available until the next day. The next day, we were able to switch to a better room, but again, not until about 4 in the late afternoon. I have to put int a plug for the gym--very nice, well-equipped and attentive, helpful staff. After that, the stay was wonderful, but for that much money, I expected FAR better service.

We went back to the MO NYC 4 years after our first stay there. We had great memories but things changed...The bad things:1- Hotel got old....after only a few years... it looks old... is it well maintained? 2- The service, in general, went south... not as good and dedicated staff... 3- the food, breakfast food is bad, really bad... we have tried both, room service and in the restaurant... this is really not acceptable for a MO.the good things:1- still incredible concierge team2- still a great view on central park

Wow! This is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. We were blown away by the service. Greeted by very friendly bell staff at the front door. Took the elevator to reception and were greeted immediately by name (bell staff calls up to desk to say you are coming). Reception staff went above and beyond. Even walked us to the elevator and pressed the buttons. Room was beautiful with an incredible view of the Hudson River. We had business events in the hotel. View from conference rooms were also incredible of Central Park and beyond. Pool and fitness area included in price. Clean and also beautiful. We will stay at the Mandarin again.

I have been meaning to write a review of this hotel for quite some time now. we stayed here about 3 years ago and it was by far one of the best hotel experiences we have had! Mainly because of the fact that it was sooo quiet! Could not hear any noise from other guests rooms or other guests doors banging (a big problem in many other hotels)! Because of this we slept very soundly in the very comfortable room/bed. The room size was generous for NYC and had great floor to ceiling windows which had great double/triple glazing too so could not hear the very very busy NYC traffic outside which again was amazing! The bathroom was lovely with a lovely window/view too! ALso we were very jetlagged the first night so ordered room service for dinner and it was the BEST meal we have ever had from rooms service in any hotel! Hope to go back again someday very soon!!
If it's not too expensive for you, I recomend you to try this place. I like this place very much, hope you will like it too.

I stayed at this Mandarin when itnfirst opened years ago and HD tv was a noveltyRooms still elegant-- not worn. Lobby lounge good scene of drinks, view and people watching. Convenient to have Whole Foods in the buildingnfor health food regime. Prompt checkin and room service.

I stayed there last week on business. Once again, the Mandarin surpassed my expectations. I had a great room overseeing Central Park. The only negative comment I have is that the ironing board and its cover could be replaced.

We stayed here partly out of convenience and partly out of a splurge for a wedding we attended here. When we made the reservation we were told there was a "wedding discount" however the price we were quoted was the same price listed as rack rate on the website. When we asked about this, we were promised and had confirmation of an upgraded corner room at the lower listed price. As part of the bridal party, we needed to be there early in the day, and had also arranged for early check in-which we were told would be no problem. Great. Arrived around 1pm, and were told we were being given a basic room. My husband stated we had been approved for an upgrade. The desk assistant said that the price didn't reflect that, but then went on to say she would honor it (after we showed her our e-mailed confirmation) however that room was also not ready. We were low key about all this, assuming we could leave our bags and go start getting ready (hair appointment, etc). Pro: The room was ready about 30min later, Con: If I had known it would be that quick, I would have waited for the key so I could go wash up first, instead I was half way across town. When we finally got into our room, it did not seem like it was either a corner view or an upgraded room, which felt like they had been dishonest with us. Too much else to do to follow up on it. Still, the room was clean, comfortable, and had a great view of central park. Loved the creature comforts of the fainting couch, the books in the room, the rain shower and the bathrobes. Seriously considered buying one. Amenities didn't seem the highest quality considering the price point.

This hotel cares for detail. High quality bath amenities, the nice little bag around the fresh morning paper, beautiful bookmarks in your books when returning to your room. It's the kind of stuff that differentiates the very good from the mediocre. Restaurants are good to very good, view from the lobby bar and restaurants breath taking, location of the hotel is perfect. They could do even a little more to give a welcoming feel to visitors at ground level (the hotel starts at the 35th floor), but all in all this hotel is well managed and worth it's steep New York prices.

Must recommend this hotel if you visit New York! Our room was fantastic, and we had the best view of Central park. But even better was the front desk staff. Especially the young manager from Singapore who went above and beyond. She recommended Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. Must go there next! She gave us the true Mandarin hospitality we are used to here in Asia.

Our visit to New York City was greatly enhanced by staying at The Mandarin. It was a splurge and we didn't regret it. For starters, the view was to die for and we were there during an eclipse! Watching the sun come up over Central Park in the early morning was a spiritual experience. The service could not have been better. Because our room wasn't quite ready when we arrived, they offered us complimentary drinks in the lounge while we were waiting. The exercise facility was first rate. We had a terrific lunch in the restaurant. Right in the heart of Manhattan, the location is optimal. We can't stay here all the time, but it was worth it when we did. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to experience New York in a 5-star setting.

Excellent Columbus Circle location with the Time Warner Center next door and Central Park a 3 minute walk. The room is one of the nicest I have ever experienced with every amenity one could imagine plus a great view. The staff and service exceeded expectations. The only downside? It's $$$$$ even by NYC standards. But if cost is not a factor, then by all means treat yourself right and enjoy this hotel.

My partner and I only spent a couple of nights at the Mandarin Oriental, but we certainly benefited as much as we could from staying at this wonderful place. After we got a warm welcome at the reception desk we admired the stylish rooms, had the most wonderful sushi just around the corner and got back for pre-dinner cocktails at the lobby lounge on the 35th floor. The views of Columbus Circle and Central Park are simply breathtaking, especially at sunset. Reserve one evening for a dinner at Asiate restaurant. We appreciated the inspired menu, the excellent service and the décor.
This is very different from a Four Seasons or a Ritz Carlton in NY. However, the level and the quality of the staff is unparalleled. Simply fantastic.

When we tell people we went to New York City to watch the fireworks on the 4th of July, they think we are crazy dealing with the crowds. The trick is to stay at the Mandarin Oriental which has rooms overlooking the Hudson and runs a fourth of July special. The service is great and rooms are perfect.It is a little expensive, but worth it for the serenity.

I stayed here for a night in June on business. The hotel was very nice and by and large lived up to the hype. The rooms are very nice and have a modern luxurious feel to them. There are some great restaurants in the Time Warner Center (Mandarin lobby on the 35th floor and rooms on floors above) such as Masa and Per Se. The lobby bar was quite dead on the night I was there although it can be hopping on other nights. Breakfast was nice with great views of the city. The fitness center was rather small and ordinary with not much equipment, but pleasant. In the end, however, I don't think I can say it was worth the hefty price.

When our family went to visit New York CIty in March of 2011 our expectations were blown away by the Mandarin Oriental. The food was delicous, the spa an excellent place to have a treatment a large indoor pool and great accomodations. The views out of the room were amazing and the service was just great. The next time we take another Spring Break trip back to the Mandarin our kids say. However, when you stay at the Mandarin Oriental your really looking for a great vacation, and as you would imagine it was too much money. But still a vacation to last a life time.

My husband and I stayed for a night in Mandarin Oriental NYC for our night out in the city in July 2011. Before that we had the most pleasant experience staying in Mandarin Oriental in Munich, Germany and because of that chose Mandarin Oriental for this short trip to NYC. However this time it was a great disappointment. The hotel stuff neither greeted us at the entrance of the hotel nor helped us with our luggage. The room itself was nice but definitely not brand new as there we some torn wall paper in the room. The fun part began when it appeared that the mini bar was locked and there was no key in the room – it took us three phone calls to have it brought to our room. After that it appeared that there was no price list for the mini bar in the room either… We ordered some champagne in room and the girl who I was making my order with was actually rude – she kept demanding some number but didn’t have a clue to explain this to me – this number appeared to be some internal code given to each vine bottle in the menu. A guy who brought us the wine was actually the nicest stuff member we came across. To sum it up the room was ok but taking into account our total bill which was around US$1,000 for an overnight stay and a bottle of a not extravagant champagne I would definitely advise another hotel for a trip to NYC with a more nicer and a more client appreciative stuff especially if it is your personal trip.
Could not have asked for more...excellent location....excellent staff.....perfect in my book....nothing to complain about.

I not only have stayed in many many hotels in NYC but I also lived there for a few years. I have rated several hotels on TripAdvisor as well in cities all over the world. NEVER have I had the experience that I had at The Mandarin Oriental. The Door Staff: very good, The Front Desk: absolutely Unbelievable, The Concierge Desk: Shockingly Amazing (Ask for a ticket to a show... any show... they can get it no matter what the show period!) Housekeeping: Spotless Work and Quite, The Maintenance Staff: Attentive and quick! (when we first checked in and showered the water was slow to drain. By the time we returned from dinner it was all taken care of) Spa: An Absolute MUST!, Check-Out: Easy and surprising. The ladies at the front even too our bags and would not accept the tip. The rooms were wonderful and spacious. Breakfast was delicious. Lobby and entrance foyer were always spotless. IT DOES NOT GET BETTER. It is not the cheapest in NYC however, if you can stay here... there is not question about this place. It is THE BEST in NYC...

Great value, even though expensive, you get what you pay for. Decent sized rooms. Wonderful pool. Fantastic breakfast, beautiful spa. Bar for late afternoon drinks, wonderful views and friendly staff. Go see for yourself.

The location of the hotel is perfect, we have had a corner room on the 54 floor overlooking the Park just spectacular. The Room itself was very well decorated with all the amenities you may need:2 large Flat screen TVs, Sound system, small TV in Bathroom, Mini Bar and so one. The Lounge, Bedroom and Bathroom are very well set out, and do easily support a week stay on Business.The Hotel truly stands out in almost everything they offer, all service areas are well maintained and top shape, only down turn (this was our 2nd stay here 1st in 2006) is the F&B Department; which used to be fantastic during our 1st stay.We enjoyed 2 times Breakfast in the room, very well set up, perfectly served and great variety. The Lounge offers great snacks and drinks, service however is no longer at the drive and attentiveness it used to have.The Bar is still the hot spot, very busy in the evening with great cocktails and nice snack food, however the waitress is pushy and likes it her way, you just need to push back and things fall into place. As an example:The 2 of us used a Cocktail table for 4 and the place was full, another couple asks if they can sit down at our table and we agreed. Strange things do happen our days, the waitress refused to serve them! As per company policy only one check per table!! Try to understand that one!!!The big disappointment was the Restaurant!Again we did stay here before and the F&B Department was out of this world, likewise as their Hotel in Miami; said to say things have changed. The Food for sure is still of perfect quality and very well presented; the Service however has much to upgrade. The friendliness for which the place was know (we go the extra mile to make you smile) is no longer.We came for the Sunday Brunch with a party of 4 at 1pm had a few drinks before lunch, during lunch 1 btl of wine. The Brunch was served at 1.45pm, first course, soup was placed at the same time, main course arrived at 2pm shortly followed by the dessert. The waiter kindly reminded us that the restaurant is closed as of 2pm. Every other Department in the hotel is there to serve you; the service is there for different reasons, but for sure not to please you as client. I would truly recommend to Management to have a very close look at the performance level of the service staff.The hotel is great, the location perfect all Departments are in line with what you should expect from a Mandarin Oriental Hotel, F&B performance however needs to get back where it was back in 2006.
This place is just stunning, in my opinion the best in NYC (Including Plaza, Peninsula eg)

Save yourselves! Don't waste your time or money at this hotel. We had to switch rooms 3 different times. One room had not even been cleaned yet! The staff were extremley condesending, & unhelpful. And we actually found a long, curly hair in our food. If your in NYC & want a fabulous place to stay, GO TO THE WALDORF!!

I stayed here because they have a 25m lap pool,high above the city. Very exciting, and extremely well-kept, as are the rooms. But, aside from the view over the park, it was no big deal. St Regis is far more luxurious. The public facilities are understated and very pleasant. Service is both friendly and professional. And breakfast is delicious. However the coffee is awful, Illy, and they charge 8 or 9 per order.My room had both a tub and shower, but unbelievably, this small stall's floor is sloped, and when your feet start sliding as it gets slippery, falling is (in my case), inevitable. Finally, they charge for wifi. At this level, I find it greedy of the hotel to tax you this way.

For the first time in Manhattan I've been thoroughly picking the hotel myself, it was Helmsley and it was pretty decent. This time I completely relied on my travel agent, it turned out to be Mandarin Oriental and it was just astonishing!I don't travel a lot thus try to have the best. This hotel is definitely the one. Great view, perfect location, professional stuff and various amenities located on the first floors in the Time Warner Center... I do recommend this place.What I liked most of all is the thing that everything is new. It's a comparably new building, new furniture etc etc etc LOVED IT!

Stayed here after immediately after our wedding just to get away from it all (a pre-honeymoon of sorts). Our room was excellent - from the bed to the bathroom, everything was clean and perfect. We didn't get a central park view, so that was one downside to our stay there, but given the high floor it was quiet.The only issue we had was that while the front desk, concierge, etc., were all perfectly competent and helpful, everything seemed just a bit cold. I didn't get the feeling that the staff would go out of their way to accommodate us. And I'm not sure it was a very good value at nearly at $900+ per night, but overall, it is the best hotel experience I've had in NYC.
user_name:
DietBoost
New York City, New York

review_body: Gorgeous hotel, amazing views, wonderful service! Fresh fruit just outside your door every day. Complimentary tea, scones and chocolate covered strawberries (silver service) upon check in to your room. Cars available to bring you where you need to go in the city, at no cost. It was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend it!

I had reviewed this hotel before but I thought I'd do it again since it has been a while. The hotel is still our favorite in NYC. The location is right across from the park. The views are phenomenal. The shopping mall on the first three floors is very handy and there are several very good restaurants on the fourth floor. The hotel itself has a fabulous restaurant. Room service has always been impeccable. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Since the hotel starts at the 35th floor all the rooms are very quiet. My husband doesn't want to every stay anywhere else when we visit NYC.

This is one of the top hotels in the world. Stunning views over all Manthattan (depending on the room), with an exceptional bar with views over central park and columbus circle (on the first floor of the hotel which is thirty-something floor in the building). The rooms are very light, not large but big enough with -as said- stunning views if you are willing to put up the money for a top floor and a good view. The bathrooms are beautiful, ours had a window. The service is -as you would expect- impeccable, the bar worth a visit (make sure you reserve a table at the window and reserve you must). The gym is large, extremely clean and well-equipped, they also have a large pool. The location could't be better, being on Columbus Cicle within walking distance from Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and the Broadway Theatres. It will cost you, but you get what you pay for. And then some!

Everything looks really good 5 star as you arrive at the Mandarin Oriental New York - I have previously been to the hotel for drinks and thought next time I'm in NY this was the place for me, so 6 months later I'm back in NY and I'm staying at the Mandarin Oriental.This hotel cost me $1200.00 per night and the room was disgusting - small, very dark stained carpet, peeling wallpaper and a chair with ripped material hanging off it!We change rooms which was better only in the sense that it was brighter and less stained carpet and furniture was fine.I think only a fool would stay here and pay $1200.00, Yes I was the fool! There are so many great hotels in NY so people don't waste your money at the Mandarin Oriental!American Express Centurion should remove this hotel from their list as it is not up to standard!

We booked a one bedroom deluxe room and we were upgraded to a one bedroom mandarin suite. The room was magnificent. We had great views and loved the comfort of the bed and the sofa. The bathroom was beautiful and everything was perfect. The service was top notch. We frequently ordered pots of hot water for tea and coffee... It was expensive but the service was so amazing we didn't care. The hotel lobby on the 35th floor was a great place to have a drink and eat. The lower lobby bellmen were also extremely nice and so attentive. We felt so spoiled. The hotel is located next to a mall which is nice. Close to Lincoln Square and across from Central Park. Very nice area. Cafe Fiorello's is about a block away and had amazing pizza. I loved this place and want to go back soon. If you are going to NYC, this is the place to stay. Almost forgot, the gym and sauna are great. Indoor swimming pool too. I can't stop raving over this place. You gotta try it!

Make sure you book a central park view room; the view is amazing, so romantic. The rooms are very spacious and clean, the breakfast delicious (also with central park view), the staff extremely competent and nice; worth every penny

We intended to make a reservation for a suite for a special anniversary and found the response cold and off-putting. Our experiences at Mandarin Orientals elsewhere has been consistently positive, particular in regards to warm and helpful service. We booked elsewhere.

We had a 3 night stay in NYC for our honeymoon. Our first night was a dreadful experience at the Waldorf Astoria. We curtailed our stay there and we promptly checked out at 7.00am having arranged a room at the MO NYC.Our cab pulled up at the MO at 7.20am and we received a great welcome. Bags sorted no fuss. Reception staff extremely helpful and friendly. They were horrified that we'd had such a bad experience the night before especially as it was our honeymoon. They did their best to make us welcome. Free upgrade to superior room. Choice of Hudson River or Central Park view. We couldn't decide so they took us and showed us each room and we plumped for the Park view room which was superb. We were given access to the room straight away. Views fantastic, bed very comfortable, bathroom luxurious and great in room entertainment setup with ipod docking station controlled via TV. The latter took a little bit of working out. The staff were all very welcoming, friendly and very helpful (especially Concierge). Lovely bar for a drink overlooking Columbus Circle and entrance to Central Park. Room and reception areas were all kept immaculately clean. Hotel very well placed for shopping, transport (subway on doorstep) and sightseeing.We had a fantastic 2 nights here and wished we could have stayed longer. Complimentary late check out to 4.00pm. It's probably a bit more expensive that we'd originally planned to spend but was a great experience for our first visit to NYC. This was everything the Waldorf had failed to be. We would highly recommend it for your visit.

My ipad was stolen from my locked hand luggage bag! So whether it was in the room or where baggage is stored , I don't know. But I do know for sure it was at The Hotel. As our next stop was the airport.

First impression: Great room, but too bad the maid forgot about the open condom wrapper next to the bed. You can't have a great first impression wondering what else she forgot.Second impression: Went down to use beautiful pool--it's closed. Perhaps they should have told me about that issue and that one of their finest features was closed.Third impression: Lighting and technology. If it takes you 2-3 days to learn how to get the lights back on or the master lighting switch reset, then your customers will always be frustrated. If your keys are so cool that people can't get into their rooms, that's a problem. If the building requires you to take two elevators to get to your room every time you step into the building, then that's a problem as well.If your customers try to get to the pool and the hallways are darkened to the point that it feels like you're in a fright house, then that's a problem.If you set up a nice poolside private dinner and the sandwiches are put on a hot plate for two hours in advance, then that's not very tasty.Colleagues can't visit each other on different floors without a major headache because te keys only get you to the correct floor, if the elevators are working correctly. Just to visit another room required both people to get to an "open" floor to proceed. More trouble...Best thing about this hotel? The staff are wonderful. Necole needs to manage the hotel, not just be one of their workers.Worst thing? The technology is so cool that you can't do anything simply. This hotel needs to remember K.I.S.S. If it can't simplify, then perhaps they will have to send a staff member with each person checking in to spend about 15 minutes teaching the customer how to operate the room.

We went with three young children and new baby for weekend, If you expect beautiful rooms, fabulous views, excellent service, you won't be surprised. It had all this. Surprise to us was that lunch in open lobby overlooking the city was super-hip Asian Fusion, with many tables with parents and children, kids menu, sliders, and all fabulous. Then for dinner they invited us to use a little private dining room adjoining large dining room, with wall of windows, usually rented for $300 extra, that was otherwise unused. It was private, intimate, spectacular, and superb. They let us stay until 5 pm. The excellence of service never ended. What a wonderful hotel.

I have stayed many many nights at the Mandarin New York. However my last two stays were disappointing. The service and staff were great as always but the rooms have started deteriorating and I think it is time for a refurbishment. The most annoying thing was that the wireless internet was not working properly. It was extremely slow and most of the times there was no connection. They tried fixing it but without success. We were told that their system had a problem with macs. Now I believe them because I had the same problem a year ago. I think for the amount they charge this is unacceptable.

We enjoyed our stay in this fine hotel and look forward to going back. The room was totally comfortable and inviting. We had a great place to return to each night. If this is in your budget, stay here and enjoy!

I usually visit NYC several times a year for holiday and shopping. I have stayed at The Penninsula, The Plaza, The Palace etc... and so far this is definitely the best.Check in- The suite was not ready when I arrived [~3pm] but I was offered a complimentary drink in the lounge bar. Normally I would be upset at this point but the gorgeous view at the bar made me forget I was waiting. By the time my drink was finished my suite was ready. The Executive Suite- Amazing. I actually smiled when I entered the suite because it was so beautiful. 5 minutes after I had arrived I was presented with some tea and light snacks. The suite was large and the views were spectacular. The bathroom could be a little bigger but given the great view and extra guest bathroom, I was willing to overlook this. An especially nice touch was the stack of books at your bedside for your reading pleasure and complimentary for you to take home.The Spa- Definitely nothing special. $225 for a 60 minute massage and for 'your convenience' they will add on an 18% gratuity. That way you don't have to rack your brain thinking about how much tip you have to give for an average massage.The Service- The door men were great. Usually I dread the money hungry door men who will only speak to you if you are flashing a wad of cash. The door men at the Mandarin were helpful, polite and would do their job with or without a tip.Housekeeping- The suite was immaculate and turn down service was great. The lady who turned down our suite nicely arranged our cosmetics. Would be nice if turn down service included a treat on the pillow.... but thats just a personal preference.Concierge- Helpful and arranged for the hotel's courtesy car to take us to a nearby spa.Room service- We ordered hamburgers and Moscato D'Asti. The bubbly was delicious, the hamburgers were just hamburgers.

Just stayed at the MO NYC this weekend and had a wonderful time. I got upgraded to a Premier Central Park View room, there was a birthday treat waiting for me in my room when I checked in, and I love the fact that they actually have a swimming pool! For the full review of my stay, with pictures, please read my blog entry: http://www.destinationsperfected.com/2011/01/new-york-city-48-hour-gastronomic.html

I had the amazing opportunity to stay at the MONYC (Mandarin Oriental) in NY for my birthday and this trip will be a lasting memory. The hotel and staff are beyond accommodating. The room had an amazing view of Central Park and the bed was like sleeping in a cloud. A drink in the Lobby lounge is a must as you enjoy a sweeping view of Columbus Circle and delightful appetizers.  It was hard to leave my room or the hotel but, you must being you are in NYC. The hotel has such a pleasant vibe and zen effect, it was so relaxing, I never wanted to leave.Stay at the MONYC as it will be an experience you will never forget.

Arrived and room not ready by 3pm; was told to have drinks and snacks on the house while room worked on;( husband came later on in the evening) 2 daughters and I ordered tea and a snack tray for us to split; took about 45 min to be served our snacks/beverages. It ended up showing up on our bill at check -out;Room very small but nice; not thouroughly cleaned however; fridge covered in sticky spray and popcorn on floor, rug and on furntiture; not told about hotel accom. at check in so missed out on rules for using elevators at night-(need card to operate it); no coffee machine in room or comp. coffee in lobby which would expect for paying 1 K a night. gym just ok; nothing special and quite small; nice access to mall and shopping on lowever levels, however; no discounts or anything for stores in mall; nice location for madison ave and macys parade. we were repeadedly asked if we were staying at the hotel whenever we used facilities including elevators. this became annoying. ordered room service breakfast on thanksgiving day so that teenage girls could eat and get out to get spot for parade viewing; 100 $ for two mini sized cereal/milk ; one hot cocoa and one order of fresh fruit and one coffee; clean bathroom with nice bath salts,shampoos, etc.beds comfy; very tight space though for price paid. our anniversary and member of their frequent club but no upgrades provided. no free wi fi even! asked for and received a 2pm check out; got to room at 1:45 and maidsin room and cleaned bathroom and part of room already- some of our personal things like toothbrushes, makeup, etc tossed in garbage already. they were not notified of the late check out. so i was quite upset- wanted to use facilities and freshen up before our departure. this should NOT happen in a 5 star hotel.

The Mandarin Oriental is, in my opinion, one of the better hotels in New York City. I was lucky enough to stay here at the end of a lengthy trip through New England and I was not disappointed! The room I stayed at had amazing (dare I say sweeping?) views of Central Park and was spacious and well-equipped. The bathroom was well-sized and clean, as was the rest of the room. The entire hotel, like the building it's in, feels modern and effortless. The staff were not necessarily as friendly as in other hotels I've stayed in, but they were certainly efficient and effective. It was easy for me to book great tickets to a show at the Lincoln Centre not to mention the helpful guidance that was offered. However, the hotel falls short on two fronts, notably that the food for breakfast costs far too much (I believe I spent $25 for Eggs Benedict) and that the Business Centre is not easy to locate.Nevertheless, this is is an excellent hotel.

My husband and I stayed in a deluxe room with a view of the park. The entire experience was flawless. At the checkin desk we requested a higher floor which was graciously granted. our view was incredible, the bathroom very large and luxurious. Asiate restaurant had wonderful service and great views of the park. The pool is very large and never crowded - perfect for lap swimming. And the spa relaxation room with view of the park and lots of complementary snacks is so comfortable i could have spent the entire afternoon there. When combined with the shopping opportunities at the time warner center, the whole package is unbeatable in new york. yes we spent $1k for the room, but it was well worth it.

Mandarin Oriental’s New York property has been over the years the hotel where I stayed most of the times, not because I think this is the perfect fit for NYC, but rather because what you see is what you get. The hotel is just a luxurious hotel, the reception at the 34th floor overlooking Central Park, the hotel is near the trendy Time Warner centre at Columbus Circle. The rooms are rated according to view (Hudson river or Central Park) and space, although the difference in space is not spectacular (never had the pleasure of staying in a suite so cannot comment on that) . The better views are the ones that overlook Central Park (although the ugly tall Trump Towers hotel unfortunately figures as a “black” spot taking away some of the views). The rooms are not very spacious (what can you expect in New York?) but some rooms have a nice long bathroom with bath and shower. Overall the rooms are absolutely not spectacular, neither in design (most of them rather outdated) nor in space or outfit. One need to explore the different rooms carefully and not take whatever first room one is put in. One of my earlier stays I was in a room opposite a service room, where personnel came in and out making quite a noise hitting the doors with their in room dining cars.The restaurant and breakfast room has superb views on Central Park. The concierge is very helpful and well connected. The beds are comfortable, the in room entertainment is well organized with a wide selection of Radio, TV, movies and equipment for your mp3 player. The hotel car can bring you in a classy Bentley to anywhere in the city in a circle of a few miles. The spa however is rather disappointing, took a massage but the masseuse was not what you can expect from a 5 star hotel. Overall my impression is that, although comfortable and luxurious, it’s not at all top notch in a city like NY where you would expect the sort of super luxurious hotels you get nowadays in world cities around the globe. Good at best.

We were celebrating our anniversary. We were in the spa one evening as the pool was closed and one of the attendants brought us in to use the spa pool. Another spa attendants, Lee, walked in while we were in the vitality pool and literally attacked us for not signing the waiver to use the spa. The other attendant did not mention this as we walked in. When we confronted him with his rude behavior, he refused to apologize, The hotel is ignored our emails and we felt very violated and disregarded by the management. I can only conclude that their guest comments mean nothing to them. This spoilt the entire trip for us. For a $1000/night, a little respect and courtesy would be greatly appreciated.

I found that the check in was efficient, friendly and cordial. I really liked the welcome green tea. The front doorman was especially considerate of the fact that it was cold out. My room was pleasant and well appointed. My big disappointment was breakfast room service. Room service just could not get the order right, even though I ordered only things that were on the menu. Even lunch room service was not right. I checked out one day early as I just was not looking forward to another breakfast being botched. Also, when all I wanted to do is report the error, room service insisted on sending a manager to talk to me. It told them no that I was busy, which I was. They would not listen to me and sent a manager anyhow. I could not believe how much emphasis room service put on not giving me what I requested and only giving me what they decided was good enough for me to have. Although the mall is convenient by accessing it from the third floor via a hallway, I also believe this is a security risk for the hotel. There are no live eyes that can see this hallway. The fitness area is pleasant with the light from the windows. Swimming int he lap pool was excellent. Windows on three sides is quite pleasant. The location is too far of a walk from Fifth Avenue to my liking. Others may like it being near Time Warner. I paid over $2,600 for two nights. I would have to rating this a five star with all five star rating to say that it was worth the money.

My room was astonishingly small, even by New York standards. The room was dark and although I had paid for a view of Central park, it was a corridor view. The bathroom was entirely substandard- far to tiny for one person, let alone 2. AND there was a curtain rod in the middle of the bed when we arrived. The gym and pool were tiny and there were disgruntled guests in the foyer waiting to be shown to the nearest Equinox. I don't judge a hotel on its restaurants as one can make reservations to eat at any restaurant regardless of where one is staying. We have stayed in many famous five star hotels around the world and this Mandarin Oriental just does not even come close to the standard offered in the other establishments we have been to. If I can save one traveller from staying here, then my review will have been worthwhile. I just wish I had taken photos.

I've stayed at Mandarin Oriental in Kuala Lumpur which is a very exceptional hotel and sets the standard for the MO brand. I'm also aware of the high quality service provided in London. The NYC MO still has some work to do on the service front. There were some issues with my room being ready and poor service at the front desk and lobby. However, these items were rectified and an apology and upgrade were forthcoming. This is a mark of a truly world class hotel - being able to rectify problems and satisfy their customers' demands. The suite upgrade had amazing views of Central Park and the Hudson River - I did not feel like leaving the hotel. The restaurant Asiate is expensive but worth every penny - try their degustation menu for an absolutely superb meal of a lifetime. I am sure this hotel will go from strength to strength - just a few polishes needed for the MO's trademark service. This is the hotel to stay in NYC and certainly better than Library Hotel (TA no#1) - although Library Hotel does have flawless service.

From the outside, the Mandarin is a dramatic modern hotel - part of a soaring glass shard set high over Columbus circle. Inside the drama continues. Stepping out of the lift into the spectacular 35th floor lobby with its view over Central Park, the Mandarin is immediately set apart.Unlike other top hotels, where you can end up looking at a non-descript side street or even an internal light well, every room in the Mandarin has those dramatic views, leaving you in no doubt that you are in NYC. Even the standard rooms have terrific cityscapes, views of the park or the Hudson River. And all the rooms are big - especially for New York. The interior design - at least the colour scheme - is not my favourite, but it is striking and all the elements, furniture, bedding etc. are very comfortable, chic and high quality. The spa treatments are first class and the facilities - hot pool, steam room, terrific swimming pool overlooking the city - are comprehensive.Food etc. - Breakfast fine, again with that tremendous view. In the evening Asiate is one of the most sophisticated fusion restaurants in town. Lobby bar good place for dim sum and asian tapas.Location - I like it. Right by the park and a stroll across to 5th Avenue to Bergdorf and FAO Schwarz - all the family presents you need.I am a big fan of Mandarin Oriental service in general and the New York hotel measures up very well.Minor gripe: If there is a conference or event it definitely impinges on the hotel. On my last visit there was a wedding and the music was pounding down into the lobby from the floor above. Some conferences occupy the corridor to the Swimming pool, so you may find yourself wandering through internet geeks in your towelling robe.I think it's pretty obvious that this is now New York's best hotel - as is confirmed by the now stratospheric room rates.
I don't want to duplicate other reviews but the hotel was perfect, great location, great staff. The concierge service was best I ever had, even better than at the Burj Al Arab :) I even tipped them!!

Stayed 4 nights at the Mandarin Oriental, NYC. We went to see our son perform at Carnige Hall. Upgraded at check-in, had the room ready at 11:00am. Staff were great and always asked as we came and went how our son was doing!! Having breakfast in the restaurant looking out over Columbus Circle/Central Park each morning was great. Best location for seeing NYC. We were offered the hotel car routinely as we went about the city...usually a Bently I think.Great hotel, great staff, superb location...can't say enough good things about the hotel and staff. It is expensive....but ...you get what you pay for.We liked the hotel so much, we are staying at the Mandarin in Boston this month and hope the experience is similar.

the rooms are gorgeous, the in-room dining is excellent, the lobby & lounge is beautiful, the concierges know everything, staff is most helpful and it is luxurious & comfortable & charming & beautiful & I want to go back & stay longer.

We stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon (06/09/10 – 08/09/10) en route to Hawaii. We have been to New York twice before and gone shopping in the Time Warner Center, so we knew that it was an excellent location and we weren’t disappointed. We stayed in a Premier Central Park View room on the 47th floor and had excellent views of the park and mid-town. My partner had advised the hotel that it was our honeymoon and so we were upgraded slightly from a Central Park View Room (to Premier). Unfortunately, there was nothing in the room when we got there and I initially felt disappointed. My partner admitted that he had ordered chocolates and champagne, which were supposed to be in the room but had been forgotten about by the hotel. So he had to phone them and someone brought them to us. The hotel also gave us a chocolate mousse that said ‘Congratulations’ on it, which we enjoyed. My partner had also requested that a welcome card have my married name on it, as it would be the first time that I would see it written down – unfortunately, the welcome card only had his name on it. So it wasn’t the best of starts at the hotel, however we tried to console ourselves that we had received a room upgrade.The room was trendy with black and red décor and the bed was comfortable. We were disappointed that we weren’t staying for longer than two days, as we really enjoyed staying here. We had breakfast at the hotel on our second morning. The views were even better from the restaurant, as we were seated at a table at a corner window. The staff were very friendly and provided good service and the breakfast was excellent. We were given a complimentary smoothie of the day (which I love!) then we ordered coffee, bagels with cream cheese and fruit salad. It was not a breakfast buffet, but then I prefer it that way as it is easier on the waistline. Our waiter happily spoke away to us about Hawaii and recommended things that we should do when we are there. He also took a few excellent photos of us. Another staff-member offered to take a photo of us in the reception area as we were checking out – very helpful.Overall, we had an excellent stay here and would stay here again.

My wife and I stay here at least once a month either on business or leisure and we enjoy every moment of our visit. We book a suite and just spoil ourselves at the spa before dinner and a show. if you are looking for a hotel that makes you feel like royalty the moment that you walk in and feel like you want to be pampered I recommended the Mandarin Oriental. From its beautiful lobby, incredible views and most of all its friendly and helpful staff the mandarin has never disappointed us.

We arrived on August 20th, after a flight from the UK, to be met with exceptional service at check in, and what a view out over Columbus circle and Central Park from the ceiling to floor windows of the lobby/lounge. Our suite on the 47th floor was everything we expected it to be, a large, modern, very comfortable set of rooms, and what breathtaking views over New York. It had a surprisingly large bathroom, something rare for New York hotels. Each room was very well equipped with every modern convenience.The Spa was the best yet, we booked the VIP Suite, very expensive, but worth every dollar. Cheryl and Samantha looked after us, we actually felt like VIP's and at no stage did the experience feel anything but relaxing. In fact we left out so relaxed we had to go have a siesta.Service in the Bar, Restaurant and Lounge was efficient, friendly and very professional. Special thanks must go to Frank who among all the staff who looked after us in the Lounge, went that little bit further to make our stay special. We must also express our heartfelt thanks to Shyanne, the Bar/ Lounge Manageress, she went out of her way, to the point of even keeping the kitchen open late one evening, as we wanted to eat in the Lounge after seeing a Broadway show, a true credit to the Mandarin Oriental.The concierge always seemed to know what we wanted, before we had even asked. As we had booked our holiday through Elegant Resorts back in the UK, we have pre-paid for our transfers from the Airport to the Hotel however, when we were checking our bill, via the TV, we noticed that we had been billed. When we queried this with the Concierge it was dealt with in a professional and efficient manner.Credit must also go to the all in Housekeeping. When ever we returned to our room after a day sightseeing, or after dinner in the evening, it was always refreshed, clean towels, toiletries laid out in the bathroom, it was a pleasure to come back to. All in all I would give the hotel 7 stars for its location, attention to detail, the service of its entire staff and for making what was a birthday trip to New York, one to remember for a very long time.We have booked into the Mandarin Oriental in Prague from April 28 and cannot wait to enjoy the service all over again.We are definitely A FAN

Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on a long weekend in New York and have to say that this hotel is great.First location - Perfect, next to central park which means great but more peaceful than time squareSecond Hotel - Rooms are really nice, well finished and great service from the maidsThird Bar - Very expensive, normal for a 5 star hotel I supposeOverall I would highly recommend this hotel for all visitors to New York, excellent

Organized a gala fundraising dinner for 500 clients in the ballroom - space is wonderful, service excellent, food was fantastic. Great venue for events, highly reccommend. The rooms are lovely, facilities too, spa one of my favorites in NYC. Overall the hotel lives up to MO standard, but some of the Asian locations definitely top it.
user_name:
czechqueen
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for a short getaway and it was a wonderful experience from start to finish. Upon checkin at the skylobby, we were escorted personally to a room with a magnificent view of Central Park. A member of the staff arrived shortly thereafter with some tea and snacks. The room itself was decorated with sophisticated and minimalist furniture, but the spectular floor to ceiling windows were the main attraction. We also took advantage of some of the unexpected benefits, including the complimentary sedan service (the hotel keeps a Bentley and Audi sedan available for guest use within a 20 block radius) that took us to dinner. The rates are certainly high, but for a special occasion it is well worth it.
user_name:
dtwclerk
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: For me its the best hotel in NY, i loved it....great view, the best service and location.....everytime that i go to NY, Mandarin its my choice......

A week in a generously sized Mandarin Executive Suite with stunning views overlooking the Hudson (great for the 4th of July fireworks) from the lounge and Central Park from the bathroom and bedroom. Guest bathroom, excellent shower and plenty of closet and storage space. Wi-Fi with decent speeds in both suite and throughout hotel. I felt that more door people were required at the entrance. It was mostly the same guy: tired, over heated and run down and this is not quite what you expect from the MO. He was very friendly, however if you’ve stayed at other destinations of this chain then you’ll know what a welcoming should be.Guest relations forgot my wife’s birthday and, though professional, the concierge staff only really started becoming proactive to the level you would expect once I started providing some fiscal inspiration for requests. I felt that the QoS which tipping acquired in New York was in line with what you obtained prior to adding a thank you tip in other hotels.Airport pickup was efficient and quick and were from plan to car in 15 mins, incl. luggage collection. We sorely missed an in-suite check-in which is almost standard at this standard nor did they escort you to the room to give a quick guide as to what’s where, etc. Very much liked the complementary use of hotel car services for short trips.Asiante was a breath of fresh air and thoroughly enjoyable with new and exciting variations and interpretations on some classic dishes. Prices were as you would expect in the 2-300$USD per meal for 2 with a lower end bottle. The only let down here was that the last sitting for lunch was at 13:45 and then no worthwhile dining options in between. So if you miss the slot, the quality of dining options drops dramatically. Great view in the Lobby bar though.The difference in service quality, personalised attention and uniqueness/exclusivity of stay between, say, Singapore and New York is vast with Singapore and even the likes of Kuala Lumpur a long way ahead.Everything said, all the above should be taken with a pinch of salt. Expectations differ from party to party and through my experience it’s unfair to perhaps compare service in one region (e.g. Asia to America) to that of another and attitudes of employees and what is considered the norm differ dramatically. So this is, by NYC standards, an efficient and highly presentable hotel with stunning views, decent suites and a flagship restaurant.Well worth a try.
Everything you expect from a 5 star hotel: excellent location, professional, friendly service, stunning lobby, gorgeous clean room with great view of the park, right next to first class shopping.

This was our first visit to New York and could not have picked a better place to stay!From check in to check out the staff were courtious and extremely helpful. Rooms are fantastic with incredible views. Very spacious and luxurious. Special word of thanks to Mr Tauser, Hotel Manager and Jenny, receptionist. Also the door staff who were very helpful and friendly. If you want to indulge yourself in a great hotel in NYC then pick the Mandarin Oriental. Will definately return!

We spent one night at the Mandarin Oriental at the end of June. Great first impression as the man who helped us check in was very welcoming and upgraded us to a room with a view of Central Park. The room was stunning, very quiet, and very comfortable. I was, however, taken aback by the strong scent in the hallways. The first time I smelled it, I thought it was a guest with strong aftershave, but then I realized that the hallways on every floor had the same scent. It was strong enough to exacerbate my allergies. Luckily the room didn't have the same smell. When I mentioned it by phone to the assistant manager and later to the person at the desk at check-out, while I did receive a verbal apology from the desk manager, they treated me like I was crazy and denied that there is a scent in the hallways. My husband also noticed it. Apparently no other guests had complained. I can still remember the smell a day later back at home and am sad to have a negative association with what is otherwise a lovely hotel. I was surprised that the desk manager only gave me his card and offerred to have me call in advance of my next stay so they could "neutralize" the scent before we arrive. If they really valued my return business, they would have made some kind of token reduction on our bill or better yet for them business-wise, would have offerred us a discount or credit towards food or spa services on our next stay. I left with the impression that they weren't interested in our return business and since NYC has so many luxury hotels, I don't plan on returning to the Mandarin Oriental. Also, I was surprised that they charge for wireless internet, which I don't expect at top hotels.

We stayed for four nights, in a room with a superb Central Park view. Looking straight down on 59th Street was fascinating. Restaurant service was excellent, staff very helpful. When we came to send postcards back to Europe there was no charge for stamps - a small touch, but welcome. Yes, the MO is expensive, but it represents - superbly - what hotels should be. Previously in Manhattan we have stayed in the Waldorf-Astoria, Doubletree, Hilton (on Avenue of the Americas), Sheraton, Marriot Marquis, Inter-Continental and Plaza Athenee, so we speak from experience.

I won a free trip to NY and was lucky enough to get to stay at the Mandarin. Everything was perfect, every staff member wanted to insure we had the best stay possible, even though the hotel was included in the free trip, staff did not treat us any different then any other guest. I loved this hotel and would LOVE to stay here again.

I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental over the Memorial Day weekend, May 28 to June1. We satyed in a Premier Central Park View Room. The view was spectacular, the location was very convenient, close to everything. Room was ok, nothing spectacular for the price (except as noted the view and the location). The bathroom was large and luxurious however.One bad experience spoiled our trip. Upon returning to our room late one evening (after 1 am), we found that although our key card opened the room, the dead bolt on the inside was thrown! I have no idea how that could have happened, I thought you needed to be in the room to move that into place. We called the front desk who promptly sent someone up to assist. I was somewhat annoyed because at first they were very insistant that we had the wrong room (I am sure at this late hour, and we had been at a bar, this does happen quite often) but if it was the wrong room why was the key card working? They were also asking how we could have engaged the dead bolt, as though it was our fault. They called for several more maintenance people to come and help. After standing in the hallway for close to half an hour, it is approaching 2 am by now, we went down to the front desk. About the same time we arrived at the front desk, they received a call that they had been successful in gaining entry into the room.Upon returning to the room, we discovered that they had managed to snap the dead bolt fixture. This was never repaired for the remainder of our stay. It also was obvious that evening turndown service had been the last ones in the room (so it was not us that caused this), management promised us a key card investigation as to who the last person to enter the room had been. We never heard anything more on the subject.My gripe is that being inconvienienced by standing in the hallway for over half an hour in the middle of the night due to a mistake on the part of the housekeeping staff (I still have no idea how they locked it) we received no further apology from the hotel. For the price we paid for the room, a complimentary breakfast, drink, discount or something would have been appreciated. I have received more from a Holiday Inn for the inconvienience of a delayed check in!
If you wasnt the best location, the best service and the best rooms there is no other choice in New York and I've used them all.
user_name:
SAWessels
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Booked a deluxe king for three nights over the Memorial Day weekend. Spent about twice the daily rate I am used to at other nice NY hotels, but wanted to treat myself to something special. So was it worth it? Yes, I think so. Would I stay there again? Probably not, just too expensive to do again. Having said that, I really can't say anything negative about the Mandarin Oriental. The location in the Time-Warner complex is excellent. The main entrance is on the street level but you have to take a high speed elevator to the 35th floor for registration, restaurant, and bar. Then you take another bank of elevators to the rooms above the 35th. Sounds like a lot of trouble, but it's really not with the high speed elevators. Another really nice feature is that the hotel elevators stop on the third floor of the shopping/dining complex so you really don't have to leave the hotel area at all to access several great restaurants and upscale shops. I can recommend the LandMarc and the Porter House restaurants in the dining area. My room on the 49th floor had an amazing view of the Hudson River and NY skyline. For a deluxe king I found the room somewhat small, but very clean and modern with a great bathroom with separate rain shower as well as a soaking tub. Believe it or not, the soaking tub actually has a small window that you can look out of while bathing. Of course, the furnishings, bed and linens, electronics, etc. were all first-rate as expected. I had room service two nights which was also excellent and well-presented. Did not use the pool or spa so I cannot comment on those. Overall, I certainly can highly recommend this property, but I can't imagine staying there regularly unless I win the lottery.

To start my review I have to express that the hotel isn't bad at all. Especially the views on the Central Park are amazing and the hotel product is still new.However, not just because of the management by MO but also due to image of the hotel had been dissapointed by our stay. The rooms has been nice with sound system for your ipod and books for bedside reading. And the view has been more than great. But the bathroom has been a joke for a new built hotel. It has been too small, not well designed and sparely equipped with amenities (e.g. just one bath gel and shampoo for bath tub/ shower).The pool area and the gym reminded us on a community swimming pool. No space for sun chairs, the sauna has been right in the pool area, no changing rooms nor relaxation areas. It made the impression that they just built a pool to have it on the checklist.Next critical service has been the business centre: they just converted a suite/ room into the business centre by palcing some desks/ PC's in an empty room. No atmosphere which nevertheless will be charged with 25$ for use.Contrariwise the restaurant Asiate serves excellent food as well as a great atmosphere for breakfast. Definitely a place to spend an evening in style with great service and food. Thanks to the different levels nearly all tables having the same great view on the Central Park and NYC.Overall we just missed the small things which separates a deluxe hotel from a regular five star hotel. And in terms of service the MO didn't reach the level of the Peninsula or Ritz.

From the moment my car pulled up in front the Mandarin, I experienced nothing but Five Star VIP treatment! The beauty of the hotel, friendliness of the staff and attention to detail is beyond compare. My room was immaculate with first class linens and toiletries. The view of Central Park, Columbus Circle, the City Skyline was breathtaking! I slept like a baby snuggled in the plushness of the bed, bedding, and pillowsFrom the moment you enter the front door, you are struck by the exquisite furnishings, rugs, and artwork. The Doormen are the best in the City...always so helpful and accommodating with smiles and welcome greetings. Housekeeping did an amazing job tending to my every need and request. My personal greeting/welcome by the Guest Relations Manager upon arrival made me feel like one of the family. The Concierege staff did an incredible job advising me and getting me what I needed quickly all with style and grace no matter what hour of the day.If you want the BEST, most luxurious Hotel experience in New York City, stay at the Mandarin Oriental! You'll have the time of your life!

I have recently stayed at Mandarin Oriental checked in 05/17 and Checked out 5/18 for a 1 night Business. My Company Booked the Hotel via Expedia and when I checked in Receptionist upgraded my room to HUDSON RIVER VIEW what a great location. This is a great hotel with excellent Lobby Bar and Restaurant as well as great service and cleanliness 5*+. Great location on Columbus Circle and right with in Time Warner building where you can access to the 3rd Floor for Shopping . HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL
